In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful.
Praise be to Allah, Lord of the universe.
The Most Merciful, the Most Merciful,
Master of the Day of Retribution.
It is You [Alone] whom we worship, and it is You [Alone] for whom we implore help.
Guide us to the right path,
the way of those whom You have bestowed favors on, not of those who have incurred Your wrath, nor of those who have gone astray.
Alif, Lâm, Mim.
This is the Book about which there is no doubt, it is a guide for the pious,
who believe in the invisible and perform Salat and spend (in obedience to Allah) from what We have allotted to them,
Those who believe in what has been sent down to you (revealed) and what has been sent down before you and who firmly believe in the Hereafter.
These are on the right path of their Lord, and they are the ones who succeed (in this life and in the life to come).
[But] certainly the infidels, whether you warn them or not, they do not believe.
Allah has sealed their hearts and ears; and a thick veil covers their sight; and for them there will be a great punishment.
Among the people there are those who say, "We believe in Allah and the Last Day!" when in fact they do not.
They seek to deceive Allah and the believers; but they deceive only themselves, and they do not realize it.
There is a sickness in their hearts, and Allah allows their sickness to grow. They will have a painful punishment for lying.
And when they are told, "Do not sow corruption on the earth," they say, "On the contrary, we are only reformers!"
Of course, they are the real corrupters, but they do not realize it.
And when they are told, "Believe as the people have believed," they say, "Shall we believe as the feeble-minded have believed?" Of course, they are the real weak-minded, but they don't know it.
When they meet those who have believed, they say, "We believe," but when they find themselves alone with their devils, they say, "We are with you; for we were only mocking (them)."
It is Allah Who mocks them and will harden them in their revolt and prolong their error without end.
They are the ones who have traded the right path for error. Well, their trade has not profited. And they are not on the right track.
They look like someone who has lit a fire; then when the fire illuminated all around, Allah made their light disappear and abandoned them in the darkness where they can no longer see anything.
Deaf, dumb, blind, they cannot therefore come back (from their error).
(They may also be compared to those people who,) at the moment when the clouds burst into rains, laden with darkness, thunder and lightning, put their fingers in their ears, terrified by the roar of lightning and fearing death; and Allah encircles the infidels on all sides.
The lightning almost carries away their sight: whenever it gives them light, they advance; but as soon as it is dark, they stop. If Allah willed, He would take away their hearing and sight, for Allah has power over all things.
O men! Worship your Lord, who created you and those who came before you. In this way you would attain piety.
He made you the earth for a bed, and heaven for a roof; who precipitates the rain from heaven and through it brings forth all kinds of fruit to feed you, so do not look for equals to Him, when you know (all this).
If you have any doubt about what We have revealed to Our Servant, then try to produce a similar Surah and call your witnesses, (idols) whom you worship besides Allah, if you are truthful.
If you do not succeed in this, and you certainly never will, then guard against the fire that will be fed by men and stones, which is reserved for the infidels.
Announce to those who believe and do good works that they will have gardens for their dwellings, under which the streams flow; every time they are blessed with a fruit from the garden, they will say: "This is what we were served before." Now it is something similar (only in form); there they will have pure wives, and there they will dwell forever.
Verily, Allah does not hesitate to cite as an example anything: a mosquito or anything above; as for the believers, they know well that it is the truth coming from their Lord; As for the infidels, they ask: "What did Allah mean by such an example?" By this, many are those whom He leads astray and many whom He guides; but by this He leads astray only the wicked,
who break the covenant they had firmly made with Allah, cut off what Allah has commanded to be united, and sow corruption on the earth. These are the real losers.
How can you deny Allah when He gave you life, when you were deprived of it? Then He will put you to death; then He will make you live again and finally it is to Him that you will return.
He created for you all that is on earth, and then directed His will to heaven and made it seven heavens. And He is All-Knowing.
When your Lord confided to the Angels, "I am going to set up a vicar Khalifa on earth." They said, "Are You going to appoint one to make a mess and shed blood, when we are here sanctifying You and glorifying You?" – He said, "Verily, I know what you do not know."
And He taught Adam all the names (of all things), and then He presented them to the angels and said, "Tell Me the names of these, if you are truthful." (in your claim that you are more deserving than Adam).
- They said, "Glory to You! We have no knowledge but what You have taught us. Verily, You are the All-Knowing, the Wise."
He said, "O Adam, tell them these names;" And when he had informed them of these names, Allah said: "Have I not told you that I know the mysteries of the heavens and the earth, and that I know what you divulge and what you hide?"
And when We asked the angels to bow down to Adam, they prostrated themselves except for Iblis, who refused, and was puffed up with pride, and was among the infidels.
And We said, "O Adam, dwell in Paradise you and your wife, and feed on it from everywhere as you please; but do not come near this tree, or you will be among the unjust."
Soon after, Satan made them slip out of there and bring them out of the place where they were. And We said, "Come down (from Paradise); enemies of each other. And for you there will be a dwelling place on the earth, and a usufruct for a time.
Then Adam received words from his Lord, and Allah accepted his repentance, for He is indeed the Repentant, the Merciful.
- We said, "Get out of here, all of you! Whenever I send you a guide, those who follow [him] will have nothing to fear and will not be afflicted."
And those who do not believe (in our messengers) and treat Our revelations as lies, these are the people of the Fire where they will dwell forever.
O children of Israel, remember My blessing with which I have bestowed upon you. If you keep your commitments to Me, I will keep mine. And it is Me whom you must fear.
And believe in what I sent down, in confirmation of what was already with you; and don't be the first to reject it. And do not exchange My revelations for a low price. And it is Me that you must fear.
And don't mix the false with the truth. Don't knowingly hide the truth.
And perform Salah, and pay Zakat, and bow with those who bow.
Will you command people to do good, and you yourselves forget to do it, while you recite the Book? Are you, then, destitute of reason?
And seek help in endurance and salah: indeed, salah is a heavy obligation, except for the humble,
who are certain to meet their Lord (after their resurrection) and return to Him alone.
O Children of Israel, remember My blessing with which I have bestowed upon you, (remember) that I have preferred you to all the peoples (of the time).
And dread the day when no soul will suffice in any way for another; where no intercession will be accepted from her; and where no compensation will be received from it. And they will not be helped.
And [remember] when We delivered you from Pharaoh's people; who inflicted the worst punishment on you: by slaughtering your sons and sparing your wives. This was a great trial on the part of your Lord.
And [remember] when We split the sea to give you passage... So we delivered you, and drowned Pharaoh's people, while you were watching.
And when We gave Moses an appointment for forty nights... Then in his absence you took the calf as an idol while you were unrighteous (to yourselves by worshipping other than Allah).
But in spite of this, We forgave you, so that you might recognize (Our blessings on you).
And [remember] when We gave Moses the Book and the Discernment so that you might be guided.
And [remember] when Moses said to his people, "O my people, you have wronged yourselves by taking the Calf for your idol. Return therefore to your Creator; then kill the guilty yourselves: it would be better for you, with your Creator!" ... Thus He accepted your repentance; for he is indeed the Repentant and the Merciful!
And [remember] when you say, "O Moses, we will not believe you until we have seen Allah clearly"... Then lightning seized you as you looked.
Then We raised you up after your death so that you might be grateful.
And We covered you with the shadow of a cloud; and sent down manna and quail upon you: "Eat of the delights which We have allotted to you!" – It was not Us that they wronged, but they wronged themselves.
And [remember] when We said, "Enter this city, and eat there as you please; but enter through the door by prostrating yourselves and asking for the "forgiveness" (of your sins); We will forgive you your sins if you do this, and we will give more reward to the righteous.
But the wicked substituted others for these words, and to punish them for their deceit We sent them a degrading punishment from heaven.
And [remember] when Moses asked for water to quench his people's thirst, it was then that We said, "Strike the rock with your staff." And all of a sudden, twelve springs gushed out, and indeed, each tribe knew where to drink! - "Eat and drink of what Allah grants you; and do not sow trouble on the earth as troublemakers."
And [remember] when you say, "O Moses, we can't tolerate one more food. Pray therefore to your Lord that He may bring us out of the earth what it grows, from its vegetables, its cucumbers, its garlic (or wheat), its lentils and its onions!" - He replied: "Will you exchange the best for the less good? Descend to any city; you will certainly find what you ask for!" Debasement and misery fell upon them; they incurred the wrath of Allah. This is because they denied the revelations of Allah, and they killed the prophets without right. This is because they disobeyed and transgressed.
Verily, those who believed, those who became Judaized, the Nazarenes, and the Sabaeans, whoever among them believed in Allah on the Last Day and did good deeds, will be rewarded by his Lord; he will feel no fear and he will never be afflicted.
(And remember) when We made a covenant with you and held up the Mount over you, "Hold fast to what We have given you, and remember what is in it, that you may be godly."
Then you turned away from it after your commitments, so if it were not for the grace of Allah and His mercy, you would certainly be among the losers.
You have certainly known those of your own who transgressed the Sabbath. Well, We said to them, "Be abject monkeys!"
We therefore made this an example to the cities that then surrounded it, and an exhortation to the pious.
(And remember) when Moses said to his people: "Verily Allah commands you to slaughter a cow." They said, "Do you take us in mockery?" "May Allah preserve me from being among the ignorant," he said.
- They said, "Ask your Lord for us to tell us what it should be." He said: "Verily Allah says that it is indeed a cow, neither old nor virgin, of middle age, between the two. Do what you are told."
- They said, "Ask your Lord for us to tell us his color." He said: "Allah says that it is a yellow cow, brightly colored and pleasant to look at."
- They said, "Ask your Lord for us to tell us what it is, for for us cows are confused. But we would certainly be well guided in this, Allah willing."
He said: "Allah says that it is a cow that has not been enslaved to plough the land or to water the field, free from infirmity and whose color is plain." - They said, "Here you are at last, you have brought us the truth." They then immolated him, but they almost did not do so.
And when you killed a man and each of you tried to exonerate yourself... But Allah unmasks what you hid.
So we said, "Strike the slain with part of the cow." - So Allah raises the dead and shows you the signs (of His power) so that you may reason
Then, and in spite of all this, your hearts became hardened; they have become like stones or even harder; for there are stones from which streams flow, others split so that water may spring up, others sink for fear of Allah. And Allah is certainly never inattentive to what you do
"Well, do you [Muslims] expect such people (the Jews) to share the faith with you?" while a group of them; after hearing and understanding the word of Allah, knowingly falsified it.
And when they meet believers, they say, "We believe," and when they are alone with each other, they say, "Will you entrust to the Muslims what Allah has revealed to you, so that you can provide them with an argument against you before your Lord? Are you then devoid of reason?"
- Do they not know that Allah knows what they hide and what they divulge?
And there are among them illiterate people who know nothing of the Book except pretensions, and they only conjecture.
Woe, therefore, to those who with their own hands compose a book and then present it as coming from Allah to make a vile profit from it. - Woe to them, then, because of what their hands have written, and woe to them because they profit by it!
And they said, "The Fire will only touch us for a few days counted." Say: "Would you have made a commitment to Allah - for Allah never breaks His commitment; "No, but you say about Allah what you do not know."
Quite the contrary! Those who do evil and who are surrounded by their sins, these are the people of the Fire where they will dwell eternally.
And those who believe and practice good deeds are the people of Paradise where they will dwell forever.
And [remember], when We made the commitment of the children of Israel to worship only Allah, to do good to fathers, mothers, close relatives, orphans and needy people, to have good words with people; to perform Salat regularly and to pay Zakat. - But with the exception of a few of you, you were breaking your commitments by turning away from Our commandments.
And remember, when We obtained from you a covenant not to shed blood for yourselves, [by murder] not to expel one another from your homes. Then you subscribed to it with your own testimony.
Although you are thus engaged, you are killing each other, expelling from their houses a part of you against whom you are lending a hand through sin and aggression. But what a contradiction! If your co-religionists come to you captive, you ransom them, even though you were forbidden to expel them. Do you then believe in one part of the Book and reject the rest? Those of you who do this deserve nothing but ignominy in this life, and on the Day of Resurrection you will be turned back to the harshest punishment, and Allah is not inattentive to what you do.
These are the ones who exchange the present life for the future life. Well, their punishment will not be lessened. And they will not be helped.
Verily, We gave the Book to Moses; We have sent after him successive prophets. And We have given proofs to Jesus, the son of Mary, and We have strengthened him with the Holy Spirit. Is it that every time a Messenger brings you truths contrary to your wishes, you are puffed up with pride? You called some impostors and you killed others.
And they said, "Our hearts are wrapped up and inscrutable" – No, but Allah has cursed them because of their unfaithfulness, so their faith is mediocre.
And when a Book came to them from Allah confirming the one they already had, whereas before they sought supremacy over the disbelievers, when it came to them that very thing which they recognized, they refused to believe it. May the curse of Allah be upon the disbelievers.
How vile is that for which they have exchanged their souls! They do not believe in what Allah has sent down, revolting at the idea that Allah, by His grace, sends down revelation on those of His servants whom He wills. So they have acquired anger upon anger, for a degrading punishment awaits the infidels!
And when it is said to them: "Believe in what Allah has sent down", they say: "We believe in what has been sent down to us". And they reject the rest, even though it is the truth confirming what was already with them. Say: "Why did you kill the Prophets of Allah before, if you were believers?"
And indeed Moses came to you with the proofs. Yet, when you were absent, you took the calf for your idol, even though you were unrighteous.
And remember, when We took the pledge of you, and brandished AT-Tûr (Mount Sinai) over you, saying, "Hold fast to what We have given you, and listen!" They said, "We have listened and disobeyed." In their impiety, their hearts were passionately in love with the Calf (the object of their worship). Say to them: "What bad prescriptions are ordained by your faith, if you are believers."
- Say: "If the Ultimate Abode with Allah is for you alone, to the exclusion of other people, then wish for [immediate] death if you are truthful."
However, they will never wish for it, knowing all the evil they have perpetrated with their hands. And Allah knows the wrongdoers well.
And certainly you will find them the most attached to the life [of this world], worse in this respect than the Associates. One of them would like to live a thousand years. But such longevity will not save him from punishment! And Allah sees their deeds well.
Say: "Whoever is an enemy of Gabriel must know that it is he who, with Allah's permission, has sent down upon your heart that revelation which declares the previous messages to be true and serves as a guide and a happy proclamation for the believers."
[Say:] "Whoever is an enemy of Allah, His angels, His messengers, Gabriel and Michael... [Allah will be his enemy] because Allah is the enemy of the infidels."
And most certainly We have sent down to you clear signs. And only perverts don't believe it.
Should every time they make a pact, some of them should denounce it? Rather, most of them are not believers.
And when a Messenger came to them from Allah confirming what was already with them, some to whom the Book had been given, threw the Book of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know.
And they followed what the devils say against the reign of Sulayman. Whereas Sulayman was never a disbeliever but the devils: they teach people magic and what came down to the two angels Harut and Ferut in Babylon; but they taught no one, until they first said, "We are nothing but a temptation: do not be a disbeliever," they learn from them what sows disunity between a man and his wife. However, they are not able to harm anyone except with Allah's permission. And people learn what harms them and is not profitable for them. And they know, most certainly, that whoever acquires [this power] will have no part in the Hereafter. Certainly, what a detestable commodity for which they sold their souls! If only they knew!
And if they believed and lived in piety, a reward from Allah would certainly be better. If only they knew!
O you who believe! Do not say: "Ra'inâ" (favor us) but say: "Onzurnâ" (look at us); and listen! A painful punishment will be for the infidels.
Neither the disbelievers among the People of the Book nor the Associates like to be brought down on you by your Lord, while Allah reserves His mercy for whomever He wills. And it is Allah the Possessor of abundant grace.
If We abrogate any verse or cause it to be forgotten, We bring a better one, or a similar one. Do you not know that Allah is Omnipotent?
Do you not know that to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and that besides Allah you have neither protector nor helper?
Would you like to question your Messenger as Moses was questioned before? Whoever substitutes disbelief for faith is indeed going astray.
Many People of the Book would like to be able to make you disbelievers out of jealousy on their part after you have believed. And after the truth has been manifested to them! Forgive and forget until Allah brings His commandment. Allah is most certainly Omnipotent!
And perform Salat and pay Zakat. And whatever is good for yourselves, you will find it with Allah, for Allah sees perfectly what you do.
And they said, "No one shall enter Paradise but Jews or Christians." These are their chimeras. - Say: "Give your proof, if you are truthful."
No, but whoever submits his being to Allah while doing good, will have his reward with his Lord. For them there is no fear, and they will not be grieved.
And the Jews say, "The Christians can't stand on anything," and the Christians say, "The Jews can't stand on anything," as they read the Book! In the same way, those who know nothing speak in a language similar to their own. Well, Allah will judge on what they oppose, on the Day of Resurrection.
Who is more unjust than the one who prevents His Name from being mentioned in the mosques of Allah, and who tries to destroy them? Such people should only enter it in fear. For them, ignominy here below; and in the Hereafter an enormous punishment.
To Allah alone belong the East and the West. Wherever you turn, the Face (direction) of Allah is there, for Allah has immense grace; He is Omniscient.
And they said, "Allah has given himself a son." Glory be to Him! No! but to Him belongs what is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him all obey.
He is the Creator of the heavens and the earth from nothing. When He decides a thing, He just says, "Be," and it is immediately.
And those who do not know said, "Why does Allah not speak to us [directly], or why does not a sign come to us?" In the same way, those before them spoke a similar word. Their hearts are alike. We have clearly laid out the signs for people who have firm faith.
Verily, We have sent you with the truth, as a herald and a warner; and you are not asked to account for the people of Hell.
Neither Jews nor Christians will ever be satisfied with you, until you follow their religion. - Say: "Verily, it is the guidance of Allah that is the true direction." But if you follow their passions after what you have received from knowledge, you will have no protector or helper against Allah.
Those to whom We have given the Book, who recite it properly, believe in it. And those who don't believe in it are the losers.
O Children of Israel, remember My blessing with which I have bestowed upon you and favored you above the rest of the world.
And dread the day when no soul will benefit another, when no compensation will be accepted from it, and when no intercession will be of any use to it. And they will not be helped.
[And remember] when your Lord had tested Abraham by certain commandments, and fulfilled them, the Lord said to him, "I will make you an example for people to follow." "And among my descendants?" he asked. - "My commitment," says Allah, "does not apply to the unjust"
[And remember], when We made the House a place of visitation and a refuge for the people – Adopt therefore as a place of prayer, this place where Abraham stood – And We confided to Abraham and Ishmael this: "Purify My House for those who turn around it, and retreat into it, bow down and bow down there.
And when Abraham pleaded, "O my Lord, make this city a place of safety, and bestow fruit on those of its inhabitants who believe in Allah and the Last Day," the Lord said, "And whoever does not believe in it, then I will grant him a short enjoyment [in this world], and then I will compel him to the punishment of the Fire [in the Hereafter]. And what a bad destination!"
And when Abraham and Ishmael were raising the foundations of the House, "O our Lord, accept this from us! For you are the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
Our Lord! Make us Your Subjects, and our descendants a community subject to You. And show us our rites and agree to repent of it. For you are indeed the Acceptor of repentance, the Merciful.
Our Lord! Send one of their number as a messenger among them, to recite Your verses to them, to teach them the Book and Wisdom, and to purify them. For you are indeed the Mighty, the Wise!
Who, then, will have an aversion to the religion of Abraham, but he who sows his soul in foolishness? For most certainly We have chosen him in this world; and in the Hereafter he is certainly one of the good.
When his Lord had said to him, "Submit," he said, "I submit to the Lord of the universe."
And this is what Abraham recommended to his sons, as did Jacob: "O my sons, Allah has chosen religion for you: do not die, therefore, otherwise than as a submissive." (To Allah).
Were you witnesses when death came to Jacob and he said to his sons, "What will you worship after me?" - They answered, "We will worship your divinity and the divinity of your fathers, Abraham, Ishmael and Isaac, the One Deity and to whom we are Subject."
This is a generation that is well and truly gone. To her what she has acquired, and to you what you have acquired. You will not be asked to account for what they were doing.
They said, "Be you Jews or Christians, so you will be on the right track." - Say: "No, but we follow the religion of Abraham, the very model of righteousness, and who was not among the Associates."
Say: "We believe in Allah and in what has been revealed to us, and in what has been sent down to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the tribes, and in what has been given to Moses and Jesus, and what has been given to the prophets from their Lord: we make no distinction between them. And to Him we are Subject."
So, if they believe in that very thing you believe in, they will certainly be on the right track. And if they turn away from it, they will certainly be in schism! Then Allah will suffice you against them. He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
"We follow the religion of Allah! And who is better than Allah in His religion? It is He whom we worship."
Say: "Are you arguing with us about Allah, when He is our Lord and yours? Ours are our actions and yours are yours! It is to Him that we are devoted.
Or do you say that Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac and Jacob and the tribes were Jews or Christians?" - Say: "Are you the most knowledgeable or Allah?" - Who is more unjust than the one who hides a testimony he has from Allah? And Allah is not inattentive to what you do.
This is a generation that is well and truly gone. To her what she has acquired, and to you what you have acquired. And you won't be asked to account for what they were doing.
The feeble-minded among the people will say: "Who has turned them away from the direction (Qibla) to which they were going before?" - Say: "To Allah belong the Rising and the Setting. He guides whomever He wills to a straight path."
And also We have made you a community of righteous people so that you may be witnesses to the people, as the Messenger will be a witness to you. And We had only established the direction (Qibla) to which you turned to know who follows the Messenger [Muhammad] and who returns on his heels. It was a difficult change, but not for those whom Allah guides. And it is not Allah who will cause you to lose your faith, for Allah is indeed Merciful and Merciful to men.
Surely we see you turning your face in all directions in the sky. So we direct you in a direction that you like. Turn your face towards the Holy Mosque. Wherever you are, turn your faces there. Verily, those to whom the Book was given know well that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not inattentive to what they do.
Certainly, if you were to bring all the evidence to those to whom the Book was given, they would not follow your (Qibla) direction! And you will not follow theirs; and between them, some do not follow the direction of the others. And if you were to follow their passions after what you have received from knowledge, you would certainly be among the unjust.
Those to whom We have given the Book recognize it as they recognize their children. But some of them are hiding the truth, even though they know it!
The truth comes from your Lord. So don't be one of those who doubt.
Everyone has an orientation to which they turn. Compete therefore in good works. Wherever you are, Allah will bring you all back to Himself, for Allah is indeed Omnipotent.
And wherever you come from, turn your face towards the Holy Mosque. Yes, this is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not inattentive to what you do.
And wherever you come from, turn your face towards the Holy Mosque. And wherever you are, turn your faces there, so that people won't have an argument against you, except those of them who are real unrighteous. Do not fear them; but fear Me that I may complete My blessing to you, and that you may be rightly guided.
Thus, We have sent a messenger from among you who will recite Our verses to you, purify you, teach you the Book and Wisdom, and teach you what you did not know.
Remember Me then. I will reward you. Thank Me and do not be ungrateful to Me!
O you who believe! Seek help in endurance and salat. For Allah is with those who are enduring.
And do not say of those who are killed in the cause of Allah that they are dead. On the contrary, they are alive, but you are unaware of it.
Most certainly, We will test you with a little fear, hunger and diminishing goods, people and fruits. And give good news to the enduring,
who say, when a calamity befalls them: "Verily we belong to Allah, and to Him we will return.
These receive blessings from their Lord, as well as mercy; and these are the guided good.
As-Safâ and Al-Marwah are truly among the sacred places of Allah. Therefore, whoever makes Hajj to the House or does Umrah does not commit a sin by going back and forth between these two mountains. And whoever does a good deed of his own free will, then Allah is Grateful, All-Knowing.
Verily, those who hide what We have sent down as proofs and guides after We have explained it to the people in the Book, these are the ones whom Allah curses and the cursers curse,
except those who have repented, corrected and declared: from them I receive repentance. For it is I, the Acceptor of repentance, the Merciful.
Those who do not believe and die disbelievers, will receive the curse of Allah, the angels and all men.
They will remain there forever; the punishment will not be alleviated to them, nor will they be given respite.
And your Divinity is a unique divinity. There is no god but Him, the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful.
Verily, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, in the alternation of night and day, in the ship that sails in the sea laden with things that benefit people, in the water that Allah sends down from heaven, by which He restores life to the earth when it is dead, and scatters beasts of all kinds in it in the variation of the winds.  and in the clouds subdued between heaven and earth, in all these there are signs for a people who reason.
Among men, there are some who, besides Allah, take equals to Him, loving them as one loves Allah. The believers are the most ardent in the love of Allah. When the wrongdoers see the punishment, they will know that all the power is Allah's and that Allah is harsh in punishment...
When the leaders disown the followers at the sight of the punishment, the bonds between them will be broken!
And the followers will say, "Ah! If a return was possible for us! Then we will disavow them as they have disowned us!" - Thus Allah showed them their deeds; a source of remorse for them; but they will not be able to come out of the Fire.
O people! Of what exists on earth; eat the lawful pure; do not follow in the footsteps of the Devil, for he is truly an open enemy to you.
He commands you only to do evil and to say against Allah what you do not know.
And when they are told, "Follow what Allah has sent down," they say, "No, but we will follow the customs of our forefathers." What if their ancestors had not reasoned and if they had not been in the right direction?
The disbelievers are like [cattle] that are shouted at and hear only a call and a voice that is confused. Deaf, dumb, blind, they do not reason.
O you who believe! Eat lawful (food) that We have given you. And thank Allah, if it is Him whom you worship.
Verily, He forbids you the flesh of a dead animal, blood, pork, and anything on which anyone other than Allah has been invoked. There is no sin on the one who is coerced without abusing or transgressing, for Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Those who hide what Allah has sent down from the Book and sell it at a low price, they fill their bellies only with fire. Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection and will not purify them. And there will be a painful punishment for them.
These have exchanged right direction for error and forgiveness for punishment. What will make them endure the Fire?!
This is so, for it is with the truth that Allah sent down the Book; and those who oppose the subject of the Book are in deep divergence.
Godly kindness does not consist in turning your faces towards the Rising or the Setting. But pious kindness is to believe in Allah, in the Last Day, in the Angels, in the Book and in the Prophets, to give of one's possessions, whatever love one may have, to relatives, orphans, the needy, to needy travelers and to those who ask for help, and to loosen the yokes, to perform Salat and pay Zakat. And those who fulfill their commitments when they have enlisted, those who endure in misery, sickness and when fighting rages, these are the truthful and these are the truly pious!
O you who believe! You have been prescribed retaliation for the slain: free man for free man, slave for slave, woman for woman. But the one who is somehow forgiven by his brother must face a proper petition and must pay damages with good grace. This is a relief from your Lord, and a mercy. Therefore, whoever after this transgresses, will have a painful punishment.
It is in retaliation that you will have the preservation of life, O you endowed with understanding, so you will attain piety.
You have been prescribed, when death is near to one of you and if he leaves property, to make a will in order in favor of his father and mother and his closest relatives. This is a duty for the pious.
Whoever alters it after hearing it, sin will rest only on those who have altered it; Verily, Allah is Hearer and All-Knowing.
But whoever fears from a testator some partiality (voluntary or involuntary), and reconciles them, then there is no sin on him, for Allah is forgiving and merciful.
O you who believe! You have been prescribed aS-Siyâm as it was prescribed to those before you, so that you will attain piety,
for a set number of days. Whoever of you is sick or travelling, will have to fast an equal number of other days. But for those who could only bear it (with great difficulty), there is a compensation: feeding a poor person. And if anyone does more of his own free will, it is for himself; but it is better for you to fast; If you only knew!
(These days are) the month of Ramadan in which the Qur'an was sent down as a guide for the people, and clear evidence of good direction and discernment. So, whoever of you is present in this month, let him fast! And whoever is sick or travelling, while fasting an equal number of other days. - Allah wills ease for you, He does not want difficulty for you, so that you may complete the number and proclaim the greatness of Allah for guiding you, and so that you may be grateful.
And when My servants ask you about Me. then I am very close: I respond to the call of the one who prays to Me when he prays to Me. Let them respond to My call, and believe in Me, so that they may be rightly guided.
On the night of as-Siyam you were allowed to have intercourse with your wives; they are a garment for you and you are a garment for them. Allah knows that you had clandestine relations with your wives. He has forgiven you and pardoned you. So live with them now and seek what Allah has ordained for you; eat and drink until the white thread of dawn is distinguished for you from the black thread of night. Then fast until nightfall. But don't live with them while you're on a ritual retreat in mosques. These are the laws of Allah: do not come near them. This is how Allah expounds His teachings to men, so that they may become pious.
And do not devour each other's goods illicitly; and do not use it to bribe judges to allow you to devour some of people's property, unjustly and knowingly.
They ask you about the new moons – Say: "They are used by people to count time, and also for the hajj [pilgrimage]. And it is not an act of charity to return home from the back of the houses. But godly kindness is to fear Allah. Enter the houses by their doors. And fear Allah, so that you may succeed!
Fight in the cause of Allah those who fight you, and do not transgress. Verily, Allah does not love transgressors.
And kill them, wherever you meet them; and drive them out of whence they have driven you: association is more serious than murder. But do not fight them near the Holy Mosque until they have fought you there. If they fight you there, kill them. This is the reward for the disbelievers.
If they cease, Allah is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
And fight them until there is no more association and the religion is entirely Allah's. If they cease, then no more hostilities, except against the unjust.
The Holy Month for the Holy Month! - The retaliation applies to all sacred things -. Therefore, whoever transgresses against you, transgress against him, with equal transgression. And fear Allah. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
And spend in the cause of Allah. And do not throw yourselves into destruction with your own hands. And do good. For Allah loves the doers.
And perform Hajj and Umrah for Allah. If you are prevented from doing so, then make a sacrifice that is easy for you. And do not shave your heads until the offering [the animal to be sacrificed] has reached its place of immolation. If any of you are sick or have a head ailment (and need to shave), then let him redeem himself with a Siyam or with alms or sacrifice. When you then find peace, whoever has enjoyed a normal life after performing Umrah while waiting for the pilgrimage, must make a sacrifice that is easy for him. If he cannot afford to fast, he should fast for three days during Hajj and seven days when he returns home, which is a total of ten days. This is prescribed for one whose family does not live near the Holy Mosque. And fear Allah. And know that Allah is harsh in punishment.
The pilgrimage takes place in known months. If one decides to perform it, then there is no sexual intercourse, no perversity, no quarrel during the pilgrimage. And the good you do, Allah knows. And take your provisions; but really the best provision is piety. And fear Me, O you endowed with understanding
It is not a sin to go in search of some grace from your Lord. Then, when you surge from 'Arafat, invoke Allah, at Al-Mash'ar-al-haram (Al-Muzdalifa). And call upon Him as He has shown you the right way, although before you were of the erring ones.
Then surge through which the people poured in, and ask Allah for forgiveness. For Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And when you have finished your rites, then call upon Allah as you invoke your fathers, and even more ardently. But there are people who only say, "Lord! Grant us [good] here below!" - For these, nowhere in the hereafter.
And there are people who say, "Lord! Grant us a fair share here below, and a good share also in the hereafter; and protect us from the punishment of the Fire!"
They will have a share of what they have acquired. And Allah is quick to give an account.
And call on Allah for a certain number of days. Secondly, there is no sin for those who behave in piety to leave after two days, to linger either. And fear Allah. And know that it is to Him that you will be gathered.
There is one among the people whose words about this life please you, and who calls Allah to witness what is in his heart, while he is the fiercest disputant.
As soon as he turns his back, he roams the land to sow disorder and ransack crops and livestock. And Allah does not like disorder!
And when he is told, "Fear Allah," criminal pride takes hold of him. Hell will suffice for him, and what a bad bed, indeed!
And there is among the people the one who sacrifices himself for the sake of Allah's pleasure. And Allah is Merciful to His servants.
O you who believe! Enter right into Islam, and do not follow in the footsteps of the devil, for he is certainly an open enemy to you.
Then, if you flinch, after the proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Mighty and Wise.
What are they waiting for but for Allah to come to them in the shadow of the clouds and the angels and for their fate to be settled? And to Allah all things are brought back.
Ask the children of Israel how many obvious miracles We have brought them! However, whoever alters the blessing of Allah after it has come to him... so, Allah is really harsh in punishment.
The present life has been embellished with those who do not believe, and they mock those who believe. But the righteous will be above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah bestows His blessings on whomever He wills, without counting.
The people (originally) formed a single (believing) community. Then, (after their differences,) Allah sent prophets as heralds and warners; and He sent down with them the Book containing the truth, to settle their differences among the people. But it was the very people to whom it had been brought who began to dispute about it, after the proofs had come to them, in a spirit of rivalry. Then Allah, by His Grace, guided those who believed to this Truth about which others disputed. And Allah guides whomever He wills to the right path.
Do you think you will enter Paradise when you have not yet undergone trials similar to those that those who lived before you underwent? Misery and disease had touched them; and they were shaken until the Messenger, and with him those who had believed, cried out, "When will Allah's help come?" Surely Allah's help is at hand.
They ask you, "What should we spend?" Say: "What you spend of good should be on the father and mother, the relatives, the orphans, the poor, and the needy travelers. And whatever good you do, Allah knows it."
The fight has been prescribed to you when it is unpleasant to you. Now, it may be that you have an aversion to something that is good for you. And you may love something when it is bad for you. It is Allah who knows, while you do not know.
They ask you about waging war during the holy months. - Say: "To fight there is a grave sin, but even more grievous with Allah is to obstruct the cause of Allah, to be ungodly towards Him and the Holy Mosque, and to expel its inhabitants from there. The association is more serious than murder." Now they will not cease to fight you until, if they can, they turn you away from your religion. And those among you who renounce their religion and die infidels, their deeds in the immediate and future life will be in vain for them. These are the people of the Fire: they will dwell there forever.
Verily, those who believed, emigrated and struggled in the cause of Allah, they hope for Allah's mercy. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
They ask you about wine and gambling. Say: "In both there is a great sin and some benefits to people; but in both, sin is greater than usefulness." And they ask you, "What should we spend (on charity)?" Say: "The surplus of your possessions." Thus, Allah explains His verses to you so that you meditate
on this world and on the hereafter! And they ask you about orphans. Say: "To do good to them is the best deed. If you mix with them, then they are your brothers [in religion]. Allah distinguishes between the one who sows disorder and the one who does good. And if Allah had willed, He would have overwhelmed you. Verily, Allah is Mighty and Wise.
And do not marry women who are associators until they have faith, and certainly, a believing slave is better than a female associator, even if she delights you. And do not give wives to associates until they have faith, and surely a believing slave is better than an associate, even if he delights you. For these [the associates] invite to the Fire; while Allah invites, by His Grace, to Paradise and forgiveness And He expounds His teachings to the people so that they may remember!
- And they ask you about women's menstruation. - Say: "This is evil. Therefore keep away from women during menstruation, and do not approach them until they are pure. When they have purified themselves, then live with them according to Allah's prescriptions, for Allah loves those who repent, and He loves those who purify themselves."
Your wives are a ploughing field for you; Go to your field as you want and work for yourselves in advance. Fear Allah and know that you will meet Him. And make a gracious announcement to the believers!
And do not use the name of Allah in your oaths to excuse yourselves from doing good, from being righteous and from reconciling people. And Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
It is not for the gratuitous expressions in your oaths that Allah seizes you: He seizes you for what your hearts have acquired. And Allah is Forgiving and Patient.
For those who swear to deprive themselves of their wives, there is a four-month waiting period. And if they go back from their oath, it will be annulled, for Allah is forgiving and Merciful.
But if they decide to divorce, (it becomes enforceable), for Allah is indeed Hearing and All-Knowing.
And divorced women must observe a waiting period of three menstrual periods; and it is not permissible for them to keep quiet about what Allah has created in their bellies, if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. And their spouses will be more entitled to take them back during this period, if they want reconciliation. As for them, they have rights equivalent to their obligations, in accordance with propriety. But men do have a predominance over them. And Allah is Mighty and Wise.
Divorce is only allowed twice. So, it's either the resumption in accordance with propriety, or the release with kindness. And it is not lawful for you to take back anything that you have given them, unless both of them are afraid that they will not be able to comply with the commands imposed by Allah. So if you fear that both of them will not be able to comply with Allah's commands, then they do not commit any sin if the woman redeems herself with any good. These are the commands of Allah. So don't transgress them. And those who transgress the commands of Allah are the unjust.
If he divorces her (the third time) then she will not be lawful for him until she marries someone else. And if the latter divorces her, then both of them do not commit any sin in resuming their life together, as long as they both think that they can comply with the commands of Allah. These are the commands of Allah, which He exposes to people who understand.
And when you divorce your wives, and their time expires, then take them back according to propriety or release them according to propriety. But do not detain them to harm them, for then you would be transgressing, and whoever does so wrongs himself. Do not mock the verses of Allah. And remember the blessing of Allah to you, and the Book and the Wisdom that He has sent down to you; by which He exhorts you. And fear Allah, and know that Allah is All-Knowing.
And when you divorce your wives, and their time expires, then do not hinder them from renewing their husbands, if they are agreeable to each other, and according to propriety. This is what the one of you who believes in Allah and the Last Day is exhorted to. This is more decent and purer for you. And Allah knows, while you do not know.
And mothers, who want to breastfeed completely, will breastfeed their babies for two full years. It is up to the father of the child to feed and clothe them in a suitable manner. No one should bear more than his means. The mother does not have to suffer damage because of her child, nor the father because of his child. The same obligation applies to the heir. And if, after consulting each other, both agree to decide on weaning, there is no grievance to be made against them. And if you want to put your children in a wet nurse, there is no grievance to be made of you either, provided that you pay the agreed remuneration, in accordance with custom. And fear Allah, and know that Allah is watching what you do.
Those of your people who die and leave wives must observe a waiting period of four months and ten days. After this period, you will not be reproached for the way in which they dispose of themselves in a proper manner. Allah is Knower of what you do.
And you will not be reproached for alluding to a proposal of marriage to women, or for keeping the intention of it secret. Allah knows that you will think of these women. But don't promise them anything secretly except to say decent words to them. And you don't decide on the marriage contract until the prescribed period has expired. And know that Allah knows what is in your souls. So beware of Him, and know also that Allah is Forgiving and Meek.
You do not commit a sin in divorcing wives whom you have not touched, and to whom you have not fixed their mahr. Give them, however, - the well-to-do according to his ability, the needy according to his ability - some suitable good which they may enjoy. It is a duty for the beneficent.
And if you divorce them without having touched them, but after their mahr has been fixed, then pay them half of what you have fixed, unless they renounce it, or the one in whose hands the marriage is to be concluded, withdraws. Withdrawal is closer to piety. And don't forget your mutual favor. For Allah sees perfectly what you are doing.
Be assiduous in the Salat and especially the Middle Salat; and stand before Allah in humility.
But if you fear (great danger), then pray while walking or on your horses. Then when you are safe, call upon Allah as He taught you what you did not know.
Those of you who die and leave wives must leave a will in favor of your wives providing for a year's maintenance without expelling them from their homes. If they are the ones who leave, then you will not be reproached for what they do that is proper for themselves. Allah is Mighty and Wise.
Divorced women are entitled to the enjoyment of a suitable allowance, [constituting] a duty for the pious.
This is how Allah explains His verses to you, so that you may reason.
Have you not seen those who came out of their dwellings, of whom there were thousands, for fear of death? Then Allah said to them: "Die." After which He restored them to life. Verily, Allah is the Possessor of Favor with people; But most people are not grateful.
And fight in the cause of Allah. And know that Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
Whoever lends to Allah with good grace, He will repay him multiplied many times over. Allah restricts or extends (His favors.) And to Him you shall return.
Did you not know the history of the notables among the children of Israel, when after Moses they said to a prophet of theirs, "Appoint us a king, that we may fight in the cause of Allah?" He said, "And if you don't fight, when the fight is prescribed to you?" They said, "And what should we not fight in the cause of Allah, when we have been expelled from our homes and our children captured?" And when the battle was prescribed to them, they turned their backs, except a few of them. And Allah knows well the wrongdoers.
And their prophet said to them: "Behold, Allah has sent you Talut as king." They said, "How shall he reign over us? We have more right to royalty than he does. He has not even been lavished with much wealth!" He said: "Allah, verily, has chosen him over you, and has increased his share in knowledge and physical condition." - And Allah allocates His power to whomever He wills. Allah has immense grace and He is All-Knowing.
And their prophet said to them, "The sign of his investiture will be that the Chest will return to you; an object of tranquillity inspired by your Lord, and containing the relics of what the family of Moses and the family of Aaron left. The Angels will carry it. This is a sign for you, if you are believers!"
Then, as he was about to set out with the troops, Talut said: "Behold, Allah will test you by a river: whoever drinks from it will no longer be of mine; and whoever does not taste it will be one of mine; - is considered to be one who will draw a blow from it in the hollow of his hand." They drank it, except for a small number of them. Then when they had passed through it, he and those of the believers who accompanied him, they said, "We are powerless today against Goliath and his troops." Those who were convinced that they would have to meet Allah said: "How many times has a small army defeated a very large army by the grace of Allah! And Allah is with those who endure."
And when they confronted Goliath and his troops, they said, "Lord! Pour out endurance on us, strengthen our steps and give us victory over this infidel people."
They routed them, by the grace of Allah. And David slew Goliath; and Allah gave him kingship and wisdom, and taught him what He wanted. And if Allah did not neutralize one part of men with another, the earth would certainly be corrupted. But Allah is the Holder of Favor for the worlds.
These are the verses of Allah, which We (Muhammad) recite to you with truth. And you are, indeed, among the Messengers.
Of these messengers, We have favored some over others. There are some to whom Allah has spoken; and He has exalted others in rank. To Jesus, son of Mary, We have brought proofs, and strengthened Him with the Holy Spirit. And if Allah had willed, the people who came after them would not have killed each other after the proofs had come to them; but they were opposed: some remained believers, others were infidels. If Allah had willed, they would not have killed each other; but Allah does what He wills.
O you who believe! Spend what We have given you, before the day comes when there will be no ransom, no friendship, no intercession. And it is the disbelievers who are the unjust.
Allah! There is no divinity except Him, the Living One, the Self-Subsisting One "Al-Qayyûm". Neither drowsiness nor sleep seize Him. To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. Who can intercede with Him without His permission? He knows their past and their future. And of His knowledge, they embrace only what He wills. His Throne, "Kursiy", overflows the heavens and the earth, the custody of which costs Him no trouble. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
There is no compulsion in religion! For the right path has been distinguished from error. Therefore, whoever disbelieves in the rebel while he believes in Allah grasps the strongest handle, which cannot break. And Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
Allah is the defender of those who have faith: He brings them out of darkness into light. As for those who do not believe, they have for their defenders the Tâghût, who bring them out of the light into darkness. These are the people of the Fire, where they dwell eternally.
Did you not know the story of the one who, because Allah made him king, argued against Abraham about his Lord? Abraham having said, "I have for my Lord the giver of life and death," "I also," says the other, "I give life and death." Then said Abraham, "Since Allah brings the sun from the east, then bring it from the west." The miscreant was then confounded. Allah does not guide unrighteous people.
Or like the one who passed through a deserted and devastated village: "How will Allah restore life to this one after his death?" he says. So Allah put him to death and kept him like this for a hundred years. Then He raised him up, saying, "How long have you been like this?" "I stayed a day," says the other, "or part of a day." "No," said Allah, "you have stayed a hundred years. Look at your food and drink: nothing has gone wrong; but look at your donkey... And to make you a sign to the people, and look at these bones, how We gather them together and clothe them with flesh." And when he saw the evidence, he said: "I know that Allah is Omnipotent."
And when Abraham said, "Lord! Show me how You raise the dead," Allah said, "Do you not yet believe?" "Yes," said Abraham; but let my heart be reassured." "Take, then," says Allah, "four birds, tame them (and cut them down), and then put a fragment of them on separate mountains and call them: they will come to you in all haste. And know that Allah is Mighty and wise."
Those who spend their wealth in the cause of Allah are like a grain from which seven ears are born, and a hundred grains the ear. For Allah multiplies the reward to whomever He wills, and the grace of Allah is immense, and He is All-Knowing.
Those who spend their wealth in the cause of Allah without following up their generosity with a reminder or a wrong, will have their reward with their Lord. There is no fear for them, and they will not be afflicted.
A pleasant word and forgiveness are better than alms followed by a wrong. Allah needs nothing, and He is Forgiving.
O you who believe! Do not cancel your alms with a reminder or a wrong, like one who spends his wealth ostentatiously in front of people without believing in Allah and the Last Day. He resembles a rock covered with earth: if a shower reaches him, it leaves him destitute. Such men derive no profit from their actions. And Allah does not guide people who disbelieve.
And those who spend their wealth seeking the pleasure of Allah, and well reassured (of His reward), they are like a garden on a hill. If a shower reaches it, it doubles its fruits; in the absence of a shower that reaches it, it is dew. And Allah sees perfectly what you are doing.
Would any of you like to have a garden of date palms and vines under which the streams flow, and which gives him all kinds of fruit, that old age overtakes him, while his children are still small, and that a whirlwind containing fire falls on his garden and burns it? So Allah explains the signs to you so that you may meditate.
O you who believe! Spend the best things you have earned and the crops We have brought out of the earth for you. And do not turn to what is vile to spend. Do not give what you yourself would only accept by closing your eyes! And know that Allah has no need of anything and that He is worthy of praise.
The Devil makes you fear destitution and commands you to do shameful actions; while Allah promises you forgiveness and favor from Him. Allah's grace is immense and He is All-Knowing.
He gives wisdom to whomever He wills. And he to whom wisdom is given, truly, it is an immense good that is given to him. But only those endowed with intelligence remember it.
Whatever you have spent, or what vow you have made, Allah knows. And for the unjust, there are no helpers!
If you give your alms openly, it is good; it is even better for you if you are discreet with them and give them to the needy. Allah will wipe out some of your misdeeds. Allah is Knower of what you do.
It is not for you to guide them, but it is Allah who guides whomever He wills. And whatever you spend of your possessions will be for your benefit and you spend only on seeking the "Wajh" Face of Allah. And all that you spend of your wealth in good works will be fully rewarded to you. And you will not be harmed.
To the needy who have confined themselves to the cause of Allah, not being able to travel the world, and whom the ignorant believe to be rich because they are ashamed to beg - you will know them by their appearance - they do not bother anyone by begging. And whatever you spend with your possessions, Allah knows perfectly.
Those who spend their wealth by night and by day, secretly and openly, have their wages with their Lord. They have nothing to fear, and they will not be afflicted.
Those who eat [practice] usurious interest only stand (on the Day of Judgment) as one who has been upset by Satan's touch. This is because they say, "Trade is just like interest." Whereas Allah has made trade lawful, and interest unlawful. Whoever, therefore, ceases as soon as an exhortation from his Lord has come to him, may keep what he has previously acquired; and his business depends on Allah. But anyone who does it again... so here they are, the people of Fire! They will remain there forever.
Allah destroys usurious interest and makes alms bear fruit. And Allah does not love the sinful disbeliever.
Those who have faith, have done good deeds, performed Salah and paid Zakat, will certainly have their reward with their Lord. Do not fear them, and they will not be afflicted.
O you who believe! Fear Allah; and renounce the remainder of the usurious interest, if you are believers.
And if you do not do so, then receive the news of a war from Allah and His Messenger. And if you repent, you will have your capital. You will not harm anyone, and you will not be wronged.
To the one who is in difficulty, grant a reprieve until he is well. But it's better for you to forgive the debt out of charity! If you only knew!
And fear the day when you will be brought back to Allah. Then each soul will be fully rewarded for what it has acquired. And they will not be wronged.
O you who believe! When you take out a debt with a fixed maturity, put it in writing; and let a scribe write it among yourselves in all justice; a scribe does not have to refuse to write according to what Allah has taught him; Let him write, and let the debtor dictate: Let him fear Allah his Lord, and take care not to diminish it in any way. If the debtor is wasteful or weak, or unable to dictate himself, then let his representative dictate in all justice. Have two witnesses of your men testify to it; and in the absence of two men, one man and two women from among those whom you accept as witnesses, so that if one of them goes astray, the other may call him back. And that the witnesses do not refuse when they are called. Do not tire of writing down the debt and its term, whether small or large, for it is more fair with Allah, and more upright in the testimony, and more likely to remove doubts. But if it is a present commodity that you are negotiating with each other: in that case, there is no sin in not writing it down. But take witnesses when you make a transaction between you; and let no harm be done to any scribe or witness. If you did, it would be a perversity in you. And fear Allah. Then Allah teaches you and Allah is All-Knowing.
But if you are on a journey and cannot find a scribe, a pledge received is enough. If there is mutual trust between you, let him to whom something has been entrusted restore it; and that he fears Allah his Lord. And do not hide the testimony: whoever hides it has a sinful heart. Allah, from what you do, is All-Knowing.
To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. Whether you manifest what is within you or hide it, Allah will call you to account. Then He will forgive whomever He wills, and punish whomever He wills. And Allah is Omnipotent.
The Messenger believed in what was sent down to him from his Lord, and also the believers: all believed in Allah, in His angels, in His books and in His Messengers; (saying): "We make no distinction between His messengers." And they said, "We heard and obeyed. Lord, we beg Your forgiveness. It is to You that the return will be."
Allah does not impose on any soul a burden beyond its capacity. It will be rewarded for the good it has done, punished for the evil it has done. Lord, do not chastise us if we happen to forget or make a mistake. Lord! Do not burden us with a heavy burden as You have burdened those who lived before us. Lord! Do not impose on us what we cannot bear, erase our faults, forgive us and have mercy on us. You are Our Master, grant us victory over the unfaithful peoples.
Alif, Lâm, Mîm.
Allah! There is no divinity except Him, the Living One, the Self-Subsisting One "Al-Qayyum".
He sent down the Book with the truth upon you, confirming the Books that came down before him. And He sent down the Torah and the Gospel.
before, as a guide for people. And He brought down the Discernment. Those who do not believe in the Revelations of Allah will certainly be severely punished. And Allah is Mighty, Possessor of the power to punish.
Nothing, really, is hidden from Allah from what exists on earth or in heaven.
He is the One who gives you form in the wombs as He wills. There is no god but Him, the Mighty, the Wise.
It is He who has sent down the Book upon you: there are unequivocal verses, which are the basis of the Book, and other verses that can be interpreted in different ways. Therefore, people who have an inclination towards error in their hearts emphasize the verses of ambiguity, seeking dissension by trying to find an interpretation for them, while no one knows the interpretation of them except Allah. But those who are well rooted in science say, "We believe it: it is all from our Lord." But only the intelligent remember it.
"Lord! Do not let our hearts go astray after You have guided us; and grant us Your mercy. Verily, You are the Great Giver!
Lord! It is You who will gather people together one day, in which there is no doubt, and Allah never fails to keep His promise."
Those who do not believe in their property and their children will not protect them from the punishment of Allah. They will be fuel for the Fire,
like Pharaoh's people and those who lived before them. They had treated Our proofs as lies. So Allah takes them for their sins. And Allah is harsh in punishment.
Say to those who do not believe, "You will soon be defeated; and you will be gathered to Hell. And what a bad place to rest!"
There was already a sign for you in these two troops that fought against each other: one was fighting in the cause of Allah; and the other was a disbeliever. The latter saw (the believers) with their own eyes, twice as many as themselves. And Allah helps whomever He wants with His help. This is an example for those endowed with clairvoyance!
People have been embellished with the love of the things they desire: women, children, hoarded treasures of gold and silver, marked horses, cattle and fields; all this is the object of enjoyment for this life, while it is to Allah that there is a good return.
Say, "Can I teach you anything better than all this? For the righteous, there are gardens with their Lord under which streams flow, to dwell in them forever, and also purified wives, and the pleasure of Allah." And Allah is Foreseeable upon [His] servants,
who say, "O our Lord, we have faith; therefore forgive us our sins, and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,"
they are the enduring, the truthful, the obedient, those who spend [in the cause of Allah] and those who beg forgiveness just before dawn.
Allah testifies, as do the angels and the gifted with knowledge, that there is no god but Him, the Maintainer of Justice. There is no god but Him, the Mighty, the Wise!
Certainly, the religion accepted by Allah is Islam. Those to whom the Book was brought did not quarrel, out of aggressiveness among themselves, until they had received knowledge. And whoever does not believe in the signs of Allah... then Allah is quick to call to account!
If they contradict you, say to them: "I have submitted myself and those who followed me completely to Allah." And say to those to whom the Book has been given, as well as to the illiterate: "Have you embraced Islam?" If they embrace Islam, they will be well guided. But; if they turn their backs... Your duty is only the transmission (of the message). Allah, upon [His] servants, is Clairvoyant.
Those who do not believe in the signs of Allah, kill the prophets without right, and kill those who command justice, announce to them a painful punishment.
It is they whose works have become in vain, here below as well as in the hereafter. And for them, there are no rescuers!
Have you not seen how those who have received a portion of the Book act, and who are now invited to the Book of Allah to settle their differences; How does a group of their own turn their backs and slip away?
That's because they say, "The Fire will only touch us for a certain number of days." And their lies deceive them in religion.
Well, how will they be, when We have gathered them together, in a day about which there is no doubt, and each soul will be fully rewarded according to what it has acquired? And they will not be wronged.
- Say: "O Allah, Master of absolute authority. You give authority to whomever You will, and You snatch authority from whomever You will; and You give power to whomever You will, and You humble whomever You will. Good is in Your hand and You are Omnipotent.
You bring night into day, and You bring day into night, and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living. And You give attribution to whomever You will, without counting."
Let not believers take infidels as allies, instead of believers. Whoever does so contradicts the religion of Allah, unless you seek to protect yourself from them. Allah warns you about Himself. And it is to Allah that he returns.
Say: "Whether you hide what is in your breasts or divulge it, Allah knows. He knows all that is in heaven and on earth. And Allah is Omnipotent.
The day when each soul will find itself confronted with what it has done well and what it has done badly; she will wish that there was a long distance between her and this evil! Allah warns you about Himself. Allah is Merciful to [His] servants.
Say: "If you truly love Allah, follow me, then Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Say: "Obey Allah and the Messenger. And if you turn your back... then Allah does not love infidels!
Verily, Allah has chosen Adam, Noah, the family of Abraham and the family of Imran above all others.
As descendants of one another, and Allah is Hearer and All-Knowing.
(Remember) when 'Imran's wife said, "Lord, I have dedicated to You exclusively what is in my womb. Accept it, then, from me. You are indeed the Hearer and the All-Knowing.
Then when she had given birth to it, she said: "Lord, behold, I have given birth to a girl," and Allah knew best what she had given birth to. The boy is not like the girl. "I have named her Mary, and I place her and her descendants under Your protection from the Devil, the banished."
His Lord then accepted it with good pleasure, and made it grow in good growth. And He entrusted the custody of it to Zechariah. Whenever he entered the Sanctuary with her, he found food near her. He said, "O Mary, where does this food come from?" – She said, "It comes to me from Allah." He certainly gives food to whomever He wills without counting.
Then Zechariah prayed to his Lord, and said, "O my Lord, give me an excellent offspring from You. For You are the One who hears prayer well."
Then the angels called to him while he was standing and praying in the Sanctuary: "Behold, Allah announces to you the birth of Yahya, the confirmation of a word of Allah. He will be a ruler, a chaste, a prophet and one of the good."
He said, "O my Lord, how can I have a boy now that old age has overtaken me and my wife is barren?" Allah says: "Like this!", Allah does what He wills.
- "Lord," said Zechariah, "give me a sign." - "Your sign," says Allah, "is that for three days you will be able to speak to people only by gesture. Call upon your Lord a lot; and glorify Him at the end and beginning of the day."
(Remember) when the angels said: "O Mary, Allah has chosen and purified you; and He has chosen you above the women of the worlds.
"O Mary, obey your Lord, prostrate yourself, and bow down with those who bow."
- These are the news of the Unknowable that We reveal to you. For you were not there when they threw away their calames to decide who should take care of Mary! You weren't there when they were arguing either!
(Remember) when the angels said: "O Mary, behold, Allah announces to you a word from Him: her name will be "Al-Masîh", "'Issa", son of Mary, illustrious in this world and in the Hereafter, and one of the near of Allah".
He will speak to the people, in the cradle and in his middle age, and he will be among the good."
- She said, "Lord! How could I have a child, when no man touched me?" – "That's the way it is!" He said. Allah creates what He wills. When He decides on something, He only says to her, "Be," and she is at once.
And (Allah) will teach him scripture, wisdom, the Torah and the Gospel,
and He will be the messenger to the children of Israel, [and will say to them]: "Verily, I come to you with a sign from your Lord. For you, I form clay like the figure of a bird, and then I blow into it: and, by Allah's permission, it becomes a bird. And I heal the man born blind and the leper, and I raise the dead, by the permission of Allah. And I teach you what you eat and what you store up in your homes. This is a sign for you, if you are believers!
And I confirm what is in the Torah revealed before me, and I make lawful for you a part of what was forbidden to you. And I have certainly brought a sign from your Lord. Fear Allah, then, and obey me.
Allah is my Lord and your Lord. Worship Him, then, and this is the straight way."
Then, when Jesus felt unbelief from them, he said, "Who are my allies in the way of Allah?" The apostles said, "We are the allies of Allah. We believe in Allah. And be a witness that we are subject to him.
Lord! We believed that You sent down and followed the messenger. So register us among those who testify."
And they [the others] began to plot. Allah has thwarted their plot. And Allah knows best how to plot them!
(Remember) when Allah says: "O Jesus, verily, I will put an end to your earthly life, raise you to Me, rid you of those who did not believe, and put those who follow you above those who do not believe until the Day of Resurrection. Then you will return to Me, and I will judge between you what you were opposing on.
As for those who have not believed, I will punish them with a severe punishment, both here and hereafter; And for them, there are no rescuers.
And as for those who have faith and do good works, He will give them their rewards. And Allah does not love the unjust.
This is what We recite to you from the verses and from the precise revelation.
To Allah, Jesus is like Adam, whom He created from dust, and then He said to him, "Be," and He was.
The truth comes from your Lord. Do not be among the sceptics.
To those who contradict you about him, now that you are well informed, you have only to say: "Come, let us call our sons and yours, our wives and yours, our own persons and yours, and then let us utter mutual execration by calling down Allah's curse on liars.
This, of course, is the true story. And there is no god but Allah. Verily, it is Allah who is the Mighty, the Wise.
So if they turn their backs... then Allah knows well the sowers of corruption!
Say: "O People of the Book, come to a common word between us and you: that we worship only Allah, without associating anything with Him, and that we do not take one another as lords besides Allah." Then, if they turn their backs, say, "Be witnesses that we are submissive."
O People of the Book, why do you dispute about Abraham, when the Torah and the Gospel came down only after him? Are you not reasoning, then?
You have indeed argued about something you know. But why do you argue about things you don't know about? But Allah knows, but you do not know.
Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian. He was completely subject to Allah (Muslim). And he was not one of the Associates.
Certainly the men most worthy to claim Abraham are those who followed him, as well as this Prophet, and those who have faith. And Allah is the ally of the believers.
Some of the People of the Book would have liked to lead you astray. But they only lead astray; and they are not aware of it.
O People of the Book, why do you not believe in the verses of Allah (the Qur'an), while you are witnesses of them?
O People of the Book, why do you mix the false with the true and knowingly hide the truth?
Thus says some of the People of the Book: "At the beginning of the day, believe in what has been revealed to the Muslims, but at the end of the day, reject it, so that they may return (to their old religion).
[And the People of the Book say to their co-religionists]: "Believe only those who follow your religion..." Say: "The true direction is the guidance of Allah" – [and they also say: You must neither approve nor acknowledge] that anyone other than you can receive as what you have received so that they (the Muslims) cannot argue against you to your Lord. Say to them: Verily, grace is in the hand of Allah. He gives it to whomever He wills. Allah's grace is immense and He is All-Knowing.
He reserves his mercy for whomever He wills. And Allah is the Possessor of immense grace.
And among the People of the Book there are some who, if you entrust him with a qintar, give it back to you. But there are also some who, if you entrust him with a dinâr, will not repay you unless you force him to do so unceasingly. All this because they say: "These (Arabs) who don't have a book have no way to coerce us." They tell lies against Allah when they know.
On the contrary, whoever fulfills his promise and fears Allah... Allah loves the pious.
Those who sell their pledge to Allah and their oaths at a low price will have no part in the Hereafter, and Allah will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will he purify them. and they will have a painful punishment.
And there are some among them who roll their tongues as they read the Book to make you believe that it comes from the Book, when it is not from the Book; and they say: "This is from Allah, but it is not from Allah. They knowingly tell lies against Allah.
It would not be fitting for a human being to whom Allah has given the Book, the Understanding and the Prophethood, to then say to the people: "Be my worshippers, to the exclusion of Allah; but on the contrary, [he must say]: "Become learned, obedient to the Lord, since you teach the Book and study it."
And he is not going to command you to take angels and prophets as your lords. Would he command you to reject the faith, you who are Muslims?
And when Allah made this commitment from the prophets: "Whenever I grant you a Book and wisdom, and then a messenger comes to you to confirm what is with you, you must believe in him, and you must help him." He said to them, "Do you consent and accept My covenant on this condition?" - "We consent," they said. "Be witnesses, then," says Allah. And here I am, with you, among the witnesses.
Whoever will then turn his back... then they are the ones who will be the perverts."
Do they desire a religion other than that of Allah, when all that is in the heavens and on earth is subject to Him, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will be returned?
Say: "We believe in Allah, in what was sent down upon us, in what was sent down on Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the tribes, and in what was brought to Moses, Jesus and the prophets from their Lord: we make no difference between them; and it is to Him that we are Subject."
