And whoever desires a religion other than Islam will not be accepted, and he will be among the losers in the Hereafter.
How would Allah guide people who no longer have faith after they believe and testify that the Messenger is truthful, and after the proofs have come to them? Allah does not guide unrighteous people.
Their reward will be that they will have the curse of Allah, the Angels and all human beings upon them.
They will remain there forever. The punishment will not be alleviated for them, and they will have no respite,
except those who will later repent and reform: for Allah is forgiving and merciful.
Verily, those who no longer believe after having faith, and allow their disbelief to increase even more, their repentance will never be accepted. These are really the misguided ones.
Those who do not believe and die disbelievers, it will never be acceptable for any of them to redeem themselves, even if they give the golden content of the earth. They will have a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.
You will only attain (true) piety if you make largesse of what you cherish. Whatever you do with largesse, Allah certainly knows well.
All food was lawful for the children of Israel, except that which Israel itself forbade itself before the Torah came down. Say [them]: "Bring the Torah and read it, if what you say is true."
So, whoever after that invents lies against Allah... these are, therefore, the truly unjust.
Say: "It is Allah who speaks the truth. So follow the religion of Abraham, an upright Muslim. And there were no associates."
The first House that was built for the people was that of Bakka (Mecca) blessed and a good direction for the universe.
There are clear signs, among them the place where Abraham stood; and whoever enters it is safe. And it is a duty to Allah for people who have the means to go and make the pilgrimage of the House. And whoever doesn't believe... Allah largely dispenses with worlds.
Say: "O People of the Book, why do you not believe in the verses of Allah (al-Qur'an), while Allah is witness of what you do?"
Say: "O People of the Book, why do you obstruct the way of Allah to the one who has faith, and why do you want to make this way crooked, when you are witnesses of the truth?" And Allah is not inattentive to what you do.
O you who believe! If you obey a group of those who have been given the Book, it will make you disbelievers after you have faith.
And how can you not believe, when the verses of Allah are recited to you, and His Messenger stands in your midst? Whoever is strongly attached to Allah, he is guided to a straight path.
O you who believe! Fear Allah as He should be feared. And die only in full submission.
And cling all together to Allah's "Habl" (cable) and do not be divided; and remember the blessing of Allah upon you: when you were enemies, it was He who reconciled your hearts. Then, by His blessing, you became brothers. And when you were on the brink of an abyss of Fire, it was He who saved you from it. So Allah shows you His signs so that you may be rightly guided.
Let there be from you a community that calls for the good, commands what is proper, and forbids what is blameworthy. Because they will be the ones who will succeed.
And don't be like those who divided and began to argue, after the proofs came to them, and they will have a great punishment.
On the day when some faces will light up, and others will darken. To those whose faces are darkened (it will be said): "Did you disbelieve after you had faith?" Now, taste the chastisement, for denying the faith.
And as for those whose faces are brightened, they will be in the mercy of Allah, where they will dwell forever.
These are the verses of Allah; We recite them to you (Muhammad) with truth. And Allah does not want to harm the worlds.
To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. And to Allah all things will be brought back.
You are the best community that has been raised up for men. You command what is proper, forbid what is blameworthy, and believe in Allah. If the People of the Book believed, it would be better for them, there are some who have faith, but most of them are perverts.
They will never know how to cause you great harm, only a nuisance (through the tongue); and if they fight you, they will turn their backs on you, and then they will have no help.
Wherever they are, they are degraded, unless there is a providential help from Allah or a pact made with men. They have incurred the wrath of Allah, and now they have been struck with misfortune, for not believing in the signs of Allah, and for unjustly murdering the prophets, and also for disobeying and transgressing.
But they are not all the same. There is an upright community among the People of the Book who, in the hours of the night, recite the verses of Allah while prostrating themselves.
They believe in Allah and the Last Day, command what is proper, forbid what is blameworthy, and contribute to good deeds. These are among the good people.
And whatever good they do, it will not be denied to them. For Allah knows the righteous well.
As for those who do not believe, neither their property nor their children will ever be able to serve them against the punishment of Allah. And they are the people of the Fire: they will dwell there forever.
What they spend in this life is like an icy wind that beats down on a field belonging to people who have wronged themselves, and destroys it. For it is not Allah who causes them harm, but they harm themselves.
O believers, do not take confidants outside of yourselves: they will not fail to upset you. They would like you to be in trouble. Hatred has certainly manifested itself in their mouths, but what their breasts hide is even more enormous. Here We are exposing the signs to you. If you could reason!
You (Muslims) love them, but they do not love you; and you have faith in the whole Book. And when they meet you, they say, "We believe," and when they are alone, in rage with you, they bite each other's fingertips. Say: "Die of your rage." Verily, Allah knows the contents of hearts very well.
If a good touches you, they grieve for it. If an evil befalls you, they rejoice. But if you are enduring and pious, their scheming will not cause you any harm. Allah knows perfectly well everything they do.
When one morning you (Muhammad) left your family to assign the fighting posts to the believers, and Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
When two of your groups thought of giving way! While Allah is the ally of both of them! For it is in Allah that the believers must place their trust.
Allah gave you victory in Badr when you were humiliated. Fear Allah, then. So that you can be grateful!
(Allah has given you victory) when you said to the believers; "Is it not enough for you that your Lord sends down three thousand angels for help?"
Of course! If you are enduring and pious, and they [the enemies] immediately assail you, your Lord will send you five thousand distinctly marked angels as reinforcements.
And Allah did it only (to tell you) good news, and to make sure of it in your hearts. Victory can only come from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise;
to annihilate some of the disbelievers or to humiliate them (by defeat) and so that they return disappointed.
- You (Muhammad) have no part in the (divine) order - let Him (Allah) accept their repentance (by embracing Islam) or chastise them, for they are indeed unjust.
To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. He forgives whom He wills, and He chastises whom He wills... And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
O you who believe! Don't practice usury by multiplying your capital disproportionately. And fear Allah so that you may succeed!
And fear the Fire prepared for the disbelievers.
And obey Allah and the Messenger so that mercy may be shown to you.
And work together for the forgiveness of your Lord, and for a Garden (paradise) as wide as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the righteous,
who spend in ease and in adversity, who overcome their rage and forgive others - for Allah loves the do-good -
and for those who, if they have committed any deceit or caused any harm to their own souls (by disobeying Allah), remember Allah and ask forgiveness for their sins - and who forgives sins if not Allah? - and who do not knowingly persist in the evil they have done.
These are rewarded with the forgiveness of their Lord, as well as the Gardens under which the streams flow, to dwell there forever. How beautiful is the wages of those who do good!
Before you, of course, many events have happened. Now go through the earth, and see what has become of those who called (the prophets) liars.
This is a talk for people, a guide, and an exhortation for the righteous.
Don't let yourselves be beaten, don't grieve when you're the superiors, if you're true believers.
If a wound strikes you, such a wound also strikes the enemy. So We make the days (good and bad) alternate among the people, so that Allah may recognize those who believe, and choose martyrs from among you, and Allah does not love the wrongdoers.
and that Allah may purify those who believe, and annihilate the disbelievers.
Do you intend to enter Paradise without Allah distinguishing among you those who struggle and endure?
Of course, you wished for death before you met her. But you saw it, indeed, while you were looking!
Muhammad is only a messenger - messengers before him have passed. If he died, then, or if he was killed, would you go back on your heels? Whoever returns on his heels will not harm Allah in any way; and Allah will soon reward those who are grateful.
No one can die except by Allah's permission, and at a predetermined time. Whoever wants the reward of this world, We give it to him. Whoever wants the reward of the Hereafter, We give it to him, and We will soon reward the grateful.
How many prophets fought, along with many disciples, they did not relent because of what happened to them in the cause of Allah. They did not weaken and they did not yield. And Allah loves those who endure.
And they had only this word: "Lord, forgive us our sins and our excesses in our behavior, strengthen our steps and give us victory over the disbelievers."
Allah, therefore, gave them the reward of this world, as well as the beautiful reward of the Hereafter. And Allah loves good people.
O you who believe! If you obey those who do not believe, they will turn you back. And you will come back as losers.
But Allah is your Master. He is the best rescuer.
We are going to strike fear into the hearts of the disbelievers. For they have associated with Allah (idols) without any proof coming down from Him. Fire will be their refuge. What a bad abode is that of the unjust!
And verily, Allah kept His promise to you, when by His permission you killed them unceasingly, until the moment when you relented, when you argued about the order given, and you disobeyed after He had shown you (the victory) that you love! There were some among you who desired the life of this world, and there were some among you who desired the hereafter. Then He made you recoil before them, in order to test you. And certainly He has forgiven you. And Allah is the Possessor of grace towards the believers.
(Remember) when you fled without looking back at anyone, while behind you the Messenger was calling you. Then He inflicted anguish upon anguish upon you, so that you would not be grieved for what has escaped you or for the setbacks you have suffered. And Allah is Fully Aware of what you do.
Then He sent down upon you, after anguish and tranquillity, a sleep that enveloped some of you, while another part was anxious for itself and had thoughts about Allah that were not in accordance with the truth, thoughts worthy of the age of Ignorance. - They said, "Do we have any part in this matter?" Say: "The whole matter is Allah's." What they do not reveal to you, they hide within themselves: "If we had had any choice in this matter," they say, "We would not have been killed here." Say: "Had you been in your houses, those for whom death was decreed would have gone out to the place where death awaited them. This is so that Allah may test what you have in your breasts, and purify what you have in your hearts. And Allah knows what is in the hearts.
Those of you who turned your backs on the day the two armies met, it was only the Devil who made them flinch, because of some of their (evil) deeds. But Allah has forgiven them. For truly Allah is Forgiving and Forgiving!
O you who believe! Do not be like those disbelievers who said of their brothers who went on a journey or to fight, "If they were with us, they would not have died, and they would not have been killed." Allah made it a cause of regret in their hearts. It is Allah who gives life and death. And Allah is watching what you do.
And if you are killed in the cause of Allah or die, forgiveness from Allah and mercy are better than what they gather.
Whether you die or are killed, you will be gathered to Allah.
It is by some mercy from Allah that you (Muhammad) have been so kind to them! But if you were rough, hard-hearted, they would have run away from you. Forgive them, therefore, and beg forgiveness for them. And consult them about affairs; then once you have made up your mind, entrust yourself to Allah, Allah truly loves those who trust in Him.
If Allah gives you His help, no one can defeat you. If He abandons you, who will help you after Him? It is Allah that believers must trust.
A prophet is not someone who appropriates booty. Whoever appropriates it, will come with what he has appropriated on the Day of Resurrection. Then, to each individual what he has acquired will be fully rewarded. And they will not be wronged.
Is the one who obeys Allah's pleasure the same as the one who incurs the wrath of Allah? His refuge will be Hell; and what a bad destination!
They have different degrees with Allah, and Allah observes what they do.
Allah has certainly done a favor to the believers when He has sent a messenger from among them to them, who will recite His verses to them, purify them, and teach them the Book and the Wisdom, even though they were already in an obvious error.
What! When a misfortune befalls you, but you once inflicted twice as much, you say, "Where does this come from?" Answer them: "It comes from yourselves." Verily, Allah is Omnipotent.
And all that you suffered on the day when the two troops met, it was by Allah's permission, and in order that He might distinguish the believers,
and that He distinguishes hypocrites. They were told, "Come and fight in the cause of Allah, or repel [the enemy]," and they said, "Of course we would follow you if we were sure that there would be a war." On that day, they were closer to disbelief than to faith. They said with their mouths what was not in their hearts. And Allah knows very well what they hid.
Those who remained in their homes said to their brothers, "If they had obeyed us, they would not have been killed." Say: "Therefore remove death from you, if you are truthful."
Do not think that those who were killed in the cause of Allah are dead. On the contrary, they are alive, with their Lord, well provided for
and rejoicing in the favor that Allah has bestowed upon them, and delighted that those who have remained behind them and have not yet joined them, will know no fear and will not be afflicted.
They are delighted with a blessing from Allah and a favor, and with the fact that Allah does not let the reward of the believers go to waste.
Those who, although wounded, responded to the call of Allah and the Messenger, there will be a great reward for those among them who have done good and practiced piety.
Certainly those to whom it was said, "The people have gathered against you; fear them" - this increased their faith - and they said: "Allah is sufficient for us; He is our best guarantor."
So they returned with a blessing from Allah and a grace. No evil came to them, and they followed what pleases Allah. And Allah is the Possessor of immense grace.
It is the Devil who frightens you of his adherents. So don't be afraid of them. But be afraid of Me, if you are believers.
Do not (O Muhammad) have any sorrow for those who quickly throw themselves into disbelief. Verily, they will not harm Allah in any way. Allah is anxious not to assign to them any share of property in the Hereafter. And for them there will be a huge punishment.
Those who have exchanged belief for disbelief will not harm Allah in any way. And for them a painful punishment.
Let not those who have not believed count on the delay which We grant them to their advantage. If We grant them a delay, it is only so that they may increase their sins. And for them a degrading punishment.
Allah is not such that He leaves the believers in the state you are in until He distinguishes the bad from the good. And Allah is not such that He reveals to you the Unknowable. But Allah chooses from among His Messengers whom He wills. Therefore believe in Allah and His Messengers. And if you have faith and godliness, then you will have a tremendous reward.
Let not those who greedily guard what Allah gives them by His grace count it as good for them. On the contrary, it is bad for them: on the Day of Resurrection, what they have kept with greed will be tied around their necks. It is Allah who has the inheritance of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Fully Aware of what you do.
Allah has certainly heard the words of those who said: "Allah is poor and we are rich." We record their words, as well as their murder, without right, of the prophets. And We will say to them: "Taste the punishment of the furnace.
This is because of what your hands have done." For Allah does not harm the servants.
The same ones who said: "Truly Allah has enjoined us not to believe in a Messenger until He has brought us an offering that the fire consumes." - Say: "Messengers before me have come to you with proofs, and with what you have said. Why did you kill them, if you are truthful?"
If they (Muhammad) call you a liar, the prophets before you have certainly been called liars. They had come with the clear proofs, the Psalms and the Luminous Book.
Every soul will taste death. But it is only on the Day of Resurrection that you will receive your full reward. Whoever is removed from the Fire and brought into Paradise has certainly succeeded. And the present life is only an object of deceptive enjoyment.
Certainly you will be tried in your goods and your persons; and certainly you will hear many unpleasant words from those to whom the Book was given before you, and from the Associates. But if you are enduring and pious... this is the best resolution to take.
Allah took this commitment from those to whom the Book was given: "Expose it to the people and do not hide it." But they threw it behind their backs and sold it at a low price. What a bad trade they have made!
Do not think that those who rejoice in what they have done, and who like to be praised for what they have not done, do not think, then, that they find an escape from punishment. For them, there will be a painful punishment!
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Omnipotent.
Verily, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are indeed signs for the endowed with understanding,
who, standing, sitting, lying on their sides, call upon Allah and meditate on the creation of the heavens and the earth (saying): "Our Lord! You did not create this in vain. Glory to You! Keep us from the punishment of the Fire.
Lord! Whoever You bring into the Fire, You truly cover him with disgrace. And for the unjust, there are no helpers!
Lord! We have heard the call of the one who called to faith: "Believe in your Lord" and from then on we have believed. Lord, forgive us our sins, blot out our misdeeds, and place us with the good people when we die.
Lord! Give us what You have promised us through Your messengers. And do not cover us with shame on the Day of Resurrection. For You do not fail in Your promise."
Their Lord then heard them (saying, "Verily, I do not let the good that any of you has done, male or female, go to waste, for you are one from one another. Therefore, those who have emigrated, who have been expelled from their homes, who have been persecuted in My way, who have fought, who have been killed, I will indeed consider their evil deeds to be expiated, and will bring them into the Gardens under which the streams flow, as a reward from Allah." As for Allah, it is with Him that the greatest reward is.
Let not be deceived by the versatility of those who are unfaithful in the land.
Poor enjoyment! Then their refuge will be Hell. And what a detestable layer!
But those who fear their Lord will have gardens under which streams flow, to dwell there forever, a place of welcome from Allah. And what is with Allah is better for the righteous.
There are certainly among the People of the Book those who believe in Allah and in what has been sent down to you and what has been sent down to them. They are humble to Allah, and do not sell the verses of Allah at a low price. These are the ones whose reward is with their Lord. Verily, Allah is quick to make the accounts.
O you who believe! Be enduring. Encourage endurance. Constantly fight (against the enemy) and fear Allah, so that you may succeed!
O men! Fear your Lord, who created you from one being, and from him his bride, and from these two caused many men and women to be scattered. Fear Allah, in whose name you implore one another, and fear breaking the ties of blood. Verily, Allah is watching you perfectly.
And give the orphans their goods; do not substitute the bad for the good. Do not eat their goods with yours: it is really a great sin.
And if you are afraid of not being fair to orphans,... It is lawful to marry two, three, or four of the women you like, but if you fear that you will not be fair to them, then only one, or slaves that you own. This is in order not to do injustice (or so as not to aggravate your family burden).
And give the wives their mahr, with good grace. If they willingly give up something of it to you, then dispose of it at your ease and with a good heart.
And do not entrust to the incompetent your possessions, which Allah has made your sustenance. But take from them food and clothing; and speak to them properly.
And test (the ability) of the orphans until they attain (the suitability) for marriage; and if you feel that they are doing well, give them their possessions. Do not use them (for your own sake) with waste and dissipation, before they grow. Whoever is well-to-do, let him abstain from taking it himself. If he is poor, then let him use them sensibly: and when you hand over their property, take witnesses against them. But Allah is enough to observe and count.
Men are responsible for a part of what their father and mother and relatives have left; and to women a share of what the father and mother as well as the relatives have left, whether little or a lot: a fixed part.
And when the next of kin, the orphans, the needy attend the division, offer them something of the inheritance, and speak to them properly.
Let fear seize those who leave behind them a weak descendant, and who are anxious about them; therefore let them fear Allah and speak righteous words.
Those who eat [dispose] unjustly of the goods of orphans only eat fire in their bellies. They will soon burn in the flames of Hell.
This is what Allah commands you to do with regard to your children: to the son, a share equal to that of two daughters. If there are only girls, even more than two, then two-thirds of what the deceased leaves. And if there is only one, then half of it. As for the father and mother of the deceased, to each of them the sixth of what he leaves, if he has a child. If he has no children and his father and mother inherit from him, then his mother will receive one-third. But if he has brothers, then to the mother the sixth, after execution of the will he has made or payment of a debt. Of your ascendants or descendants, you do not know who is closer to you in use. This is an obligatory command of Allah, for Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And to you half of what your wives leave, if they have no children. If they have a child, then to you a quarter of what they leave, after the execution of the will they would have made or the payment of a debt. And to them a quarter of what you leave, if you don't have children. But if you have a child, then to them the eighth of what you leave after the execution of the will you would have made or the payment of a debt. And if a man or a woman dies without a direct heir, yet let him leave a brother or sister, to each of these then a sixth. If there are more than two, then all of them will participate in the third party, after execution of the will or payment of a debt, without prejudice to anyone. (Such is the) Injunction of Allah! And Allah is All-Knowing and Forgiving.
These are the commands of Allah. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, He will bring him into the Gardens under which the streams flow, to dwell there forever. And that's the great success.
And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses His commands, He will bring him into the Fire to dwell there forever. And he will have a degrading punishment.
Those of your wives who fornicate, have four of you testify against them. If they testify, then confine these women to your homes until death calls them back or Allah decrees another order for them.
The two of you who have committed it, punish them. If they then repent and reform, then leave them in peace. Allah remains Welcoming to repentance and Merciful.
Allah only welcomes the repentance of those who do evil out of ignorance and immediately repent. These are the ones from whom Allah welcomes repentance. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
But absolution is not for those who do evil deeds until death comes to one of them, and he cries out, "Verily, I repent now," nor for those who die disbelievers. And it is for them that We have prepared a painful punishment.
O you who believe! It is not lawful for you to inherit women against their will. Don't prevent them from remarrying in order to take away some of what you gave from them, unless they commit a proven sin. And behave properly towards them. If you have an aversion to them during your life together, you may have an aversion to something in which Allah has deposited a great good.
If you want to substitute one wife for another, and you have given one a qintar, do not take anything back. What! Would you rebuke him out of injustice and manifest sin?
How can you dare to take it up again, after the most intimate union has associated you with each other, and they have obtained a solemn engagement from you?
And do not marry the women whom your fathers married, except for the past. It is a turpitude, an abomination, and what bad conduct!
You are forbidden your mothers, daughters, sisters, paternal aunts and maternal aunts, daughters of a brother and daughters of a sister, mothers who have nursed you, foster-sisters, mothers of your wives, daughters-in-law under your guardianship and descendants of women with whom you have consummated marriage; if the marriage has not been consummated, this is not a sin on your part; the wives of your sons born of your loins; as well as two sisters together - except for the past. For truly Allah is Forgiving and Merciful;
and, among the women, the ladies (who have a husband), unless they are your slaves in full ownership. Allah's prescription upon you! Apart from that, it is permissible for you to seek them out, using your possessions and entering into marriage, not as debauched. Then, as you enjoy them, give them their mahr as a thing due. There is no sin against you if you make any agreement among yourselves after the mahr has been set, for Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And whoever among you does not have the means to marry free (non-slave) believing women, well (he can marry) a woman among those of your believing slaves. Allah knows your faith best, for you are one of the same religion. And marry them with the permission of their masters (Waliy) and give them a suitable mahr; (marry them) being virtuous and not given over to debauchery or having clandestine lovers. If, once engaged in marriage, they commit adultery, they receive half the punishment due to free (non-slave) married women. This is permissible to those of you who fear debauchery; but it would be better for you to be enduring. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Allah wants to enlighten you, to show you the ways of men before you, and also to welcome your repentance. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And Allah wants to welcome your repentance. But those who follow the passions want you to bow greatly (to error as they do).
Allah wants to lighten your obligations because man was created weak.
O you who believe! Let none of you eat each other's goods illegally. But let there be (legal) trade, between you, by mutual consent. And don't kill yourself. Allah, verily, is merciful to you.
And whoever does this because of excess and iniquity, We will throw him into the Fire, which is easy for Allah.
If you avoid the great sins that are forbidden to you, We will erase your misdeeds from your account, and We will bring you into an honorable place (Paradise).
Do not covet what Allah has bestowed upon some of you more than others; to men the share they have acquired, and to women the share they have acquired. Ask Allah for His grace. For Allah is Omniscient.
To all We have appointed heirs for what their parents and their relatives, and those to whom you have pledged with your own hands, give them their share, for Allah is the Witness of all things.
Men have authority over women because of the favors that Allah bestows on women over women, and also because of the expenditure they make of their property. Righteous women are obedient (to their husbands), and protect what should be protected, during the absence of their husbands, with the protection of Allah. And as for those whose disobedience you fear, exhort them, and depart from them in their beds, and beat them. If they can obey you, then do not look for a way against them, for Allah is indeed High and Great!
If you are afraid of disagreement between the two [spouses], then send an arbiter from his family, and an arbiter from his family. If the two want reconciliation, Allah will restore understanding between them. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing and All-Knowing.
Worship Allah and do not give Him any partners. Be kind to (your) father and mother, the relatives, the orphans, the poor, the near neighbor, the distant neighbor, the colleague and the traveler, and the slaves in your possession, for Allah does not love the presumptuous, the arrogant, the arrogant,
Those who are miserly and command others to be greedy, and hide what Allah has given them by His grace. We have prepared a degrading punishment for the disbelievers.
And those who spend their wealth ostentatiously in front of the people, and do not believe in Allah or the Last Day. Whoever has the Devil for an inseparable comrade, what a bad comrade!
What would they have to reproach themselves for if they had believed in Allah and the Last Day and spent what Allah has given them? Allah, of them, is All-Knowing.
Verily, Allah does not harm anyone, even if it is by the weight of an atom. If it is a good deed, He doubles it, and gives a great reward from Him.
What will they be like when We bring a witness from every community, and We bring you (Muhammad) as a witness against these people?
On that day, those who did not believe and disobeyed the Messenger would prefer that the earth be levelled over them, and they will not be able to hide any word from Allah.
O you who believe! Do not approach the Salat while you are drunk until you understand what you are saying, and also when you are in a state of impurity - unless you are on a journey - until you have taken a ritual bath. If you are sick or travelling, or if one of you returns from the place where he relieved, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then have recourse to pure earth, and pass it on your faces and on your hands. Allah, verily, is Forgiving and Forgiving.
Have you not (Muhammad) seen those who have received a part of the Book buy error and try to make you go astray from the [right] path?
Allah knows your enemies best. And Allah is sufficient as a protector. And Allah is sufficient as a helper.
There are some among the Jews who distort words from their meaning, and say, "We heard, but we disobeyed," "Listen without your being given to hear," and favor us with "Ra'ina," twisting the tongue and attacking religion. If, on the contrary, they said, "We have heard and obeyed," "Listen," and "Look at us," it would be better for them, and more righteous. But Allah cursed them because of their disbelief; their faith is therefore very mediocre.
O you to whom the Book has been given, believe in what We have sent down, in confirmation of what you already had, before We blotted out faces and turned them upside down, or cursed them as We cursed the people of the Sabbath. For the command of Allah is always carried out.
Verily, Allah does not forgive Him if He is given a partner. Apart from that, He forgives whomever He wills. But whoever gives Allah a partner commits a great sin.
Have you not seen those who declare themselves clean? But it is Allah who purifies whomever He wills; and they shall not be injured, not even by a sprig of date stone.
Look at how they invent lies against Allah. And that's enough of a manifest sin!
Have you not seen those to whom a part of the Book has been given faith in magic (gibt) and Taghhut, and say in favor of those who do not believe, "These are better guided (on the way) than those who have believed"?
These are the ones whom Allah has cursed; and whoever curses Allah, you will never find a helper for him.
Do they have some of the power? So they wouldn't give people anything, not even the hollow of a date pit.
Do they envy people what Allah has given them by His grace? Now We have given to the family of Abraham the Book and Wisdom; and We have given them a great kingdom.
Some of them believed in him, others of them distanced themselves from him. Hell will suffice for them as a flame (to burn there).
Verily, those who do not believe in Our verses, We will soon burn them in the Fire. Whenever their skins have been consumed, We will give them more skins in exchange so that they may taste punishment. Verily, Allah is Mighty and Wise!
And as for those who have believed and done good works, We will soon bring them into the Gardens under which streams flow. They will remain there forever. There will be purified wives for them. And We will bring them in under a thick shade.
Verily, Allah commands you to return the deposits to their beneficiaries, and when you judge among people, to judge fairly. What a good exhortation that Allah gives you! Verily, Allah is the One who hears and sees all things.
O you who believe! Obey Allah, and obey the Messenger and those of you who hold the commandment. Then, if you quarrel about anything, refer it to Allah and to the Messenger, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day. It will be much better and better interpreted (and completed).
Have you not seen those who claim to believe in what was sent down to you [Prophet] and what was sent down before you? They want to take the Taghût as their judge, when it is in him that they have been commanded not to believe. But the Devil wants to lead them astray far away, into error.
And when they are told, "Come to what Allah has sent down and to the Messenger," you see the hypocrites moving away from you.
How will they act when a calamity befalls them, because of what they have prepared with their own hands? Then they will come to you, swearing by Allah: "We have only wanted good and reconciliation."
These are the ones of whom Allah knows what is in their hearts. Do not hold it against them, but exhort them, and speak convincing words about themselves.
We have sent a Messenger only to be obeyed by the permission of Allah. If, when they have wronged themselves, they come to you and ask for forgiveness from Allah, and if the Messenger asks forgiveness for them, they will find Allah, Most Accepting of Repentance, Merciful.
No!... By your Lord! They will not be believers until they have asked you to judge their disputes, and have not felt any anguish for what you have decided, and they submit completely [to your sentence].
If We had commanded them, "Kill yourselves," or "Come out of your homes," they would not have done it, except for a few of them. If they had done what they were exhorted to do, it would certainly have been better for them, and (their faith) would have been more established.
Then We would certainly have given them a great reward from Us.
and We would have guided them to a straight path.
Whoever obeys Allah and the Messenger... these will be with those whom Allah has bestowed with His blessings: the prophets, the truthful, the martyrs, and the righteous. And what good companions these are!
This grace comes from Allah. And Allah is sufficient as the Perfect Knower.
O you who believe! Take your precautions and go on expeditions in detachments or en masse.
Verily, there will be someone among you who will delay [going to battle] and if something bad befalls you, he will say: "Verily, Allah has done me a favor because I have not been with them."
and if it is a grace that comes to you from Allah, he will certainly begin to say, as if there were no affection between you and him: "What a pity! If I had been with them, I would have gained a huge gain."
Let them, therefore, fight in the cause of Allah those who exchange this life for the Hereafter. And whoever fights in the cause of Allah, whether killed or victorious, We will soon give him a great reward.
And what have you not to fight in the cause of Allah, and for the cause of the weak: men, women and children who say: "Lord! Bring us out of this city whose people are unjust, and assign us an ally from You, and assign us a helper from You."
The believers fight in the cause of Allah, and those who do not believe fight in the path of the Taghût. Well, fight the Devil's allies, for the Devil's cunning is, indeed, weak.
Have you not seen those who were told: "Abstain from fighting, perform Salat and pay Zakat?" Then when the battle was prescribed to them, behold, some of them began to fear the people as one fears Allah, or even with a still stronger fear, and to say: "O our Lord! Why did You command us to fight? Why didn't You put it off until a little later?" Say: "The enjoyment of this world is ephemeral, but the future life is better for anyone who is pious. And you will not be wronged, even with a sprig of date stone.
Wherever you are, death will reach you, even if you are in impregnable towers. If a good thing befalls them, they say: "It is from Allah." If an evil befalls them, they say: "It is due to you (Muhammad)." Say: "All is of Allah." But what is the matter with these people, that they understand almost no words?
Every good that befalls you comes from Allah, and every evil that befalls you comes from yourself. And we sent you to the people as a messenger. And Allah is sufficient as a witness.
Whoever obeys the Messenger is certainly obeying Allah. And whoever turns his back... We did not send you to them as a guardian.
They say, "Obedience!" Then, as soon as they leave your house, some of them deliberate during the night on something quite different from what they have told you. [However] Allah records what they do at night. So forgive them and put your trust in Allah. And Allah is sufficient as the Protector.
Do they not meditate on the Qur'an? If it came from anyone other than Allah, they would certainly find many contradictions in it.
When they receive reassuring or alarming news, they spread it. If they reported it to the Messenger and the holders of the commandment among them, those of them who seek enlightenment, would have learned (the truth from the mouth of the Prophet and the holders of the commandment). And if it had not been for Allah's grace upon you and His mercy, you would have followed the Devil, except for a few.
Fight in the cause of Allah, you are responsible only for yourself, and incite the believers (to fight). Allah will indeed stop the violence of the disbelievers. Allah is more formidable in strength and more severe in punishment.
Whoever intercedes with good intercession will have a share of it; and whoever intercedes with a bad intercession will bear some of the responsibility. And Allah is Mighty over all things.
If you are greeted, salute in a better way; or else return it (simply). Verily, Allah takes everything into account.
Allah! No god but Him! Most certainly He will gather you together on the Day of Resurrection, no doubt about it. And who is more truthful than Allah in word?
What have you to do with dividing yourselves into two factions about hypocrites? Whereas Allah has repressed them (in their unfaithfulness) for what they have acquired. Do you want to guide those whom Allah leads astray? And whoever Allah leads astray, you will not find a way for him.
They would like to see you disbelievers as they disbelieved: then you would all be equal! So do not take allies from among them, until they emigrate in the cause of Allah. But if they turn their backs, then seize them, and kill them wherever you find them; and do not take from among them any ally or helper,
except those who join a group with which you have made an alliance, or those who come to you with a heavy heart from having to fight you or their own tribe. If Allah had willed, He would have given them boldness (and strength) against you, and they would certainly have fought you. If they remain neutral towards you and do not fight you, and offer you peace, then Allah does not give you a way against them.
You will find others who seek to have your trust, and at the same time the trust of their own tribe. Whenever they are pushed towards Association (idolatry) they fall back into it en masse. (Therefore,) if they do not remain neutral toward you, do not offer you peace, and do not hold back their hands (from fighting you), then seize them and kill them wherever you find them. Against these We have given you manifest authority.
It is not up to a believer to kill another believer, except by mistake. Whoever kills a believer by mistake, then let him free a believing slave and remit the blood money to his family, unless the family renounces it out of charity. But if [the slain] belonged to a people who were enemies of yours and was a believer, then let a believing slave be freed. If he belonged to a people to whom you are bound by a covenant, then let his family be paid blood money and let a believing slave be freed. Whoever cannot find the means to do so, let him fast for two months in a row to be forgiven by Allah. Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Whoever intentionally kills a believer, then His reward will be Hell, to dwell there forever. Allah has struck him with His wrath, cursed him, and prepared a great punishment for him.
O you who believe! When you go out to fight in the cause of Allah, see clearly (do not hurry) and do not say to anyone who greets you (from Islam): "You are not a believer," coveting the goods of this world. And it is with Allah that there is much spoils. That's how you were before; then Allah granted you His grace. So see clearly. Verily, Allah is the All-Knower of what you do.
Those of the believers who stay at home - except those who have some infirmity - and those who strive for the cause of Allah are not equal. Allah gives those who struggle body and soul a rank of excellence over those who stay at home. And to each one Allah has promised the best reward; and Allah has put the fighters above the non-combatants by granting them immense reward;
degrees of superiority from Him as well as forgiveness and mercy. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Those who have wronged themselves, the Angels will take away their souls, saying, "Where were you?" (about your religion) - "We were powerless on earth," they said. Then the angels will say, "Was not the land of Allah large enough for you to emigrate?" These are those whose refuge is Hell. And what a bad destination!
Except for the helpless: men, women and children, unable to fend for themselves, and who find no way:
To them, Allah may forgive them. Allah is the Merciful and Forgiving.
And whoever emigrates in the cause of Allah will find many refuges and abundance on earth. And whoever goes out of his house, emigrating to Allah and His Messenger, and death comes, his reward belongs to Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And when you walk the earth, it is not a sin for you to shorten Salah, if you fear that the disbelievers will put you to the test, for the disbelievers remain an open enemy to you.
And when you (Muhammad) are among them, and you lead them in Salah, let a group of them stand with you, keeping their weapons. Then when they have finished prostration, let them go behind you and let the other group come, those who have not yet celebrated Salah. It is then up to them to perform Salat with you, taking their precautions and their weapons. The disbelievers would like you to neglect your weapons and baggage so that they can fall on you in one mass. You commit no sin if, inconvenienced by the rain or sick, you lay down your arms; However, take care. Verily, Allah has prepared a degrading punishment for the disbelievers.
When you have performed Salah, call upon the name of Allah, standing, sitting, or lying on your sides. Then when you are safe, perform Salat (normally), because Salat remains a prescription for believers at certain times.
Do not falter in the pursuit of the [enemy] people. If you suffer, he also suffers as you suffer, while you hope for Allah what he does not hope for. Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
We have sent down the Book with the truth to you, so that you may judge among people, according to what Allah has taught you. And don't be the advocate of traitors.
And beg Allah for forgiveness, for Allah is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
And do not argue in favor of those who betray themselves. Allah, indeed, does not love the traitor and the sinner.
They seek to hide from people, but they do not seek to hide from Allah. He is with them when they say things at night that He (Allah) does not accept. And Allah does not cease to understand what they do.
These are the people in whose favor you dispute in this present life. But who is going to argue for them before Allah on the Day of Resurrection? Or who will be their protector?
Whoever does wrong or wrongs himself, and then immediately begs Allah for forgiveness, will find Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
Whoever acquires a sin, acquires it only against himself. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And whoever acquires a fault or a sin and then accuses an innocent person of it, is then guilty of injustice and manifest sin.
And if it had not been for Allah's grace upon you (Muhammad) and His mercy, some of them would have gladly led you astray. But they only lead astray themselves, and can do you no harm. Allah has sent down upon you the Book and Wisdom, and has taught you what you did not know. And Allah's grace upon you is immense.
There is nothing good in the greater part of their secret conversations, unless one of them commands charity, a good deed, or conciliation between people. And whoever does this, seeking the pleasure of Allah, to him We will soon give a great reward.
And whoever splits from the Messenger after the right path has appeared to him and follows a path other than that of the believers, then We will leave him as he has turned away, and burn him in Hell. And what a bad destination!
Verily, Allah does not forgive that He is given partners. Apart from that, He forgives whomever He wills. Whoever gives partners to Allah is going astray, far into error.
They are only females that they invoke, apart from Him. And it is only a rebellious devil that they invoke.
Allah cursed him (the Devil) and he said: "Certainly, I will seize a certain part of Your servants.
Surely I will not fail to lead them astray, I will give them false hopes, I will command them, and they will split the ears of the cattle; I will command them, and they will alter the creation of Allah. And whoever takes the Devil as his ally instead of Allah, will certainly be doomed to obvious destruction.
He makes promises and gives them false hope. And the Devil only makes them deceptive promises.
These are those whose refuge is Hell. And they won't find any way to escape it!
And as for those who have believed and done good works, We will soon bring them into the Gardens under which the streams flow, to dwell there forever. Promise of Allah in truth. And who is more truthful than Allah in word?
This does not depend on your desires or the desires of the People of the Book. Whoever does evil will be rewarded for it, and will not find an ally or helper in his favor except Allah.
And whoever, man or woman, does good deeds, but is a believer... these are the ones who will enter Paradise; and no injustice shall be done to them, even if it be a hollow in the pit of a date.
Who is better in religion than he who submits his being to Allah, while conforming to the revealed Law and following the religion of Abraham, the man of righteousness? And Allah had taken Abraham as his privileged friend.
To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. And Allah embraces all things.
And they consult you about what has been decreed about women. Say: "Allah gives you His decree on this, in addition to what is recited to you in the Book, concerning orphan girls to whom you do not give what is prescribed to them, and whom you desire to marry, and about minors who are still of low age." You must act fairly towards orphans. And of all that you do that is good, Allah is indeed All-Knowing.
And if a woman fears abandonment or indifference from her husband, then it is not a sin for both if they are reconciled by some compromise, and reconciliation is better, since souls are inclined to ladrery. But if you do good and are pious... Verily, Allah is the All-Knower of what you do.
You can never be fair between your wives, even if you are concerned about it. Don't lean quite towards one of them, to the point of leaving the other as if hanging. But if you are reconciled and you are pious... therefore Allah is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
If the two separate, Allah will grant each of them a different destiny through His bounty. And Allah is full of largesse and Perfectly Wise.
To Allah alone belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. "Fear Allah!" This is what We have enjoined on those to whom the Book was given before you, as well as on yourselves. And if you do not believe (it does not harm Allah, for) surely to Allah alone belongs everything that is in the heavens and on the earth. And Allah is sufficient in Himself and He is worthy of praise.
To Allah alone belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. And Allah is enough to take care of everything.
If He willed, He would make you disappear, O people, and bring in others. For Allah is very capable of this.
Whoever desires the reward of this world, the reward of this world is with Allah, as well as the reward of the Hereafter. And Allah hears and observes everything.
O you who believe! Observe justice strictly and be witnesses as Allah commands, even if it is against yourselves, your father and mother or your close relatives. Whether it is a rich man or a needy man, Allah has priority over both of them (and He knows more about their interest than you). Do not, therefore, follow the passions, so as not to deviate from justice. If you bear false witness or refuse to bear false witness, Allah is the Allafore of what you do.
O you who believe! Be firm in your faith in Allah, in His Messenger, in the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger, and in the Book that He sent down before. Whoever does not believe in Allah, His angels, His Books, His Messengers, and the Last Day, is going astray, far into error.
Those who believed, then became disbelievers, then believed again, then became disbelievers again, and only grew in disbelief, Allah will not forgive them, nor will he guide them to a path.
Announce to the hypocrites that there is a painful punishment for them,
Those who take disbelievers instead of believers as allies, is this power that they seek from them? (Verily) the power belongs entirely to Allah.
In the Book He has already revealed to you this: When you hear that the verses of Allah are denied and mocked, do not sit down with them until they start another conversation. If not, you'll be like them. Verily, Allah will gather the hypocrites and the disbelievers, all of them, in Hell.
They remain waiting for you; If you have a victory from Allah, they say, "Were we not with you?" and if it benefits the disbelievers, they say to them, "Have we not laid our hands on you to hide you from the believers?" Well, Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah will never give a way to the disbelievers against the believers.
Hypocrites seek to deceive Allah, but Allah turns their deception (against themselves). And when they get up for Salah, they stand up lazily and ostentatiously to the people. They hardly invoke Allah.
They are undecided (between believers and disbelievers) and do not belong to either of them. And whoever Allah leads astray, you will never find a way for him.
O you who believe! Do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Would you like to give Allah clear evidence against you?
The hypocrites will certainly be in the lowest depths of the Fire, and you will never find a helper for them,
except those who repent, mend their ways, cling firmly to Allah, and have exclusive faith in Him. These will be with the believers. And Allah will give the believers a huge reward.
Why would Allah punish you if you are grateful and believing? Allah is Grateful and All-Knowing.
Allah does not like it when one speaks evil words except when one has been unjustly provoked. And Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
Whether you do good, openly or secretly, or whether you forgive an evil... Then Allah is Forgiving and Omnipotent.
Those who do not believe in Allah and His Messengers, and who want to distinguish between Allah and His Messengers, and who say, "We believe in some of them but do not believe in others," and who want to take an intermediate path (between faith and disbelief),
These are the real disbelievers! And We have prepared for the disbelievers a degrading punishment.
And those who believe in Allah and His Messengers and do not differentiate between them, these are the ones to whom He will give their rewards. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
The People of the Book ask you to send down a Book from heaven. They already asked Moses something much more serious when they said, "Let us see Allah in the open." Then lightning struck them for their wrong. Then they adopted the Calf (as an idol) even after the proofs had come to them. We forgave them for this and gave Moses declared authority.
And to (obtain) their commitment, We held up Mount Tor over them, We said to them, "Come in by the door and bow down," We said to them, "Do not transgress the Sabbath," and We made a firm commitment from them.
(We have cursed them) because of their breaking of commitment, their disbelief in the revelations of Allah, their unjustified killing of the prophets, and their saying: "Our hearts are (wrapped) and impervious." In fact, it was Allah who sealed their hearts because of their disbelief, because they believed very little.
And because of their disbelief and the enormous slander they utter against Mary,
and because of their words: "We have truly killed Christ, Jesus, son of Mary, the Messenger of Allah"... But they did not kill him or crucify him; but it was only a pretense! And those who have argued about him are really in a state of uncertainty: they have no certain knowledge of it, they are only following conjectures and they certainly did not kill him,
but Allah has lifted him up to Himself. And Allah is Mighty and Wise.
There will be no one among the People of the Book who will not have faith in Him before His death. And on the Day of Resurrection, he will be a witness against them.
It is because of the iniquities of the Jews that We have made unlawful to them the good food that was lawful for them, and also because they obstruct the cause of Allah (to themselves and) to many people,
and because they take usurious interest - which was forbidden to them - and because they illegally eat people's property. To those of them who are disbelievers, We have prepared a painful punishment.
But those of them who are rooted in knowledge, as well as the believers, (all) have faith in what was sent down upon you and what was sent down before you. And as for those who perform Salah, pay Zakat, and believe in Allah and the Last Day, We will give them a great reward.
We have made a revelation to you as We did to Noah and the prophets after him. And We made revelation to Abraham, to Ishmael, to Isaac, to Jacob to the Tribes, to Jesus, to Job, to Jonah, to Aaron and to Solomon, and We gave Zabur to David.
And there are messengers whose story We told you before, and messengers whose story We did not tell you – and Allah spoke to Moses by word of mouth –
as messengers, heralds, and warners, so that after the coming of the messengers there would be no argument for the people before Allah. Allah is Mighty and Wise.
But Allah testifies to what He has sent down to you, He has sent it down in all knowledge. And the Angels testify to this. And Allah is sufficient as a witness.
Those who do not believe and obstruct the path of Allah are indeed going astray in error.
Those who do not believe and practice injustice, Allah is in no way willing to forgive them, nor to guide them in a path
(other) than the way to Hell where they will dwell forever. And this is easy for Allah.
O people! The Messenger has brought you the truth from your Lord. Have faith, therefore, it will be better for you. And if you do not believe (what does it matter!), to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
O People of the Book (Christians), do not exaggerate in your religion, and speak of Allah only the truth. The Messiah Jesus, son of Mary, is only a Messenger of Allah, His word which He sent to Mary, and a breath (of life) from Him. Therefore believe in Allah and His Messengers. And don't say "Three." Stop! It will be better for you. Allah is only one God. He is too glorious to have a child. To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth, and Allah is sufficient as protector.
The Messiah never finds it unworthy to be a servant of Allah, nor the angels who are close to Him. And those who find it unworthy to worship Him and puff themselves up with pride... He will gather them all to Himself.
As for those who have believed and done good works, He will give them their full rewards and add to them the increase of His grace. And as for those who have been haughty and puffed up with pride, He will punish them with a painful punishment. And they will not find for them, besides Allah, an ally or a helper,
O people! Verily, a clear proof has come to you from your Lord. And We have sent down to you a bright light.
Then those who believe in Allah and cling to Him, He will bring them into mercy from Him, and into grace as well. And He will guide them to Him in a straight way.
They ask you what has been decreed. Say: "Concerning the deceased who has no father, mother or child, Allah gives you His decree: If anyone dies without a child but has a sister, to her half of what he leaves. And he will inherit from her in full if she has no children. But if he has two sisters (or more), then to them two-thirds of what he leaves; and if he has brothers and sisters, then to one brother belongs a portion equal to that of two sisters. Allah gives you explanations so that you do not go astray. And Allah is All-Knowing.
O you who believe! Faithfully fulfill your commitments. You may have the animal of the flock, except what is stated [as forbidden]. Do not allow yourself to hunt while you are in the state of ihrâm. Verily, Allah decides what He wills.
O you who believe! Do not desecrate the rites of Hajjj of Allah, nor the holy month, nor the sacrificial animals, nor the garlands, nor those who go to the Holy House seeking from their Lord grace and pleasure. Once desecrated, you are free to hunt. And do not let hatred for a people who have obstructed your way to the Holy Mosque incite you to transgress. Help each other in doing good works and godliness, and do not help each other in sin and transgression. And fear Allah, for Allah is indeed harsh in punishment.
You are forbidden to eat the animal that is found dead, the blood, the flesh of a pig, that which has been called for by a name other than that of Allah, the animal that has been choked, the animal that has been knocked down or died by a fall or died by a blow from a horn, and the animal that has been devoured by a ferocious animal, except the one that you slaughter before it is dead. (You are also forbidden to slay the beast) that has been sacrificed on the standing stones, and to divide it by drawing lots by means of arrows. For this is perversity. Today, the disbelievers despair (of turning you away) from your religion, so do not fear them and fear Me. Today I have perfected your religion for you, and performed My blessing on you. And I accept Islam as a religion for you. If anyone is compelled by hunger, without inclination to sin... then, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
They ask you about what is permissible for them. Say: "It is lawful for you to eat good food, as well as what is caught by the predators that you have trained, teaching them what Allah has taught you. Eat of what they catch for you and pronounce the name of Allah on it. And fear Allah. For Allah is swift in reckoning.
"You are allowed, today, good food. You are permitted to eat from the People of the Book, and your own food is permitted to them. (You are lawful) the virtuous women of the believers, and the virtuous women of the people who received the Book before you, if you give them their mahr with a marriage contract, not as debauched people or as lover-takers. And whoever renounces the faith, then vain becomes his action, and he will be in the Hereafter, among the losers
O you who believe! When you get up for Salah, wash your faces and hands up to your elbows; Run wet hands over your heads. and wash your feet up to your ankles. And if you are polluted "junub", then purify yourself (by a bath); but if you are sick, or on a journey, or if one of you returns from the place where he relieved himself, or if you have touched the women and cannot find water, then have recourse to the pure earth, and pass it over your faces and your hands. Allah does not want to put any discomfort on you, but He wants to purify you and perfect His blessing on you. Maybe you'll be grateful.
And remember the blessing of Allah upon you, as well as the covenant He made with you, when you said, "We have heard and we have obeyed." And fear Allah. For Allah knows perfectly well the contents of hearts.
O you who believe! Be strict (in your duties) to Allah and (be) fair witnesses. And that hatred for a people does not incite you to be unjust. Practice fairness: this is closer to godliness. And fear Allah. For Allah is indeed Knower of what you do.
Allah has promised those who believe and do good deeds that there will be forgiveness and a huge reward for them.
As for those who do not believe and treat Our proofs as lies, these are people from Hell.
O you who believe! Remember the blessing of Allah on you on the day when a group of enemies was about to lay hands on you and He repulsed their attempt. And fear Allah. It is in Allah that the believers must put their trust.
And Allah certainly took the pledge of the children of Israel. We appointed twelve chiefs from among them. And Allah said: "I am with you, provided that you perform Salah, pay Zakat, believe in My Messengers, help them and make a good loan to Allah. Then, certainly, I will blot out your misdeeds, and bring you into the Gardens under which the streams flow. And whoever among you after this disbelieves, is certainly going astray."
And then, because of their violation of the commitment, We have cursed them and hardened their hearts: they turn the words away from their meaning and forget part of what they have been reminded of. You will not cease to discover their treachery, except for a small number of them. Forgive them, therefore, and forget [their sins]. For Allah certainly loves the doers.
And of those who say, "We are Christians," We have made their commitment. But they have forgotten part of what they were reminded of. So We stirred up enmity and hatred among them until the Day of Resurrection. And Allah will inform them of what they were doing.
O People of the Book! Our Messenger (Muhammad) has indeed come to you, exposing to you much of what you hid from the Book, and passing over many other things! A light and an explicit Book have come to you from Allah!
By this (the Qur'an), Allah guides to the paths of salvation those who seek His pleasure. And He brings them out of darkness into light by His grace. And He guides them to a straight path.
Verily, those who say, "Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary?" - say: "Who has anything from Allah (to prevent Him), if He wanted to destroy the Messiah, the son of Mary, and his mother and all those who are on earth?... To Allah alone belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and of what lies between the two." He creates what He wants. And Allah is Omnipotent.
The Jews and Christians said, "We are the sons of Allah and His favorites." Say: "Why then does He punish you for your sins?" In fact, you are human beings from those whom He created. He forgives whom He wills and He chastises whom He wills. And to Allah alone belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and that which lies between the two. And it is to Him that the final destination will be.
O People of the Book! Our Messenger (Muhammad) came to enlighten you after an interruption of the Messengers so that you would not say, "There has come to us neither a herald nor a warner." Surely a herald and a warner has come to you. And Allah is Omnipotent.
(Remember) When Moses said to his people, "O my people! Remember the blessing of Allah upon you, when He appointed prophets from among you. And He has made you kings. And He has given you what He had not given to any one else in the worlds.
O my people! Enter the holy land that Allah has commanded you. And do not turn back [by refusing to fight] for you will return losers.
They said, "O Moses, there is a people of giants there. We will never enter it until they come out. If they leave, then we will enter."
Two men of those who feared Allah and were showered with blessings by Him said, "Enter them through the gate; and when you have entered it, you will undoubtedly be the dominant. And it is in Allah that you must trust, if you are believers."
They said, "Moses! We will never enter it, as long as they are there. Go, then, you and your Lord, and fight together. We stay where we are."
He said, "Lord! I have no power, truly, except over myself and over my brother: separate us therefore from this perverse people."
He (Allah) said: "Well, this land will be forbidden to them for forty years, during which time they will wander the earth. Do not worry about this evil people."
And tell them the truth the story of the two sons of Adam. Both offered sacrifices; that of one was accepted and that of the other was not. He said, "I will surely kill you." "Allah accepts," says the other, "only from the pious."
If you stretch out your hand to kill me, I will not stretch out my hand to kill you to you, for I fear Allah, the Lord of the universe.
I want you to leave with the sin of having killed me and with your own sin: then you will be among the people of the Fire. This is the reward of the unjust.
His soul incited him to kill his brother. So he killed him and thus became one of the losers.
Then Allah sent a raven who began to scratch the earth to show him how to bury his brother's corpse. He said, "Woe to me! Am I incapable of being able, like this raven, to bury my brother's corpse?" He then became one of those who are gnawed by remorse.
Therefore We have ordained for the Children of Israel that whoever kills a person who is not guilty of murder or corruption on earth, it is as if he had killed all men. And whoever gives him life, it is as if he were giving life to all men. Indeed, Our Messengers came to them with the proofs. And then, in spite of this, many of them begin to commit excesses on earth.
The reward for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger, and who strive to sow corruption in the earth, is that they will be killed, or crucified, or that their opposite hands and legs will be cut off, or that they will be expelled from the land. It will be ignominy for them here below; and in the Hereafter there will be a great punishment for them,
except those who repented before they fell into your power: know that then Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
O you who believe! Fear Allah, seek a way to draw closer to Him, and strive for His cause. Maybe you will be one of those who succeed!
If the disbelievers possessed all that is on earth, and even more, to redeem themselves from the punishment of the Day of Resurrection, it would not be accepted from them. And for them there will be a painful punishment.
They will want to come out of the Fire, but they will not come out of it. And they will have permanent punishment.
The thief and the thief both cut off their hands, as a punishment for what they have acquired, and as a punishment from Allah. Allah is Mighty and Wise.
But whoever repents after his sin and reforms, Allah accepts his repentance. For Allah is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
Do you not know that to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He chastises whom He wills and forgives whomever He wills. And Allah is Omnipotent.
O Messenger! Let not those afflict you who concur in disbelief; among those who have said, "We have believed" with their mouths without their hearts ever having believed, and among the Jews who like to listen to lies and listen to other people who have never come to you and who distort the meaning of words once they are well established. They say, "If you have received this, accept it, and if you have not received it, be suspicious." Whoever Allah wants to test, you have no protection for him from Allah. These are the people whose hearts Allah did not want to purify. To them will be reserved an ignominy here below and an enormous punishment in the hereafter.
They are alert to lies and greedy for illicit gains. If they come to you, be a judge among them or turn away from them. And if you turn away from them, they will never be able to do you any harm. And if you judge, then judge between them in equity. For Allah loves those who judge fairly.
But how can they ask you to be their judge when they have the Torah with them, in which the judgment of Allah is found? And then, after that, they reject your judgment. These people are not believers at all.
We have sent down the Torah in which there is guidance and light. It is on the basis of this that the prophets who have submitted to Allah, as well as the rabbis and doctors, judge the affairs of the Jews. For they have been entrusted with the custody of the Book of Allah, and they are witnesses of it. So don't fear people, but fear Me. And do not sell My teachings at a low price. And those who do not judge according to what Allah has sent down, they are the disbelievers.
And We have prescribed for them life for life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth. Injuries fall under the law of retaliation. Afterwards, whoever renounces it out of charity, it will earn him expiation. And those who do not judge according to what Allah has sent down, these are unjust.
And We sent after them Jesus, the son of Mary, to confirm what was in the Torah before him. And We gave him the Gospel, where there is guidance and light, to confirm what was in the Torah before him, and a guide and an exhortation for the pious.
Let the people of the Gospel judge according to what Allah has sent down to it. Those who do not judge according to what Allah has sent down are the wicked ones.
And upon you (Muhammad) We sent down the Book with the truth, to confirm the Book that was there before it and to prevail over it. Judge among them, therefore, according to what Allah has sent down. Do not follow their passions, far from the truth that has come to you. To each of you We have assigned legislation and a plan to follow. If Allah had willed, He would have made you all one community. But He wants to test you in what He gives you. Compete in the right hearts. To Allah is the return of you all; then He will inform you of what you differed in.
Then judge among them according to what Allah has sent down. Do not follow their passions, and take care that they do not try to distance you from some of what Allah has revealed to you. And then, if they refuse (the revealed judgment), know that Allah wants to afflict them [here below] for some of their sins. Many people, of course, are perverts.
Is it then the judgment of the time of Ignorance that they seek? What is better than Allah in judging people who have a firm faith?
O you who believe! Do not take Jews and Christians as allies; they are allies of each other. And whoever among you takes them as allies, becomes one of them. Allah does not guide the unrighteous.
You will see, moreover, that those who have sickness in their hearts rush to them and say: "We fear that a reversal of fortune will befall us." But perhaps Allah will bring victory or a command from Him. Then they will regret their secret thoughts.
And the believers will say: "Are these those who swore by Allah with all their strength that they were with you?" But their actions became futile and they became losers.
O you who believe! Whoever among you apostatizes from his religion... Allah will bring a people whom He loves and who love Him, modest towards the believers and proud and powerful towards the disbelievers, who strive in the cause of Allah, fearing no blame from any blame. This is the grace of Allah. He gives it to whomever He wills. Allah is Immense and All-Knowing.
You have no allies but Allah, His Messenger, and the believers who perform Salah, pay Zakat, and bow (to Allah).
And whoever takes Allah and His Messenger and the believers as his allies, [will succeed] because it is the party of Allah that will be victorious.
O you who believe! Do not adopt as your allies those who mock your religion, among those to whom the Book was given before you and among the disbelievers. And fear Allah if you are believers.
And when you call for salah, they take it as a mockery and a game. It is because they are people who do not reason.
Say: "O People of the Book! Do you reproach us for anything other than believing in Allah, in what has been sent down to us and what has been sent down before? But most of you are perverts.
Say: "May I tell you what is worse in terms of retribution with Allah? Whoever Allah has cursed, whoever has incurred His wrath, and those whom He has made monkeys, pigs, and likewise, whoever worshipped the Taghût, these have the worst of places and are the most strayed from the straight path."
When they come to you, they say, "We believe." Whereas they went in with disbelief and they went out with it. And Allah knows perfectly well what they are hiding.
And you will see many of them rushing to sin and iniquity, and eating illicit gains. How bad is what they do!
Why don't the rabbis and the doctors (of the religious law) prevent them from speaking lies and eating illicit gains? How evil are their deeds!
And the Jews say: "The hand of Allah is closed!" Let their own hands be closed, and cursed be they for saying so. Rather, His two hands are wide open: He distributes His gifts as He wills. And verily, what has been sent down to you from your Lord will cause rebellion and disbelief to increase greatly among them. We have spread enmity and hatred among them until the Day of Resurrection. Whenever they light a fire for war, Allah extinguishes it. And they strive to sow disorder on the earth, while Allah does not like the sowers of disorder.
If the People of the Book had faith and godliness, We would certainly have blotted out their misdeeds and brought them into the Gardens of Earthly Delight.
If they had applied the Torah and the Gospel and what came down upon them from their Lord, they would certainly have enjoyed what is above them and what is under their feet. There is a group among them that acts righteously; but for many of them, how bad is what they do!
O Messenger, convey what has been sent down to you from your Lord. If you didn't, then you wouldn't have communicated His message. And Allah will protect you from people. Verily, Allah does not guide people who disbelieve.
Say: "O People of the Book, you do not stand by anything until you conform to the Torah and the Gospel and to what has been sent down to you from your Lord." And verily, what has been sent down to you from your Lord will increase many of them in rebellion and disbelief. So don't worry about disbelievers.
Those who have believed, those who have become Judaized, the Sabaeans, and the Christians, those among them who believe in Allah, in the Last Day and who do good deeds, do not fear them, and they will not be afflicted.
Of course, We had already made the commitment of the Children of Israel, and We had sent messengers to them. But whenever a Messenger comes to them with what they do not want, they call some liars and they kill others.
Trusting that there would be no temptation against them, they had become blind and deaf. Then Allah welcomed their repentance. Then many of them became blind and deaf again. And Allah sees perfectly what they are doing.
Verily, they are disbelievers who say: "Verily, Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary." While the Messiah said, "O children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord." Whoever associates Allah (other gods) with Allah forbids him Paradise; and his refuge will be Fire. And for the unjust, there are no helpers!
They are disbelievers who say, "Verily, Allah is the third of three." When there is no deity but One Deity! And if they do not cease to say so, surely a painful punishment will befall the disbelievers among them.
Will they not repent to Allah and beg His forgiveness? For Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
The Messiah, son of Mary, was only a Messenger. Messengers passed before him. And his mother was a truthful woman. And both consumed food. See how We explain the proofs to them, and then see how they turn away.
Say: "Do you worship instead of Allah that which has no power to do you evil or good?" Allah is the Hearer and the All-Knowing.
