Say: "O People of the Book, do not exaggerate in your religion, opposing the truth. Do not follow the passions of people who have gone astray before this, who have led many people astray, and who have gone astray from the right path.
Those of the Children of Israel who did not believe were cursed by the mouth of David and Jesus, the son of Mary, because they disobeyed and transgressed.
They did not forbid each other what they did that was blameworthy. How bad, indeed, is what they did!
You see many of them allying themselves with the disbelievers. How evil is that which their souls have prepared for themselves, so that they have incurred the wrath of Allah, and it is in torment that they will eternalize.
If they believed in Allah, the Prophet and what has been sent down to him, they would not take these disbelievers as allies. But many of them are perverse.
You will certainly find that the Jews and the associates are the bitterest enemies of the believers. And you will certainly find that those who are most disposed to love believers are those who say, "We are Christians." It is because there are priests and monks among them, and they are not puffed up with pride.
And when they hear what has been sent down upon the Messenger [Muhammad], you see their eyes overflowing with tears, because they have recognized the truth. They say, "O our Lord! We believe: So register us among those who testify (to the truthfulness of the Qur'an).
Why should we not believe in Allah and in what has come to us from the truth. Why do we not covet that our Lord should bring us into the company of the virtuous?"
Therefore Allah rewards them for what they say with gardens under which the streams flow, where they will dwell forever. Such is the reward of the beneficent.
And as for those who do not believe and who treat Our verses as lies, they are the people of the Furnace.
O you who believe: do not declare unlawful the good things that Allah has made lawful for you. And don't transgress. Allah, (verily,) does not love transgressors.
And eat of what Allah has given you that is lawful and good. Fear Allah, in whom you have faith.
Allah does not punish you for frivolity in your oaths, but He punishes you for the oaths you intend to perform. The atonement will be to feed ten poor people, with what you normally feed your families, or to clothe them, or to free a slave. Whoever cannot afford it must fast for three days. This is the expiation for your oaths, when you have sworn. And hold fast to your oaths. So Allah explains His verses to you, so that you may be thankful!
O you who believe! Wine, gambling, standing stones, divination arrows are nothing but an abomination, the work of the Devil. Depart from it, that you may succeed.
The Devil only wants to sow enmity and hatred among you through wine and gambling, and to turn you away from calling on Allah and Salah. Are you going to put an end to it?
Obey Allah, obey the Messenger, and beware! If you then turn away... then know that it is only the responsibility of Our Messenger to convey the message clearly.
It is not a sin for those who have faith and do good works in that they have consumed (wine and gambling before they were forbidden), provided they are pious (avoiding forbidden things after they have knowledge of them) and believe (accepting their prohibition) and do good works; and then (continue) to be pious and to believe, and (remain) pious and beneficent. For Allah loves the doers.
O you who believe! Allah will certainly test you with some game within the reach of your hands and spears. This is so that Allah may know the one who fears Him in secret. Whoever transgresses after this will have a painful punishment.
O you who believe! Do not kill game while you are in the state of Ihram. Whoever among you kills them deliberately, then he compensates for it either by some herd animal, similar to what he has killed, according to the judgment of two upright people among you, and this as an offering which he will send to the Ka'aba, or by expiation, by feeding the poor, or by the equivalent in fasting. This is so that he can taste the bad consequence of his act. Allah has forgiven what has happened; but whoever reoffends, Allah will punish him. Allah is the Mighty and the Possessor of the power to punish.
Hunting at sea is permitted to you, and also to eat it, for your enjoyment and that of the travellers. And it is unlawful for you to hunt on land as long as you are in the state of Ihram. And fear Allah to whom you will be gathered.
Allah has instituted the Ka'aba, the Sacred House, as a gathering place for people. (He has instituted) the holy month, the offering (of animals,) and the garlands, so that you may know that truly Allah knows all that is in the heavens and on the earth; and that Allah is truly All-Knowing.
Know that Allah is severe in punishment, but also that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
It is only the responsibility of the Messenger to convey (the message). And Allah knows what you divulge as well as what you hide.
Say: "The bad and the good are not alike, even if the abundance of evil deceives you. Fear Allah, therefore, O intelligent people, so that you may succeed.
O you who believe! Don't ask about things that, if disclosed to you, would upset you. And if you ask about them, while the Qur'an is revealed, they will be disclosed to you. Allah has forgiven you for this. And Allah is Forgiving and Forgiving.
A people before you had asked questions (similar) and then became disbelievers by their own doing.
Allah has not instituted the Bahira, the Saïba, the Wasîlani the Hâm. But those who disbelieved invented this lie against Allah, and most of them do not reason.
And when it is said to them, "Come to that which Allah has sent down (the Revelation), and to the Messenger," they say, "It is enough for us to do what we found our ancestors on." What! Even if their ancestors knew nothing and were not on the right path...?
O you who believe! You are responsible for yourselves! He who goes astray will not harm you if you have taken the right path. To Allah you will all return; then He will inform you of what you were doing.
O you who believe! When death comes to one of you, the will will be witnessed by two men of integrity among you, or two others, not of yours, if you are on a journey in the world and death strikes you. You shall retain them (the two witnesses) after the Sal?t, and then, if you have any doubts, you shall make them swear by Allah: "We do not trade or profit with this, even if it is a relative, and we will not hide the testimony of Allah. Otherwise, we would be among the sinners."
If it is discovered that these two witnesses are guilty of sin, two others who are more upright, among those who have been wronged, will take their place and both will swear by Allah: "Verily, our testimony is more righteous than the testimony of these two; and we do not transgress. Otherwise, we would certainly be among the unjust."
This is the surest way to induce them to give the testimony in its real form; or to make them fear that other oaths will be substituted for their own. And fear Allah and listen. Allah does not guide evil people.
(Remember) the Day when Allah gathers (all) the Messengers, and He says: "What has been given to you as an answer?" They will say: "We have no knowledge: you are truly the great knower of all that is unknown."
And when Allah will say: "O Jesus, son of Mary, remember My blessing on you and your mother when I strengthened you with the Holy Spirit. In the cradle you talked to people, just like in your middle age. I taught you the Book, the Wisdom, the Torah and the Gospel! You made clay like a bird shape by My permission; then you blew into it. Then by My permission, she became a bird. And you healed by My permission, the man born blind and the leper. And by My permission, you were reviving the dead. I protected you from the Children of Israel while you brought them the evidence. But those of them who did not believe said, "This is just obvious magic."
And when I revealed to the Apostles this: "Believe in Me and in My Messenger (Jesus)". They said, "We believe; and attests that we are fully submissive."
Remember the moment when the Apostles said: "O Jesus, son of Mary, can it be that your Lord sends down upon us from heaven a table served?" He said to them: "Fear Allah if you are believers."
They said, "We want to eat of it, to reassure our hearts, to know that you have really told us the truth, and to be among the witnesses of it."
"O Allah our Lord," says Jesus, son of Mary, "send down upon us from heaven a table that will be a feast for us, for the first of us, as well as for the last, and a sign from You.
"Yes," says Allah, "I will send it down upon you. But then, whoever of you refuses to believe, I will punish him with a punishment that I will not chastise anyone else in the universe."
(Remind them) of the time when Allah will say: "O Jesus, son of Mary, was it you who said to the people: 'Take me and my mother for two gods besides Allah?' He will say, "Glory and purity be to You! It is not for me to declare what I am not allowed to say! If I had said it, You would have known it, indeed. You know what's in me, and I don't know what's in you. You are, in truth, the great connoisseur of all that is unknown.
I told them only what You commanded me, "Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord." And I was a witness against them as long as I was among them. Then when You called me back, You were their watchful observer. And You're a witness to all things.
If You chastise them, they are Your servants. And if You forgive them, You are the Mighty, the Wise."
Allah will say: "This is the day when their truthfulness will benefit the truthful: they will have gardens under which the streams flow, to dwell in them forever." Allah has accepted them and they have accepted Him. This is the enormous success.
To Allah alone belongs the kingdom of the heavens, the earth and all that is in them. And He is Omnipotent.
Praise be to Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, and established darkness and light. Yet the disbelievers give equals to their Lord.
It is He who created you from clay; then he decreed a term for you, and there is a term fixed with him. Yet, you still doubt!
And He is Allah in the heavens and on the earth. He knows what you hide inside you and what you divulge and He knows what you acquire.
And none of the signs come to them from among the signs of their Lord, without their turning away from them.
They call the truth a lie when it comes to them. But they will have news of what they are making fun of.
Have they not seen how many generations before them We have destroyed, to whom We had given power on earth, far more than We have given you? We had sent rain upon them from the sky in abundance, and We had caused rivers to flow at their feet. Then We destroyed them for their sins; and We have created a new generation after them.
Even if We had sent down upon you (Muhammad) a paper Book that they could touch with their hands, those who do not believe would certainly have said, "This is just obvious magic."
And they say, "Why was not an angel sent down upon him (Muhammad)?" If We had sent down an Angel, it would surely have been the case; then they would not have been given a delay.
If We had appointed an angel [as a prophet], We would have made him a man and caused them the same confusion that they are in.
Of course, messengers have been mocked before you, but those who mocked them, their own mockery enveloped them.
Say: "Go through the earth and see what has become of those who called the truth a lie."
Say: "To whom belongs what is in the heavens and the earth?" Say: "To Allah." He has prescribed mercy to Himself. He will certainly gather you together on the Day of Resurrection: there is no doubt about it. Those who make their own destruction are those who do not believe.
And to Him all that dwells in night and day. He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
Say: "Should I take as an ally other than Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He is the one who feeds and no one feeds Him. Say: "I have been commanded to be the first to submit." And never be among the associates.
Say: "If I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a dreadful day."
On this day, whoever is spared, it is because [Allah] has had mercy on him. And here is the resounding success.
And if Allah causes a calamity to befall you, no one but Him can take it away. And if He makes a happiness touch you... it is because He is Omnipotent.
He is the Supreme Ruler over His servants; He is the Wise, the Perfected Knower.
Say: "What is greater in the way of testimony?" Say: "Allah is a witness between me and you; and this Qur'an has been revealed to me so that I may warn you and all whom it will reach through it. "Are you really the one who testifies that there are other gods with Allah? Say: "I do not testify." Say [also]: "There is only one Deity. And I disavow what you associate with (Him)."
Those to whom We have given the Book recognize (the Messenger Muhammad) as they recognize their own children. Those who make their own destruction are those who do not believe.
Who is more unjust than the one who invents a lie against Allah, or who calls His verses a lie? The unrighteous will not succeed.
And on the Day when We will gather them all together and say to those who have given partners: "Where are your associates that you claimed?"
Then they will have no excuse but to say, "By Allah our Lord! We were never associates."
See how they lie to themselves! And how do they (the associates) abandon them that they invented!
There are some among them who come to listen to you, while We have veiled their hearts, which prevent them from understanding (the Qur'an), and in their ears is a heaviness. Even if they saw all kinds of evidence, they would not believe it. And when they come to argue with you, those who do not believe then say, "These are only legends of the ancients."
They prevent [people] from approaching him and keep themselves away from him. They will only destroy themselves without realizing it.
If you see them, when they are placed before the Fire. Then they will say, "Alas! If we could be sent back (to the earth), we would no longer treat the verses of our Lord as lies, and we would be among the believers."
Of course not! Behold, what they hid before will appear to them. Now, if they were restored [to earthly life], they would surely return to what was forbidden to them. They are really liars.
And they say, "There is no other life for us than this world; and we will not be resurrected."
If you see them, when they appear before their Lord. He will say to them, "Is this not the truth?" They will say: "But yes! By our Lord!" And he will say, "Then taste the punishment for not believing."
Of course, those who call the encounter with Allah a lie are losers. And when suddenly the Hour comes to them, they will say, "Woe to us for our neglect of him, and they will bear their burdens on their backs, and what evil burdens!
The present life is all about play and fun. The dwelling place in the Hereafter will be better for those who are pious. Well, don't you understand?
We know that in truth what they say grieves you. But they really do not believe that you are a liar, but the verses of Allah that the wrongdoers deny.
Verily, messengers before you (Muhammad) were called liars. They then endured steadfastly being called liars and persecuted, until Our help came to them. And no one can change the words of Allah, and a part of the history of the Messengers has already come to you.
And if their indifference grieves you greatly, and it is in your power to seek a tunnel through the earth, or a ladder to go to heaven to bring them a miracle, [do it, then]. And if Allah willed, He could put them all on the right path. Do not be among the ignorant.
Only those who hear respond to the call [of faith]. And as for the dead, Allah will raise them up; then they will be brought back to Him.
And they say, "Why was not a miracle sent down upon him (Muhammad) from his Lord?" Say: "Verily, Allah is able to bring down a miracle. But most of them don't know."
There is no beast walking on the ground, no bird flying its wings, that is not like you in community. We have not omitted anything to write in the Book. Then they will be brought back to their Lord.
And those who call lies Our verses are deaf and dumb in darkness. Allah leads astray whomever He wills; and He places whomever He wants on a straight path.
Say: "Inform me: If the punishment of Allah comes to you, or the Hour comes to you, will you call on anyone but Allah, if you are truthful?"
Rather, you will appeal to Him. Then He will dissipate, if He wills, the object of your call, and you will forget what you associate with Him.
We have indeed sent (messengers) to the communities before you. Then We seized them with adversity and distress - perhaps they will beg (for mercy)! -
Why, then, when Our severity came to them, did they not implore (mercy)? But their hearts had hardened, and the Devil was embellishing in their eyes what they were doing.
Then, when they had forgotten what they had been reminded of, We opened to them the doors to all things; and when they had rejoiced at what had been given them, We suddenly seized them, and they were in despair.
Thus was the last remnant of these unrighteous men exterminated. And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Universe!
Say: "See? If Allah were to take your hearing and sight, and seal your hearts, what god but Allah would restore them to you? See how, for them, We clarify the evidence! Yet they turn away from it.
Say: "What do you think? If Allah's punishment comes to you unexpectedly or in broad daylight, who will be destroyed if not the unrighteous people?"
We send messengers only as heralds and warners: therefore those who believe and reform, have no fear over them, and they will not be afflicted.
And those who treat Our proofs as lies, the punishment will come upon them, because of their wickedness.
Say to them: "I do not tell you that I have the treasures of Allah, nor that I know the Unknowable, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I am only following what is revealed to me." Say: "Are the blind equal to the one who sees? Don't you think?"
And warned by this (the Qur'an), those who fear to be gathered before their Lord, that they will have no ally or intercessor besides Allah besides Allah. Maybe they would become pious!
And do not reject those who, morning and evening, cry out to their Lord, seeking his "Wajh" Face. To hold them to account is not your responsibility, and to hold you to account is not their responsibility in any way. If you reject them, you would be among the unjust.
So We test one another, so that they say: "Are these those whom Allah has favored among us?" Doesn't Allah know best which ones are grateful?
And when those who believe in our verses (the Qur'an) come to you, say: "Peace be upon you! Your Lord has prescribed mercy to Himself. And whoever of you has done evil through ignorance, and then repented and reformed... He is, then, Forgiving and Merciful."
This is how We detail the verses, so that the path of the criminals may be clearly seen.
Say: "It has been forbidden for me to worship those whom you pray to except Allah." Say: "I will not follow your passions, for that would be to go astray, and I would no longer be among the rightly guided."
Say: "I stand by a clear proof from my Lord, and you have called it a lie. What (the chastisement) you want to hasten does not depend on me. Judgment belongs only to Allah, for He is the true ruler and He is the best of judges.
Say: "If what you want to hasten were up to me, it would be a matter between you and me." Allah knows the wrongdoers best.
It is He who holds the keys to the Unknowable. No one but Him knows them. And He knows what is on dry land, as in the sea. And not a leaf falls that He doesn't know. And there is not a seed in the darkness of the earth, nothing fresh or dry, that is not recorded in an explicit book.
And at night He takes your souls, and He knows what you have gained during the day. Then He raises you up on the day so that the appointed term may be fulfilled. Then it is to Him that your return will be, and He will inform you of what you were doing.
And He is the Supreme Ruler over His servants. And He sends guards upon you. And when death befalls one of you, Our Messengers (the Angels) take away his soul without any negligence.
They are then brought back to Allah, their true Master. He is the one who judges and He is the most prompt of judges.
Say: "Who delivers you from the darkness of the earth and the sea?" You humbly and secretly invoke Him: "If He delivers us from this, we will be among the grateful.
Say: "It is Allah who delivers you from it and from all anguish. Yet you give Him associates."
Say: "He is able to bring punishment against you from above, or from under your feet, or to confound you in sectarianism. And He makes you taste the ardor [of battle] to one another." Look at how We set forth Our verses. Maybe they will understand?
And your people call this (the Qur'an) a lie, when it is the truth. Say: "I am not your guarantor.
Each announcement arrives in its time and place. And soon you'll find out."
When you see those who are wading in discussions about Our verses, stay away from them until they start another discussion. And if the Devil makes you forget, then, as soon as you remember, do not stay with the unjust.
It is not the responsibility of those who are pious to give an account for these people. But this is as a reminder. Perhaps they will fear [Allah].
Leave those who take their religion for play and amusement, and who are seduced by life on earth. And by this (the Qur'an) reminds us that so that a soul does not expose itself to its destruction according to what it has acquired, it will have no ally or intercessor besides Allah. And whatever compensation she offers, she will not be accepted by her. These have given themselves up to their perdition because of what they have acquired. Their drink will be boiling water, and they will have a painful punishment for having disbelieved.
Say: "Shall we invoke instead of Allah that which cannot benefit or harm us? And shall we come back on our heels after Allah has guided us, as one who has been seduced by the devils and who wanders perplexed on the earth, although friends call him to the right path (saying to him): "Come to us". Say: "The true way is the way of Allah. And we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the universe,
And to perform Salat and to fear Him. To Him you will be gathered."
And it is He who created the heavens and the earth, in all truth. And the day that He said, "Be." That's it, His word is the truth. To Him alone is the kingdom on the day when the trumpet is blown. He is the Knower of what is veiled and what is manifest. And He is the Wise and the Perfected Knower.
(Recall the time) when Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols as deities? I see you and your people in an obvious way!"
Thus We showed Abraham the kingdom of heaven and earth, that he might be one of those who believe with conviction.
When night enveloped him, he looked at a star, and said, "This is my Lord!" Then, when she disappeared, he said, "I don't like things that disappear."
When he then observed the moon rising, he said, "This is my Lord!" Then, when she disappeared, he said, "If my Lord does not guide me, I will certainly be one of the misguided."
When he then observed the rising sun, he said, "This is my Lord! This one is greater" Then when the sun disappeared, he said, "O my people, I disavow everything that you associate with Allah.
I turn my face exclusively to Him who created (out of nothing) the heavens and the earth; and I am not one of those who give Him associates."
His people disputed with him; but he said, "Are you going to argue with me about Allah, when He has guided me? I am not afraid of the partners you give Him. I fear only what my Lord wants. My Lord embraces all things in His knowledge. Don't you remember?
And how can I be afraid of the partners you give Him, when you have not been afraid to associate with Allah things for which He has not sent down any evidence to you? Which of the two parties has the greater right to security? (Say it) if you know.
Those who have believed and have not disturbed the purity of their faith by some inequity (association), these have security; and they are the rightly guided."
This is the argument which We inspired in Abraham against his people. We raise to high rank whomever We will. Your Lord is Wise and All-Knowing.
And We gave him Isaac and Jacob and guided them both. And Noah, We have guided him before, and among the descendants (of Abraham) (or Noah), David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron. And this is how We reward the beneficial.
In the same way, Zechariah, John the Baptist, Jesus, and Elijah, all of whom are among the good.
Likewise, Ishmael, Elisha, Jonah and Lot. Each of them We have favored above the rest of the world.
Likewise some of their ancestors, their descendants and their brothers and We have chosen them and guided them to a straight path.
This is the direction in which Allah guides whomever He wills among His servants. But if they had given Allah partners, then all that they would have done would certainly have been in vain.
To them We have brought the Book, wisdom and prophecy. If these others do not believe in them, at least We have confided these things to people who do not deny them.
These are the ones whom Allah has guided: follow their direction. Say: "I do not ask you for a salary for this." It is only a reminder to the whole universe.
They do not appreciate Allah as He deserves when they say, "Allah has not sent anything down on a human." Say: "Who sent down the Book that Moses brought as a light and guide to the people? You put it in sheets, to show a part of it, while hiding a lot. You have been taught what you and your ancestors did not know. Say: "This is Allah." And then, let them have fun in their wandering.
This is a blessed Book (the Qur'an) that We have sent down, confirming what already existed before it, so that you may warn the Mother of Cities (Makkah) and the people around it. Those who believe in the Last Day, believe in it and remain assiduous in their Salah.
And what worse unjust person than the one who fabricates a lie against Allah or who says, "Revelation has been made to me," when nothing has been revealed to him. The same is true of the one who says: "I am going to send down something like what Allah has sent down." If you would see the unrighteous when they are in the throes of death, and the angels will stretch out their hands to them (saying), "Let your souls go out. Today you will be rewarded with the punishment of humiliation for what you said about Allah other than the truth and because you proudly turned away from His teachings."
And here you are coming to Us, alone, just as We created you the first time, leaving behind your backs all that We had bestowed upon you. We do not see you accompanied by the intercessors whom you pretended to be associates. There has certainly been a rupture between you: they have abandoned you, those whom you claimed (to be your intercessors).
It is Allah who splits the seed and the stone: from the dead he brings out the living, and from the living he brings out the dead. This is Allah. How, then, do you allow yourself to be diverted?
Splitter of the dawn, He has made the night a phase of rest; the sun and the moon to measure time. This is the order conceived by the Mighty, the All-Knowing.
And it is He who has assigned you the stars, so that through them you may be guided in the darkness of the earth and the sea. Verily, We expose the proofs for those who know!
And it is He who created you from a single person (Adam). And there is a dwelling place and a place of deposit (for you.) We have laid out the evidence for those who understand.
And it was He who brought down the water from heaven. Then by it We caused every plant to germinate, from which We brought forth a verdure, from which We produced grains, superimposed one on top of the other; and of the palm tree, of its spathe, of the bunches of dates that are stretched out. And also the grape gardens, the olive and the pomegranate, similar or different from each other. Look at their fruits as they are produced and ripened. These are signs for those who have faith.
And they have appointed partners with Allah, the jinn, even though it is He who created them. And they have invented for Him, in their ignorance, sons and daughters, Glory to Him! He transcends everything they attribute to him.
Creator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a child when He has no partner? He is the One who created everything, and He is All-Knowing.
This is Allah your Lord! There is no divinity but He, the Creator of all. Worship Him, then. He is in charge of everything.
Eyes cannot reach Him, while He seizes all eyes. And He is the Sweet, the Perfected Knower.
Verily, there have been clear proofs of your Lord coming to you. Therefore, whoever sees clearly, it is in his favor; and whoever remains blind, it is to his detriment, for I am in no way charged with your safeguard.
This is how We explain the verses. And that they might say, "You have studied." And in order to expose it clearly to people who know.
Follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. There is no god but Him. And keep away from the associates.
Allah willing, they would not be associates! But We have not appointed you as guardian over them; and you are not their guarantor.
Do not insult those whom they invoke except Allah, for by aggressiveness they would be insulting Allah in their ignorance. In the same way, We have embellished (in the eyes of) each community its own action. Then it is to their Lord that their return will be; and He will inform them of what they were doing.
And they swear by Allah with all the force of their oaths, that if a miracle were to happen to them, they would believe in it (without hesitation,) Say: "Verily, miracles depend only on Allah." But what makes you think that when this happens, they won't believe it?
Because they did not believe the first time, we will turn away their hearts and their eyes; we will let them march blindly in their rebellion.
And if We were to send down the angels to them, [as they had proposed] if the dead spoke to them, and if We gathered all things before them, they would not believe except if Allah wills. But most of them don't know.
Thus We have assigned an enemy to each prophet: devils among men and the jinn, who deceitfully inspire each other with embellished words. If your Lord had willed, they would not have done it; leave them with what they invent.
And that the hearts of those who do not believe in the hereafter may lean toward them, and accept them, and perpetrate what they perpetrate.
Shall I seek any other judge than Allah, when it is He who has sent down to you this well-exposed Book? Those to whom We have given the Book know that it has come down with the truth from your Lord. Do not be among those who doubt.
And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in all truth and justice. No one can change His words. He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
And if you obey the majority of those who are on earth, they will lead you astray from the path of Allah: they only follow conjecture and only fabricate lies.
Verily your Lord knows best those who stray from His path, and He knows best those who are rightly guided.
So eat of what the name of Allah has been pronounced on if you believe in His verses (the Qur'an).
What do you have not to eat of what the name of Allah has been pronounced on? Whereas He has detailed to you what He has forbidden you, unless you are forced to resort to it. Many people lead astray, without knowing, by their passions. It is your Lord who knows the transgressors best.
Avoid sin, whether overt or hidden, (for) those who acquire sin will be rewarded according to what they have committed.
And do not eat of that on which the name of Allah has not been spoken, for that would be (assuredly) an evil. The devils inspire their allies to argue with you. If you obey them, you will certainly become associates.
Is he who was dead and whom We have brought back to life and to whom We have assigned a light by which he walks among the people, like one who is in darkness and cannot come out of it? Thus the disbelievers have been embellished with what they do.
Thus, We have placed in every city great criminals who hatch plots there. But they are only plotting against themselves and they are not aware of it.
And when proof comes to them, they say: "We will never believe until we have received a gift similar to that which was given to the messengers of Allah." Allah knows best where to place His message. Those who committed the crime will be reduced in the sight of Allah and will be punished severely for the tricks they were plotting.
And then, whoever Allah wants to guide, He opens his chest to Islam. And whoever He wants to go astray, He makes his chest narrow and embarrassed, as if he were striving to ascend to heaven. Thus Allah inflicts His punishment on those who do not believe.
This is the way of your Lord in all its righteousness. We have [indeed] detailed the signs (or verses) well to people who remember.
For them, the house of salvation with their Lord. And it is He who is their protector, for what they did (on earth).
And on the day when He gathers them all: "O community of the jinn, you have abused humans too much." And their allies among mankind will say, "O our Lord, we have profited by one another, and we have reached the time that You set for us." He will say to them: "Hell is your home, to remain there forever, unless Allah decides otherwise." Truly your Lord is Wise and All-Knowing.
And so We grant authority over others who are unrighteous because of what they have acquired.
O community of jinn and mankind, have not messengers come to you, chosen from among you, who have told you My signs and warned you of today's meeting? They'll say, "We're testifying against ourselves." The present life has deceived them; and they testified against themselves that they were disbelievers.
For your Lord does not unjustly destroy cities of which the people are not yet warned.
To each of the ranks (rewards) according to his works. Now your Lord is not inattentive to what they do.
Your Lord is Self-Sufficient, the Possessor of mercy. If He willed, He would destroy you and put in your place whomever He wills, just as He created you from the descendants of another people.
What you have been promised will (certainly) happen. And you are not in a position to reduce [Us] to impotence.
Say: "O my people! Continue to act according to your method; I too will act according to mine. Then you will know who will have a better fate in the Hereafter." Certainly, the unrighteous will never succeed.
And they assign to Allah a portion of what He Himself has created, in the way of crops and cattle, and they say: "This is Allah's - according to their claim! - and this to our deities." But what is for their gods does not come to Allah, while what is for Allah comes to their gods. How bad their judgment is!
And it is in this way that their deities have embellished the murder of their children with many associations, in order to ruin them and distort their religion in their eyes. But if Allah wills, they would not do it. Leave them, then, and what they invent.
And they said, "These are cattle and fields that are forbidden: only those we want will eat of them." "And these are beasts whose backs are taboo, and beasts on which they do not mention the name of Allah." Inventions against Him! He will reward them for what they invented as lies.
And they said, "What is in the belly of these beasts is reserved for the males of us, and forbidden to our wives." And if it's stillborn, they all participate. Soon He will reward them for their prescription, for He is Wise and All-Knowing.
They are certainly losers, those who have killed their children out of foolishness and ignorance, and those who have forbidden what Allah has given them of food, inventing lies against Allah. They have gone astray and are not guided.
It is He who created the gardens, trellis and non-trellises; as well as palm trees and crops with various crops; [as well as] the olive and the pomegranate, of similar and different species. Eat of their fruit, when they produce it; and pay the duties on the day of harvest. And do not waste, for He does not like wasters.
And (He created) among the cattle, some for transportation, and others for various uses; eat of what Allah has given you, and do not follow in the footsteps of the Devil, for he is an open enemy to you.
(He created) eight, in pairs: two for sheep, two for goats... say, "Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or what is in the wombs of the two females? Inform me of all knowledge, if you are truthful."
... two for camelids, two for cattle... Say: "Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or what is in the wombs of the two females? Or were you witnesses when Allah commanded you to do so?" Who is more unjust than the one who invents a lie against Allah to lead people astray without relying on any knowledge? Allah does not guide unrighteous people.
Say: "In what has been revealed to me, I find no forbidden for any eater to eat of it except the dead animal, or the blood that has been shed, or the flesh of a pig, for it is a filth, or that which has been sacrificed to anyone other than Allah out of wickedness." Whoever is compelled, but does not abuse or transgress, your Lord is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
To the Jews We have forbidden every beast with a single nail. Of cattle and sheep We have forbidden them to fat, except what is on their backs, their entrails, or what is mixed with the bone. Thus We have punished them for their rebellion. And We are very truthful.
Then, if they call you a liar, then say: "Your Lord is the Holder of immense mercy, but His severity cannot be turned away from the criminals."
Those who have associated will say: "If Allah had willed, we would not have given Him associates, nor would our ancestors, nor would we have declared anything forbidden." Thus their predecessors called liars (the messengers) until they had tasted Our rigor. Say: "Have you any knowledge to produce for us? You only follow conjecture and only lie."
Say: The decisive argument belongs to Allah. If He had wanted to sure, He would have guided you all. (on the right path)
Say: "Bring your witnesses who will testify that Allah has forbidden this." If they then testify, then you do not bear witness with them and do not follow the passions of those who call Our signs lies and do not believe in the Hereafter, while they give equals to their Lord.
Say: "Come, I will recite what your Lord has forbidden you: do not associate anything with Him; and be kind to your father and mother. Don't kill your children because of poverty. We feed you just like them. Do not approach turpitudes openly, or in secret. Kill only in justice the life that Allah has made sacred. This is what [Allah] has commanded you to do; perhaps you will understand.
And do not approach the property of the orphan except in the most beautiful way, until he has reached his majority. And give the right measure and weight, in all justice. We impose on a soul only according to its capacity. And when you speak, be fair even if it's a close relative. And fulfill your commitment to Allah. This is what He enjoins you to do. Maybe you'll remember.
"And this is My way in all its righteousness, so follow it; and do not walk in the paths that lead you away from His way." This is what He enjoins you to do. In this way you will attain piety.
Then We gave Moses the complete Book as a reward for the good he had done, and as a detailed account of all things, a guide and a mercy. Perhaps they would believe in their meeting with their Lord (on the Day of Judgment).
And here is a blessed Book (the Qur'an) which We have sent down - follow it therefore and be pious, that you may receive mercy -
so that you do not say, "The Book was sent down to only two peoples before us, and we were inattentive to study them.
Or you say, "If the Book had been sent down to us, we certainly would have been better guided than they were." Verily, you have come proof, guidance, and mercy from your Lord. Who is more unjust than the one who calls the verses of Allah lies and turns away from them? We will punish those who turn away from Our verses, with evil punishment, for turning away from them.
What are they waiting for? That the Angels come to them? Thy Lord come? Or that certain signs come from your Lord? In the day when certain signs of your Lord come, faith in Him will not benefit any soul who had not believed before or who had not gained any merit from his belief. Say: "Wait!" We are waiting, too.
Those who break up their religion and divide themselves into sects, for these you are not responsible for anything: their fate depends only on Allah. Then He will inform them of what they were doing.
Whoever comes with good will have ten times as much; and whoever comes with evil will be rewarded only by his equivalent. And we will do them no injustice.
Say: "My Lord has guided me to a straight path, a right religion, the religion of Abraham, the one who is subject only to Allah and who was not among the associates.
Say: "Verily, my Salah, my acts of devotion, my life and my death belong to Allah, the Lord of the Universe.
To Him no associate! And this is what I have been commanded, and I am the first to submit."
Say: "Would I seek any other Lord than Allah, when He is the Lord of all things? Everyone acquires [evil] only to his own detriment: no one will bear the burden (responsibility) of another. Then to your Lord will be your return and He will inform you of what you differ in.
It is He who has made you successors on earth and who has raised you in ranks one above the other, in order to test you in what He has given you. (Truly) your Lord is prompt in punishment, He is also Forgiving and Merciful.
Alif, Lâm, Mîm, Sâd.
It is a Book that has been sent down to you; let there be no embarrassment in your heart about him; so that by this you may warn, and (that it may be) a Reminder to the believers.
Follow what has been sent down to you from your Lord, and do not follow any allies but Him. But you remember little.
How many cities We have destroyed! Now Our severity came to them during the night's rest or during their siesta.
Their invocation, when our severity came upon them, was limited to these words: "Certainly we were unjust."
We will question those to whom messengers were sent, and We will also question those who have been sent.
We will tell them with full knowledge (what they were doing) because We were not absent!
And the weigh-in on that day will be fair. So, the one whose good deeds will weigh heavily... these are the ones who will succeed!
And as for the one whose good deeds will weigh lightly... these are the ones who have caused the loss of their souls because they were unjust to Our teachings.
Verily, We have given you power on earth and We have assigned you sustenance on it. (But) you are very ungrateful!
We created you, then We gave you a form, then We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam." They prostrated themselves, with the exception of Iblis, who was not one of those who prostrated themselves.
[Allah] said: "What prevents you from prostrating yourself when I have commanded you to do so?" He replied, "I am better than he: You created me from fire, but You created him from clay."
[Allah] said: "Come down from here, You need not be puffed up with pride here. Come out, you are among the despised."
"Give me a delay," says (Satan), "until the day they are resurrected."
[Allah] says: "You are one of those to whom a delay is granted."
"Since You have misled me," says [Satan], "I will sit for them on Your right path,
then I will attack them from the front, from the rear, from their right and from their left. And for the most part, You won't find them grateful."
"Get out of there," says (Allah,) banished and rejected. Whoever follows you among them... of all of you, I will fill Hell."
"O Adam, dwell in Paradise, you and your wife; and eat of both of you, as you please; and do not come near this tree; otherwise you will be among the unjust."
Then the Devil, in order to make visible to them what was hidden from them - their nakedness - whispered to them, saying, "Your Lord has forbidden you this tree only to prevent you from becoming Angels or being immortal."
And he swore to them, "Truly, I am a good adviser to both of you."
Then he brought them down by deception. Then, when they had tasted of the tree, their nakedness became visible to them; and they both began to attach leaves of Paradise to it. And their Lord called to them, "Did I not forbid you this tree? And didn't I tell you that the Devil was an open enemy to you?"
Both of them said, "O our Lord, we have wronged ourselves. And if You do not forgive us and show us mercy, we will most certainly be among the losers."
"Come down," says [Allah], "you will be enemies of one another. And there will be for you on earth sojourn and enjoy for a time."
"There," says (Allah), "you will live, there you will die, and from there you will be brought out."
O children of Adam! We have sent down upon you a garment to hide your nakedness, as well as ornaments. - But the garment of piety is better - It is one of the signs (of the power) of Allah. So that they remember.
O children of Adam! Let not the Devil tempt you, as he brought your father and mother out of Paradise, tearing off their garments to make their nakedness visible to them. He sees you and his henchmen, from where you do not see them. We have appointed the devils as allies to those who do not believe,
and when they commit a slew, they say: "This is a custom bequeathed by our ancestors and prescribed by Allah." Say: "[No,] Allah does not command turpitude. Will you say against Allah what you do not know?"
Say: "My Lord has commanded righteousness. Let your prostration be exclusively for Him. And call upon Him, sincere in your worship. As He created you, you will return to Him."
He guides one part, while another part has merited the error because they have taken the devils as their allies instead of Allah, and they think that they are rightly guided.
O children of Adam, in every place of Salat wear your adornment (your clothes). And eat and drink; and do not commit excesses, for He [Allah] does not love those who commit excesses.
Say: "Who has forbidden the adornment of Allah, which He has produced for His servants, and good food?" Say: "They are for those who have faith in this life, and only for them on the Day of Resurrection." Thus We make the verses clear to the people who know.
Say: "My Lord has forbidden only the great sins, both overt and secret, as well as sin, unlawful aggression, and to associate with Allah what He has sent down no proof, and to say about Allah what you do not know."
For every community there is a term. When their term comes, they cannot delay it for an hour, nor can they hasten it.
O children of Adam! If messengers [chosen] from among you come to expound My signs to you, then those who acquire piety and reform will have no fear and will not be afflicted.
And those who treat Our signs as lies and depart from them with pride, are the people of the Fire and they will dwell there forever.
Who is more unrighteous than the one who invents a lie against Allah, or who treats His signs as lies? These will have the share that has been prescribed for them; until the time when Our Messengers [Our Angels] come to them to take away their souls, saying to them: "Where are those whom you invoked besides Allah?" – They will answer: "We can no longer find them". And they will testify against themselves that they were disbelievers.
"Enter into the Fire," [Allah] will say, "among the jinn and the men of the communities that have gone before you." Every time a community enters, it will curse the one that preceded it. Then, when all are there, the last batch will say of the first: "O our Lord! These are the ones who have led us astray: give them therefore a double punishment of fire." He will say: "To each double the amount, but you don't know".
And the first batch will say to the last: "But you have no advantage over us. Taste punishment for what you have acquired."
For those who treat Our teachings as lies and depart from them out of pride, the gates of heaven will not be opened to them, and they will not enter Paradise until the camel enters the eye of the needle. In this way We reward criminals.
Hell will serve as their bed, and as a blanket they will have veils of darkness. Thus do We reward the unjust.
And those who believe and do good deeds - We do not impose any burden on anyone except according to his ability - these will be the people of Paradise: they will dwell there forever.
And We will remove all the rancor from their breasts, and under them will flow the streams, and they will say: "Praise be to Allah who has guided us to this. We would not have been guided if Allah had not guided us. The messengers of our Lord have come with the truth." And they will be proclaimed, "This is the Paradise that has been given to you as an inheritance for what you did."
The people of Paradise will cry out to the people of Fire: "Verily, we have found true what our Lord promised us. Have you also found true what your Lord promised?" "Yes," they will say. Then a herald will announce in their midst: "May the curse of Allah be upon the unjust,
who obstructed the path of Allah, who wanted to make it crooked, and who did not believe in the Hereafter."
And between the two, there will be a wall, and on al-A'râf will be people who will recognize everyone by their characteristic features. And they will cry out to the people of Paradise, "Peace be upon you!" They did not enter it although they wanted to.
And when their eyes are turned to the people of the Fire, they will say; "O our Lord! Don't put us with the unjust people."
And the people of al-A'râf, calling certain men whom they will recognize by their characteristic features, will say: "You have not made any profit from all that you had amassed and from the pride with which you were puffed up!
Are these the ones you swore will not have mercy on Allah? - Enter Paradise! You will be free from all fear, and you will not be afflicted.
And the people of the Fire will cry out to the people of Paradise: "Pour water on us, or of what Allah has given you." "They will answer: Allah has forbidden them to the disbelievers."
The latter took their religion as a distraction and a game, and the life of this world deceived them. Today We will forget them as they forgot the meeting of their day here, and because they denied Our teachings.
We have indeed brought them a Book which We have detailed, in all knowledge, as a guide and mercy for people who believe.
Are they just waiting for fulfillment (of His threat and promises?)? On the day when its (true) fulfillment comes, those who previously forgot it will say, "The messengers of our Lord have come with the truth. Are there intercessors for us who can intercede on our behalf? Or can we be sent back [to earth], so that we can work differently from what we did before?" They have certainly created their own downfall; and what they invented has abandoned them.
Your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then established Himself "istawâ" on the Throne. It covers the day with the night that pursues it without ceasing. (He created) the sun, the moon, and the stars, subject to His command. Creation and command belong to Him alone. All glory be to Allah, Lord of the Universe!
Call upon your Lord in all humility, reverence and discretion. Certainly, He does not like transgressors.
And do not sow corruption on the earth after it has been reformed. And call upon Him with fear and hope, for Allah's mercy is near to the doers.
It is He who sends the winds as a proclamation of His Mercy. Then, when they carry a heavy cloud, We direct it to a dead land, then We bring down the water, and then We bring out all kinds of fruit. In this way We will bring out the dead. Maybe you'll remember.
The good country, its vegetation grows with the grace of its Lord; as for the bad country, (its vegetation) comes out only insufficiently and with difficulty. In this way We spread the teachings for grateful people.
We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people, worship Allah. For you, there is no other god but Him. I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
The leaders of his people said, "We see you in manifest error."
He said, "O my people, there is no error in me; but I am a Messenger from the Lord of the Universe.
I give you the messages of my Lord, and I give you sincere advice, and I know of Allah what you do not know.
Are you surprised that a reminder comes to you from your Lord through a man from you, that he may warn you, and that you may become godly and have mercy be granted to you?"
And they called him a liar. Now We saved him and those who were with him in the ark, and drowned those who called Our miracles lies. They were blind people, really.
And to the 'Aad, their brother Hud: "O my people," he said, "worship Allah. For you, there is no other god but Him. Do you not fear [him]?"
The leaders of his people who did not believe said, "Surely we see you in the midst of foolishness, and we think that you are among the liars."
He said, "O my people, there is no foolishness in me; but I am a Messenger from the Lord of the Universe.
I am communicating to you the messages of my Lord, and I am a trustworthy adviser to you.
What! Are you surprised that a reminder comes to you from your Lord through a man from you, to warn you? And remember when He made you succeed Noah's people, and increased your body in height (and power). Well, remember the blessings of Allah so that you may succeed.
They said, "Have you come to us that we may worship Allah alone, and that we should forsake what our forefathers worshipped? Therefore bring forth what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful."
He said, "Behold, you are struck by your Lord with torment and anger. Are you going to argue with me about names that you and your ancestors have given, without Allah sending down any proof? Wait! I, too, am waiting with you.
Now We saved him and those who were with him out of mercy from Us, and We destroyed those who treated Our teachings as lies and who were not believers.
And to the Thamûd, their brother Sâlih: "O my people," he said, "worship Allah. For you, there is no other god but Him. Verily, a proof has come to you from your Lord: this is the she-camel of Allah, a sign for you. Let her eat in the land of Allah and do not harm her; otherwise a painful punishment will seize you.
And remember when He made you succeed the Aad and settled you on the earth. You have built palaces in its plains, and hewn the mountains into houses. So remember the bounties of Allah and do not spread corruption on the earth "like troublemakers."
The notables of his people, who were puffed up with pride, said to the oppressed, to those among them who had faith: "Do you know if Salih is sent from his Lord?" They said, "Yes, we believe in his message."
Those who were puffed up with pride said, "We certainly do not believe in what you have believed."
They killed the she-camel, disobeyed the command of their Lord, and said, "O Salih, bring to us what you threaten us with, if you are of the Messengers."
The cataclysm seizes them; and there they are lying lying in their dwellings.
Then he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had communicated to you the message of my Lord and had counseled you sincerely. But you don't like sincere advisors!"
And Lot, when he said to his people, "Are you giving yourself up to this turpitude which none of the worlds has committed before you?
Certainly, you satisfy your carnal desires with men instead of women! You are indeed an outrageous people."
And in response, his people only said, "Expel them from your city. These are people who want to keep themselves pure!"
Now We have saved him and his family, except his wife, who was among the exterminated.
And We rained down on them. Look at what the end of the criminals was!
And to the Madyan, their brother Chu'aib: "O my people," he said, "worship Allah. For you, there is no other god but Him. A proof has come to you from your Lord. So give the full measure and weight and don't give people less than they are due. And do not commit corruption on the earth after its reform. It will be better for you if you are believers.
And do not stand on any path, threatening, preventing from the path of Allah the one who believes in Him and seeking to make this path crooked. Remember when you were few in number and He multiplied you in great numbers. And look at what happened to the troublemakers.
If some of you believed the message with which I was sent, and some of you did not, then wait until Allah judges among us, for He is the best of judges."
The leaders of his people, who were puffed up with pride, said, "We will certainly expel you from our city, O Chu'aib, you and those who have believed with you. Or that you go back to our religion." – He said, "Is it even when it disgusts us?"
Certainly, we would have forged a lie against Allah if we returned to your religion after Allah has saved us from it. It is not for us to go back unless Allah our Lord wills it. Our Lord embraces all things of His knowledge. It is in Allah that we place our trust. O our Lord, decide by the truth, between us and our people, for You are the best of judges."
And the elders of his people who did not believe, said: "If you follow Chu'aib, you will certainly lose."
Then the earthquake seizes them; and there they are stretched out, lying in their dwellings.
Those who called Chu'aib a liar (disappeared) as if they had never lived there. Those who called Chu'aib a liar were the losers.
He turned away from them and said, "O my people, I have well communicated to you the messages of my Lord and given you advice. How can I grieve over disbelievers?"
We have not sent any prophet into a city, except that We have taken its inhabitants afterwards out of adversity and distress to beg (forgiveness).
Then We changed their evil condition by substituting good for it, so that when they grew in numbers and wealth, they said, "Trouble and ease have come to our forefathers also." Well, We have seized them suddenly, without them realizing it.
If the inhabitants of the cities had believed and been pious, We would certainly have granted them blessings from heaven and earth. But they denied it, and so We seized them for what they had acquired.
Are the people of the cities sure that Our severe punishment will not come upon them at night, while they are asleep?
Are the people of the cities sure that Our severe punishment will not come upon them in the day, while they are enjoying themselves?
Are they safe from Allah's scheme? Only lost people feel safe from Allah's scheme.
Is it not proved to those who receive the earth as an inheritance from the previous peoples that, if We willed, We would strike them for their sins and seal their hearts, and they would hear nothing more?
These are the cities of which We tell you some of their news. [To these,] in truth, their messengers had brought them proofs, but they were not ready to accept what they had previously called a lie. This is how Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.
And We have found in most of them no respect for the commitment; but We have found most of them perverse.
Then, after [these messengers,] We sent Moses with Our miracles to Pharaoh and his notables. But they were unjust to Our signs. Consider, then, what was the end of the corrupters.
And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a Messenger from the Lord of the Universe,
I must only tell the truth about Allah. I have come to you with a proof from your Lord. Let the Children of Israel go with me."
"If you have come with a miracle," says (Pharaoh), "bring it then, if you are of the truthful."
He threw down his staff, and behold, it was an obvious snake.
And he took out his hand and behold, it was white, to those who were looking.
The leaders of Pharaoh's people said, "This is indeed a seasoned magician.
He wants to expel you from your country." - "Then what do you command?"
They said, "Keep him and his brother waiting, and send gatherers into the cities,
which will bring you any wise magician.
And the magicians came to Pharaoh saying, "Will there really be a reward for us, if we are the overcomers?"
He said, "Yes, and you will certainly be among those who are near me."
They said, "O Moses, either you will throw (the first), or we will be the first to throw."
"Throw it away," he said. Then when they had thrown, they bewitched the eyes of the people and terrified them, and came with a powerful magic.
And We revealed to Moses, "Throw down your staff." And then he began to swallow up what they had made.
Thus the truth came to light and what they did was in vain.
Thus they were beaten and humiliated.
And the magicians fell down in prostration.
They said, "We believe in the Lord of the universe,
to the Lord of Moses and Aaron."
"Did you believe it before I allowed you?" said Pharaoh. It is indeed a stratagem that you have devised in the city, in order to make its inhabitants leave. You'll soon know...
I will cut off your opposite hand and leg, and then I will crucify you all."
They said, "Verily, we will return to our Lord.
You only take revenge on us because we believed in the proofs of our Lord, when they came to us. O our Lord! Pour out endurance on us and make us die completely submissive."
And the leaders of Pharaoh's people said, "Will you let Moses and his people make a mess on the earth, and he himself forsake you and your gods?" He said, "We are going to slaughter their sons and let their wives live. We'll get the better of them and dominate them."
Moses said to his people, "Ask Allah for help and be patient, for the land belongs to Allah. He makes them an heir whomever He wills among His servants. And the (happy) end will be to the pious."
They said, "We were persecuted before you came to us and after you came." He says, "Your Lord may destroy your enemy and give you the lieutenancy on earth, and then He will see how you will act."
We have tried Pharaoh's people by years of scarcity and by a decrease in fruit so that they might remember.
And when well-being came to them, they said, "It is due to us," and if any evil came upon them, they saw in Moses and those who were with him an ominous omen. Truly, their fate depends solely on Allah? But most of them don't know.
And they said, "No matter what miracle you bring to fascinate us, we will not believe in you."
And then We sent upon them the flood, the locusts, the lice (or the calender), the frogs, and the blood, as explicit signs. But they were puffed up with pride and remained a criminal people.
And when the chastisement came upon them, they said, "O Moses, call upon your Lord for us by virtue of the pledge He has given you. If you remove the punishment from us, we will certainly believe in you and let the children of Israel go with you."
And when We had removed the punishment from them until the appointed time which they were to reach, behold, they violated the engagement.
Then We took revenge on them; We drowned them in the waves, because they treated Our signs as lies and paid no attention to them.
And the people who were oppressed, We made them inherit the eastern and western lands of the land that We blessed. And the most beautiful promise of your Lord on the children of Israel is fulfilled as the price of their endurance. And We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people were doing, and what they were building.
And We have brought the Children of Israel across the Sea. They passed by a people attached to their idols and said, "O Moses, appoint us a deity like their gods." He said, "You are ignorant people.
The worship to which they devote themselves is obsolete; and everything they do is null and worthless."
He said: "Shall I seek for you any other god than Allah, when He has preferred you to all creatures?"
(Remember) the time when We saved you from Pharaoh's people who inflicted the worst punishment on you. They slaughtered your sons and let your wives live. This was a terrible trial on the part of your Lord.
And We gave Moses an appointment for thirty nights, and completed them with ten, so that the time appointed by his Lord ended at the end of forty nights. And Moses said to Aaron his brother, "Take my place among my people, and do good, and do not follow the path of the corrupters."
And when Moses came to Our appointment and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "O my Lord, show Yourself to me that I may see You." He said, "You shall not see Me; but look at the Mount: if it stands in its place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord manifested Himself on the Mount, He pulverized it, and Moses fell down in lightning. When he had recovered, he said, "Glory to You! To you I repent; and I am the first of the believers."
And (Allah) said: "O Moses, I have preferred you to all men, by My messages and by My word. Take therefore what I give you, and be among the grateful."
And We wrote for him on the tablets an exhortation concerning all things, and a detailed exposition of all things. "Take them therefore firmly and command your people to adopt the best of them. Soon I will show you the dwelling place of the wicked.
I will remove from My signs those who, without reason, puff themselves up with pride on earth. Even if they saw all the miracles, they wouldn't believe them. And if they see the right trail, they don't take it as a trail. But if they see the path of error, they take it as a path. It is because in truth they treat Our proofs as lies, and they paid no attention to them.
And those who deal with lies Our proofs as well as the encounter with the Hereafter, their works are in vain. Would they be rewarded otherwise than according to their deeds?"
And the people of Moses adopted after him a calf, made of their finery: a body that seemed to roar. Did they not see that he did not speak to them and that he did not guide them on any path? They adopted him [as a deity], and they were unrighteous.
And when they felt regret, and saw that they were indeed lost, they said, "If our Lord does not show us mercy and forgive us, we will certainly be among the losers."
And when Moses returned to his people, angry and saddened, he said, "You have done very badly during my absence! Did you want to hasten the command of your Lord?" He threw down the tablets and took his brother's head, drawing it to him: "O son of my mother," said (Aaron), "the people have treated me as weak, and they have come very near killing me. Do not therefore make enemies rejoice at my expense, nor assign me the company of unrighteous people."
And (Moses) said, "O my Lord, forgive me and my brother and bring us into Your mercy, for You are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
Those who took the calf (as a deity), soon will fall upon them from their Lord, anger, and degradation in this life. In this way, We reward the inventors (of idols).
Those who did evil deeds and then repented and believed... your Lord, after that, is surely Forgiving and Merciful.
And when Moses' anger had subsided, he took the tablets. In their text there was guidance and mercy for those who fear their Lord.
And Moses chose seventy men from his people to meet with Us. Then when they were seized by the earthquake, he said, "My Lord, if You had willed, You would have destroyed them first, and I with it. Are You going to destroy us for what foolish among us has done? This is only a trial of You, by which You lead astray whom You will, and guide whom You will. You are our Master. Forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the best of forgivers.
And prescribe for us good in this world as well as in the hereafter. Here we are back to You, repentant." And (Allah) said: "I will cause My punishment to reach whomever I will. And My mercy embraces all things. I will prescribe it to those who fear (Me), pay Zakat, and have faith in Our signs,
Those who follow the Messenger, the illiterate Prophet whom they find written (mentioned) in their homes in the Torah and the Gospel. He commands them what is proper, forbids them what is blameworthy, makes good things lawful for them, forbids them bad things, and takes away from them the burden and yokes that were upon them. Those who believe in him will support him, help him, and follow the light that has come down with him; These will be the winners.
Say: "O men! I am the Messenger of Allah to all of you, to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. No god but Him. He gives life and He gives death. So believe in Allah, in His Messenger, the illiterate Prophet who believes in Allah and His words. And follow him so that you may be well guided."
Among the people of Moses there is a community that guides (others) with the truth, and thereby exercises justice.
We divided them into twelve tribes, (twelve) communities. And We revealed to Moses, when his people asked him for water, "Strike the rock with your staff." And now twelve springs gushed out. Each tribe knew its watering trough. We covered them with the shadow of the cloud, and sent down upon them manna and quails: "Eat of the good things which We have given you." And it was not Us that they wronged, but they harmed themselves.
And when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city and eat [of its produce] as you please, but say, 'Forgiveness [of our sins] and go in by the gate and bow down. We will forgive you your faults; and to the beneficent (of you,) We will grant more."
Then the unrighteous among them changed the word that was spoken to them into another. Then We sent punishment from heaven upon them for the misdeed they had committed.
And ask them about the city that looked out on the sea, when the Sabbath was transgressed there. That their fish came to them surfacing on their Sabbath day, and did not come to them on the day when it was not Sabbath. Thus We tested them for the evil they committed.
And when a community among them says: "Why do you exhort a people whom Allah is going to annihilate or punish with severe punishment?" They answered, "To relieve our responsibility to your Lord; and that perhaps they will become pious!"
Then, when they forgot what they had been reminded of, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized with severe punishment the unrighteous for their wicked deeds.
Then, when they refused (out of pride) to give up what had been forbidden to them, We said to them, "Be abject monkeys."
And when your Lord announced that He would indeed send someone against them who would impose the worst punishment on them until the Day of Resurrection. Verily, your Lord is quick to punish, but He is also Forgiving and Merciful.
And We have divided them into communities on earth. There are good people among them, but there are some who are less so. We have tried them with good and evil, perhaps they would return (to the right path).
Then followed them by successors who inherited the Book, but who preferred what life on earth offers, saying: "We will have forgiveness." And if similar things are offered to them, they accept them. Had it not been made of them that they would not speak the truth about Allah? They had studied what is there. And the final resting place is better for those who practice godliness, - Will you not understand? -
And those who conform to the Book and perform Salat, [verily], We do not let the reward of those who mend their ways be lost.
And when We held up the Mount above them, as if it had been a parasol. They thought he was going to fall on them. "Hold fast to what We give you and remember its contents. Perhaps you will fear Allah."
And when your Lord took offspring from the loins of the sons of Adam and made them testify about themselves, "Am I not your Lord?" They answered, "Yes, we testify to it..." – so that you do not say on the Day of Resurrection, "Truly, we have not paid any attention to it."
or that you would have said (simply): "Our ancestors once gave partners to Allah, and we are their descendants, after them. Are You going to destroy us for what the impostors have done?"
And this is how We intelligently explain the signs. Maybe they will come back!
And tell them the story of the one to whom We gave Our signs and who departed from them. The Devil, therefore, dragged him into his retinue and he thus became one of the misguided.
And if We had willed, We would have brought him up by these same teachings, but he bowed down to the earth and followed his own passion. He is like a dog that pants if you attack him, and also pants if you leave him. This is the example of people who call Our Signs lies. Well, the story goes. Maybe they will think about it!
What a bad example are those who treat Our signs as lies, while it is themselves that they are wronging.
Whoever Allah guides, this is the rightly guided. And whoever He leads astray, these are the losers.
We have destined many jinn and men for Hell. They have hearts, but they don't understand. They have eyes, but they can't see. They have ears, but they can't hear. These are like cattle, even more misguided. Such are the careless.
To Allah belong the most beautiful names. Call upon Him by these names and let those who profane His names be rewarded: they will be rewarded for what they have done.
Among those whom We have created, there is a community that guides (others) according to the truth and through it exercises justice.
Those who treat Our teachings as lies, We will gradually lead them to their ruin in ways they do not know.
And I will give them a delay, for My stratagem is sound!
Have they not thought about it? There is no folly in their companion (Muhammad): he is only an explicit warner!
Have they not meditated on the kingdom of heaven and earth, and all things that Allah has created, and that their end may already be at hand? In what word will they believe after this?
Whoever Allah leads astray, there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression confused and hesitant.
They ask you about the Hour, "When will it come?" Say: "Only my Lord knows about it. He alone will manifest it in his own time. Heavy, it will be in the heavens and on the earth, and it will come to you only suddenly." They question you as if you were warned. Say: "Only Allah knows about it." But many people don't know.
Say: "I have no profit or damage for myself, except what Allah wills. And if I knew the Unknowable, I would have had abundant possessions and no evil would have touched me. I am, for people who believe, only a warner and a herald."
It is He who created you from one being from whom he took his wife, so that he might find tranquillity with her; and when he had cohabited with her, she conceived a slight pregnancy, with which she moved (easily). Then, when she found herself weighed down, they both invoked their Lord: "If You give us a healthy (child), we will certainly be among the grateful."
Then, when He had given them a healthy child, they both assigned to Allah partners in what He had given them. But Allah is far above the partners assigned to Him.
Do they assign as associates those who create nothing and who themselves are created,
and who can neither help them nor themselves?
If you call them to the straight path, they will not follow you. The result for you is the same whether you call them or keep silent.
Those whom you invoke besides Allah are servants like you. Therefore call upon them, and let them answer you, if you are truthful.
Do they have legs to walk? Do they have hands to strike? Do they have eyes to observe? Do they have ears to hear? Say: "Call upon your associates, and then cunning against me; and do not give me respite.
Verily, my Master, it is Allah who sent down the Book (the Qur'an). It is He who takes care of the righteous.
And those whom you call upon besides Him are not able to help you or themselves."
And if you call them to the straight path, they do not hear. You see them looking at you, (but) they don't see.
Accept what is reasonable offered you, command what is proper, and keep away from the ignorant.
And if the Devil ever incites you to do evil, seek refuge with Allah. For He hears, and knows everything.
Those who practice piety, when a suggestion of the Devil touches them, remember [Allah's punishment]: and behold, they become clairvoyants.
(As for the wicked), their evil partners drive them into aberration, and then they keep sinking.
When you don't bring them a miracle, they say, "Why don't you make it up?" Say: "I am only following what is revealed to me from my Lord. These [Quranic verses] are illuminating evidence from your Lord, a guide and a grace for people who believe.
And when one recites the Qur'an, listen carefully to him and observe silence, so that you may obtain mercy (from Allah).
And call upon your Lord in yourself, in humility and fear, in a low voice, morning and evening, and do not be of the careless.
Those who are with your Lord [the angels] do not disdain to worship Him. They glorify Him and bow down to Him.
They ask you about the loot. Say: "The spoils are Allah's and His Messenger's." Fear Allah, maintain harmony among yourselves, and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you are believers.
The true believers are those whose hearts tremble when Allah is mentioned. And when His verses are recited to them, it increases their faith. And they put their trust in their Lord.
Those who perform Salat and spend [in the cause of Allah] what We have allotted to them.
These are truly believers: to them are (high) degrees with their Lord, as well as forgiveness and a generous endowment.
In the same way, it is in the name of truth that your Lord has brought you out of your dwelling, despite the repulsion of some of the believers.
They argue with you about the truth after it has clearly appeared; as if they were being pushed to death and they saw (it).
(Remember), when Allah promised you that one of the two bands will be yours. You wanted to take the one who was unarmed, while Allah wanted to make the truth triumph and destroy every last one of the disbelievers with His words.
so that He may make the truth triumph and the false destroyed, in spite of the repulsion of the criminals.
(And remember) the time when you implored your Lord's help and He immediately heard you: "I will help you with a thousand Angels pouring one after the other."
Allah did this only to bring good news and so that your hearts might be at peace with it. There is no victory except on the part of Allah. Allah is Mighty and Wise.
And when He enveloped you in sleep as a security from Him, and from heaven He sent water down upon you to cleanse you of it, to remove from you the defilement of the Devil, to strengthen your hearts and to strengthen your steps! [your steps].
