And your Lord revealed to the angels, "I am with you: therefore strengthen the believers. I will strike fear into the hearts of the disbelievers. Strike above the necks and hit them on all the tips of your fingers.
This is because they have disobeyed Allah and His Messenger." And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger... Allah is certainly harsh in punishment!
That's (your fate); Taste it! And the disbelievers will be punished by the Fire.
O you who believe when you meet (the army) of the disbelievers on the march, do not turn your back on them.
Whoever turns his back on them on that day, unless it is as a battle tactic or to rally another group, he incurs the wrath of Allah and his refuge will be Hell. And what a bad destination!
It is not you who have killed them, but Allah has killed them. And when you threw a handful of ground, it was not you who threw it, but Allah threw it, and this was to test the believers with a great trial from Him. Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
There you go! Allah reduces the cunning of the disbelievers to nothing.
If you have implored Allah's arbitration, you now know [Allah's] ruling, and if you cease [disbelief and hostility against the Prophet..], it is better for you. But if you return, We will return, and your mass, even if it is numerous, will be of no use to you. For Allah is truly with the believers.
O you who believe! Obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn away from Him when you hear Him (speak).
And don't be like those who say, "We have heard," when they do not hear.
The worst of the beasts in the sight of Allah are, [verily], the deaf and dumb who do not reason.
And if Allah had recognized any good in them, He would have made them hear. But even if He made them heard, they would [surely] turn their backs as they walked away.
O you who believe! Respond to Allah and the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you (true) life, and know that Allah stands between man and his heart, and to Him you will be gathered.
And fear a calamity that will not afflict exclusively the unrighteous among you. And know that Allah is harsh in punishment.
And remember when you were few, oppressed on earth, afraid of being taken away by people. He gave you refuge, strengthened you with His help, and bestowed good things on you so that you might be grateful.
O you who believe! Do not betray Allah and the Messenger. Don't knowingly betray the trust that has been placed in you?
And know that your property and your children are but a trial and that with Allah there is a great reward.
O you who believe! If you fear Allah, He will grant you the ability to discern (between good and evil), erase your wrongdoings, and forgive you. And Allah is the Possessor of great grace.
(And remember) the time when the disbelievers were plotting against you to imprison you or murder you or banish you. They plotted. but Allah has thwarted their plot, and Allah is the best in stratagems.
And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, "We have listened, verily! If we wanted, we would say the same thing, they are only legends of the ancients."
And when they said, "O Allah, if this is the truth from You, then rain stones on us from heaven, or bring upon us a painful punishment."
Allah is not such that He chastises them while you are in the midst of them. And Allah is not such that He chastises them when they ask for forgiveness.
What then do they have that Allah does not chastise them, while they reject (the believers) from the Holy Mosque, although they are not its guardians, for its guardians are only the righteous? But most of them don't know this.
And their prayer at the house is nothing but whistling and clapping of hands: "Taste punishment for your disbelief."
Those who do not believe spend their wealth to lead (people) away from the path of Allah. Now, after having spent them, they will be a cause of regret to them. Then they will be defeated, and all those who do not believe will be gathered to Hell,
so that Allah may distinguish the evil from the good, and place the evil one on top of the other, to make a heap of them and cast it into Hell. These are the losers.
Tell those who do not believe that if they stop, they will be forgiven for what has happened. And if they reoffend, (they shall be punished); following the example of (their) predecessors.
And fight them until there is no longer any association, and the religion is entirely Allah's. Then, if they cease (they will be forgiven, for) Allah observes what they do.
And if they turn their backs, then know that Allah is your Master. What an excellent Master and what an excellent Protector!
And know that of all the booty you have collected, the fifth belongs to Allah, to the Messenger, to his next relatives, to the orphans, to the poor, and to the travelers, if you believe in Allah and in what We have sent down upon Our servant on the Day of Discernment, the day on which the two groups met,  and Allah is Omnipotent.
You were on the nearest slope, and they (the enemies) were on the farthest slope, while the caravan was lower than you. If you had made an appointment, you would have missed it (frightened by the number of the enemy). But Allah had to fulfill a command that was to be carried out, so that, on proof, he who was (to) perish, and live, on proof, the one who (was) to live. And Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
In a dream, Allah showed you that they were few! For if He had shown you many of them, you would certainly have relented, and you would certainly have quarrelled about the matter. But Allah has preserved you from it. He knows the contents of hearts.
And also, at the time of the meeting, He showed you that they were few in Your eyes, just as He made you appear to their eyes few so that Allah could complete a command that had to be carried out. It is to Allah that things are brought back.
O you who believe! When you meet a troop, be firm, and invoke Allah a lot in order to succeed.
And obey Allah and His Messenger; and do not quarrel, or you will give way and lose your strength. And be enduring, for Allah is with those who endure.
And do not be like those who went out of their homes to reject the truth and with public ostentation, obstructing the way of Allah. And Allah knows what they do.
And when the Devil had embellished their deeds and said, "No one among mankind can dominate you today, and I am your support." But when the two groups were in sight of each other, he turned on both heels and said, "I disown you. I see what you do not see; I fear Allah, and Allah is harsh in punishment."
(And remember), when the hypocrites and those with a heart trouble [whose faith is doubtful] said, "These people, their religion deceives them." But whoever puts his trust in Allah (will be victorious)... for Allah is Mighty and Wise.
If you only saw when the angels snatched the souls of the disbelievers! They struck them on their faces and behinds, (saying, "Taste the punishment of the Fire.
This (the punishment), for what your hands have done." And Allah is not unjust to slaves.
The same was true of Pharaoh's people and those who before them did not believe in the signs (teachings) of Allah. Allah seizes them for their sins. Verily, Allah is strong and severe in punishment.
This is because Allah does not change a blessing that He has bestowed on a people before they change what is in themselves. And Allah is, Hearer and All-Knowing.
So it was with Pharaoh's people and those who before them had called the signs (teachings) of their Lord lies. We have destroyed them for their sins. And We have drowned Pharaoh's people. For they were all unrighteous.
The worst beasts in the sight of Allah are those who have been unfaithful (in the past) and therefore do not believe (at present),
the same ones with whom you have made a pact and who break it every time, without any fear [of Allah].
Therefore, if you subdue them in war, inflict exemplary punishment on them so that those behind them will be frightened. So that they remember.
And if you really fear betrayal by a people, then denounce the pact (which you have made with it) in a frank and fair way, because Allah does not like traitors.
Let not the disbelievers think that they have escaped Us. No, they will never be able to stop Us (from catching up with them at any time).
And prepare against them all that you can in the way of strength and equipped, in order to frighten the enemy of Allah and your own, and others whom you do not know besides these, but whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be repaid to you in full, and you will not be wronged.
And if they incline to peace, incline to it (you also) and put your trust in Allah, for He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
And if they want to deceive you, then Allah will be sufficient for you. It is He who has sustained you with His help, as well as with the believers.
He has united their hearts (by faith). Had you spent all that is on earth, you would not have been able to unite their hearts; but Allah has united them, for He is Mighty and Wise.
O Prophet, Allah and those of the believers who follow you are sufficient for you.
O Prophet, incite the believers to battle. If there are twenty of you who endure, they will overcome two hundred; And if there are a hundred, they will overcome a thousand disbelievers, for they are really people who do not understand.
Now, Allah has lightened your task, knowing that there is weakness in you. If there are a hundred of you who have endured, they will overcome two hundred; and if there are a thousand, they will overcome two thousand, by the grace of Allah. And Allah is with those who endure.
A prophet should not take prisoners until he has prevailed [put the disbelievers out of action] on the earth. You want the goods of this world, while Allah wants the Hereafter. Allah is Mighty and Wise.
Had it not been for a prior prescription from Allah, a great punishment would have come upon you for what you have taken. [of the ransom]
Eat therefore of what is yours as booty, as long as it is lawful and pure. And fear Allah, for Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
O Prophet, say to the captives in your hands: "If Allah knows that there is any good in your hearts, He will give you better than what has been taken from you and will forgive you. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And if they want to betray you, they have already betrayed Allah [by disbelief]; but He has given a hold on them [on the day of Badr]. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Those who believed, emigrated and struggled with their property and their lives in the cause of Allah, as well as those who gave them refuge and help, these are allies of one another. As for those who believed and did not emigrate, you will not be bound to them until they emigrate. And if they ask you for help in the name of religion, then it is up to you to help them, but not against a people to whom you are bound by a pact. And Allah observes what you do.
And those who did not believe are allies of one another. If you do not do this [by severing ties with the infidels], there will be discord on earth and great disorder.
And those who believed, emigrated and struggled in the cause of Allah, as well as those who gave them refuge and help, these are the true believers: to them forgiveness and a generous reward.
And those who after that believed and emigrated and struggled with you, these are yours. However, those who are related have priority over each other, according to the Book of Allah. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing.
Disavowal on the part of Allah and His Messenger with regard to the associates with whom you have made a pact:
Travel the earth for four months; and know that you will not reduce Allah to impotence, and that Allah covers the disbelievers with shame."
And proclamation to the people, from Allah and His Messenger, on the Day of the Great Hajj, that Allah and His Messenger disavow the associates. If you repent, it will be better for you. But if you turn away, know that you will not reduce Allah to helplessness. And announces a painful punishment to those who do not believe.
Except for the partners with whom you made a covenant, and then they did not fail you in anything, and did not support anyone against you: fully abide by the covenant made with them until the agreed term. Allah loves the pious.
After the holy months expire, kill the Associates wherever you find them. Capture them, besiege them, and lie in wait for them in any ambush. If they then repent, perform Salah and pay Zakat, then let them go, for Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And if one of the associates asks you for asylum, grant it to him, so that he may hear the word of Allah, and then bring him to his place of safety. Because these are people who don't know.
How can there be a covenant for the members of the association that Allah and His Messenger accepts? Except for those with whom you have made a pact near the Holy Mosque. As long as they are right to you, be right to them. For Allah loves the pious.
How so! When they triumph over you, they respect neither kinship nor pact made with you. They satisfy you with their mouths, while their hearts refuse; and most of them are perverts.
They barter the verses of Allah (the Koran) at a low price and obstruct His path. What they are doing is very bad!
They do not respect any kinship or pact made with regard to a believer. And these are the transgressors.
But if they repent, perform Salah, and pay Zakat, they will become your brothers in religion. We explain the verses intelligibly to people who know.
And if, after the covenant, they violate their oaths and attack your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief - for they do not keep any oath - perhaps they will cease?
Will you not fight against people who have broken their oaths, who have wanted to banish the Messenger and then they are the ones who attacked you first? Did you fear them? Allah is more worthy of your fear if you are believers.
Fight them. Allah, through your hands, will punish them, cover them with shame, give you victory over them, and heal the breasts of a believing people.
And he will remove the wrath from their hearts. Allah welcomes repentance from whomever He wills. Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Do you think that you will be left behind, but Allah has not yet distinguished those of you who have struggled and have not sought allies besides Allah, His Messenger and the believers? And Allah is Fully Aware of what you do.
It is not for the associators to populate the mosques of Allah, since they are testifying against themselves to their disbelief. These are those whose works are in vain; and in the Fire they will remain forever.
Only those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, perform Salah, pay Zakat, and fear only Allah will populate the mosques of Allah. It may be that these are among the rightly guided.
Will you make it a duty to give the pilgrims something to drink and to maintain the Sacred Mosque (duties) comparable to the merit of one who believes in Allah and the Last Day and strives in the cause of Allah? They are not equal with Allah, and Allah does not guide the unjust.
Those who believed, who emigrated and who struggled with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah, have the highest rank with Allah... and they are the victors.
Their Lord proclaims to them mercy and pleasure from Him, and of the Gardens where there will be a permanent delight for them
where they will dwell forever. Verily, there is a great reward with Allah.
O you who believe! Do not take your fathers and brothers as allies if they prefer disbelief to faith. And whoever among you takes them as allies... these are the unjust.
Say: "If your fathers, your children, your brothers, your wives, your clans, the wealth you earn, the trade that you fear will decline, and the dwellings that are pleasing to you, are dearer to you than Allah His Messenger and the struggle in the cause of Allah, then wait for Allah to send for His command. And Allah does not guide evil people."
Allah has already helped you in many places. And [remember] the day of Hunayn, when you were proud of your great numbers and it was of no use to you. The earth, in spite of its extent, became very narrow for you; then you turned your backs on the fugitives.
Then Allah sent down His peace of Allah upon His Messenger and upon the believers. He sent down troops (angels) whom you did not see, and punished those who disbelieved. This is the reward for the disbelievers.
After that, Allah will receive repentance from whomever He wills, for Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
O you who believe! The associates are nothing but impurity: let them not go near the Holy Mosque after this year. And if you fear a shortage, Allah will enrich you, if He wills, by His grace. For Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Fight those who do not believe in Allah or the Last Day, who do not forbid what Allah and His Messenger have forbidden, and who do not profess the religion of truth, among those who have received the Book, until they pay the poll tax with their own hands, after having humbled themselves.
The Jews say, "Uzayr is the son of Allah," and the Christians say, "Christ is the son of Allah." This is their word from their mouths. They imitate the words of the disbelievers before them. May Allah destroy them! How do they deviate (from the truth)?
They took their rabbis and monks, as well as Christ son of Mary, as Lords besides Allah, while they were commanded only to worship one God. No god but Him! Glory be to Him! He is above what they associate with Him.
They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, while Allah only wants to complete His light, however much the disbelievers may be repulsed by it.
It is He who sent His messenger with the right guidance and the religion of truth, that it might triumph over all other religions, no matter how much the associates may be repulsed by them.
O you who believe! Many rabbis and monks devour people's property illegally and obstruct [their] path of Allah. To those who hoard gold and silver and do not spend them in the cause of Allah, announce a painful punishment,
on the day when (these treasures) are brought to incandescence in the fire of Hell and are cauterized by it, forehead, flanks, and backs: this is what you have hoarded for yourselves. Taste of what you have been hoarding."
The number of months with Allah is twelve [months], according to Allah's prescription, on the day on which He created the heavens and the earth. Four of them are sacred: such is the right religion. [During these months], do not harm yourselves. Fight the associators without exception, as they fight you without exception. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
Postponing from one holy month to another is an increase in disbelief. In this way, the disbelievers are led astray: one year they make it profane, and one year they make it sacred, in order to adjust the number of months that Allah has made sacred. In this way they make profane what Allah has made sacred. Their misdeeds are embellished with them. And Allah does not guide people who disbelieve.
O you who believe! What have you got? When you were told, "Pursue the cause of Allah," you weighed down on the earth. Is the present life more pleasing to you than the hereafter? - Now, the enjoyment of the present life will be but a small thing compared to the hereafter!
If you do not go into battle, He will punish you with a painful punishment and replace you with another people. You will not harm Him in any way. And Allah is Omnipotent.
If you don't help him... Allah has already helped him, when those who had disbelieved had banished him, the second of two. When they were in the cave and he said to his companion, "Do not grieve, for Allah is with us." Allah then sent down upon Him His serenity and supported him with soldiers (angels) whom you did not see, and thus He lowered the word of the disbelievers, while the word of Allah prevailed. And Allah is Mighty and Wise.
Light or heavy, go into battle, and fight with your property and your people in the cause of Allah. This is better for you, if you knew.
If it had been an easy profit or a short journey, they would have followed you; but the distance seemed long to them. And they will swear by Allah: "If we had been able, we would have gone out with you." They lose themselves. And Allah knows that they are lying.
May Allah forgive you! Why did you give them permission before you could distinguish those who spoke the truth and recognize the liars?
Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day do not ask your permission to fight with their property and their persons. And Allah knows the righteous well.
Ask permission only those who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day, and whose hearts are filled with doubt. They only hesitate in their uncertainty.
And if they had wanted to go (to battle), they would have made preparations for him. But their departure was repugnant to Allah; He made them lazy. And it was said to them, "Stay with those who remain."
If they had gone out with you, they would only have increased your trouble and thrown your ranks into dissension, seeking to create discord among you. And there are some of you who are listening to them. And Allah knows well the wrongdoers.
They have previously sought to sow discord (in your ranks) and to confuse your affairs until the truth comes and the command of Allah triumphs, despite their hostility.
Among them there are those who say, "Give me permission (to stay) and do not put me in temptation." But it is indeed into temptation that they have fallen; Hell is all around the disbelievers.
When happiness reaches you, it distresses them. And when something bad befalls you, they say: "Fortunately we had taken our precautions in advance." And they turn away while exulting.
Say: "Nothing will come to us except what Allah has ordained for us. He is our Protector. It is in Allah that believers must put their trust."
Say: "What are you waiting for us, if not one of the two best things? Whereas what we expect for you is that Allah inflicts punishment on you from Him or through our hands. Wait! We are also waiting, with you."
Say: "Spend willingly or unwillingly: it will never be accepted of you, for you are perverse people."
What prevents their gifts from being accepted is the fact that they have not believed in Allah and His Messenger, that they go to Salat only lazily, and that they spend (on good deeds) only reluctantly.
Let not their possessions and their children marvel at you! Allah only wants to punish them in this life, and to make the soul painfully disbelieved.
And they (the hypocrites) swear by Allah that they are truly of you; when they are not. But they are fearful people.
If they found a refuge, caves or an underground passage, they would turn there and rush into it at full speed.
There are some among them who criticize you about the Sadaqats: if they are given any, they are pleased; but if they are not given any, they are full of resentment.
If they had been satisfied with what Allah had given them and His Messenger and said, "Allah is sufficient for us. Soon Allah will bestow His favor on us as well as His Messenger... It is to Allah that all our desire goes."
Sadaqats are intended only for the poor, the destitute, those who work in them, those whose hearts are to be won (to Islam), freedom from yokes, those who are heavily indebted, in the cause of Allah, and for the traveler (in distress). This is a decree of Allah! And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And there are among them those who harm the Prophet and say, "He is all ear." - Say: "An ear for your good. He believes in Allah and trusts the believers, and he is a mercy to those of you who believe. And those who harm the Messenger of Allah will have a painful punishment."
They swear to you by Allah to satisfy you. Whereas Allah - as well as His Messenger - has more right for them to satisfy Him, if they are truly believers.
Do they not know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger will have the fire of Hell to dwell there forever? And here is the immense opprobrium.
The hypocrites fear that a Surah will be sent down upon them revealing what is in their hearts. Say: "Mock! Allah will bring out what you take the precaution (to hide)."
And if you asked them, they'd most certainly say, "Really, we were just chatting and playing." Say: "Are you mocking Allah and His verses (the Qur'an) and His Messenger?"
Don't apologize: you did reject faith after believing. If We pardon one part of your people, We will punish another for having been criminals.
Hypocrites, men and women, belong to each other. They command what is blameworthy, forbid what is proper, and fold up their hands (in avarice). They have forgotten Allah and He has forgotten them. In truth, the hypocrites are the perverts.
To the hypocrites, men and women, and to the disbelievers, Allah has promised the fire of Hell to dwell there forever. That's enough for them. Allah has cursed them. And for them, there will be permanent punishment.
The same was true of those who came before you: they were stronger than you, richer, and had more children. They enjoyed their lot [in this world], and you enjoyed your lot as your predecessors enjoyed their lot. And you argued at random like what they had discussed. These will see their works destroyed in this world and in the next, and they are the losers.
Has not the history of those who came before them come down to them: the people of Noah, the 'Aad, the Tamûd, the Abraham, the people of Midyan, and the overthrown cities? Their messengers had brought them clear proofs. It was not Allah who wronged them, but they wronged themselves.
Believers are allies of one another. They command what is proper, forbid what is blameworthy, perform the 'alat, pay zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger. These are the ones to whom Allah will have mercy, for Allah is Mighty and Wise.
To the believers, Allah has promised Gardens under which streams flow, so that they may dwell in them forever, and excellent mansions, in the Gardens of Eden. And Allah's satisfaction is even greater, and this is the enormous success.
O Prophet, fight against the disbelievers and hypocrites, and be harsh with them; Hell will be their refuge, and what a bad destination!
They swear by Allah that they did not say (what they said), when in truth they spoke the word of disbelief and they rejected the faith after they were Muslims. They projected what they could not accomplish. But they have nothing to reproach except that Allah - as well as His Messenger - has enriched them by His grace. If they repented, it would be better for them. And if they turn their backs, Allah will punish them with a painful punishment, both here and hereafter; and they will have no ally or helper on earth.
And among them there are some who have made a pledge to Allah: "If He gives us His grace, we will certainly pay Zakat and be among the righteous."
But when He gave them His grace, they were miserly and turned their backs in an about-face.
So He has stirred up hypocrisy in their hearts until the day they meet Him, for breaking what they promised Allah and for lying.
Do they not know that Allah knows their secret and their confidential conversations, and that Allah knows perfectly well the unknowable?
Those who direct their slanders against believers who give voluntary alms and against those who find only their feeble means (to offer), and then they mock them. May Allah mock them. And they will have a painful punishment.
Whether you ask forgiveness for them, or whether you do not ask for it - and if you ask forgiveness for them seventy times - Allah will not forgive them. This is because they did not believe in Allah and His Messenger and Allah does not guide evil people.
Those who were left behind rejoiced that they could stay at home behind the Messenger of Allah, they were loath to fight with their property and their persons in the cause of Allah, and said: "Do not go to battle in this heat!" Say: "The fire of Hell is more intense in heat."
Let them laugh a little and cry a lot as a reward for what they have acquired.
If Allah brings you back to a group of these (people), and they ask your permission to go to battle, then say: "You will never go out with me again, and you will never fight enemies with me again. You were happier staying at home the first time; therefore remain at home in the company of those who stand in the rear."
And never do Salat on one of them who dies, and do not stand by his grave, because they did not believe in Allah and His Messenger, and they died while being perverse.
And let neither their possessions nor their children amaze you! Allah only wants to punish them here below, and that they give up the ghost with difficulty as disbelievers.
And when a Surah is revealed: "Believe in Allah and fight in the company of His Messenger," the people who have all the means (to fight) among them ask you to exempt them (from the fight), and say: "Leave us with those who remain."
It pleases them (after the departure of the combatants) to remain with those who have remained in the rear. Their hearts have been sealed and they don't understand anything.
But the Messenger and those who believed with him struggled with their possessions and their persons. They will have the right things and they will succeed.
Allah has prepared for them Gardens under which streams flow, so that they may dwell in them forever. This is a huge success!
And among the Bedouins, some came to ask to be excused (from fighting). And those who lied to Allah and His Messenger stayed at home. A painful punishment will afflict the disbelievers among them.
There is no reproach against the weak, nor against the sick, nor on those who cannot find anything to spend (for the sake of Allah), if they are sincere towards Allah and His Messenger. No reproach against benefactors. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Nor do you reproach those who came to you to provide them with a mount, and to whom you said, "I cannot find a mount for you." They turned back with tears in their eyes, sad that they couldn't find anything to spend.
There is no way (of reproach to), truly, except against those who ask to be exempted, even though they are rich. They like to stay with those who have remained behind. And Allah has sealed their hearts and they do not know.
They apologize to you when you come back to them. Say: "Don't apologize: we don't believe you. Allah has already informed us of your news. And Allah will see your work, as well as His Messenger. Then you will be brought back to the One who knows the invisible and the visible well, and then He will inform you of what you were doing.
They will swear oaths to you by Allah, when you return to them, so that you may pass away. Turn away from them. They are a defilement and their refuge is Hell, in retribution for what they acquired.
They make oaths to you to be acceptable to you, even if you accept them, Allah does not accept evil people.
The Bedouins are more hardened in their impiety and hypocrisy, and the most inclined to disregard the precepts that Allah revealed to His Messenger. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Among the Bedouins, some take their expense (in alms or in war) as an expensive burden, and expect a reversal of fortune for you. May misfortune fall upon them! Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
Another of the Bedouins believes in Allah and the Last Day and takes what he spends as a means of getting closer to Allah and in order to benefit from the supplications of the Messenger. It is truly for them (a way) to draw closer (to Allah) and Allah will admit them into His mercy. For Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
The very first [believers] among the Émigrés and Auxiliaries and those who followed them in good behavior, Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. He has prepared for them Gardens under which streams flow, and they will dwell there forever. This is a huge success!
And among the Bedouins around you, there are hypocrites, as well as some of the inhabitants of Medina. They persist in hypocrisy. You do not know them, but We know them. We will chastise them twice and then they will be brought back to a huge punishment.
Others have acknowledged their sins, they have mixed good deeds with bad ones. It may be that Allah will welcome their repentance. For Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Take from their possessions a Sadaqah by which you purify and bless them, and pray for them. Your prayer is a peace of mind for them. And Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
Do they not know that it is Allah who receives the repentance of His servants, and who receives the Sadaqat, and that Allah is the One who welcomes repentance and the Merciful?
And say: "Work, for Allah will see your work, as well as His Messenger and the believers, and you will be brought back to Him who knows well the invisible and the visible. Then He will inform you of what you were doing."
And others are left waiting for Allah's decision, either to punish them or to forgive them. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Those who have built a mosque to make it a motive for rivalry, ungodliness and division among the believers, who prepare it for the one who previously fought against Allah and His Messenger and swear, saying: "We wanted only good." Allah testifies that they are lying.
Never stand in (this mosque). For a mosque founded from the first day on piety is more worthy for you to stand in it. There are people who like to purify themselves, and Allah loves those who purify themselves.
Which one is more deserving? Is it the one who founded his building on the piety and pleasure of Allah, or the one who placed the foundations of his building on the edge of a crumbling cliff and collapsed with him in the fire of Hell? And Allah does not guide unrighteous people.
The building they have built will always be a source of doubt in their hearts, until their hearts are torn apart. And Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Verily, Allah bought believers, their persons and their possessions in exchange for Paradise. They fight in the cause of Allah: they kill, and they are killed. It is an authentic promise that He has made upon Himself in the Torah, the Gospel and the Qur'an. And who is more faithful than Allah to his commitment? So rejoice in the exchange you have made: And this is the great success.
They are those who repent, worship, praise, walk the earth (or fast), bow, bow, prostrate, command what is proper and forbid what is blameworthy, and observe the laws of Allah... and give good news to the believers.
It is not for the Prophet and the believers to beg forgiveness for the associates, even if they are relatives, when it has become clear to them that they are the people of Hell.
Abraham asked forgiveness for his father only because of a promise he had made to him. But as soon as it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, he disowned him. Abraham was certainly full of care and forgiving.
Allah is not such as to lead a people astray after He has guided them, until He has made it clear to them what they should avoid. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing.
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and He gives death. And there is no ally or protector for you besides Allah.
Allah welcomed the repentance of the Prophet, that of the Emigrants and Auxiliaries who followed him at a difficult time, after the hearts of a group of them were on the verge of deviating. Then He welcomed their repentance, for He is Compassionate and Merciful to them.
And [He accepted repentance] of the three who had remained behind, so that, vast as it was, the earth seemed small to them; they felt cramped, in their own person, and they thought that there was no other refuge from Allah than with Him. Then He accepted their repentance so that they might return, for Allah is the Merciful One who welcomes repentance.
O you who believe! Fear Allah and be with the truthful.
It is not for the people of Medina, nor for the Bedouins who are around them, to lag far behind the Messenger of Allah, nor to prefer their own life to his. For they will not be thirsty, weary, or hungry in the cause of Allah, nor will they tread any land and provoke the anger of the infidels, nor will they gain any advantage over an enemy, unless a good deed is written for them. Verily, Allah does not let the reward of the benefactors be lost.
They shall not bear any expense, small or large, shall not pass through any valley, and shall not be recorded in their credit, so that Allah may reward them for the best of what they did.
Believers do not have to leave all their homes. Why should not a few men from each clan come to be instructed in religion, so that on their return they can warn their people so that they may be on their guard?
O you who believe! Fight against those who disbelieve who are near you; and that they find hardness in you. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
And when a Surah is revealed, there is one among them who says, "Which of you is it that it increases in faith?" As for the believers, it certainly increases their faith, and they rejoice in it.
But as for those whose hearts are sick, it adds a defilement to their defilement, and they die in disbelief.
Do they not see that every year they are tried once or twice? Despite this, they do not repent or remember.
And when a Surah is revealed, they look at each other [and say]: "Does anyone see you?" Then they turn away. May Allah turn away their hearts, since they are people who do not understand anything.
Verily, a Messenger from among you has come to you, who is burdened by the difficulties you are undergoing, who is full of concern for you, who is compassionate and merciful to the believers.
So, if they turn away, say: "Allah is sufficient for me. There is no god but Him. In Him I place my trust; and He is the Lord of the immense Throne."
Alif, Lâm, Râ. These are the verses of the Book full of wisdom.
Is it any wonder to the people that We have revealed to one of them, "Warn the people, and preach the good news to the believers that they have a deserved presence with their Lord [for their former loyalty]? The disbelievers then said, "This one is certainly an obvious magician."
Your Lord is, Allah who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then established Himself "Istawa" on the Throne, administering all things. There is no intercessor except with His permission. This is Allah your Lord. Worship Him, then. Don't you think?
To Him you will all return, this is the promise of Allah in all truth. It is He who makes the creation for the first time and then remakes it (by resurrecting it) in order to reward in all fairness those who have believed and done good deeds. As for those who did not believe, they will have a drink of boiling water and a painful punishment because of their disbelief.
It is He who has made the sun a brightness and the moon a light, and He has determined the phases of them so that you may know the number of years and the calculation. Allah has created this only in all truth. He exposes the signs for people who are gifted with knowledge.
In the alternation of night and day, and also in all that Allah has created in the heavens and the earth, there are signs, indeed, for people who fear (Allah).
Those who do not hope for Our meeting, who are satisfied with the present life and feel safe in it, and those who are inattentive to Our signs [or verses],
their refuge will be Fire, for what they acquired.
Those who believe and do good deeds, their Lord will guide them because of their faith. At their feet the streams will flow in the Gardens of Earthly Delights.
There, their supplication will be "Glory to You, O Allah," and their greeting: "Salam," [Peace!], and the end of their supplication: "Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Universe."
And if Allah hastened people's misfortune with as much haste as they seek happiness, the end of their lives would have been decreed. But We leave those who do not hope for Our meeting confused and hesitant in their transgression.
And when misfortune befalls man, he calls upon Us, lying on his side, sitting, or standing. And when We deliver him from his misfortune, he goes away as if he had not implored Us for an evil that has befallen him. Thus were their actions embellished by the outrageous.
We have destroyed the generations before you when they were unrighteous when their messengers had brought them proofs. However, they were not willing to believe. This is how We reward criminal people.
Then we made you successors on earth after them, to see how you would act.
And when Our verses are recited to them in all clarity, those who do not expect us to meet say: "Bring a Qur'an other than this" or "Change it." Say: "It is not for me to change it of my own accord. I am only following what is revealed to me. I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a terrible day."
Say: "If Allah had willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you. Before that, I remained among you for a whole age. Are you not reasoning?"
Who is more unjust than the one who invents a lie against Allah, or who treats His verses (the Qur'an) as lies? Criminals really don't succeed.
They worship instead of Allah that which can neither harm nor benefit them, and say: "These are our intercessors with Allah." Say: "Will you inform Allah of what He does not know in the heavens and on the earth?" Purity to Him, He is Very High above what They associate with Him!
The people were (originally) one community. Then they diverged. And if it were not for the prior decision of your Lord, the disputes between them would have been settled.
And they say, "Why is not a miracle of his Lord sent down upon him?" Then say: "The unknowable belongs only to Allah. Wait, then; I will be with you among those who wait.
And when We give people a taste of mercy after a misfortune has befallen them, behold, they are denigrating Our verses. Say: "Allah is quicker to repress (those who denigrate His verses)." For Our angels record your denigrations.
It is He who makes you go on land and sea, when you are in a boat. [These boats] carried them away, thanks to a good wind. They rejoiced until the moment when, assailed by a rushing wind, assailed on all sides by the waves, judging themselves enveloped [by death], they prayed to Allah, worshipping Him [and saying]: "Verily, if You save us from this, we will be among the grateful."
When He has saved them, there they are, on earth, transgressing unjustly. O people! Your transgression will fall only on yourselves. It is a temporary enjoyment of the present life. Then you will return to Us, and then We will remind you of what you were doing.
The present life is like water that We send down from heaven and that mixes with the vegetation of the earth on which men and beasts feed. Then, when the earth takes on its adornment and becomes more beautiful, and its inhabitants think that it is entirely at their disposal, Our Order comes to it, night or day, and it is then that We will make it all harvested, as if it had not flourished the day before. Thus We set forth the proofs for thinking people.
Allah calls to the abode of peace and guides whomever He wills to a straight path.
To those who do good is reserved the best (reward) and even more. No blackening smoke, no degradation will cover their faces. These are the people of Paradise, where they will dwell forever.
And those who have committed evil deeds, the reward for an evil deed will be the equivalent. A degradation will cover them, - no protector for them against Allah - as if their faces were covered with shreds of darkness at night. These are the people of the Fire where they will dwell forever.
(And remember) the day when We will gather them all. Then We will say to those who have given [Allah] associates: "In your place, you and your associates." We will separate them from each other and their associates will say, "It is not us that you worship."
Allah is sufficient as a witness between us and you. In truth, we were indifferent to your adoration."
There every soul will experience (the consequences of) what it has previously accomplished. And they will be brought back to Allah their true Master; and their inventions (idols) will depart from them.
Say: "Who gives you food from heaven and earth? Who has hearing and sight, and who brings the living out of the dead and the dead out of the living, and who administers everything?" They will say, "Allah." Then say, "Do you not fear Him?"
This is Allah, your true Lord. Beyond the truth, what is there but delusion? How can you turn away?"
Thus the word of your Lord against the wicked has been fulfilled: "They will not believe."
Say: "Of your associates, who gives life by a first creation and gives it again [after death]?" Say: "Allah [alone] gives life through a first creation and gives it again. How can you deviate from [worshiping Allah]?
Say: "Is there one among your associates who guides to the truth?" Say: "It is Allah who guides to the truth. Is he who guides to the truth more worthy of being followed, or is he who directs himself only in so far as he himself is directed? What is the matter with you? How do you judge that?"
And most of them follow only conjecture. But, conjecture is useless against the truth! Allah knows perfectly well what they are doing.
This Qur'an is in no way to be forged apart from Allah, but it is the confirmation of what already existed before it, and the detailed exposition of the Book in which there is no doubt, which came from the Lord of the Universe.
Or do they say, "He (Muhammad) invented it?" Say: "Compose a surah like this, and call for help from anyone you can, besides Allah, if you are truthful."
Quite the contrary: they have treated as a lie what they cannot embrace with their knowledge, and the interpretation of which has not yet reached them. Thus those who lived before them called their messengers impostors. Look at how the end of the unrighteous was!
Some of them believe in it, and others don't. And your Lord knows best the troublemakers.
And if they call you a liar, then say, "My work is mine, and yours is yours. You are irresponsible for what I do and I am irresponsible for what you do."
And there are some among them who lend an ear to you. Is it you who makes the deaf hear, even if they are unable to understand.
And there are some among them who look at you. Are you the one who can guide the blind, even if they do not see?
Verily, Allah is not unjust to people, but it is the people who do harm to themselves.
And the day He gathers them together, it will be as if they had stayed [in their tomb] only an hour of the day and they will recognize one another. The losers will then be those who have treated the encounter with Allah as a lie, and they will not have been properly guided.
Whether We show you a part of what We threaten them with, or whether We put you to death, (in any case), it is to Us that their return will be. Allah is also a witness of what they do.
To each community a Messenger. And when their messenger came, everything was decided in equity among them, and they were not wronged.
And they say, "When will this promise come, if you are truthful"?
Say: "I have nothing for myself that can harm or benefit me, except what Allah wills. Each community has a term. When their term comes, they can neither delay it by an hour nor bring it forward."
Say: "See! If His punishment came to you night or day, could the criminals hasten it?
"Will you believe when the punishment comes? [You will be told, "Useless."] Right now! In the past, you [ironically] demanded its speedy arrival!"
Then it will be said to the unjust: "Taste eternal punishment! Are you paid otherwise than in proportion to what you acquired?"
And they inquire of you, "Is it true?" – Say, "Yes! By my Lord! That's true. And you cannot escape the power of Allah.
If every unrighteous soul possessed all that is on earth, he would give it for his ransom. They will hide their regret when they see the punishment. And it shall be decided between them in all equity, and they shall not be wronged.
Verily, to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. Verily, Allah's promise is truth. But most of them don't know (it).
It is He who gives life and gives death; and to Him you will be brought back.
O people! An exhortation has come to you from your Lord, a healing of what is in the breasts, a guide and a mercy for believers.
Say: "[This is] from the grace of Allah and His mercy; This is something they should be happy about. It's much better than anything they amass."
What do you say about what Allah has sent down for you as sustenance and which you have then made lawful and forbidden things about? Say: "Has Allah permitted you to do so? Or are you fabricating lies against Allah?"
And what will those who forge a lie against Allah think on the Day of Resurrection? - Verily, Allah is the Possessor of grace for people, but most of them are not grateful.
You shall not be in any situation, you shall not recite any passage of the Qur'an, you shall not perform any deed without Our witnessing at the time you undertake it. Neither the weight of an atom on earth or in heaven escapes your Lord, nor a smaller or greater weight that is not already written in an obvious book.
Verily, the beloved of Allah will be free from all fear, and they will not be afflicted,
those who believe and fear [Allah].
There is a good announcement for them in the life of this world as well as in the ultimate life. - There will be no change in the words of Allah -. This is a huge success!
Don't let what they say distress you. All power belongs to Allah. He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. What then do those who besides Allah follow [the gods] whom they associate with Him? They only follow conjecture and only lie.
It is He who has appointed you at night to rest, and during the day to allow you to see. These are indeed signs for the people who hear!
They say: "Allah has given Himself a child." He is The Rich One par excellence. To Him belongs all that is in heaven and on earth; - You have no proof for this. Are you going to say against Allah what you do not know?
Say: "Verily, those who forge lies against Allah will not succeed."
It is a (temporary) enjoyment in the life of this world; then they will return to Us and We will give them a taste of harsh punishment as a punishment for their disbelief.
Tell them the story of Noah, when he said to his people: "O my people, if my sojourn (among you) and my remembrance of the signs of Allah weigh too heavily on you, then I trust in Allah. Consult with your associates, and do not conceal your designs. Then decide on me and give me no respite.
If you turn away, then I didn't ask you for a salary... My salary belongs only to Allah. And I have been commanded to be among the submissive."
They called him a liar. We saved him and those who were with him in the ark, and made them successors (on earth). We drowned those who treated Our proofs as lies. Look at how the end of those who had been warned was!
Then We sent messengers after him to their peoples. They came to them with the proofs. But (the people) were such that they could not believe what they had previously called a lie. Thus do We seal the hearts of the transgressors.
Then We sent Moses and Aaron after them with Our proofs to Pharaoh and his nobles. But (these people) were puffed up with pride and they were a criminal people.
And when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Verily, this is manifest magic."
Moses said, "Say to the Truth when it came to you, 'Is this magic?' Whereas magicians do not succeed..."
They said, "Is it to depart from what we found our ancestors on that you have come to us, and that the greatness may belong to you both on earth? And we don't believe in you!"
And Pharaoh said, "Bring me every learned magician."
Then when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw away what you have to throw."
When they threw away, Moses said, "What you have produced is magic! Allah will annul it. For Allah does not prosper what the troublemakers do.
And by His words, Allah will make the Truth triumph, however much the criminals may be repulsed by it."
No one believed (the message) of Moses, except a group of young men of his people, for fear of reprisals from Pharaoh and their notables. In truth, Pharaoh was certainly superb on earth and he was among the extravagant.
And Moses said, "O my people, if you believe in Allah, put your trust in Him if you are submissive."
They said, "In Allah we place our trust. O our Lord, do not make us a target for the persecution of the unjust.
And deliver us, by Your mercy, from disbelievers."
And We revealed to Moses and his brother: "Take houses for your people in Egypt, make your houses a place of prayer, and be diligent in prayer. And give good news to believers."
And Moses said, "O our Lord, Thou hast bestowed upon Pharaoh and his notables adornments and possessions in this present life, and behold, O our Lord, with this they are leading (the people far aside) from Thy path. O our Lord, destroy their possessions and harden their hearts, that they may not believe, until they have seen the painful punishment."
He said, "Your prayer is answered. Stay both on the straight path, and do not walk in the path of those who do not know."
And We took the Children of Israel across the sea. Pharaoh and his armies pursued them with fury and enmity. Then, when he had drowned, he said, "I believe that there is no god but Him in whom the children of Israel believed. And I am one of the submissives."
[Allah says]: Now? Whereas before you disobeyed and were among the corrupters!
Today we will spare your body, so that you may become a sign to your successors. However, many people pay no attention to Our (warning) signs.
Verily, We have established the Children of Israel in an honorable place, and have given them good food as food. Thereafter, they diverged only when science came to them. Your Lord will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection what divided them.
And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down to you, then ask those who read the Book revealed before you. The truth has come to you from your Lord: therefore do not be of those who doubt.
And do not be one of those who call the verses of Allah a lie. You would then be among the losers.
Those against whom the word (threat) of your Lord is fulfilled will not believe,
even if all the signs came to them, until they saw the painful punishment.
If only there was, apart from the people of Yunus (Jonah), a city that believed and whose belief had then profited! When they had believed, We took away from them the punishment of ignominy in this life and gave them enjoyment for a time.
If your Lord had willed, all who are on earth would have believed. Is it up to you to force people to become believers?
It is not proper for a soul to believe except with the permission of Allah. And He condemns to punishment those who do not reason.
Say: "Look at what is in the heavens and on the earth." But neither proofs nor warnings (prophets) are enough for people who do not believe.
Do they expect anything other than punishments similar to those of previous peoples? Say: "Wait! I, too, am waiting with you."
Then We will deliver Our Messengers and believers. Thus it is incumbent upon Us to deliver the believers.
Say: "O people! If you are in doubt about my religion, I do not worship those whom you worship except Allah; but I worship Allah who will put you to death. And I have been commanded to be of the believers."
And (I was told): "Orient yourself exclusively on religion as a pure monotheist! And do not be of the number of the Associates;
and do not invoke except Allah that which cannot benefit you or harm you. And if you do this, then you will be among the unjust."
And if Allah causes evil to befall you, no one can remove it except Him. And if He wishes you good, no one can reject His grace. He rewards whomever He wants among His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
Say: "O people! Verily the truth has come to you from your Lord. Therefore, whoever is on the right path is only on the right path for himself; and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to his own detriment. I am in no way a protector for you.
And follow what is revealed to you, and be steadfast until Allah renders His judgment, for He is the best of judges.
Alif, Lâm, Râ. It is a Book whose verses are perfect in style and meaning, emanating from a Sage, a Perfect Knower.
Worship only Allah. I am a warner and a herald for you from Him.
Ask forgiveness from your Lord; then come back to Him. He will grant you a beautiful enjoyment until a fixed term, and He will grant to each deserving person the honor he deserves. But if you turn your back, then I fear for you the punishment of a great day.
To Allah will be your return; and He is Omnipotent.
What! They fold their breasts in order to hide themselves from Him. Even when they cover themselves with their garments, He knows what they are hiding and what they are disclosing, for He certainly knows the contents of the breasts.
There is no beast on earth whose sustenance does not belong to Allah, who knows its dwelling place and its deposit; everything is in an explicit Book.
And He's the One who created the heavens and the earth in six days, while His Throne was on the water, to test which of you would do best. And if you say, "You will be resurrected after death," those who do not believe will say, "This is just obvious magic."
And if We delay the punishment for them until a fixed period, they will say, "What is holding him back?" - But on the day it comes to them, he will not be turned away; of them and what they mocked will envelop them.
And if We make man taste a grace from Us, and then wrest it from him, he is desperate and ungrateful.
And if We give him a taste of happiness, after a misfortune has befallen him, he will say, "The evils have departed from me," and there he rejoices, full of glory.
except those who are enduring and do good works. They will get forgiveness and a big reward.
You may neglect some of what is revealed to you, and your chest may feel compressed; because they say, "Why has not treasure been sent down upon him?" Or, "Why didn't an angel come with him?" – You're just a warner. And Allah is the protector of all things.
Or they say: "He has forged it [the Qur'an]" - Say: "Bring then ten Surahs like this, forged (by you). And call whomever you can, except Allah, if you are truthful."
If they do not answer you, then know that it is through the knowledge of Allah that He has descended, and that there is no god but Him. Are you subject (to Him)?
Those who want the present life with its adornment, We will reward them exactly according to their actions on earth, without any diminishment to them.
Those who have nothing in the afterlife but Fire. What they have done here below will be a failure, and what they have worked will be in vain.
Is he who bases himself on a clear proof (the Qur'an) from his Lord and recited by a witness [the archangel Gabriel] on His behalf, while before him [Muhammad] there is the book of Moses as a guide and mercy... [is better or is it that is not based on any valid evidence?]. They believe in it; but whoever of the factions does not believe in it, will have Fire as his rendezvous. So do not be in doubt about this. Yes, it is the truth from your Lord; But most people don't believe it.
And what worse unrighteous person than the one who forges a lie against Allah? These will be presented to their Lord, and the witnesses (the angels) will say, "These are the ones who have lied against their Lord." May the curse of Allah befall the unjust,
who obstruct the path of Allah (to the people), seek to make it crooked, and do not believe in the Hereafter.
They cannot reduce (Allah) to impotence on earth! There are no allies for them but Allah and their punishment will be doubled. They were unable to hear; nor could they see.
These are the ones who have caused the loss of their own souls. And their inventions (idols) have moved away from them.
It is they, infallibly, who will be the biggest losers in the afterlife.
Verily, those who believe, do good works, and humble themselves before their Lord, these are the people of Paradise, where they will dwell forever.
The two groups resemble, one the blind and the deaf, the other the one who sees and hears. Are the two comparatively equal? Don't you remember?
We have already sent Noah to his people: "I am a clear warner to you
so that you may worship only Allah. I fear for you the punishment of a painful day."
Then the leaders of his people who had disbelieved said there, "We see in you only a man like us; and we see that it is only the vile among us who follow you without thinking; and we see in you no superiority over us. Rather, we think you are liars."
He said, "O my people! What do you think of it? If I conform to a proof of my Lord, if a mercy (prophecy) that escapes your eyes has come to me from Him, shall we impose it on you when you repugnant it?
O my people, I do not ask you for riches in return. My salary belongs only to Allah. I will not reject those who have believed, they will have to meet their Lord. But I find you ignorant people.
O my people, who will help me against Allah if I reject them? Don't you remember?
And I do not tell you that I hold the treasures of Allah, I do not know the Unknowable, and I do not say that I am an angel; nor do I say to the people, whom your eyes despise, that Allah will not grant them any favor; Allah knows best what is in their souls. [If I told them], I would be among the unjust.
They said, "O Noah, you have argued with us and multiplied the arguments. Bring us, then, what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful."
He said: "Allah alone will bring it to you, if He wills, and you will not be able to escape it.
And my advice would not benefit you, in case I wanted to advise you, and Allah would lead you astray. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be brought back."
Or do they say: he invented it? Say: "If I invented it, let my crime fall upon me! And I am innocent of your criminal accusations."
And it was revealed to Noah, "Of your people there will be no believers but those who have already believed. Do not grieve over what they did.
And build the ark before Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And do not call Me out any more about the unrighteous, for they will be drowned."
And he was building the ark. And whenever the notables of his people passed by him, they laughed at him. He said, "If you mock us, well, we will mock you, as you mock [us].
And you will soon know to whom a punishment will come that will humiliate him, and on whom a lasting punishment will fall!"
Then when Our command came and the oven began to bubble [with water], We said: "Load [into the ark] a couple of every kind as well as your family - except those against whom the decree has already been pronounced - and those who believe." But those who had believed with him were few.
And he said, "Get in. May his course and anchorage be in the name of Allah. Verily my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
And she sailed, carrying them among the waves like mountains. And Noah called to his son, who was staying in a secluded place (not far from the ark), "O my son, go up with us and do not stay with the disbelievers."
He replied, "I will take refuge in a mountain that will protect me from the water." And Noah said to him, "Today there is no protector against the command of Allah. (All will perish) except the one to whom He has mercy." And the waves came between the two, and the son was then among the drowned.
And it was said, "O earth, absorb your water! And you, heaven, stop [raining]!" The water went down, the order was carried out and the ark was set up on the Judi, and it was said: "Let the wicked disappear"!
And Noah called upon his Lord and said, "O my Lord, certainly my son is of my family, and Your promise is truth. You are the most just of judges."
He said, "O Noah, he is not of your family because he has committed a disgraceful deed. Don't ask me what you don't know about. I exhort you not to be among the ignorant."
Then Noah said, "Lord, I seek Your protection from every demand of that of which I have no knowledge. And if You do not forgive me and show me mercy, I will be among the losers."
It was said, "O Noah, come with Our safety and blessings upon you and upon the communities of those who are with you. And there will be communities to which We will grant temporary enjoyment; then a painful punishment from Us will come upon them."
Here is some news of the Unknowable that We reveal to you. You didn't know them, neither you nor your people, before that. Be patient. The happy ending will be to the pious.
And (We sent) to the 'Aad, their brother Hud, who said to them: "O my people, worship Allah. You have no god but Him. You are only forgers (of lies).
O my people, I do not ask you for a reward for this. My salary belongs only to the One who created me. Are you not reasoning?
O my people, beg your Lord's forgiveness and repent to Him that He may send abundant rains upon you from heaven and add strength to your strength. And do not turn away [from Him] by becoming guilty."
They said, "O Hud, you have not come to us with a proof, and we are not willing to surrender our gods at your word, and we have no faith in you.
We will rather say that one of our gods has afflicted you with an evil." He said: "I call Allah to witness - and you also be witnesses - that verily I disavow what you associate,
outside of Him. Cunning, therefore, all against me, and give me no respite.
I place my trust in Allah, my Lord and yours. There is no living being that He does not hold by His toupee. My Lord, indeed, is on the right path.
If you turn away... now I have conveyed to you [the message] which I was instructed to convey to you. And my Lord will replace you with another people, without your harming Him in any way, for my Lord is the guardian par excellence over all things."
And when Our Order came, We saved by a mercy on Our part, Hud and those who had believed with him. And We saved them from a terrible punishment.
These are the 'Aad. They had denied the signs (teachings) of their Lord, disobeyed His messengers, and followed the command of every stubborn tyrant.
And they were chased here on earth with a curse, as well as on the Day of Resurrection. Verily, the 'Aad did not believe in their Lord. Let the 'Aad, the people of Hud, depart (perish)!
And (We sent) to the Thamud, their brother Salih who said: "O my people, worship Allah. You have no divinity besides Him. From the earth He created you, and He made you populate (and exploit) it. So beg His forgiveness, and then repent to Him. My Lord is very close and He always responds (to calls)."
They said, "O Salih, you were once a hope for us. Would you forbid us to worship what our ancestors worshipped? However, here we are in a troubling doubt about what you are inviting us towards."
He said, "O my people! What do you think, if I rely on a clear proof from my Lord and He has shown me mercy from Him, who will protect me from Allah if I disobey Him? You will only increase my loss.
O my people, this is the she-camel of Allah that He has sent you as a sign. Let her tread in the land of Allah, and do not harm her, otherwise you will be punished at hand."
They killed her. Then he said to them, "Enjoy (your goods) in your dwellings for three days (more)! This is a promise that will not be denied."
Then, when Our command came, We saved Salih and those who had believed with him, by a mercy from Us, from the ignominy of that day. Verily, it is your Lord who is the Strong, the Mighty.
And the Cry seizes the unrighteous. And here they are thunderstruck by lightning in their homes,
as if they had never prospered there. In truth, the Thamûd did not believe in their Lord. May the Thamud perish!
And Our emissaries came to Abraham with the good news, saying, "Salam." He said, "Salam," and he soon brought a roast calf.
Then, when he saw that their hands did not approach him, he was seized with suspicion of them and felt fear of them. They said, "Do not be afraid, we are sent to the people of Lot."
His wife was standing, and she laughed then; So we told him (the birth of) Isaac, and after Isaac, Jacob.
She said, "Woe to me! Am I going to give birth when I am old and my husband, who is here, an old man? This is really a strange thing!"
They said, "Are you surprised at the command of Allah? May Allah's mercy and blessings be upon you, the people of this house! He is truly worthy of praise and glorification!"
When the fear had left Abraham and the good news had reached him, behold, he argued with Us (on behalf of) the people of Lot.
Abraham was, indeed, long-suffering, very imploring and repentant.
O Abraham, renounce this; for the command of your Lord has already come, and an irrevocable punishment will come upon them."
And when Our emissaries (angels) came to Lot, he was grieved for them, and was greatly troubled by it. And he said, "This is a terrible day."
As for his people, they came to him, running. Before, they committed evil deeds. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters: they are purer to you. Fear Allah, therefore, and do not dishonor me in my hosts. Is there not a reasonable man among you?"
They said, "You know very well that we have no right to your daughters." And in truth, you know well what we want."
He said, "[Ah!] if I had strength to resist you! or if I found a solid support!"
Then [the hosts] said, "O Lot, we are truly the emissaries of your Lord. They will never be able to reach you. Go with your family at some point during the night. And let none of you look back. Except for your wife who will be affected by what will strike others. What threatens them will be fulfilled at dawn. Isn't dawn near?"
And when Our command came, We overthrew [the city] from top to bottom, and rained down on it in masses, stones of clay one after another,
bearing a mark known to your Lord. And they (these stones) are not far from the unjust.
And (We sent) to the Madyan, their brother Chuayb who said to them: "O my people, worship Allah; you have no divinity but Him. And don't decrease measurements and weight. I see you in ease, and I fear for you [if you do not believe] the punishment of a day that will envelop everything.
O my people, do not fairly make full measure and full weight, do not belittle people their values and do not sow corruption on earth.
What remains with Allah is better for you if you are believers. And I'm not a guardian for you."
They said, "O Chuayb! Does your prayer ask you to make us abandon what our ancestors worshipped, or to no longer do with our goods what we want? Are you the indulgent, the right?"
He said, "O my people, do you see if I am basing myself on a clear proof from my Lord, and if He gives me an excellent gift from Him?... I do not want to do what I forbid you to do. I want only reform, as far as I can. And my success depends only on Allah. In Him I place my trust, and it is to Him that I return in repentance.
O my people, let not your repugnance and hostility towards me lead you to incur the same punishments that befell the people of Noah, the people of Hud, or the people of Salih, and (the example of) the people of Lot is not far from you.
And beg your Lord's forgiveness and repent to Him. My Lord is truly Merciful and full of love."
They said, "O Chuayb, we do not understand much of what you are saying; and truly we consider you a weak among us. If it weren't for your clan, we would certainly have stoned you. And nothing prevents us from reaching you."
He said: "O my people, is my clan in your eyes more powerful than Allah, to whom you openly turn your back? My Lord embraces (in His knowledge) all that you do.
O my people, act as much as you will. I too act. Soon you will know on whom a punishment will fall that will dishonor him, and who of us is the impostor. And wait (for the consequence of your actions)! I too am waiting with you."
When Our command came, We saved, by mercy on Our part, Chuayb and those who had believed with him. And the terrible cry seized the unjust, and they lay in their dwellings,
as if they had never prospered there. Let the Madyan depart as the Thamûd have departed.
And We sent Moses, with Our miracles and unquestionable authority,
to Pharaoh and his notables. But they followed Pharaoh's command, although Pharaoh's command made no sense.
He will go before his people on the Day of Resurrection. He will lead them to the Aiguade du Feu. And what a detestable aiguade!
And they are pursued by a curse here on earth and on the Day of Resurrection. What a detestable gift will be given to them!
This is one of the narrations that We [Muhammad] tell you about cities: some are still standing, while others are completely razed to the ground.
We have done them no harm. But they have wronged themselves. Their gods, whom they invoked besides Allah, availed them no good, when the order (punishment) of your Lord came; they have only increased their loss.
Such is the severity of your Lord's capture when He strikes cities when they are unjust. His punishment is very painful and very harsh.
This is a sign for one who fears the punishment of the Hereafter. It is a day when people will be brought together; and it is a solemn day (attested by all).
And We delay it only for a very specific period.
On the day this happens, no soul will speak except with His (Allah's) permission. There will be the damned and the happy.
Those who are damned will be in the Fire where they have sighs and sobs.
To remain there forever as long as the heavens and the earth endure - unless your Lord decides otherwise - for your Lord does absolutely everything He wills.
And as for the blessed, they will be in Paradise, to dwell there forever as long as the heavens and the earth endure - unless your Lord decides otherwise - this is a gift that is never interrupted.
So don't be in doubt about what these worship. They worship only as their ancestors worshipped before. And We will give them all of their share, without taking anything away from it.
And We have already given Moses the Book. There were differences about him. If there had not been a prior decree from your Lord, everything would have been decided between them. And they are full of troubling doubt about him.
Most certainly, your Lord will make their full retribution to all for their works... He is a Perfectly Knowledgeable of what they do.
Abide on the right path as you are commanded, as well as those who have returned with you. And don't go overboard. For truly He is watching what you do.
And do not bend to the unjust, or the Fire will come upon you. You have no allies besides Allah. And you will not be rescued.
And perform Salat at both ends of the day and at certain hours of the night. Good works dispel bad ones. This is an exhortation for those who reflect.
And be patient. For Allah does not let the reward of good people be lost.
If only there were righteous people in the generations before you who forbid corruption on earth! (Alas) There were only a few whom We saved, while the unrighteous persisted in the (exaggerated) luxury in which they lived, and they were criminals.
And your Lord is not such as to unjustly destroy cities whose inhabitants are reformers.
And if your Lord had willed, He would have made the people one community. However, they are constantly at odds (among themselves,)
except those to whom your Lord has granted mercy. That's why He created them. And the word of your Lord is fulfilled: "Most certainly, I will fill Hell with jinn and men, all together."
And all that We tell you of the narrations of the messengers is to strengthen your heart. And from these came the truth and an exhortation and a reminder to the believers.
And say to those who do not believe, "Work as much as you can. We are also working.
And wait. We are waiting too!"
To Allah belongs the Unknowable of the heavens and the earth, and to Him belongs the whole order. Worship Him, therefore, and place your trust in Him. Your Lord is not inattentive to what you do.
Alif, Lâm, Râ. These are the verses of the Explicit Book.
We sent it down, a Qur'an in Arabic, so that you might reason.
We tell you the best narration because We reveal to you in this Qur'an, even though you were previously one of the inattentive (to these narrations).
When Joseph said to his father, "O my father, I have seen [in a dream] eleven stars, and also the sun and the moon; I saw them prostrate before me."
"O my son," he said, "do not tell your brothers your vision, for they would plot against you; the Devil is certainly an open enemy to man.
So your Lord will choose you and teach you the interpretation of dreams, and He will perfect His blessing on you and on Jacob's family, just as He perfected it before on your two ancestors, Abraham and Isaac, for your Lord is All-Knowing and Wise.
There were certainly exhortations in Joseph and his brethren to those who question,
when they said, "Joseph and his brother are more beloved by our father than we are, even though we are a very strong group. Our father is really in the wrong.
Kill Joseph or remove him to any country, so that your father's face may be turned exclusively to you, and that after that you may be good people."
One of them said, "Do not kill Joseph, but throw him if you are willing to do so, to the bottom of the well so that some caravan can pick him up."
They said, "O our father, why do you not trust us about Joseph? However, we have good intentions towards it.
Send him with us to-morrow for a walk and play. And we will watch over him."
He said, "Surely I will be sad if you take him away; and I fear that the wolf will devour him at a time when you will not pay attention to him."
They said, "If the wolf devours him when there are many of us, we will really be the losers."
And when they had taken him away, and had agreed to throw him into the invisible depths of the well, We revealed to him: "You will surely inform them of this matter without their realizing it."
And they came to their father in the evening, weeping.
They said, "O our father, we have gone on an errand and left Joseph with our belongings; and the wolf devoured him. You will not believe us, even if we tell the truth."
They brought his tunic, which was stained with fake blood. He said, "Your souls, rather, suggested something to you... [So all I have left] is a nice patience! It is Allah who must be called for help against what you say."
Now came a caravan. They sent their water seeker, who lowered his bucket. He said, "Good news! That's a boy!" And they hid it [to sell] like a commodity. Allah, however, knew very well what they were doing.
And they sold it at a low price: for a few dirhams counted. They considered him undesirable.
And the one who bought it was from Egypt. He said to his wife, "Give him generous hospitality. It may be useful to us or we may adopt it as our child." Thus we strengthened Joseph in the land and taught him the interpretation of dreams. And Allah is sovereign in His Commandment: but most people do not know.
And when he had reached maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. This is how we reward the beneficent.
