Now she [Zulikha] who had received him into her house tried to seduce him. And she closed the doors tightly and said, "Come, (I am ready for you!)" - He said, "May Allah protect me! It was my master who granted me a good asylum. Truly the unrighteous do not succeed."
And she desired it. And he would have desired it had it not been for what he saw as a clear proof of his Lord. Thus [We acted] to remove evil and turpitude. He was certainly one of Our chosen servants.
And they both ran to the door, and she tore his tunic from behind. They found [the woman's] husband at the door. She said, "What would be the punishment for anyone who wanted to harm your family, if not prison, or a painful punishment?"
[Joseph] said, "It was she who wanted to seduce me." And a witness from her family testified: "If his tunic is torn from the front, then it is she who speaks the truth, while he is among the liars.
But if his tunic is torn from behind, then it is she who lies, while he is of the truthful."
Then, when he (the husband) saw the tunic torn from behind, he said: "It is indeed your cunning of women! Your tricks are really huge!
Joseph, don't think about that any more! And you, (woman), beg forgiveness for your sin because you are guilty."
And in the city, some women said, "The wife of Al-'Azize is trying to seduce her valet! He really made her mad with love. We certainly find it in an obvious way.
When she heard their deceit, she sent them [invitations,] and prepared a collation for them; and she gave each of them a knife. Then she said, "Come out before them, (Joseph!)" - When they saw him, they admired him, cut off their hands and said, "Allah forbid! He is not a human being, he is only a noble angel!"
She said, "So that's the one you blamed me for. I tried to seduce him but he firmly defended himself. But if he does not do what I command him, he will most certainly be imprisoned and will certainly be among the humiliated."
He said, "O my Lord, prison is preferable to me than what they invite me to do. And if You do not remove their cunning from me, I will lean towards them and be among the ignorant" [sinners].
So his Lord heard him, and removed their cunning from him. It is He, truly, who is the Hearer and the All-Knowing.
Then, after they had seen the proofs (of his innocence), it seemed to them that they should imprison him for a time.
Two servants entered the prison with him. One of them said, "I saw myself [in a dream] pressing grapes..." And the other said, "And I saw myself carrying bread on my head that the birds were eating of. Teach us the interpretation (of our dreams), we see you among the beneficents."
"The food allotted to you shall not come to you," he said, "until I have informed you of his interpretation [of your food] before it comes to you. This is part of what my Lord has taught me. Certainly, I have abandoned the religion of a people who do not believe in Allah and who deny the future life."
And I followed the religion of my ancestors, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. It is not proper for us to associate anything with Allah. This is a grace from Allah upon us and upon everyone; But most people are not grateful.
O my two companions in prison! Who is better: scattered Lords or Allah, the One, the Supreme Ruler?
Apart from Him, you worship only names that you and your ancestors have invented, and for which Allah has sent down no proof. Power belongs only to Allah. He has commanded you to worship Him alone. Such is the right religion; But most people don't know.
O my two companions in prison! One of you will give his master some wine to drink; and the other will be crucified, and the birds will eat from his head. The matter on which you are consulting me has already been decided."
And he said to the one of the two from whom he thought he would be delivered, "Speak of me to your master." But the Devil caused him to forget to remind (Joseph's case) of his master. Joseph therefore remained in prison for a few years.
And the king said, "Verily, I saw (in a dream) seven fat cows eaten by seven skinny ones; and seven green ears, and as many others, dry. O council of notables, give me an explanation of my vision, if you know how to interpret the dream."
They said, "It's a heap of dreams! And we don't know how to interpret dreams!"
Now the one of the two who had been delivered, and after some time remembered, said, "I will give you the interpretation of it. Send me, then."
"O you, Joseph, the truthful one! Enlighten us about seven fat cows eaten by seven very thin ones, and seven green ears and as many others, dry, so that I may return to the people and they may know [the exact interpretation of the dream]."
Then [Joseph said], "You shall sow for seven consecutive years. Whatever you have harvested, leave it on the cob, except the little you consume.
Then will come seven years of scarcity, which will consume all that you have gathered for them, except the little that you have set aside.
Then there will come a year after that when people will be rescued [by the rain] and go to the winepress."
And the king said, "Bring him to me." Then, when the emissary came to him, [Joseph] said, "Go back to your master and ask him, 'What was the reason that caused the women to cut off their hands? My Lord knows their cunning well."
Then [the king said to them], "What made you try to seduce Joseph?" They said, "Allah forbid! We know nothing bad against him." And the wife of Al-'Azize said: "Now the truth has come out. It was I who wanted to seduce him. And it is he, truly, who is among the truthful!"
"This is so that he may know that I have not betrayed him in his absence, and that in truth Allah does not guide the cunning of traitors.
I do not exonerate myself, however, for the soul is very inclined to evil, unless my Lord, out of mercy, [preserves it from sin]. My Lord is indeed Forgiving and Most Merciful."
And the king said, "Bring it to me, and I will keep it for myself." And when he had spoken to him, he said, "You are with us this day, in a position of authority and trust."
And [Joseph] said, "Assign me the deposits of the land: I am a good guardian and a connoisseur."
Thus we established (the authority of) Joseph in this territory and he settled there where he wanted. We touch with Our mercy whom We will, and do not cause good men to lose the merit [of their works].
And the reward of the Hereafter is better for those who have believed and practiced godliness.
And Joseph's brothers came and came to him. He recognized them, but they did not.
And when he had given them their provisions, he said, "Bring me a brother whom you have by your father. Don't you see that I give my full measure and that I am the best of hosts?
And if you do not bring it to me, then there will be no provision for you in my house; and you shall not approach me again."
They said, "We will try to persuade his father. Certainly, we will."
And he said to his servants, "Put their goods back in their sacks: perhaps they will recognize them when they return to their families and perhaps they will return."
And when they returned to their father, they said, "O our father, we will be denied [in the future] food [in grain]. Send our brother with us, so that we may obtain provisions. We will keep a close eye on him."
He said, "Shall I entrust him to you as I entrusted his brother to you before? But Allah is the best guardian, and He is the Most Merciful of the Merciful."
And when they opened their luggage, they found that their goods had been returned to them. They said, "O our father. What do we want? Now our goods have been returned to us. And in this way we will provide for our family, we will ensure the safety of our brother and we will add to ourselves the load of a camel and it is an easy burden."
He said: "I will never send him with you, until you bring me a formal commitment in the name of Allah that you will bring it back to me unless you are surrounded." When they had given him the commitment, he said: "Allah is the guarantor of what we say."
And he said, "O my sons, do not enter by one door, but enter by separate doors. However, I cannot be of any use to you against Allah's designs. The decision belongs only to Allah, and in Him I place my trust. And let those who place their trust in Him place it."
Having entered as their father had commanded them, [this] availed them nothing against (the decrees of) Allah. It was only a precaution that Jacob had judged [to recommend to them]. He had full knowledge of what We had taught him. But most people don't know.
And when they had come to Joseph, [he] held his brother to him, saying, "I am your brother. So don't be upset about what they did."
Then, when he had provided them with their provisions, he put the cup in his brother's sack. Then a crier announced: "Caravanners! you are thieves."
They turned around and said, "What have you lost?"
They answered, "We are looking for the great cup of the king. The load of a camel to whoever brings it and I am the guarantor of it."
"By Allah," they said, "you know that we have not come to sow corruption in the land and that we are not thieves."
- So what will be the punishment if you are liars? (they said).
They said: "The punishment for the one whose baggage is found is: [let him] be delivered himself [as a slave to the victim of the robbery]. This is how we punish the wrongdoers."
[Joseph] began with the sacks of others before his brother's; then he took her out of his brother's bag. Thus We suggested this artifice to Joseph. For he could not seize his brother, according to the king's justice, unless Allah had willed it. We raise in rank whomever We will. And above every man who possesses knowledge there is a scholar [more learned than he].
They said, "If he has committed theft, a brother of his before has stolen also." But Joseph kept his thought secret, and did not reveal it to them. He says [to himself]: "Your position is much worse! And Allah knows best what you describe."
- They said. "O Al-'Azize, he has a very old father; take hold of one of us, then, in his place." We see that you are truly among the beneficent people."
He said: "May Allah forbid that we should take anyone other than the one with whom we have found our property. We would then be really unfair."
Then, when they had lost all hope [of bringing back Benyamin], they consulted in secret. Their eldest son said, "Do you not know that your father made a formal commitment from you in the name of Allah, and that you have already broken it in the past about Joseph? I will not leave the land until my father permits me to do so, or until Allah judges in my favor, and He is the best of judges.
Go back to your father and say, "O our father, your son has stolen. And we only attest to what we know. And we were in no way aware of the unknown.
And questions the city where we were, as well as the caravan in which we arrived. We are really telling the truth."
Then [Jacob] said, "Your souls rather have inspired you to do something... Oh! nice patience. It may be that Allah will bring them both back to me. For He is the All-Knowing, the Wise."
And he turned away from them and said, "How great is my sorrow for Joseph!" And his eyes turned white with sorrow. And he was overwhelmed.
They said: "By Allah! You shall not cease to evoke Joseph until you are exhausted or are among the dead."
He said: "I complain only to Allah about my heartbreak and sorrow. And I know from Allah what you do not know.
O my sons! Go and inquire about Joseph and his brother. And do not despair of Allah's mercy. It is only the disbelievers who despair of Allah's mercy."
And when they came to [Joseph,] they said, "O al-'Azize, famine has come upon us and our family; and we come with a commodity of little value. Give us a full measure, and give us charity. Verily, Allah rewards the charitable."
- He said, "Do you know what you did with Joseph and his brother when you were ignorant? [unfair]".
- They said, "Are you... Verily, you are Joseph!" - He said, "I am Joseph, and this is my brother. Verily, Allah favored us. Whoever fears and waits... And most certainly, Allah does not cause the reward of the doers to be lost."
They said: "By Allah! Truly Allah preferred you to us and we were at fault."
- He says, "No recrimination against you today! May Allah forgive you. He is the most merciful of the merciful.
Take away this this tunic of my tunic and put it on my father's face, and he will immediately receive his sight. And bring me your whole family."
- And as soon as the caravan crosses the border [of Canaan], their father says: "I can see the smell of Joseph, even if you say that I ramble."
They said to him, "By Allah, you are in your old error."
Then when the bearer of good news arrived, he put it [the tunic] on Jacob's face. He immediately received his sight and said, "Have I not told you that I know by Allah what you do not know?"
- They said, "O our father, implore for us the forgiveness of our sins. We were really at fault."
- He said, "I will implore my Lord's forgiveness for you. For He is the Forgiving, the Most Merciful."
When they came to Joseph, he welcomed his father and mother and said to them, "Enter Egypt in safety, Allah willing."
And he raised his parents to the throne, and they all fell down before him, prostrate. And he said, "O my father, this is the interpretation of my dream of old. Allah has indeed achieved this... And He certainly did me good when He brought me out of prison and brought you out of the country, [out of the desert], after the Devil stirred up discord between my brothers and me. My Lord is full of meekness for what He wills. And He is the All-Knowing, the Wise.
O my Lord, You have given me power and taught me the interpretation of dreams. [It's you the] Creator of the heavens and the earth, You are my patron, here below and in the Hereafter. Cause me to die in perfect submission and make me join the virtuous.
These are unknown stories that We reveal to you. And you were not with them when they agreed to plot.
And most people are not believers despite your ardent desire.
And you don't ask them for any salary for it. This is only a reminder to the universe.
And in heaven and on earth, how many signs people pass by, turning away from them!
And most of them believe in Allah only by giving Him partners.
Are they sure that Allah's punishment will not come to cover them or that the Hour will not come to them suddenly, without them realizing it?
Say: "This is my way, I call the people to the [religion] of Allah, me and those who follow me, based on clear evidence. Glory be to Allah! And I am not one of the associates.
We have sent before you only men from the cities, to whom We have made revelations. Didn't [these people] walk the earth and consider what was the end of those who lived before them? The abode of the Hereafter is certainly better for those who fear [Allah]. Will you not then reason?
When the messengers almost lost hope (and their followers) thought they were being duped, behold, Our help came to them. And those whom We willed were saved. But Our rigour cannot be turned away from criminals.
In their stories there is certainly a lesson for people endowed with intelligence. This is not a fabricated story. Rather, it is the confirmation of what already existed before him, a detailed exposition of all things, a guide and a mercy for people who believe.
Alif, Lâm, Mîm, Râ. These are the verses of the Book; and that which has been revealed to you by your Lord is the truth; But most people don't believe.
Allah is the One who has exalted the heavens without visible pillars. He established Himself [istawâ] on the Throne and subdued the sun and the moon, each pursuing its course towards a fixed term. He regulates the Order [of everything] and sets forth in detail the signs so that you may have the certainty of the encounter with your Lord.
And it is He who has spread out the earth and placed mountains and rivers in it. And of each species of fruit He establishes two elements of couple. He makes the night cover the day. These are proofs for people who think.
And on the earth there are plots of land next to each other, gardens [planted] with vines, and cereals and palms, in tufts or spaced out, watered with the same water, yet We make one superior to the other in taste. These are proofs for people who reason.
And if you are to be surprised, nothing is more astonishing than their words: "When we are dust, will we really return to a new creation?" These are those who do not believe in their Lord. And they are the ones who will have yokes around their necks. And they are the people of the Fire, where they will dwell forever.
And they ask you to hasten [the coming] of misfortune rather than that of happiness. Certainly, exemplary punishments have occurred before them. Your Lord is the Holder of forgiveness for people, despite their misdeeds. And your Lord is certainly harsh in punishment.
And those who disbelieve say: "Why was not a miracle sent down upon this (Muhammad) from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and to each people a guide.
Allah knows what each female wears, and how much the gestation period in the womb is shortened or prolonged. And all things have their measure with Him.
The Knower of what is hidden and what is apparent, the Great, the Sublime.
Equal to him are he who keeps his word secret, and he who divulges it, he who hides himself at night as well as he who shows himself in broad daylight.
He has angels in front of him and behind him who take turns and watch over him by the command of Allah. Verily, Allah does not change the state of a people, as long as the people do not change what is in themselves. And when Allah wants to do harm to a people, no one can reject him, for they have no protector besides Him.
It is he who makes you see the lightning [that inspires you] fear and hope; and He creates the heavy clouds.
The thunder glorifies Him by His praise, and also the Angels, under the effect of His fear. And He hurls the thunderbolts with which He strikes whomever He wills. Now they argue about Allah when He is formidable in His might.
To Him is the call of Truth! Those whom they invoke apart from Him do not answer them in any way; like the one who stretches out both hands towards the water to bring it to his mouth, but never succeeds in reaching it. The supplication of the disbelievers is vanity.
And to Allah all those who are in the heavens and on the earth, and their shadows, prostrate themselves, willy-nilly, at the beginning and at the end of the day.
Say: "Who is the Lord of heaven and earth?" Say: "Allah." Say: "And will you take from Him masters who have neither good nor evil for themselves?" Say: "Are they equal, the blind and the seeing? Or are they equal, darkness and light? Or do they give to Allah partners who create as His creation to the point that the two creations are merged with them? Say: "Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Supreme Ruler."
He sent down water from heaven, to which valleys serve as beds, according to their size. The overflowing flood has carried a floating foam; and similar to this is [the] foam from that which is brought to fusion, in the fire to [make] jewels and utensils. Thus Allah represents in a parable the Truth and the Falsehood: the foam [of the torrent and molten metal] goes away to the discard, while [the water and objects] useful to men remain on the earth. Thus Allah offers parables.
The best [end] is for those who respond to their Lord's [call]. And as for those who do not answer Him, if they had all that is on the earth, and as much as that, they would offer it as a ransom. These will have the detestable return on account and Hell will be their refuge. What a detestable daybed!
Is he who knows that what is revealed to you from your Lord the truth, like a blind man? Only people with intelligence think well,
those who fulfill their commitment to Allah and do not violate the covenant,
who unite what Allah has commanded to unite, fear their Lord and fear an unfortunate reckoning,
and who endure in seeking the pleasure of Allah, perform Salah and spend (in good), in secret and in public, what We have allotted to them, and repel evil with good. To these, the final good abode,
the gardens of Eden, which they will enter, as well as all those of their ascendants, spouses and descendants, who have been good believers. From each door, the Angels will enter to them:
- "Peace be upon you, for what you have endured!" - How good is your final home!"
[But] those who violate their covenant with Allah after committing Him, and break what Allah has commanded to unite and commit disorder on earth, will have a curse and an evil abode.
Allah greatly extends His gifts or restricts [them] to whomever He wills. They rejoice in life on earth, but life here below will appear only as an ephemeral enjoyment in comparison with the hereafter.
Those who have disbelieved say: "Why was not a miracle sent down on him (Muhammad) from his Lord?" Say: "Verily, Allah leads astray whomever He wills; and He guides to Himself the one who repents,
those who believed, and whose hearts are tranquilized at the remembrance of Allah." Certainly, it is by the evocation of Allah that hearts are at ease.
Those who believe and do good deeds, will have the greatest good and also the best return.
Thus We send you to a community - which other communities have preceded - so that you may recite to them what We reveal to you, even though they do not believe in the Most Merciful. Say: "He is my Lord. No other god but Him. In Him I place my trust. And to Him I repent."
If there were a Qur'an to set the mountains in motion, to split the earth or to make the dead speak (it would be this one). Rather, it is to Allah the entire commandment. Do not the believers know that, if Allah willed, He would have led all men to the right path? However, those who do not believe will not fail to be struck by a cataclysm as a reward for what they do, or that a cataclysm will befall their homes until the promise of Allah comes. For Allah does not break His promise.
Of course, the messengers were laughed at before you. So, I gave a respite to the disbelievers. Then I grabbed them. And what was My chastisement!
Is He who observes what each soul acquires [like the associates?...] And yet they give partners to Allah. Say [to them:] "Name them. Or are you trying to teach Him what He doesn't know on earth? Or were you simply seduced by fake names?" In fact, the disbelievers have been embellished with their stratagem and prevented from taking the right path. And whoever Allah allows to go astray, has no one left to guide him.
A chastisement will come upon them in this life. The punishment of the Hereafter, however, will be more crushing and they will have no protector against Allah.
This is the paradise that has been promised to the righteous: under which the streams flow; its fruits are perpetual, as is its shade. This is the end of those who practice godliness, while the end of the disbelievers will be the Fire.
And those to whom We have already given the Book rejoice that they have sent down to you. While some factions reject some of them. Say: "I have only been commanded to worship Allah and not to associate anything with Him. It is to Him that I call [the people], and it is to Him that my return will be."
Thus We have sent it down as a law in Arabic. And if you follow their passions after what you have received as knowledge, there will be no ally or protector for you against Allah.
And We have sent messengers before you, and have given them wives and descendants. And it is not for a Messenger to bring a miracle, except with Allah's permission. Each maturity has its prescribed term.
Allah erases or confirms what He wills and the primordial Scripture is with Him.
Whether We make you see any part of what We threaten them with, or whether We put you to death (before that), your duty is only the communication of the message, and the settling of accounts will be Ours.
Do they not see that We are striking the earth and reducing it on all sides? It is Allah who judges and no one can oppose His judgment, and He is quick to settle accounts.
Verily, those before them plotted (against their Messenger); the whole scheme belongs to Allah. He knows what each soul acquires. And the disbelievers will soon know to whom the final abode belongs.
And those who do not believe say, "You are not a Messenger." Say: "Allah is sufficient as a witness between you and me, and those who have knowledge of the Book (are also witnesses)."
Alif, Lâm, Râ. (Behold) a book which We have sent down upon you, so that - by the permission of their Lord - you may bring people out of darkness into the light, in the way of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy.
Allah, to whom belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers, for a severe punishment [which they will suffer].
Those who prefer the life of this world to the Hereafter, obstruct the path of Allah and seek to make it crooked, are far from being led astray.
And We have not sent a Messenger except with the language of his people, in order to enlighten them. Allah leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Almighty, the Wise.
We sent Moses with Our miracles, saying, "Bring your people out of darkness into the light, and remind them of the days of Allah." [Its benefits]. In all this there are signs for every man full of endurance and gratitude.
(Remember) when Moses said to his people: "Remember the blessing of Allah upon you when He saved you from Pharaoh's people who inflicted the worst punishment on you. They slaughtered your sons and left your daughters alive. This was a severe trial on the part of your Lord,"
And when your Lord proclaimed, "If you are grateful, I will certainly increase [My blessings] for you. But if you are ungrateful, My punishment will be terrible."
And Moses said, "If you and all those on earth are ungrateful, [know] that Allah is sufficient in Himself and that He is worthy of praise.
Has not the narration come down to you of those before you, of the people of Noah, of the 'Aad, of the Thamud and of those who lived after them, and whom only Allah knows? Their messengers came to them with proofs, but they said, bringing their hands to their mouths, "We do not believe [the message] with which you were sent, and we are in a really troubling doubt about what you are calling us to."
Their messengers said: "Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, who calls you to forgive you some of your sins and to give you a delay until a fixed time?" [The disbelievers] replied, "You are only men like us. You want to prevent us from what our ancestors worshipped. So bring us clear proof."
Their messengers said to them, "Surely we are only humans like you. But Allah favors whomever He wills among His servants. It is for us to give you any proof only by the permission of Allah. And it is in Allah that the believers must place their trust.
And what would we have if we did not put our trust in Allah, when He has guided us in the paths [that we should follow]? We will surely endure the persecution you inflict on us. And those who trust in Allah entrust themselves entirely to Him."
And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will certainly expel you from our territory, unless you reinstate our religion." Then their Lord revealed to them, "We will certainly destroy the unrighteous,
and settle you in the land after them. This is for him who fears My presence and fears My threat."
And they asked [Allah] for victory. And every insolent tyrant was disappointed.
Hell is his destination and he will be watered with purulent water
which he will try to swallow in small gulps. But he can barely swallow it. Death will come to him from all sides, but he will not die; and he will have a terrible punishment.
The works of those who have disbelieved in their Lord are like ashes violently struck by the wind on a stormy day. They will not benefit from what they have acquired. This is the profound bewilderment.
Do you not see that Allah created the heavens and the earth for a just reason? If He willed, He would make you disappear and bring in new creatures,
and this is not difficult for Allah.
And all of them will appear before Allah. Then the weak will say to those who were puffed up with pride: "We were indeed your followers. Can you be of any use to us against the punishment of Allah?" - Then others will say: "If Allah had guided us, we would certainly have guided you. It is indifferent for us to complain or to endure; we have no escape."
And when all is accomplished, the Devil will say: "Verily, Allah had promised you truth; while I made you a promise that I did not keep. I had no authority over you except that I called you, and you answered me. Do not reproach me, then; but do it to yourselves. I am of no help to you, and you are of no help to me. I deny you that you once associated me [with Allah]." Verily, a painful punishment awaits the unrighteous [the associates].
And those who believe and do good works shall be brought into the gardens under which the streams flow, to dwell there forever, by the permission of their Lord. And there, their greeting will be: "Salam" (Peace).
Have you not seen how Allah offers a parable of a good word like a beautiful tree whose root is firm and its branches soaring into the sky?
He gives his fruits at all times, by the grace of his Lord. Allah offers parables for people to exhort each other.
And an evil word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the face of the earth and which has no stability.
Allah strengthens the believers with a firm word, both in this life and in the Hereafter. While He leads the unrighteous astray. And Allah does what He wills.
Do you not see those who trade the blessings of Allah for ingratitude and establish their people in the abode of perdition
... Hell, where they will burn? And what a bad lodging!
And they have given Allah equals in order to lead (people) astray from His path. - Say: "Enjoy [this life] for your destination will be fire."
Tell My servants who have believed, let them perform Salat and spend [in good] in secret and in public what We have allotted to them, before the day comes when there is no redemption or friendship.
Allah is the One who created the heavens and the earth and from heaven sent down water; thanks to which He has produced fruit to nourish you. He has placed in your service the ships which, by His command, sail on the sea. And He has made the rivers subject to your service.
And for you, He has subjected the sun and the moon to a perpetual revolution. And He has subdued you night and day.
He has granted you all that you have asked Him. And if you were to count the blessings of Allah, you would not be able to count them. The man is really very unjust, very ungrateful.
And (remember) when Abraham said, "O my Lord, make this city a safe place, and preserve me and my children from the worship of idols.
O my Lord, they (idols) have led many people astray. Whoever follows me is one of mine. As for the one who disobeys me... it is You, the Forgiving, the Most Merciful!
O our Lord, I have settled part of my descendants in a valley without agriculture, near Your sacred house [the Ka'ba], O our Lord, so that they may perform Salah. Therefore let the hearts of some of the people lean towards them. And feed them with fruit. Maybe they'll be grateful?
O our Lord, You truly know what we hide and what we divulge: - and nothing escapes Allah, neither on earth nor in heaven! -
Praise be to Allah, who in spite of my old age, has given me Ishmael and Isaac. Verily, my Lord hears prayers well.
O my Lord! Grant that I may diligently perform Salat as well as a part of my descendants; hear my prayer, O our Lord!
O our Lord! forgive me, my father and mother and the believers on the day of reckoning."
And do not think that Allah is inattentive to what the wrongdoers. They will give them a delay until the day when their eyes freeze.
They will run [supplicate], raising their heads, haggard eyes and empty hearts.
And warn the people of the day when the punishment will come upon them, and those who have been unjust will say, "O our Lord, grant us a short delay, and we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." - Didn't you swear before that you should never disappear?
And you have dwelt in the dwellings of those who have wronged themselves. It has become clear to you how We have dealt with them and We have given you the examples.
They certainly plotted. However, their plot is written with Allah even if their plot was powerful enough to make the mountains disappear...
Do not think that Allah is breaking His promise to His Messengers. Verily, Allah is Almighty and Possessor of the power to punish,
on the Day when the earth will be replaced by another, as well as the heavens, and (men) will appear before Allah, the One, the Supreme Ruler.
And on that day you will see the guilty, chained to each other,
their tunics will be of tar and fire will cover their faces.
(All this) so that Allah may reward each soul for what it has acquired. Verily, Allah is prompt in His reckoning.
This is a message (the Qur'an) for the people to be warned, to know that He is only one God, and for the intelligent to exhort each other.
Alif, Lâm, Râ. Here are the verses of the Book and of an explicit Reading.
[On the Day of Judgment] the disbelievers would like to have been Muslims.
Let them eat, enjoy (for a time), and be distracted by hope; for soon they will know!
Now We do not destroy any city unless it has had a known scripture.
No community anticipates its end, nor delays it.
And they (the Meccans) say: "O you on whom the Qur'an has been sent down, you are certainly mad!
Why did you not come to us with the angels, if you are of the truthful?"
We send down the angels only with the truth; and then they will not be given [these ungodly men] any respite.
Verily, it is We who sent down the Qur'an, and We are the custodians of it.
And we have sent [Messengers] before you among the peoples of the ancients.
And not a Messenger has come to them without their mocking it.
This is how We make (disbelief) penetrate into the hearts of the guilty.
They will not believe in him [the Messenger or the Qur'an] even though the traditional fate of the ancients has been fulfilled.
And even if We were to open a gate of heaven for them, and they could ascend to it,
they would say, "Truly our eyes are veiled. But rather, we are bewitched people."
Verily, We have placed constellations in the sky, and We have beautified it for those who look.
And We have protected him from every banished devil.
Unless one of them surreptitiously manages to listen, a bright flame then pursues him.
And as for the earth, We have spread it out and placed mountains on it, and have caused everything to grow in harmony proportion.
And We have placed in it food for you, and (placed also for you) beings that you do not feed.
And there is nothing of which We do not have the reserves, and We send it down only to a certain extent.
And We send forth the fertilizing winds; and then We send down from heaven water which We drink for you and which you are not able to preserve.
And it is We who give life and give death, and it is We who are the heir [of all].
And We certainly know those among you who have gone forward, and We know those who are still delaying.
Verily, it is your Lord who will gather them. For He is the Wise, the All-Knowing.
We created man from a crunchy clay, extracted from a malleable mud.
And as for the jinn, We had previously created him from a fire of fiery heat.
And when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a man of crunching clay, extracted from malleable mud,
and as soon as I have harmoniously formed him and breathed into him My breath of life, then fall down prostrate before him."
Then the angels all prostrated themselves together,
except Iblis, who refused to be with the prostrate.
Then [Allah] said: "O Iblis, why are you not among the prostrate?"
He said, "I cannot bow down to a man whom You have created of crunching clay out of malleable mud."
- And [Allah] said: "Come out of this [Paradise], for you are banished!
And curse upon you, until the Day of Retribution!"
- He said, "O my Lord, give me a delay until the day when they (the people) are risen."
[Allah] said: "You are one of those to whom this delay is granted,
until the day of the known moment" [of Allah].
- He said, "O my Lord, because You have misled me, then I will beautify their life on earth and lead them all astray,
except, among them, Your chosen servants."
- "[Allah] says: This is a straight path [that leads] to Me.
Over My servants you shall have no authority, except over the one who follows you among the misguided.
And Hell will surely be the meeting place for all of them.
It has seven gates; and each door has its own determined share."
Certainly, the pious will be in gardens with springs.
"Enter in peace and security."
And We will have torn out all grudges from their breasts, and they will feel themselves brothers, facing one another on beds.
No fatigue will touch them. And they will not be taken out.
Inform My servants that I am the Forgiving, the Most Merciful.
and that My chastisement is indeed the painful chastisement.
And inform them about Abraham's guests
When they came to his house and said, "Salam," he said, "We are afraid of you."
They said, "Do not be afraid! We bring you good news, [the birth] of a boy full of knowledge."
He said, "Do you tell me [this news] when old age has touched me? What do you tell me?"
- They said, "We are telling you the truth. So do not be among those who despair."
- He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, if not the erring?"
And he said to them: "What do you want, O messengers of Allah?"
- They said, "Verily, we are sent to sinful people,
with the exception of Lot's family, whom we will all save
except his wife. We (Allah) had determined that she would be among the exterminated.
Then when the envoys came to the family of Lot
he says, "You are strangers to me."
- They said, "Rather, we have come to you bringing (the punishment) about which they doubted.
And we come to you with the truth. And we are truthful.
Go with your family by night and follow their backs; and let none of you turn back. And go where you are commanded."
And We gave him this order, that in the morning these people shall be annihilated to the last.
And the inhabitants of the city (Sodom) came [to him] in joy.
- He said, "These are my guests, so do not dishonor me.
And fear Allah. And do not cover me with ignominy."
They said, "Didn't we forbid you to [receive] people?"
He said, "Here are my daughters, if you want to do something!"
By your life! they were confused in their delirium.
Then, at sunrise, the Cry (the catastrophe) seizes them.
And We overthrew [the city] from top to bottom, and rained upon them stones of hard clay.
This is really proof, for those who know how to observe!
It [this city] was on a path known to all.
This is truly an exhortation for believers!
And the people of al-Aika were [also] unrighteous.
So we took revenge on them. And these two [cities], really, are on a very obvious road [that you know].
Certainly, the people of al-Hijr called the messengers liars.
We showed them Our miracles, but they turned away from them.
And they carved houses in the mountains, living in safety.
Then, in the morning, the Scream seized them.
What they had acquired therefore did not profit them.
And We created the heavens and the earth, and what is between them, only for a just reason. And the Hour [without a doubt] will come! Forgive [them] therefore with a beautiful forgiveness.
Your Lord is truly the great Creator, the All-Knowing.
We have indeed given you "the seven verses that are repeated", as well as the sublime Qur'an.
Above all, do not look with envy at the things that We have given temporary enjoyment to some of them, do not grieve over them, and lower your wing for the believers.
And say, "I am the evident warner" (of a punishment),
As We have sent down [the punishment] on those who have sworn (among themselves),
those who have made the Qur'an into various fractions, (to create doubts).
By your Lord! We will question them all
on what they were doing.
Therefore make clear what you have been commanded to do, and turn away from the associates.
We have indeed defended you against the scoffers.
Those who associate Allah with another deity. But they will soon know.
And We know that your breast is clenched because of what they say.
Glorify your Lord therefore by His praise and be of those who bow down;
and worship your Lord until certainty comes to you.
Allah's command is coming. So don't hasten it. Glory be to Him! He is above what is associated with Him.
He sends down the Angels by His command, with the revelation about whom He wills among His servants: "Warn that there is no god but Me. Fear Me, then."
He created the heavens and the earth with good reason. It transcends what is associated with [Him].
He created man from a drop of semen; and now the man becomes an open disputant.
And the cattle He created for you; you get warm [clothes] from it as well as other benefits. And you eat it too.
They look beautiful when you bring them back in the evening, and also in the morning when you release them for grazing.
And they carry your burdens to a land that you would hardly reach. Truly, your Lord is Compassionate and Merciful.
And horses, mules, and donkeys, for you to ride, and for pageantry. And He creates what you don't know.
It is up to Allah to show the right path, for there are some who detach themselves from it. Now, if He willed, He'd guide you all.
It is He who has sent down water from heaven to drink you and to feed your flocks.
From it He causes crops to grow for you, olive trees, palm trees, vineyards and also all kinds of fruit. This is a proof for people who think.
For your sake He has subdued night and day; the sun and the moon. And to His command are the stars. These are proofs for people who reason.
What He has created for you on earth has various colors. This is a proof for people who remember.
And it is He who has subdued the sea so that you may eat fresh flesh from it, and take out of it ornaments that you wear. And you see the ships cleaving the sea with noise, so that you go in search of His grace and so that you can be thankful.
And He has set up motionless mountains in the earth so that it will not shake and take you with it, and rivers and paths, that you may be guided,
as well as landmarks. And by means of the stars [people] guide themselves.
Is he who creates like he who creates nothing? Don't you remember?
And if you count the blessings of Allah, you will not be able to count them. For Allah is Forgiving, and Merciful.
And Allah knows what you hide and what you divulge.
And those whom they invoke besides Allah create nothing, and they themselves are created.
They are dead, not alive, and they do not know when they will be resurrected.
Your God is one God. Those who do not believe in the Hereafter, their hearts deny (the Oneness of Allah) and they are filled with pride.
There is no doubt that Allah knows what they hide and what they divulge. And assuredly He does not like the proud.
And when they are asked, "What has your Lord sent down?" They say, "Ancient legends!"
Let them, therefore, on the Day of Resurrection, bear all the burdens of their own works, as well as a part of the burdens of those whom they unknowingly lead astray; How bad is [the burden] they carry!
Those who lived before them, of course, plotted, but Allah attacked the very foundations of their building. The roof collapsed above them, and the punishment surprised them from where they had not sensed it.
Then on the Day of Resurrection, He will cover them with disgrace, and [them] will say, "Where are My associates for whom you were fighting?" - Those who have knowledge will say, "Shame and misfortune are falling on the disbelievers today."
Those whose lives are taken away by the angels, while they are unjust to themselves, will submit in humiliation, (and say): "We did no wrong!" - "But, in fact, Allah knows well what you were doing".
Enter therefore through the gates of Hell to dwell there forever. How bad is the dwelling of the proud!
And those who were pious will be asked, "What has your Lord sent down?" They will say, "A good." Those who do good works will have good here on earth; but the abode of the hereafter is certainly better. How pleasant will be the dwelling of the righteous!
The gardens of the (eternal) abode, where they will enter and under which the streams flow. They will have what they want there; this is how Allah rewards the righteous.
Those whose souls are taken back by the angels – even though they are good – [the angels say to them], "Peace be upon you! Enter Heaven for what you did."
Do they wait for the angels to come to them, or for the command of your Lord to come? This is how people acted before them. Allah has not wronged them; but they were doing harm to themselves.
The misdeeds they committed will reach them, and what they mocked will surround them on all sides.
And the associates said: "If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything besides Him, neither we nor our ancestors; and we would not have forbidden anything that He had not forbidden Himself." This is how people acted before them. Is it not the responsibility of the messengers to convey the message clearly?
We have sent a Messenger to every Messenger, saying: "Worship Allah and depart from the Tagut." So Allah guided some of them, but there were some who were destined to go astray. Go through the earth, then, and see what was the end of those who called [Our Messengers] liars.
Even if you longed for them to be guided... [Know] that Allah does not guide those who go astray. And they won't have rescuers.
And they swear by Allah by pronouncing their most solemn oaths: "Allah will not raise up the one who dies." Quite the contrary! This is a true promise [from Him], but most people don't know it.
(He will raise them up) so that He may make clear to them what they differed from, and so that those who disbelieved would know that they were liars.
When We want something, Our only word is, "Be." And, it is.
And those who, for the sake of Allah, have emigrated after suffering injustices, We will put them in a pleasant position in this world's life. And the wages of the last life would be even greater if they knew.
They who have endured and placed their trust in their Lord.
We have sent before you only men to whom We have made revelations. So ask the callback people if you don't know.
(We sent them) with clear proofs and holy books. And to you, We sent down the Qur'an, so that you may make clear to the people what has been sent down for them, and so that they may reflect.
Are those who were plotting misdeeds safe from Allah swallowing them up in the ground or from coming to them the punishment from which they did not expect?
Or let Him seize them in the middle of their activity and they cannot escape (Allah's punishment).
Or that He seizes them in full terror? But truly, your Lord is Compassionate and Merciful.
Have they not seen that the shadows of all things that Allah has created lengthen to the right and to the left, prostrating themselves before Allah in all humility?
And it is before Allah that every living creature in the heavens and on the earth bows down; as well as the angels who are not puffed up with pride.
They fear their Lord, above them, and do what they are commanded.
Allah says: "Do not take two gods. He is only one God. Therefore, fear only Me."
To Him belongs what is in heaven and on earth; it is to Him that perpetual obedience is due. Would you then fear anyone other than Allah?
And whatever you have as a blessing comes from Allah. Then when misfortune befalls you, it is Him whom you implore aloud.
And when He has dispelled your misfortune, behold, some of you begin to give partners to their Lord,
thus disregarding what We have given them. Enjoy, then, [for a time!] Soon you'll know!
And they assign a portion [of the goods] which We have allotted to them to [idols] which they do not know. By Allah! You will certainly be questioned about what you were inventing.
And they assign daughters to Allah. Glory and purity be to Him! And to themselves, however, (they assign) what they desire (sons).
And when one of them is told of a girl, his face darkens and a deep rage [invades him].
He hides himself from people, because of the misfortune that has been announced to him. Should he keep it despite the shame or will he bury it in the ground? How bad is their judgment!
It is to those who do not believe in the Hereafter that the wrong adjective (which they have attributed to Allah) belongs. Whereas to Allah [Alone] is the supreme adjective. And He is the Almighty, the Wise.
If Allah were to go after people for their misdeeds, He would not leave any living beings on this earth. But He postpones them until a fixed time. Then, when their term comes, they can neither delay it by an hour nor bring it forward.
And they assign to Allah what they hate [for themselves]. And their tongues speak a lie when they say that the greatest reward will be reserved for them. It is the Fire, no doubt, that will be reserved for them, and they will be sent to it first.
By Allah! We have indeed sent (messengers) to communities before you. But the Devil embellished what they were doing. He is the one who is their ally today [in this world]. And they will have a painful punishment [in the Hereafter].
And We have sent down the Book upon you only so that you may clearly show them the reason for their dissension, as well as a guide and a mercy for believing people.
Allah sent down water from heaven with which He revives the earth after his death. This is really proof for people who hear.
Verily, there is a teaching for you in the cattle: We drink you with what is in their bellies, - [a product] extracted from the [mixture] of [intestinal] excrement and blood - pure milk, delicious for drinkers.
From the fruits of the palm trees and vines, you get an intoxicating drink and an excellent food. This is really a sign for people who reason.
[And this] is what your Lord revealed to the bees: "Take dwellings in the mountains, and in the trees, and in the trellises that [men] make.
Then eat of every kind of fruit, and follow the paths of your Lord, which have been made easy for you. From their bellies comes a liquor, of various colors, in which there is a healing for people. This is really proof for people who think.
Allah created you! Then He will put you to death. One of you will be led back to the vilest age, so that after he has known, he comes to know nothing. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.
Allah has favored some of you over others in [the distribution] of His gifts. Those who have been favored are in no way disposed to give their share to those whom they possess by right [slaves] to the point that they become equal partners in them. Will they deny the blessings of Allah?
Allah has made you wives from yourselves, and from your wives He has given you children and grandchildren. And He has attributed good things to you. Do they believe in falsehood, and deny the blessing of Allah?
And they worship besides Allah that which cannot provide them with any food from the heavens and the earth, and is capable of nothing.
So do not attribute to Allah like them. For Allah knows, but you do not know.
Allah offers in a parable a slave belonging to [his master], devoid of all power, and a man to whom We have granted a good allocation from Us, which he spends in secret and in public. Are [these two men] equal? Praise be to Allah! But most of them don't know.
And Allah proposes in a parable two men: one of them is dumb, devoid of all power and totally dependent on his master; Wherever the latter sends him, he brings nothing good; Would he be the equal of him who ordains justice and is on the right path?
To Allah belongs the unknowable of the heavens and the earth. And the order of the Hour will be only as a wink or even briefer! For Allah is indeed Omnipotent.
And Allah has brought you out of your mothers' wombs, destitute of all knowledge, and has given you hearing, eyes, and hearts, so that you; Be grateful.
Have they not seen the birds subject in the atmosphere of the sky without anything holding them back except Allah? There is really evidence there for people who believe.
And Allah has made your houses a dwelling, just as He has provided you with houses made of animal skins that you find light, on the day you move and the day you camp. Of their wool, their hair and their hair (He has procured for you) effects and articles which you enjoy for a certain time.
And from what He has created, Allah has provided you with shadows. And He has provided you with shelter in the mountains. And He has provided you with clothing that protects you from the heat, as well as clothing [breastplates, armor] that protects you from your own violence. This is how Allah completes His blessing on you, perhaps you submit.
If they turn away... it is only your responsibility to communicate clearly.
They acknowledge the blessing of Allah; then they deny it. And most of them are ungrateful.
(And remember) on the Day when from every community We raise up a witness, the infidels will not be allowed (to apologize), nor will they be asked to go back [on what provoked the wrath of Allah].
And when the unrighteous see the punishment, they will not be given relief or respite.
When the associates see those whom they associated with Allah, they will say: "O our Lord, these are our gods whom we invoked apart from You." But [their associates] will say to them, "You are certainly liars."
On that day they will offer Allah submission, and what they have invented will be lost to them.
Those who did not believe and obstructed the cause of Allah, We will add to them punishment upon punishment, for the corruption they sowed (on earth).
And on the Day when in every community We will raise up a witness from among themselves against them, and We will take you [Muhammad] as a witness against them. And We have sent down upon you the Book as an explicit exposition of all things, and as a guide, a grace, and a good proclamation to the Muslims.
Verily, Allah commands fairness, beneficence, and assistance to relatives. And He forbids turpitude, wrongdoing, and rebellion. He exhorts you to remember.
Be faithful to Allah's covenant after you have made it, and do not violate your oaths after you have solemnly taken them and taken Allah as your guarantor. Truly Allah knows what you are doing!
And do not be like the one who undid her distaff strand by strand after she had spun it solidly, taking your oaths as a means to deceive one another, because (you have found) one community stronger and more numerous than the other. Allah only tests you. And verily, He will make it clear to you on the Day of Resurrection what you were opposing on.
If Allah had willed, He would have made you one nation. But He lets whomever He wills go astray and guides whom He wills. And you will certainly be questioned about what you were doing.
And do not take your oaths as a means to deceive one another, otherwise [your] steps will slip after they have been firm, and you will taste misfortune for standing in the way of Allah. And you will suffer a terrible punishment.
And do not sell Allah's pact at a low price. What is with Allah is better for you, if you knew!
All that you possess will be exhausted, while that which is with Allah will endure. And We will reward those who have been consistent according to the best of what they have done.
Whoever, male or female, does a good deed while being a believer, We will make him live a good life. And We will reward them, indeed, according to the best of their deeds.
When you read the Qur'an, ask for Allah's protection from the banished Devil.
He has no power over those who believe and trust in their Lord.
He has power only over those who take him as an ally and who become associates because of him.
When We replace one verse with another – and Allah knows best what He is sending down – they say, "You are just a liar." But most of them don't know.
Say: "It is the Holy Spirit [Gabriel] who sent him down from your Lord in all truth, in order to strengthen [the faith] of those who believe, and to be a guide and good news for the Muslims."
And We know perfectly well that they say: "It is only a human being who teaches him (the Qur'an)". Now the language of the one to whom they refer is foreign [non-Arabic], and this is a very clear Arabic language.
Those who do not believe in the verses of Allah, Allah does not guide them. And they have a painful punishment.
Only those who do not believe in the verses of Allah forge lies; and such are the liars.
Whoever has denied Allah after believing - except the one who has been forced to do so while his heart remains full of the serenity of faith - but those who deliberately open their hearts to disbelief, they have the wrath of Allah upon them and they have a terrible punishment.
This is so, because they loved the present life more than the hereafter. And Allah, indeed, does not guide disbelievers.
These are the ones whose hearts, hearings, and eyes Allah has sealed. They are the carefree ones.
And there is no doubt that in the afterlife, they will be the losers.
As for those who have emigrated after having undergone trials, then struggled and endured, your Lord after this is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
(Remember) the day when every soul will come, pleading for themselves, and every soul will be fully rewarded for what they have done without suffering the slightest injustice.
And Allah proposes in a parable a city: it was safe, quiet; his share of food came to him from everywhere in abundance. Then she showed herself ungrateful to the blessings of Allah. Allah then made him taste the violence of hunger and fear [as punishment] for what they were doing.
Indeed, a Messenger of their own came to them, but they called him a liar. Punishment, therefore, seizes them because they were unjust.
Eat therefore of what Allah has given you that is lawful and good. And be thankful for the blessings of Allah, if it is Him whom you worship.
He has forbidden you (the flesh) of the dead animal, the blood, the flesh of a pig, and the beast on which a name other than that of Allah has been invoked. But whoever eats it under duress, and is neither a rebel nor a transgressor, then Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And do not say, in accordance with the lies spoken by your tongues, "This is lawful, and this is unlawful," to forge a lie against Allah. Verily, those who forge a lie against Allah will not succeed.
It will be a pitiful enjoyment for them, but a painful punishment awaits them.
To the Jews We forbade what We have already told you. We have done them no wrong; but they were doing themselves a disservice.
Then your Lord towards those who have committed evil through ignorance, and have subsequently repented and improved their conduct, your Lord, after that is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
Abraham was a perfect guide ('Umma). He was subject to Allah, dedicated exclusively to Him, and he was not one of the associates.
He was grateful for His bounty and Allah had chosen him and guided him to a straight path.
We have given it a good share here below. And he will certainly be in the Hereafter of the number of good people.
Then We revealed to you: "Follow the religion of Abraham, who was dedicated exclusively to Allah and was not among the associates."
The Sabbath was imposed only on those who differed about it. On the Day of Resurrection, your Lord will certainly judge about what they differed from.
By wisdom and good exhortation call (people) to the path of your Lord. And discuss with them in the best way. For it is your Lord who knows best the one who strays from His path, and it is He who knows best those who are rightly guided.
And if you punish, inflict [on the aggressor] a punishment equal to the wrong he has done you. And if you endure... This is certainly better for those who have endurance.
Endure! Your endurance will come only with (the help) of Allah. Do not grieve for them. And don't be distressed because of their plots.
Verily, Allah is with those who have feared [Him] with piety and those who are beneficent.
Glory and Purity to Him who made His servant [Muhammad] travel by night from the Mosque of Al-Haram to the Mosque of Al-Aqsa, the surroundings of which We have blessed, in order that He may see some of Our wonders. It is He, truly, who is the Hearer, the Clairvoyant.
And We gave Moses the Book that We made a guide for the Children of Israel: "Take no protector besides Me."
[O you], the descendants of those whom We carried in the ark with Noah. He was truly a very grateful servant.
We had decreed for the Children of Israel, (and announced) in the Book: "Twice you will sow corruption on the earth and you will transgress excessively."
When the fulfillment of the first of these two [predictions] came, We sent against you some of Our servants endowed with terrible strength, who entered into the interior of the mansions. And the prediction was fulfilled.
Then We gave you revenge on them; and We strengthened you in goods and children. And We made you more numerous:
"If you do good; you do it to yourselves; and if you do evil, you do it to yourself [also]." Then when the last [prediction] came, it was that they should afflict your faces and enter the Mosque as they had entered it the first time, and that they might completely destroy what they had seized.
It may be that your Lord will have mercy on you. But if you reoffend, We will reoffend. And We have assigned Hell as a detention camp for the infidels.
Verily, this Qur'an guides to what is most right, and it announces to believers who do good deeds that they will have a great reward,
and to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, that We have prepared a painful punishment for them.
Man calls evil as he calls good, for man is very hasty.
We have made night and day two signs, and We have blotted out the sign of night, while We have made the sign of the day visible, so that you may seek graces from your Lord, and know the number of years and the reckoning of time. And We have explained everything in detail.
And to the neck of every man We have fastened his work. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will bring out to him a writing which he will find unfolded:
"Read your writing. Today, you just have to be your own accountant."
Whoever takes the right path takes it only for himself; and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to his own detriment. And no one will bear the burden of another. And We have never punished [a people] until We have sent a Messenger.
And when We want to destroy a city, We command its wealthy people [to obey Our prescriptions], but (on the contrary) they give themselves up to perversity. Then the Word spoken against it is fulfilled, and We destroy it entirely.
How many generations have we exterminated, after Noah! And your Lord is sufficient that He is Perfectly Knower and Clear-Sighted about the sins of His servants.
Whoever desires [life] immediately, We hasten to give what We want, to whom We will. Then We assign him Hell, where he will burn, despised and rejected.
And those who seek the hereafter and make the efforts that lead to it, while being believers... then the effort of these will be recognized.
We grant abundantly to all, these as well as these, gifts from your Lord. And the gifts of your Lord are not withheld [to anyone].
Look at how we favor some over others. And in the afterlife, there are higher and more privileged ranks.
Do not assign to Allah any other god; otherwise you will find yourself despised and abandoned.
And your Lord has decreed, "Worship only Him; and (mark) kindness to the father and mother: if one or both of them should reach old age with you, then do not say to them, "Fi!" and do not rush them, but speak to them with respectful words.
and out of mercy lower the wing of humility for them, and say, "O my Lord, have mercy on them both, as they have raised me when I was a child."
Your Lord knows best what is in your souls. If you are good, He is certainly Forgiving for those who return to Him in repentance.
"And give to the next of kin what is due to him and to the poor and to the traveler (in distress). And do not waste unduly,
for the wasters are the brothers of the devils; and the Devil is very ungrateful to his Lord.
If you turn away from them in search of your Lord's mercy, which you hope for, speak a kind word to them.
Do not put your hand in chains around your neck [out of avarice], nor stretch it out too wide, or you will find yourself blamed and grieved.
Verily, your Lord extends His gifts widely to what He wills or grants them sparingly. He is, over His servants, Perfectly Knower and Clear-sighted.
And don't kill your children for fear of poverty; We are the ones who assign their sustenance, just as to you. Killing them is really a huge sin.
And do not approach fornication. In truth, it is a turpitude and what a bad path!
And except in law, do not kill the life that Allah has made sacred. Whoever is killed unjustly, then We have given power to his relative. Let him not commit excess in murder, for he is already assisted (by the law).
And approach the property of the orphan only in the best way, until he reaches his majority. And fulfill the pledge, for one will be asked about the pledges.
And give the full measure when you measure, and weigh with an accurate scale. It's better [for you] and the result will be better.
And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Hearing, sight, and heart: on all this, in truth, one will be questioned.
And do not tread the earth with pride: you will never know how to split the earth and you will never be able to reach the height of the mountains.
What is evil in all this is hated by your Lord.
All this is part of what your Lord has revealed to you about Wisdom. So do not assign any other god to Allah, or you will be thrown into Hell, blamed and rejected.
Would your Lord have reserved sons for you and taken daughters for Himself from among the angels? You are speaking a monstrous word.
Most certainly We have set forth [all this] in this Qur'an so that [people] may think. But this only increases their revulsion.
Say: "If there were gods with Him, as they say, then they would have sought a way [to reach] the Throne Holder."
Purity to Him! He is higher and infinitely above what they say!
The seven heavens and the earth and those in them celebrate His glory. And there is nothing that does not celebrate His glory and praise. But you don't understand how they glorify Him. Surely it is He who is Forgiving and Forgiving.
And when you read the Qur'an, We place an invisible veil between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter,
We have put veils over their hearts, so that they do not understand it: and in their ears, a heaviness. And when, in the Qur'an, you mention Your Lord the One, they turn their backs out of revulsion.
We know very well what they are listening to. When they listen to you and whisper among themselves, the unrighteous say, "You follow only a bewitched man."
See what they're comparing you to! So they go astray and are unable to find a way (to the truth).
And they say, "When we are bones and dust, will we be raised in a new creation?"
Say: "Be stone or iron.
or any other creature you can conceive." Then they will say, "Who will bring us back?" – say, "He who created you the first time." They will shake their heads at you and say, "When is this?" Say: "It may be near.
On the day He calls you, you will respond to Him by glorifying Him. But you will think that you have only stayed [on earth] for a short time!"
And tell My servants to express the best words, for the Devil sows discord among them. The Devil is certainly a declared enemy for man.
Your Lord knows you best. If He wills, He will show you mercy, and if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you to be their protector.
And your Lord is more Knower than those who are in heaven and on earth. And among the prophets, We have given more favors to some than to others. And to David We gave the "Zabur."
Say: "Call upon those whom you pretend, (to be gods) besides Him. They possess neither the means of dispelling your misfortune nor of diverting it.
Those whom they invoke seek [themselves], who are the best they can, the means of drawing nearer to their Lord. They hope for His mercy and fear His chastisement. The punishment of your Lord is truly feared.
There is no city that We do not destroy before the Day of Resurrection, or that We do not punish with severe punishment. This is well traced in the Book [of Immutable Decrees].
Nothing prevents Us from sending miracles, except that the ancients called them lies. We brought to the Thamûd the she-camel, which was a visible [miracle]: but they wronged him. Moreover, We send miracles only as a threat.
And when We told you that your Lord encircles all people (by His power and knowledge). As for the vision that We have shown you, We have only made it to test people, just like the cursed tree mentioned in the Qur'an. We threaten them, but this only increases their great transgression.
And when We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," they prostrated themselves, except for Iblis, who said, "Shall I prostrate myself before one whom You have created of clay?"
He said again, "See? He whom You have honored above me, if You give me respite until the Day of Resurrection, I will certainly test his descendants except a few [among them]."
And [Allah] said: "Go away! Whoever of them will follow you... your punishment will be Hell, ample retribution.
Stir up those among them whom you can by your voice, gather your cavalry and infantry against them, associate with them in their property and their children, and make promises to them." Now the Devil makes promises to them only in deception.
As for My servants, you have no power over them." And your Lord is enough to protect them!
Your Lord is the One who sails the ship for you at sea, that you may go in search of some grace from Him; Verily He is merciful to you,
And when evil touches you at sea, those whom you invoked apart from Him are lost. Then, when He saves you and brings you back to shore, you turn away. The man remains very ungrateful!
Are you safe from the fact that He will swallow you up by a piece of earth, or that He will send a hurricane against you (with rain in stones) and that you will then find no protector?
Or are you safe from bringing you back to the sea another time, and unleashing one of these winds against you, and then drowning you because of your disbelief? And then you will find no one to defend you against Us!
Verily, We have honored the sons of Adam. We have transported them by land and sea, have given them good things for food, and We have clearly preferred them to many of Our creatures.
On the Day when We call each group of men by their leader, those who are given their book in their right hand will read their book (with pleasure) and will not suffer the slightest injustice.
And whoever is blind here on earth will be blind in the hereafter, and will be more misguided in the right way.
They almost turned you away from what We had revealed to you, [in the hope] that instead of this, you would invent something else and (impute it) to Us. And then they would have taken you as an intimate friend.
And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost bowed a little to them.
Then We would certainly have made you taste the double [torment] of life and the double [torment] of death; and then you would not have found a helper against Us.
In truth, they almost made you flee the country and banish you. But in that case, they wouldn't have stayed there long after you.
This was the rule applied by Us to Our messengers whom We sent before you. And you will not find any change in Our rule.
Perform Salat at the setting of the sun until the darkness of the night, and also at dawn, for the Reading at dawn has witnesses.
And of the night dedicate a part [before dawn] to voluntary salah: so that your Lord may raise you up in a position of glory.
And say, "O my Lord, let me enter by an entrance of truth and go out by an exit of truth; and grant me power from You that is helped by You."
And say: "The Truth (Islam) has come and the Error has disappeared. For Error is destined to disappear."
We send down from the Qur'an, which is healing and mercy for believers. However, this only increases the perdition of the unrighteous.
And when We shower man with blessings, he turns away and withdraws into himself; and when an evil touches him, he is profoundly desperate.
Say: "Each one acts according to his own method, while your Lord knows best who follows the best way."
And they ask you about the soul, say, "The soul belongs to the order of my Lord." And you have been given little knowledge.
If We will, We can certainly make disappear what We have revealed to you; and you would find no defender against Us in it afterwards.
Except by the mercy of your Lord, for indeed His grace upon you is great.
Say: "Even if men and jinn were to unite to produce something like this Qur'an, they would not be able to produce anything like this, even if they supported each other."
And verily, We have displayed all kinds of examples for the people in this Qur'an. But most people persist in being disbelievers.
And they said, "We will not believe in you until you have caused a spring to spring up for us out of the earth;
or that you have a garden of palm trees and vines, between which you will cause streams to gush forth in abundance;
or that you cause the sky to fall on us, as you pretend, in pieces; or that you bring Allah and the angels before us;
or that you have a house [garnished] with ornaments; or that you have ascended to heaven. Yet we will not believe in your ascension into heaven until you send down upon us a Book that we can read." Say to them, "Glory be to my Lord! Am I just a human being-Messenger?"
And nothing prevented the people from believing, when the guide came to them, except that they said: "Does Allah send a human being as a Messenger?"
Say: "If there were angels walking quietly on earth, We would have sent down an Angel Messenger to them from heaven."
Say: "Allah is sufficient as a witness between you and me." He is, over His servants, Perfectly Knower and Clear-sighted.
The one whom Allah guides is the right-guided and those whom He leads astray... you will never find them allies besides Him, and on the Day of Resurrection We will gather them dragged over their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf. Hell will be their dwelling place: whenever its fire weakens, We will increase the burning flame for them.
This will be their punishment because they do not believe in Our proofs and say, "When we are bones and dust, will we be resurrected in a new creation?"
Have they not seen that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, is able to create their like? He has set a time for them, about which there is no doubt, but the unrighteous persist in their disbelief.
Say: "If you were the ones who possessed the treasures of my Lord's mercy, you would certainly skimp for fear of spending them. And man is very miserly!
And verily, We gave Moses nine evident miracles. Ask the Children of Israel, when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "O Moses, I think you are bewitched."
He said, "You know very well that these things [miracles] only the Lord of heaven and earth has sent down as so many illuminating proofs; and indeed, O Pharaoh, I believe you to be lost."
So [Pharaoh] wanted to expel them from the land. Then We drowned them all, he and those who were with him.
And after him We said to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land." Then, when the promise of the last (life) comes, We will bring you in crowds.
And it is in all truth that We sent it down (the Qur'an), and with the truth it came down, and We sent you only as a herald and a warner.
(We have sent down) a Qur'an that We have fragmented, so that you can read it slowly to the people. And We have brought it down gradually.
Say: "Believe it or don't believe it. Those to whom knowledge has been given before this, when it is recited to them, fall prostrate, with their chins to the ground
and say, "Glory to our Lord! Our Lord's promise is certainly fulfilled."
And they fall on their chins, weeping, and this increases their humility.
Say: "Call upon Allah, or invoke the Most Merciful. Whatever you call Him by, He has the most beautiful names. And in your Salah, do not recite aloud; and do not lower it too much, but seek the golden mean between the two."
And say: "Praise be to Allah, who has never given Himself a child, who has no partner in the kingdom, and who has never had a protector of humiliation." And loudly proclaims His greatness.
Praise be to Allaah, who sent down the Book upon His servant (Muhammad) and did not introduce any wrongness into it.
[A Book] of perfect righteousness to warn of severe punishment from Him and to announce to believers who do good deeds that there will be a great reward for them.
where they will dwell forever,
and to warn those who say: "Allah has given Himself a child."
Neither they nor their ancestors know anything about it. What a monstrous word is that which comes from their mouths! What they say is a lie.
You may be consumed with grief because they turn away from you and don't believe in this speech!
We have placed what is on the earth to beautify it, in order to test (men and to know) which of them are the best in their actions.
Then We will surely transform its surface into an arid soil.
Do you think that the people of the Cave and of ar-Raquîm were an extraordinary thing among Our wonders?
When the young men had taken refuge in the cave, they said, "O our Lord, give us mercy from You; and assure us of righteousness in everything that concerns us."
So We deafened their ears in the cave for many years.
Then We resurrected them, in order to know which of the two groups would best calculate the exact length of their stay.
We will tell you their story in all truth. They are young men who believed in their Lord; and We have granted them the greatest means of directing themselves [in the right way].
We strengthened their hearts when they stood up to say, "Our Lord is the Lord of heaven and earth: we will never call upon any god besides Him, or we shall transgress in our words.
Behold, our fellow citizens have adopted divinities besides Him. Why do they not bring clear proof of them? Who is more unrighteous than the one who invents a lie against Allah?
And when you have separated yourselves from them and from what they worship besides Allah, take refuge in the cave, and your Lord will pour out His mercy on you and will bring a softening of your fate to you.
You would have seen the sun, when it rises, move away from their cave to the right, and when it sets, pass to their left, while they themselves are there in a spacious part (of the cave)... This is one of the wonders of Allah. The one whom Allah guides, he is the rightly guided. And whoever He leads astray, then you will find no ally for Him to put Him on the right path.
