And you would have thought them awake, while they are sleeping. And We turn them to the right side and to the left side, while their dog is at the entrance with legs extended. If you had seen them, you would certainly have turned your back on them as you fled; and you would certainly have been filled with terror before them.
And so We raised them up, so that they might ask one another. One of them said, "How long did you stay there?" They said, "We have stayed a day or part of a day." Others said, "Your Lord knows best how long you have dwelt there. Send one of you to the city with this money, so that he may see what food is the purest and bring you food to eat. Let him act with tact; and let him not awaken anyone about you.
If they ever catch you, they will stone you or make you return to their religion, and then you will never succeed again."
And so We caused them to be discovered, so that they [the people of the city] might know that the promise of Allah is true and that there should be no doubt about the Hour. So they argued about them and said, "Build a building over them. Their Lord knows them best." But those who prevailed said, "Let us build a sanctuary over them."
They will say: "There were three of them and the fourth was their dog". And they will say by conjecturing on their mystery that they were five, the sixth being their dog and they will say, "seven, the eighth being their dog." Say: "My Lord knows their number best. There are only a few who know this." Discusses them only in an apparent way and does not consult anyone about them.
And never say, about a thing, "I'll surely do it tomorrow,"
without adding: "Allah willing," and call upon your Lord when you forget and say, "I wish that my Lord would guide me and lead me closer to what is right."
Now they remained in their cave three hundred years and added nine (years).
Say: "Allah knows best how long they stayed there. To Him belongs the Unknowable of the heavens and the earth. How Seer and Hearer He is! They have no allies besides Him, and He does not associate anyone with His command.
And recite what has been revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. No one can change His words. And you will find no refuge apart from Him.
Be patient with those who call upon their Lord morning and night, desiring His Face. And let not thy eyes detach themselves from them, seeking (the false) brilliance of life on earth. And do not obey Him whose hearts We have made inattentive to Our Reminder, who pursues his passion and whose behavior is outrageous.
And say, "The truth emanates from your Lord." Whoever wants it, let him believe, whoever wants it, let him disbelieve." We have prepared for the unrighteous a Fire whose flames surround them. And if they beg for a drink, they will be watered with water like molten metal, burning their faces. What a bad drink and what a detestable dwelling!
Those who believe and do good deeds... truly We do not let the reward of him who does good be lost.
These are the ones who will have the gardens of the (eternal) abode under which the streams flow. They will be adorned with gold bracelets and will dress in green clothes of fine silk and brocade, leaning on couches (well decorated). What a good reward and what a beautiful house!
Give them the example of two men: to one of them We have assigned two gardens of vines, which We have surrounded with palm trees, and We have placed cultivated fields between the two gardens.
The two gardens produced their harvest without ever failing. And We have caused a stream to gush forth between them.
And he had fruit and then said to his companion with whom he was conversing: "I have more goods than you, and I am more powerful than you because of my clan."
He went into his garden guilty of himself [by his disbelief]; he says, "I don't think this can ever perish,
and I don't think the Hour will come. And if I am brought back to my Lord, I will certainly find a better place to return than this garden.
His companion said to him, while conversing with him, "Are you a disbeliever towards Him who created you from earth, then from semen, and finally fashioned you into a man?
As for me, Allah is my Lord; and I associate no one with my Lord.
When you enter your garden, why do you not say: "This is the will (and grace) of Allah! There is no power except through Allah." If you see me less provided than you in goods and children,
it may be that my Lord will soon give me something better than your garden, that He will send some calamity to your garden from heaven, and that its ground will become slippery,
or let its water dry up so that you can no longer find it."
And his crop was destroyed, and he began to wring both his hands because of what he had spent on it, while his trellises were completely destroyed. And he said, "How I wish I had associated no one with my Lord."
He had no group of people to help him against Allah. And he could not help himself.
In this case, the sovereign protection belongs to Allah, the True. It gives the best reward and the best result.
And offer them the example of life here on earth. It is like water which We send down from heaven; the vegetation of the earth mixes with it. Then it becomes parched grass that the winds scatter. Verily, Allah is Mighty in all things.
Property and children are the ornament of the life of this world. However, good works that persist have a better reward with your Lord and [arouse] good hope.
The Day when We will make the mountains move and you will see the earth levelled (like a plain) and We will gather them together without omitting a single one.
And they will be presented in rows before your Lord. "You have come to Us as We created you the first time. Yet you claimed that We would not fulfill Our promises."
And we will put down the book (of each). Then you will see the criminals, frightened because of what is in it, say: "Woe to us, what is the matter with this book that does not omit to mention either venial or capital sin?" And they will find before them all that they have worked. And your Lord does not harm anyone.
And when We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," they prostrated themselves, except Iblis [Satan] who was of the jinn and rebelled against the command of his Lord. Are you going to take him and his descendants as allies besides Me, when they are enemies to you? What a bad exchange for the unjust!
I did not take them as witnesses of the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor of the creation of their own persons. And I have not taken as helpers those who go astray.
And the day He says, "Call those whom you claimed to be My associates." They will invoke them; but they will not answer them, for We will have placed between them a valley of perdition.
And criminals will see Fire. They will then be convinced that they will fall into it and will not find a way out.
And certainly, We have displayed for the people in this Qur'an all kinds of examples. Man, however, is the greatest disputant of all beings.
What, then, prevented the people from believing, when the guide came to them, and from asking forgiveness from their Lord, except that they want to suffer the fate of the ancients, or to come face to face with the punishment?
And We send messengers only to preach the good news and warn. And those who have disbelieved argue with false arguments, in order to invalidate the truth, and mock My verses (the Qur'an) and that (punishment) of which they have been warned.
Who is more unjust than he who was reminded of the verses of his Lord and turned his back away from them, forgetting what his two hands have done? We have placed veils over their hearts, so that they do not understand (the Qur'an), and put a heaviness in their ears. Even if you call them to the right path, they will never be able to guide themselves.
And your Lord is the Forgiver, the Holder of mercy. If He were to attack them for what they have acquired, He would certainly hasten their punishment. But there is a fixed time for them (for the fulfillment of threats) from which they will find no refuge.
And these are the cities that We destroyed when their people committed injustices, and We set a date for their destruction.
(Remember) when Moses said to his servant, "I will not stop until I have reached the confluence of the two seas, even if I walk for many years."
Then, when they had both reached the confluence, they forgot their fish, which then took its way freely into the sea.
And when they had both passed [this place,] he said to his servant, "Bring us our breakfast, for we have met with fatigue in our present journey."
[The valet] said, "When we took refuge by the rock, you see, I forgot the fish - the Devil alone made me forget to remind you of it - and it curiously made its way into the sea."
[Moses] said, "This is what we were looking for." Then they retraced their steps, following in their footsteps.
They found one of Our servants to whom We had given a grace from Us and to whom We had taught a science from Us.
Moses said to him, "May I follow you, if you teach me what you have been taught about good leadership?"
[The other] said, "Really, you can never be patient with me.
How can you endure things that you do not embrace by your knowledge?"
[Moses] said to him, "Allah willing, you will find me patient; and I will not disobey any of your commands."
"If you follow me," said [the other], "do not ask me about anything until I have mentioned it to you."
So the two of them left. And after they had boarded a boat, the man made a breach in it. [Moses] said to him, "Have you chipped it to drown its occupants? You have certainly committed a monstrous thing!"
[The other] replied, "Did I not say that you could not have patience with me?"
"Do not blame me," said [Moses,] "for an oversight on my part; and does not impose any great difficulty on me in my business."
Then they both departed; and when they met a child, [the man] killed him. Then [Moses] said to him, "Have you killed an innocent being, who has not killed anyone? You have certainly committed a dreadful thing!"
[The other] said to him, "Didn't I tell you that you couldn't be patient with me?"
"If, after this, I ask you about anything," said [Moses], "then don't go with me anymore. You will then be excused for parting with me."
So they both set out; and when they came to an inhabited village, they asked for food from its inhabitants; but the latter refused to give them hospitality. Then they found a wall on the verge of collapse. The man straightened it up. Then [Moses] said to him, "If you wanted, you could have asked for a salary for it."
"This [marks] the separation between you and me," said [the man,] "I will teach you the interpretation of what you have not been able to bear with patience.
As for the boat, it belonged to poor people who worked at sea. I therefore wanted to make it defective, for there was a king behind them who seized every boat by force.
As for the boy, his father and mother were believers; we feared that he would impose rebellion and disbelief on them.
We have therefore willed that their Lord should grant them in exchange another purer and more affectionate.
And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphaned boys of the city, and there was a treasure of theirs underneath; and their father was a virtuous man. Therefore your Lord has willed that both of them should come of age, and that they should extract their treasure by the mercy of your Lord. I didn't do it on my own. This is the interpretation of what you have not been able to endure with patience."
And they ask you about Dul-Qarnayn. Say: "I will tell you some memorable facts about it."
Truly, We have established His power on earth, and We have given Him free rein to all things.
So he followed a path.
And when he had reached the sunset, he found that the sun was setting in a muddy spring, and near it he found an ungodly tribe. We said, "O Dul-Qarnayn! either you chastise them, or you use benevolence towards them".
He said, "As for the one who is unjust, we will punish him; then he will be brought back to his Lord who will punish him with a terrible punishment.
And as for the one who believes and does a good deed, he will have the greatest reward in return. And we will give him orders that are easy to execute."
Then he followed (another) path.
And when he reached the east, he found that the sun was rising over a tribe to which We had not given a veil to protect themselves.
This was the case, and We embrace with Our Science what he held.
Then he followed (another) path.
And when he had reached a place between the Two Barriers (mountains), he found behind them a tribe that understood almost no language.
They said, "O Dul-Qarnayn, the Ya Juj and the Ma Juj are making a mess on earth. Will we be able to pay tribute to you to build a barrier between them and us?"
He said, "What My Lord has bestowed upon me is better (than your gifts). So help me with your strength and I will build an embankment between you and them.
Bring me iron blocks." Then, when he had filled up the space between the two mountains, he said, "Blow!" Then, when he had returned it to a furnace, he said, "Bring me molten copper, and I may pour it on it."
Thus, they could hardly climb or chip it either.
He said, "It's a mercy from my Lord. But when my Lord's promise comes, He will level it. And the promise of my Lord is truth."
We will let them break like the waves on that day, and the trumpet will be blown and gathered together.
And on that day We will present Hell to the disbelievers,
whose eyes were covered with a veil that prevented them from thinking of Me, and they could not hear anything either.
Do those who have disbelieved expect to be able to take My servants apart from Me as allies? We have prepared Hell as a residence for the disbelievers.
Say: "Do you want Us to tell you who are the biggest losers, in works?
Those whose effort in this life has gone astray, when they imagine they are doing good.
Those who denied the signs of their Lord, as well as His meeting. Their actions are therefore in vain." We will not assign them weight on the Day of Resurrection.
It is because their retribution will be Hell, for having disbelieved and mocked My signs (teachings) and My messengers.
Those who believe and do good works will have for their residence the Gardens of the "Firdaws" (Paradise),
where they will dwell forever, without desiring any change.
Say: "If the sea were ink [to write] the words of my Lord, surely the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We were to bring him his equivalent as a reinforcement."
Say: "I'm actually a human being like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is one God! Whosoever hopes to meet his Lord, let him do good deeds and not associate in his worship any other with his Lord."
Kâf, Hâ', Yâ', 'Aîn, Sâd.
It is a record of your Lord's mercy toward His servant Zechariah.
When he invoked his Lord with a secret invocation,
and said, "O my Lord, my bones are weak, and my head is inflamed with white hairs. [However], I have never been unhappy [disappointed] in praying to you, O my Lord.
I fear [the behavior] of my heirs, after me. And my own wife is barren. Give me a descendant from You
who inherits from me and inherits from the family of Jacob. And make it acceptable to you, O my Lord."
"O Zechariah, We preach to you the good news of a son. His name will be Yahya [John]. We have not previously given it a namesake."
And [Zechariah said], "O my Lord, how shall I have a son, when my wife is barren and I am far advanced in old age?"
[Allah] said to him: "So it will be! Your Lord said, "This is easy for me. And before that, I created you when you were nothing."
"O my Lord," says [Zechariah], "grant me a sign." "Your sign," says [Allah,] "will be that you will not be able to talk to people for three nights while being well.
So he went out of the sanctuary to his people; then he made a sign to them to pray morning and evening.
... "O Yahya, hold fast to the Book (the Torah)!" We gave him wisdom when he was a child,
as well as the tenderness of Us and purity. He was pious,
and devoted to his father and mother; and was neither violent nor disobedient.
Peace be upon him on the day he was born, the day he dies, and the day he is raised alive.
Mentioned in the Book (the Qur'an), Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place towards the East.
She put a veil between herself and them. We sent her Our Spirit (Gabriel), who presented himself to her in the form of a perfect man.
She said, "I take refuge from you with the Most Merciful. If you are pious, [do not come near me]."
He says, "I am in fact a Messenger of your Lord to give you a pure son."
She said, "How can I have a son, when no man has touched me, and I am not a prostitute?"
He said, "So it will be! It is easy for Me, your Lord has said. And We will make him a sign to the people, and a mercy from Us. It's a matter already decided."
So she became pregnant [with the child], and she withdrew with him to a distant place.
Then the pangs of childbirth brought her to the trunk of the palm tree, and she said, "Woe to me! That I had died before that moment! And that I was totally forgotten!"
Then he called her from below her, [saying:] "Do not grieve. Your Lord has placed a spring at your feet.
Shake the trunk of the palm tree towards you, and it will cause fresh and ripe dates to fall on you.
Eat and drink, and let your eye rejoice! If you see any of men, say to him, "Surely I have vowed a fast to the Most Merciful, so I will not speak to any human being today."
Then she came to her family carrying him [the baby]. They said, "O Mary, you have done a monstrous thing!
"Sister of Harun, your father was not a man of evil and your mother was not a prostitute."
She then made a sign to him [the baby]. They said, "How shall we speak to a baby in the cradle?"
But (the baby) said, "I am truly the servant of Allah. He gave me the Book and designated me a prophet.
Wherever I am, He has blessed me; and He has recommended to me, as long as I live, prayer and Zakat;
and kindness to my mother. He didn't make me violent or unhappy.
And peace be upon me on the day I was born, and on the day I die, and on the day I am raised alive."
Such is Issa (Jesus), son of Mary: word of truth, of which they doubt.
It is not fitting for Allah to attribute a son to Himself. Glory and Purity be to Him! When He decides on something, He just says, "Be," and it is.
Verily, Allah is my Lord just like your Lord. Worship him, then. This is a straight path."
[Subsequently,] the sects diverged among themselves. So, woe to the disbelievers at the sight of a terrible day!
How well they will hear and see the day when they come to Us! But today, the unrighteous are in an obvious error.
And warn them of the day of Regret, when all will be settled; while they are inattentive and do not believe.
Verily, We will inherit the earth and all that is on it, and to Us they will be returned.
And mentioned in the Book, Abraham. He was a very truthful and prophet.
When he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which neither hears nor sees, and does not profit you in anything?
O my father, it has come to me from knowledge that which thou hast not received; follow me, therefore, and I will guide you to a straight path.
O my father, do not worship the Devil, for the Devil disobeys the Most Merciful.
O my father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Merciful will come upon you and that you will become an ally of the Devil."
He said, "O Abraham, would you have any disdain for my gods? If you do not cease, I will stone you, and depart from me for a long time."
"Peace be upon you," says Abraham. "I will implore my Lord to forgive you because He has always showered me with His blessings.
I separate myself from you and from what you call upon besides Allah, and I will call upon my Lord. I hope I am not unhappy in my call to my Lord."
And when he had separated himself from them and from what they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob; and of each One We made a prophet.
And We gave them by Our mercy, and granted them a sublime language of truth.
And mentions in the Book Moses. He was truly a chosen one, and he was a Messenger and a prophet.
From the right side of Mount (Sinai) We called him and brought him up as a confidant.
And by Our mercy We gave him Aaron his brother as a prophet.
And mentions Ishmael in the Book. He was faithful to his promises; and he was a Messenger and a prophet.
And he commanded his family to pray and Zakat; and he was accepted with his Lord.
And mentions Idris, in the Book. He was a truthful man and a prophet.
And We raised him to a high station.
These are those whom Allah has bestowed favors on among the prophets, among the descendants of Adam, and also among those whom We carried with Noah, and among the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and among those whom We have guided and chosen. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell prostrate and wept.
Then they were succeeded by generations who abandoned prayer and followed their passions. They will find themselves in perdition,
except the one who repents, believes, and does good: these will enter Paradise and will not be wronged,
to the gardens of the (eternal) abode which the Most Merciful promised to His servants, [who believed] in the mystery. For His promise will undoubtedly come.
No insignificant words are heard in it; only: "Salâm"; and there they will have their food, morning and evening.
This is the Paradise from which We will inherit those of Our servants who have been pious.
"We do not descend except by order of your Lord. To Him all that is before us, all that is behind us, and all that is in between. Your Lord forgets nothing.
He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them. Worship Him, therefore, and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know a homonym for him?"
And the man said, "When I'm dead, will they take me out alive?"
Does not man remember that before that, We created him, when he was nothing?
By your Lord! Assuredly, We will gather them and the devils. Then We will place them around Hell, kneeling.
Then We will uproot from each group those of them who were most obstinate against the Most Merciful.
Then we are the best at knowing the ones who most deserve to be burned there.
There is no one among you who will not pass through [Hell]: for [this is] an irrevocable sentence for your Lord.
Then We will deliver those who were pious and leave the unrighteous on their knees.
And when Our obvious verses are recited to them, the disbelievers say to those who believe, "Which of the two groups has the more comfortable situation and the better company?"
How many generations have We destroyed before them, which surpassed them in good things and appearances?
Say: "Whoever is in error, let the Most Merciful prolong his life for a certain time, until they see either the punishment or the Hour with which they are threatened. Then they will know who has the worst situation and the weakest troop."
Allah increases the righteousness of those who follow the right path, and lasting good deeds merit a better reward and destination with your Lord.
Have you seen the one who does not believe in Our verses and says, "They will certainly give me property and children"?
Is he aware of the Unknowable or has he made a commitment to the Most Merciful?
Quite the contrary! We will record what he says and increase his punishment.
It is We who will inherit what he speaks of, while he will come to Us alone.
They have adopted deities besides Allah to be protectors of them.
Quite the contrary! [these deities] will deny their worship and will be adversaries to them.
Have you not seen that We have sent devils against the disbelievers who are furiously stirring them up?
Do not therefore be hasty against them: We keep a precise account of [all their deeds].
(Remember) the Day when We gather the pious on horses and with great pomp to the Most Merciful,
and drive the criminals to Hell as (a flock) to the watering-place,
they will have no intercession, except the one who has made a commitment with the Most Merciful.
And they said, "The Most Merciful has given Himself a child."
You are certainly saying an abominable thing here!
The heavens are very far from opening at these words, and the earth is splitting, and the mountains are falling,
because they have assigned a child to the Most Merciful,
when it is by no means fitting for the Most Merciful to have a child!
All who are in heaven and on earth will go to the Most Merciful, [without exception], as servants.
He has certainly counted them and counted them well.
And on the Day of Resurrection, each of them will go to Him alone.
To those who believe and do good works, the All-Merciful will bestow His love.
We have made it (the Qur'an) easy [to understand] in your language, so that you may preach the good news to the righteous people through it, and warn an irreconcilable people.
How many generations before them have We destroyed them! Do you find a single individual? Or do you hear the slightest whisper of it?
Tâ-Hâ.
We have not sent down the Qur'an upon you to make you miserable,
if it is only a reminder to the one who fears (Allah),
(and as) a revelation from Him who created the earth and the sublime heavens.
The Most Merciful has established Himself "Istawâ" on the Throne.
To Him belongs what is in the heavens, on the earth, what is between them and what is under the damp ground.
And if you lift up your voice, He certainly knows the secrets, even the most hidden.
Allah! No divinity but Him! It has the most beautiful names.
Has the account of Moses come to you?
When he saw fire, he said to his family, "Stay here! I see fire from afar; perhaps I will bring you a brand, or I will find something to guide me by the fire."
Then, when he arrived there, he was challenged: "Moses!
I am your Lord. Take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley, Tuwa.
I have chosen you. Listen therefore to what is about to be revealed.
Verily, it is I Allah: there is no god but Me. Worship Me, therefore, and perform Salat to remember Me.
The Hour will certainly arrive. I hardly hide it, so that each soul may be rewarded according to his efforts.
Let not those who do not believe in it and follow their own passion turn away from it. Otherwise you will perish.
And what's in your right hand, O Moses?"
He said: "It is my stick on which I lean, which I use to leaf (the trees) for my sheep and I use it for other purposes."
[Allah] said to him: "Throw it away, O Moses."
He threw it away, and behold, a serpent crawling.
[Allah] says: "Take hold of him and do not be afraid: We will bring him back to his former state.
And clasp your hand under your armpit, and it will come out white without any harm, and this will be another wonder,
so that We may show you Our most important wonders.
Go to Pharaoh because he has exceeded all limits.
[Moses] said, "Lord, open my breast to me,
and facilitates my mission,
and untie a knot in my tongue,
that they may understand my words,
and assign me an assistant from my family:
Aaron my brother,
increase my strength through him!
and associate him with my mission,
that we may glorify You much,
and that we call upon You a lot.
And you are very clear of us."
[Allah] said: "Your request is granted, O Moses.
And We have already favored you the first time
when We revealed to your mother what was revealed:
"Put it in the casket, and then throw it into the waves, and then the river throws it on the shore; an enemy of Mine and of him will take him." And I have poured out upon you an affection from Me, that you may be lifted up under My eye.
And your sister followed you walking and said, "Can I tell you someone who will take care of him?" So We brought you back to your mother, so that her eye might rejoice and she might not grieve any more. You then killed a person; We saved you from the fears that oppressed you; and We imposed many trials on you. Then you stayed for years with the inhabitants of Madyan. Then you came, O Moses, according to a decree.
And I have assigned you to Myself.
Go with My wonders, you and your brother; and do not neglect to call upon Me.
Go to Pharaoh: he really rebelled.
Then, talk to him nicely. Maybe he will remember or fear [Me]?"
They said, "O our Lord, we fear that he will mistreat us unduly, or that he will go beyond the bounds."
He said, "Fear not. I am with you: I hear and I see.
Go to him, then; Then say to him, "We are both messengers of your Lord. Send the Children of Israel to our company and punish them no more. We have come to you with a proof from your Lord. And peace be upon everyone who follows the right path!
It has been revealed to us that the punishment is for those who refuse to have faith and turn their backs."
Then [Pharaoh] said, "Who is your Lord, O Moses?"
"Our Lord," says Moses, "is the One who gave to each thing its own nature and then directed it."
"What then of the older generations?" said Pharaoh.
Moses said, "The knowledge of their fate is with my Lord in a book. My Lord [makes] no error or forgetfulness.
It is He who has assigned the earth to you as a cradle and has traced paths for you in it; and who from heaven sent down water with which We cause to germinate pairs of plants of all kinds."
"Eat and graze your cattle." These are signs for the intelligent.
From it (the earth) We created you, and in it We will return you, and from it We will bring you out once more.
Verily We have shown him all Our wonders; but he denied them and refused (to believe).
He said, "Have you come to us, O Moses, to bring us out of our land by your magic?
We will certainly bring you similar magic. Appoint a meeting between us and you that neither we nor you will miss, in a suitable place."
Then Moses said, "Your appointment is on the feast day. And that people gather in the morning."
Pharaoh, therefore, withdrew. Then he gathered his cunning and came (to the rendezvous).
Moses said to them, "Woe to you! Do not forge a lie against Allah, or He will destroy you with punishment. He who forges (a lie) is lost."
Thereupon they began to dispute among themselves about their affair, and kept their discussions secret.
They said, "Here are two magicians who, by their magic, want to make you abandon your land and carry away your ideal doctrine.
So gather your cunning and then come in tight rows. And whoever comes out on top today will have succeeded."
They said, "O Moses, either do you throw [your staff first] or let us be the first to throw?"
He said, "Throw it away." And now their ropes and sticks seemed to him to creep by the effect of their magic.
Moses felt some fear within himself.
We told him, "Don't be afraid, you will have the upper hand.
Throw away what is in your right hand; it will devour what they have made. What they have made is only a magician's trick; and the magician does not succeed, wherever he is."
The magicians fell down in prostration, saying, "We have faith in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."
Then Pharaoh said, "Did you believe in him before I allowed you to do so? He is your leader who taught you magic. I will surely have you cut off opposite hands and legs, and crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will know for sure which of us is stronger in punishment and which is the most lasting."
"By Him who created us," they said, "we will never prefer you to what has come down to us as clear proofs. Decree, therefore, what you have to decree. Your decrees affect only this present life.
We believe in our Lord, so that He will forgive us our sins and the magic to which you have forced us." And Allah is better and eternal.
Whoever comes as a criminal to his Lord, will certainly have Hell where he neither dies nor lives.
And whoever comes to Him believing, after having done good deeds, these are the ones who will have the highest ranks,
the gardens of the (eternal) abode, under which the streams flow, where they will dwell forever. And this is the reward of those who purify themselves [from disbelief and sins].
We revealed to Moses, "Go out at night at the head of My servants, and then make a dry passage for them in the sea, without fear of pursuit, and without fear."
Pharaoh pursued them with his armies. The sea did indeed submerge them.
Pharaoh thus led his people astray and did not set them on the right path.
O Children of Israel, We have already delivered you from your enemy, and We have appointed you to meet on the right side of the Mount. And We have sent down manna and quail upon you.
"Eat of the good things that We have bestowed upon you, and do not be ungrateful, or My wrath will fall upon you: and whoever My wrath falls upon is surely going to the abyss.
And I am the Great Forgiver to the one who repents, believes, does good work, and then sets out on the right path."
"Why did you hasten to leave your people, Moses?"
They are there in my footsteps, says Moses. And I hastened to You, Lord, that You might be pleased.
Allah said: "We have put your people to the test after you have left. And the Sâmirî has led them astray."
So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved; he said, "O my people, has not your Lord already made you a fine promise? So was the alliance too long for you? or have you desired that the wrath of your Lord should fall upon you, for having betrayed your pledge to me?"
They said, "It is not of our own free will that we have failed in our commitment to you. But we were laden with burdens of ornaments of the people (of Pharaoh); so we threw them (on the fire) just as the Sâmirî threw them.
Then he brought out for them a calf, a body with a roar. And they said, "That's your god and the godhead of Moses; so he forgot"!
What! Did they not see that he [the calf] did not give them any words and that he had no means of harming them or doing them good?
Aaron had said to them before, "O my people, you have fallen into temptation (because of the calf). Now it is the Most Merciful who is truly your Lord. Follow me, therefore, and obey my command."
They said, "We will continue to be attached to it until Moses returns to us."
Then [Moses] said, "What prevented you, Aaron, when you saw them go astray,
to follow me? Have you then disobeyed my command?"
[Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not take me by the beard or by the head. I was afraid that you would say, "You divided the children of Israel and did not keep my commands."
Then [Moses] said, "What was your purpose? O Sâmirî?"
He said, "I have seen what they have not seen, so I have taken a handful of the trace of the Messenger; Then I threw it. This is what my soul has suggested to me."
"Go away," said [Moses]. In life, you'll have to say (to everyone), "Don't touch me!" And there will be an appointment for you that you cannot miss. Look at your divinity whom you have assiduously worshipped. We will certainly burn it, and then we will scatter [its ashes] in the waves.
Verily, your only God is Allah, besides whom there is no god. Of His knowledge He embraces everything.
This is how We tell you the stories of what happened. It is indeed a reminder from Us that We have brought you.
Whoever turns away from it (from this Qur'an), will bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection;
they will remain in this state forever, and what a bad burden for them on the Day of Resurrection,
On the Day when the Trunk is blown, on that Day We will gather the criminals all blue (with fear)!
They will whisper to each other, "You were only here ten [days]!"
We know perfectly well what they will say when one of them, whose conduct is exemplary, says: "You have only stayed for one day".
And they ask you about the mountains. Say: "My Lord will scatter them like dust,
and will leave them like a bare plain
in which you will see neither tortuosity nor depression.
On that day, they will follow the Convener without tortuosity; and voices will bow before the Most Merciful. Then you will only hear a whisper.
On that day, intercession will benefit only the one to whom the Most Merciful has given His permission and whose word He accepts.
He knows what is before them and what is behind them, while they themselves do not understand Him with their knowledge.
And faces will humble themselves before the Living One, the Self-Subsisting One "al-Qayyûm," and woe will be he who [will appear before Him] burdened with iniquity.
And whoever has done good deeds while being a believer will not fear injustice or oppression.
Thus We sent down a Qur'an in Arabic, and We multiplied threats in it, so that they would become pious or it would encourage them to exhort each other.
May Allah, the True Ruler, be exalted. Do not hasten the Qur'an until it has been revealed to you. And say, "O my Lord, increase my knowledge."
For We have previously given a counsel to Adam; but he forgot; and We have not found in him a firm resolution.
And when We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," they prostrated themselves, except Iblis, who refused.
Then We said, "O Adam, this one is indeed an enemy to you and your wife. Take care that he takes you out of Paradise, for then you will be unhappy.
For you will not hunger or be naked,
you will not thirst there nor be struck by the heat of the sun."
Then the Devil tempted him, saying, "O Adam, shall I point out to you the tree of eternity and an imperishable kingdom?"
Both of them (Adam and Eve) ate of it. Then their nakedness appeared to them. They began to cover themselves with leaves of paradise. Adam thus disobeyed his Lord and went astray.
His Lord then elected him, accepted his repentance, and guided him.
He said, "Come down from here, (Adam and Eve), [You will be] all (with your descendants) enemies of one another. Then, if ever a guide comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guide will not go astray or be miserable.
And whoever turns away from My Remembrance, will indeed lead a life full of embarrassment, and on the Day of Resurrection We will bring him blind to the gathering."
He'll say, "O my Lord, why did You bring me blind when I could see before?"
[Allah] will say to him: "As Our Signs (teachings) came to you and you have forgotten them, so today you are forgotten."
Thus we punish the outrageous who does not believe in the revelations of his Lord. And certainly, the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more lasting.
Has it not served as a direction for them that We have destroyed before them so many generations in whose mansions they now walk? These are lessons for those endowed with intelligence!
Had it not been for a previous decree of your Lord, and also a term already fixed, (their punishment) would have been inevitable (and immediate).
Bear patiently with what they say and praise His praise, before sunrise, before sunset, and during the night; and exalts His glory at the ends of the day. Maybe you'll be satisfied:
And do not turn your eyes to that which We have given temporary enjoyment to certain groups of them, as a backdrop to the present life, in order to test them by it. What Allah provides (in Paradise) is better and more lasting.
And command your family to be salah, and do it with perseverance. We do not ask you for food, but it is for Us to feed you. The good end is reserved for piety.
And they say, "Why doesn't he bring us a miracle from his Lord? Has not the Proof (the Qur'an) of what is contained in the ancient Scriptures come to them?
And if We had put them to death by punishment before him [Muhammad], they would certainly have said, "O our Lord, why did You not send us a Messenger? Then we would have followed Your teachings before we were humbled and cast into ignominy."
Say: "Everyone is waiting. Wait! You will soon know who are the right people and who are the rightly guided."
[The deadline] for the settlement of their account is approaching for men, while in their carelessness they turn away from it.
No recent reminder [of revelation] comes to them from their Lord, unless they hear it in amusement,
their distracted hearts; and the unrighteous hold secret conversations and say, "Is this just a human being like you? Are you going to indulge in magic when you see clearly?"
He replied, "My Lord knows all that is said in heaven and on earth; and He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing."
But they said, "This is a heap of dreams! Or He invented it. Or, he's more of a poet. Let him therefore bring us a sign [identical] with which the first envoys were charged."
Not one of the cities which We destroyed before them believed [at the sight of miracles]. Will they believe?
We have sent before you only men to whom We made revelations. Ask the scholars of the Book, if you don't know.
And We did not make them bodies that did not consume food. And they were not eternal.
Then We fulfilled the promise (made to them). We saved them with those whom We wished to save. And We put to death the outrageous.
We have certainly sent down to you a book containing your memory [or your fame]. Don't you understand?
And how many cities that have committed injustices, We have broken; and We have created other peoples after them.
When [these people] felt Our rigor, they fled hastily.
Do not gallop. Rather, return to the great luxury where you were and to your homes, that you may be questioned.
They said, "Woe to us! We were really unfair."
Such was their lamentation until We had reaped and extinguished them.
It is not for fun that We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them.
If We had wanted to take a distraction, We would have taken it of Our own accord, if We really wanted to do it.
On the contrary, We hurl against the false the truth that subjugates it, and there it disappears. And woe to you for what you attribute [unjustly to Allah].
To Him alone belong all those who are in heaven and on earth. Those who are with Him [the Angels] do not consider themselves too great to worship Him, nor do they tire of it.
They exalt His glory night and day and do not stop.
Have they taken deities who can raise (the dead) from the earth?
If there were gods in heaven and earth other than Allah, both would be in disorder. Glory, therefore, to Allah, Lord of the Throne; He is above what they attribute to Him!
He is not questioned about what He does, but they are the ones who will have to give an account.
Did they take deities apart from Him? Say: "Bring your proof." This is the revelation of those who are with me and of those who were before me. But most of them do not know the truth and deviate from it.
And We have not sent any Messenger before you to whom We have not revealed: "There is no god but Me. Worship Me, then."
And they said, "The Most Merciful has given himself a child." Purity to Him! But they are rather honored servants.
They do not anticipate His Commandment and act according to His commands.
He knows what is in front of them and what is behind them. And they intercede only on behalf of those whom He has accepted [while being] imbued with His fear.
And whoever of them would say, "I'm a god besides Him." We will repay him from Hell. This is how We reward the wrongdoers.
Did not those who disbelieved see that the heavens and the earth formed a compact mass? Then We separated them and made water every living thing. Will they not believe?
And We have set firm mountains in the earth, that it may not be shaken by dragging them down. And We have placed defiles on them to serve as paths so that they can guide each other.
And We have made heaven a protected roof. And yet they turn away from its wonders.
And it is He who created night and day, the sun and the moon; each one sailing in an orbit.
And We have not attributed immortality to any man before you. If you die, will they be eternal?
Every soul must taste death. We will try you with evil and with good [as] a temptation. And it is to Us that you will be brought back.
When the disbelievers see you, they only mock you (saying): "What! Is this the one who speaks ill of your gods?" And they deny [any] reminder of the Most Merciful.
Man was created prompt in his nature. I will show you My signs [the fulfillment of My threats]. Do not hasten me, then.
And they say, "When will this promise be made, if you are truthful?"
If only the disbelievers knew the time when they would not be able to prevent the fire from their faces and backs, and when they would not be helped.
But no, it will come to them suddenly and they will be amazed; they will not be able to repel him and they will not be given a break.
Messengers who came before you have been mocked. And those who mocked them were struck on all sides by the very object of their mockery.
Say: "Who protects you night and day from the [chastisement] of the Most Merciful?" Yet they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.
Do they then have deities besides Us who can protect them? But they can neither help themselves nor be assisted against Us.
On the contrary, We have granted [temporary] enjoyment to these as to their ancestors until an advanced age. Do they not see that We are coming to the earth, which We are reducing on all sides? Will they then be the winners?
Say: "I warn you by what is revealed to me." The deaf, however, do not hear the call when they are warned.
If a breath of your Lord's chastisement touched them, then they would say, "Woe to us! We were really unfair."
On the Day of Resurrection, We will set the right scales. No soul will be harmed in anything, even by the weight of a mustard seed that We will bring in. We are more than enough to draw up the accounts.
We have already brought to Moses and Aaron the Book of Discernment (the Torah) and a light and a reminder for the righteous,
who fear their Lord even though they do not see Him, and fear the Hour (the end of the world).
And this [the Qur'an] is a blessed reminder that We have sent down. Are you going to deny him?
Indeed, We have previously put Abraham on the right path. And We were well aware of it.
When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are attached?"
they said, "We found our ancestors worshipping them."
He says, "Surely you and your ancestors have been in a manifest error."
They said, "Are you coming to us with the truth, or are you joking?"
He said, "But your Lord is rather the Lord of heaven and earth, and He created them. And I am one of those who testify to this.
And by Allah! I will certainly be cunning against your idols once you are gone."
He tore them to pieces, except for the largest [statue]. Maybe they would come back to her.
They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He is certainly among the unjust."
(Some) said, "We have heard a young man speak ill of them; his name is Abraham."
They said, "Bring him before the eyes of the people so that they can testify.
(Then) they said, "Is it you who did this to our gods, Abraham?"
He said, "This is the greatest of them that has done it. Ask them, then, if they can speak."
Then they changed their minds and said to one another, "You are the truly unrighteous."
Then they turned around and said, "You know very well that these do not speak."
He said: "Worship yourselves, then, apart from Allah, which can neither benefit nor harm you.
Forget you and what you worship besides Allah! Are you not reasoning?"
They said, "Burn it. Help your gods if you want to do something (for them)."
We said, "O fire, be a salutary freshness to Abraham."
They wanted to cunning against him, but it was they whom We made the greatest losers.
And We rescued him and Lot to a land which We had blessed for the whole universe.
And We gave him Isaac and, moreover, Jacob, whom We made good men.
We made them leaders who guided by Our order. And We revealed to them to do good, to perform the prayer, and to pay Zakat. And they were Our worshippers.
And Lot! We have brought him the ability to judge and to know it, and We have saved him from the city where vices were committed; These people were really evil people, perverts.
and We have brought him into Our mercy. He was truly one of the good people.
And Noah, when he called before. We heard him and saved him and his family from great anguish,
and We helped him against the people who treated Our wonders as lies. They were truly people of evil. So we drowned them all.
And David, and Solomon, when they had to judge about a cultivated field where some sheep belonging to a tribe had gone to graze at night. And We witnessed their judgment.
We made it clear to Solomon. And to each We gave the faculty of judgment and knowledge. And We enslaved the mountains to exalt Our glory with David, as well as the birds. And We are the Doer.
We taught him (David) how to make chainmail so that it would protect you from your mutual violence (war). So are you grateful for that?
And (We subdued) to Solomon the rushing wind which, by his command, went to the land which We had blessed. And We are able to know everything,
and among the devils there were some who dived for him and did other work, and We watched over them Ourselves.
And Job, when he implored his Lord, said: "Evil has touched me. But you are the most merciful of the merciful"!
We heard him, took away the evil he had, restored to him his own and as much as they did with them, out of mercy on Our part and as a reminder to the worshippers.
And Ishmael, Idris, and Dûl-Kifl! who were all enduring;
whom We brought into Our mercy, for they were truly of the good.
And Dû'n-Nûn (Jonah) when he left, angry. He thought that We were not going to test him. Then he made the following call in the darkness: "No god but You! Purity to You! I was truly among the unjust."
We heard him and saved him from his anguish. And this is how We save believers.
And Zechariah, when he implored his Lord, "Do not leave me alone, Lord, when You are the best of heirs."
We heard him, gave him Yahya, and healed his wife. They worked together for good and invoked Us out of love and fear. And they were humble before Us.
And the one [the virgin Mary] who had preserved her chastity! We breathed into her a breath (of life) from Us and made her and her son a sign [miracle] for the universe.
Certainly, this community of yours is a unique community, and I am your Lord. Worship Me, then.
They have divided into sects. But all will return to Us.
Whoever does good deeds while believing, his effort will not be disregarded, and We record it for him.
It is forbidden [the inhabitants] of a city that We have destroyed to return [to the life of this world]!
Until the Yajuj and the Majuj are released and they rush from every height;
it is then that the true promise will draw near, while the eyes of those who have disbelieved are fixed: "Woe to us! We have been inattentive to this. Moreover, we were unjust."
"You and what you worshipped besides Allah will be the fuel of Hell, you will all go there.
If these were really divinities, they would not enter it; and all will dwell there forever.
They will groan in it, and hear nothing.
Those who were previously promised handsome rewards from Us will be excluded.
They will not hear his hissing and will enjoy eternally what their souls desire.
The great terror will not afflict them, and the Angels will welcome them: "This is the day that has been promised to you."
The day when We will fold the sky as one folds the roll of books. Just as We began the first creation, so We will repeat it; it is a promise that is incumbent upon Us and We will fulfill it!
And We have indeed written in the Zabur, after having mentioned it (in the Heavenly Book), that the earth will be inherited by My good servants."
In this [these teachings] there is a communication to a people of worshippers!
And We have sent you only in mercy for the universe.
Say: "This is what is revealed to me: Your God is one God; Are you submissive?" [determined to embrace Islam]
If they then turn away, then say, "I have warned you in all fairness; I do not know whether what is promised to you is near or far.
He knows what you say out loud and what you hide.
And I don't know; This may be a temptation for you and a pleasure for a while"!
He said, "Lord, judge in all justice! And Our Lord, the Most Merciful, it is He whose help is implored against your assertions."
O men! Fear your Lord. The earthquake [that will precede] the Hour is a terrible thing.
On the day you see him, every nurse will forget what she was suckling, and every pregnant female will abort what she was wearing. And you will see people drunk, when they are not. But Allah's punishment is harsh.
And there are people who argue about Allah without any knowledge, and who follow every rebellious devil.
It has been ordained with regard to the latter that he shall lead astray whoever takes him as his master, and that he shall guide him to the punishment of the furnace.
O men! If you doubt about the Resurrection, It is We Who created you from earth, then from a drop of semen, then from an adhesion, then from a [normally] formed as well as formless embryo to show you [Our Omnipotence] and We will deposit in the wombs what We want until a fixed term. Then We will take you out of you as a baby, so that you may then reach maturity. There are some among you who die [young] while others reach the lowest of years, so that they no longer know anything of what they knew before. In the same way you see the parched earth: as soon as We bring water down into it, it stirs up, swells, and causes all kinds of splendid pairs of vegetables to grow.
This is so because Allah is the truth; and it is He who restores life to the dead; and it is He who is Omnipotent.
And that the Hour will come; There is no doubt about it, and that Allah will raise up those who are in the tombs.
However, there are people who argue about Allah without any knowledge, no guide, and no Book to enlighten them.
displaying a proud attitude to lead people astray from the path of Allah. To him is the ignominy here below; and We will make Him taste the Day of Resurrection, the punishment of the furnace.
This is what your two hands have prepared (here below)! However, Allah is not unjust to His servants.
There are some people who worship Allah marginally. If anything good happens to them, they are at ease, and if a trial happens to them, they turn away their faces, thus losing (the good) of the here and hereafter. Such is the obvious loss!
They supplicate apart from Allah, which can neither harm nor benefit them. Such is the profound delusion!
They invoke what evil is certainly closer to than usefulness. What a bad ally, and what a bad companion!
Those who believe and do good deeds, Allah brings them into the Gardens under which the streams flow, for Allah does what He wills.
Whoever thinks that Allah will not help him in this world and in the Hereafter, let him stretch a rope to heaven and cut it, and see if his cunning will make what enrages him disappear.
This is how We sent it down in clear verses and Allah guides whomever He wills.
Verily, those who believed, the Jews, the Sabaeans, the Nazarenes, the Magi, and those who give Allah partners, Allah will decide between them on the Day of Judgment, for Allah is indeed the witness of all things.
Have you not seen that all those who are in the heavens and all those who are on the earth, the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the animals, and many people, bow down to Allah? There are also many who deserve punishment. And whoever degrades Allah has no one to honor him, for Allah does what He wills.
Here are two opposing clans who were arguing about their Lord. To those who do not believe, they will cut clothes of fire, while boiling water will be poured over their heads,
who will melt what is in their bellies as well as their skins.
And there will be iron mallets for them.
Whenever they want to get out of it (to escape) distress, they are to be put back into it and (it is said to them): "Taste the punishment of the Furnace.
Verily, Allah introduces those who believe and do good deeds to the Gardens under which the streams flow. There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, and also with pearls; and their garments shall be of silk.
They were guided to the good word and they were guided to the path of the Worthy of praise.
But those who disbelieve and obstruct the path of Allah and the path of the Holy Mosque, which We have established for the people, both residents and those passing through... Whoever seeks to commit a sacrilege unjustly, We will make him taste a painful punishment,
And when We pointed out for Abraham the place of the House (the Kaaba) [saying to him]: "Do not associate anything with Me; and purify My House for those who walk around it, for those who stand in it, and for those who bow and bow down in it."
And make an announcement to the people for the Hajj. They will come to you on foot, and also on every horse, coming from every distant way,
to share in the benefits bestowed upon them and to invoke the name of Allah on the appointed days, over the livestock that He has assigned to them, "Eat of it yourselves and make the needy wretch eat it.
Then let them put an end to their prohibitions (cleanse their bodies), let them fulfill their vows, and let them make the circuits around the Ancient House."
This is what must be observed, and whoever holds the sacred limits of Allah in high regard, it will be better for him with his Lord. Cattle, except what you have been told, have been made lawful for you. Abstain from the defilement of idols and abstain from lying words.
Exclusively [be committed to the religion] of Allah, do not associate anything with Him; for whoever associates with Allah is as if he fell from the sky and the birds caught him, or the wind threw him into a very deep abyss.
This is [what is prescribed]. And whoever exalts the sacred injunctions of Allah, is indeed inspired by the piety of hearts.
[From these beasts] you derive advantages until a fixed term; then his place of immolation is near the Ancient House.
We have assigned a sacrificial rite to each of our communities, so that they may pronounce the name of Allah on the livestock that He has assigned to them. Your God is indeed a unique God. Submit therefore to Him. And give good news to those who humble themselves,
those whose hearts tremble when the name of Allah is mentioned, those who endure what comes to them, and those who perform Salah and spend what We have allotted to them.
We have appointed for you healthy camels (and cows) for certain rites established by Allah. There is a good in them for you. Therefore pronounce the name of Allah upon them, when they have had their paws tied, [ready to be slain]. Then, when they lie on their sides, eat of them, and feed them to the discreet needy and the beggar. So We have made them subject to you so that you may be grateful.
Neither their flesh nor their blood will reach Allah, but what affects Him from you is piety. Thus He has subdued them to you so that you may proclaim the greatness of Allah, for having set you on the right path. And proclaims the good news to the beneficents.
Allah defends those who believe. Allah does not love any ungrateful traitor.
Permission is given to those who are attacked (to defend themselves) - because they are really wronged; and Allah is indeed able to help them.
those who were expelled from their homes, - against all justice, simply because they said, "Allah is our Lord." - If Allah did not repel people one by one, the hermitages would be demolished, as well as the churches, synagogues and mosques where the name of Allah is invoked a lot. Verily, Allah supports those who uphold (His Religion). Verily, Allah is Mighty and Mighty,
those who, if We give them power on earth, perform Salah, pay Zakat, ordain what is proper, and forbid what is blameworthy. However, the final outcome of all things belongs to Allah.
And if they call you a liar, [know that] the people of Noah, the 'Aad, the Tamûd before them, also cried falsehood,
as well as the people of Abraham, the people of Lot.
and the people of Madyan. And Moses was called a liar. Then I gave respite to the disbelievers; then I took them. And what was My reprobation!
How many cities, then, have We put to death, because they committed tyrannies. They are reduced to collapsed roofs: what deserted wells! How many palaces have been built (and deserted too)!
Why do they not travel on earth that they may have hearts to understand, and ears to hear? For it is not the eyes that are blinded, but the hearts in the breasts that are blinded.
And they ask you to hasten [the coming] of the chastisement. Allah will never fail in His promise. However, one day with your Lord is equivalent to a thousand years of what you count.
How many cities have I not given respite when they committed tyrannies? Then I grabbed them. To Me is becoming.
Say: "O men! I am only an explicit warning to you."
Therefore those who believe and do good works will have forgiveness and generous favors,
while those who strive to escape (the punishment mentioned in) Our verses, these are the people of Hell.
We have not sent a Messenger or a prophet before you who did not recite (what was revealed to him) without the Devil trying to intervene [to sow doubt in the hearts of the people about] his recitation. Allah abrogates what the Devil suggests, and Allah strengthens His verses. Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
To make a temptation to those who have a heart disease and those who are hard-hearted out of what the Devil casts... The unjust are certainly in a deep schism.
And so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that (the Qur'an) is indeed the Truth from your Lord, let them then believe in it, and let their hearts submit to it in all humility. Verily, Allah guides those who believe to the right path.
And those who disbelieve will not cease to doubt him, until the Hour overtakes them unexpectedly or the punishment of a terrifying day overtakes them.
The sovereignty on that day will belong to Allah who will judge among them. Those who have believed and done good works will be in the Gardens of Delight,
and as for the infidels who have treated Our revelations as lies, they will have a degrading punishment!
Those who emigrate in the cause of Allah and are killed or die, Allah will indeed give them a great reward, for Allah is the best of givers.
Verily, He will bring them into a place that they are pleased with, and Allah is All-Knowing and Forgiving.
So it is. Whoever punishes in the same way that he was punished, and then he is the victim of a new insult, Allah will help him, for Allah is certainly the Absolutor and Forgiver.
This is how Allah brings night into day, and brings day into night. Verily, Allah is the Hearer and the Clairvoyant.
Thus Allah is the True, while what they invoke besides Him is false; Allah is the Exalted, the Great.
Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from heaven, and then the earth becomes green? Allah is Full of Kindness and Knower.
To Him belongs what is in heaven and on earth. Allah is the only One who is sufficient to Himself and is the One Worthy of praise.
Have you not seen that Allah has subdued to you all that is on the earth and the ship that sails on the sea by His command? He holds back the heavens from falling to the earth, except when He allows it. For Allah is full of kindness and mercy toward men.
It is He who gives you life, then gives you death, then makes you live again. Truly man is very ungrateful!
To each community We have assigned a worship to follow. Let them not dispute with you what they have received! And call to your Lord. You are certainly on a straight path.
And if they argue with you, then say, "Allah knows best what you are doing.
Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection what you disagree with."
Do you not know that Allah knows what is in heaven and on earth? All this is in a Book, and it is very easy for Allah.
And they worship besides Allah that in which He has sent down no evidence and of which they have no knowledge. And there will be no protector for the unrighteous.
And when Our clear verses are recited to them, you will discern the reprobation on the faces of those who have disbelieved. They are very far from throwing themselves at those who recite Our verses to them. Say: "Shall I inform you of something more terrible? - Fire: Allah has promised it to those who have disbelieved. And what a sad future!"
O men! A parable is proposed to you, listen to it: "Those whom you invoke apart from Allah would not even be able to create a fly, even if they were to unite for it. And if the fly robbed them of anything, they could not take it back from it. The solicitor and the solicited are [equally] weak!"
They did not value Allah at His true value; Verily, Allah is Mighty and Mighty.
Allah chooses messengers from among the angels and from among men. Allah is Hearing and Clairvoyant.
He knows what is in front of them and behind them. And it is to Allah that everything will return.
O you who believe! Bow down, bow down, worship your Lord, and do good. Maybe you will succeed!
And fight for Allah with all the effort He deserves. It is He who has chosen you; and He has not imposed any hindrance on you in the religion of your father Abraham, who has already called you "Muslims" before (this Book) and in this (Book), so that the Messenger may be a witness against you, and that you yourselves may be witnesses against the people. So perform Salah, pay Zakat, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Master. What an excellent master! And what a great support!
Blessed are the believers,
those who are humble in their salat,
who turn away from trivialities,
who pay Zakat,
and who preserve their sexes [from all intercourse],
except with their wives or the slaves they own, for there really they cannot be blamed;
whereas those who seek beyond these limits are transgressors;
and who see to the safeguarding of the deposits entrusted to them and honour their commitments,
and who strictly observe their Salah.
They are the heirs,
who will inherit Paradise to dwell there forever.
We have certainly created man from an extract of clay.
then We made a drop of semen out of it in a solid altar.
Then We made the sperm an adhesion; and adhesion We have created an embryo; and from this embryo We created bones and clothed the bones with flesh. Then We turned it into a completely different creation. Glory be to Allah, the Best of Creators!
And then, after that, you will die.
And then on the Day of Resurrection you will be resurrected.
We have created seven heavens above you. And We are not inattentive to creation.
And We have brought down the water from heaven in measure. Then We kept it in the earth, while We are quite capable of making it disappear.
With it We have produced for you gardens of palm trees and vines, in which you have abundant fruit and from which you eat,
as well as a tree (the olive tree) that grows on Mount Sinai, producing the oil used for anointing and where the eaters dip their bread.
You certainly have a subject for meditation in cattle. We give you to drink of what they have in their belly, and you will also find many uses in them; and you feed off it.
On them as well as on ships you are transported.
We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people, worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him. Are you not afraid of [him]?"
Then the leaders of his people who had disbelieved said: "This is only a human being like you, who wants to distinguish himself to your detriment. If Allah had willed, He would have sent down angels. We have never heard this from our most remote ancestors.
He is really only a man afflicted with madness, so watch him for a while.
He said, "Lord! Help me because they call me a liar."
We revealed to him: "Build the ark before Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And when Our commandment comes, and the oven is boiling, bring in a couple of every kind, and your family, except those of them against whom the word has already been spoken; and do not speak to Me about the unrighteous, for they will be fatally drowned.
And when you and those who are with you are seated in the ark, say: "Praise be to Allah who has saved us from the people of the unjust."
And say, "Lord, bring me ashore from a blessed landing. You are the One who brings the best landing."
These are indeed signs. We are certainly the One who experiences.
And after them We created other generations,
We sent a Messenger from among them to say to them: "Worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him. Are you not afraid of him?"
The leaders of his people who had disbelieved and dismissed the encounter with the Hereafter, and to whom We had granted luxury in this life, said: "This is only a human being like you, eating of what you eat, and drinking of what you drink.
If you obey a man like you, then you will lose.
Does he promise you, when you are dead, and turned to dust and bones, that you will have come out [of your graves]?
Far, far, what we promise you!
This is only our present life: we die and we live; and we will never be resurrected.
It is only a man who forges a lie against Allah; and we will not believe in him."
He said, "Lord! Help me because they call me a liar."
[Allah] says: "Yes, soon they will come to regret."
The cry, therefore, seizes them in all justice; then We made them like debris carried away by the torrent. May the unrighteous disappear forever!
Then after them We created other generations.
No community can advance or postpone its end.
Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Whenever a messenger came to his community, they called him a liar. And We made them succeed one another [in destruction], and We made them the themes of legendary tales. May the people who do not believe disappear forever!
Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our wonders and clear proof,
to Pharaoh and his nobles, but they were puffed up with pride: they were haughty people.
They said, "Shall we believe in two men like us, whose fellows are our slaves?"
They called them [both] liars, and so they were among the destroyed.
And We brought the Book to Moses for guidance.
And We made a miracle of the son of Mary, as well as of his mother; and We gave refuge to both of them on a stable hill with a spring.
O Messengers! Eat of what is permissible and pleasant and do good. For I know perfectly well what you are doing.
This community, yours, is one community, while I am your Lord. Fear Me, then."
But they divided into sects, each sect exulting in what it held.
Leave them in their wandering for a while.
Do they think that what We grant them, in goods and children,
[i.e., an advance] that We hasten to make to them on the goods [of the future life]? On the contrary, they are not aware of it.
Those who, by the fear of their Lord, are penetrated,
who believe in the verses of their Lord,
who associate nothing with their Lord,
who give what they give, while their hearts are full of fear [at the thought] that they must return to their Lord.
These people rush to good deeds and are the first to perform them.
We impose on no one except according to his ability. And with Us there is a Book that speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged.
But their hearts remain in ignorance of this [the Qur'an]. [In addition] they have other (vile) deeds that they perform,
until by punishment We seize the wealthiest among them, and behold, they cry out for help.
"Don't shout today. No one will protect you from Us.
My verses were recited to you before; but you turned away from it,
puffing themselves up with pride, and you would denigrate them during your vigils."
Do they not meditate on the word (the Qur'an)? Or did they come to what never came to their first ancestors?
Or did they not know their Messenger to the point of denying him?
Or will they say, "He's crazy?" On the contrary, it is the truth that he has brought them. And most of them disdain the truth.
If the truth were in accordance with their passions, the heavens and the earth and those in them would certainly be corrupt. On the contrary, We have given them their reminder. But they turn away from it.
Or do you ask them for a reward? But the reward of your Lord is better. And He is the Best of Providers.
And you are calling them, indeed, to the right path.
However, those who do not believe in the hereafter are far removed from this path.
If We were to show them mercy and remove evil from them, they would certainly persist in their transgression, confused and hesitant.
We have indeed seized them with the punishment, but they have not submitted to their Lord; as they do not beseech [Him],
until the day when We open a door to harsh punishment for them, and behold, they will be in despair.
And it is He who has created for you hearing, eyes and hearts. But you're rarely grateful.
It is He who has spread you over the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
And it is He who gives life and gives death; and the alternation of night and day depends on Him. Will you not then reason?
They rather said the same things as the elders.
They said, "When we are dead and are dust and bones, will we really be resurrected?
We were promised this, as well as our ancestors before; It's just old nonsense."
Say: "To whom belongs the earth and those who are on it? if you know."
They will say: "To Allah". Say: "Don't you remember?"
Say: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the sublime throne?"
They will say: "To Allah." Say: "Are you not afraid?"
Say: "Who holds in his hand the absolute kingship of all things, and who protects and does not need to be protected? [Say], if you know!"
They will say, "Allah." Say: "How is it that you are bewitched?" [to the point of not believing in Him].
Rather, we have brought them the truth and they are certainly liars.
Allah has not given Himself a child, and there is no god with Him; otherwise, each deity would go away with what he has created, and some would be superior to the others. (Glory and purity) to Allah! He is Superior to all that they describe.
[It is] Knower of all things visible and invisible! He is far above what they associate with Him!
Say, "Lord, if You ever show me what is promised to them;
so, Lord, do not place me among the unrighteous people.
We are able, indeed, to show you what We promise them.
Repels evil with what is better. We know very well what they are describing.
And say, "Lord, I seek Your protection, from the incitements of the devils.
and I seek Your protection, O Lord, from their presence with me."
... Then, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord! Bring me back (to earth),
so that I may do good in what I was abandoning." No, it is simply a word that he says. Behind them, however, there is a barrier, until the day they are resurrected."
Then when the Trunk is blown, there will be no kinship between them that day, and they will not ask each other any questions.
Those whose scales are heavy will be the blessed;
and those whose scales are light will be those who have ruined their own souls and they will remain eternally in Hell.
The fire will burn their faces and their lips will be clenched.
"Were not my verses recited to you and you called them lies?"
They said, "Lord! Our misfortune overcame us, and we were misguided people.
Lord, bring us out of it! And if we reoffend, then we will be unjust."
He said, "Be repressed (humiliated) and speak no more to Me."
There was a group of My servants who said, "Lord, we believe; forgive us, therefore, and show us mercy, for You are the best of the Merciful."
but you took them in mockery to the point of forgetting to invoke Me, and you laughed at them.
Truly, I have rewarded them today for what they have endured; and they are the triumphant.
He'll say, "How many years have you been on earth?"
They'll say, "We stayed there a day, or part of a day. Ask those who matter."
He will say, "You have only stayed there for a short time, if you only knew.
Did you think that We had created you aimlessly, and that you would not be brought back to Us?"
May Allah, the true Ruler, be exalted. No god but Him, the Lord of the Sublime Throne!
And whoever invokes another god with Allah, without having clear proof [of his existence], will have to give an account of it to his Lord. Verily, the disbelievers will not succeed.
And say, "Lord, forgive and have mercy. You are the Best of the Merciful."
Here is a Surah which We have sent down and imposed, and We have sent down explicit verses in it so that you may remember."
The fornicator and the fornicator, whip them each with a hundred lashes. And do not have mercy on them in the execution of the law of Allah - if you believe in Allah and the Last Day. And that a group of believers witness their punishment.
The fornicator will marry only a fornicator or an associate. And the fornicator shall not be married except by a fornicator or an associate; and this has been forbidden to believers.
And those who make accusations against chaste women without subsequently producing four witnesses, whip them with eighty lashes, and never again accept their testimony. And these are the perverts,
except for those who repent and reform themselves after that, for Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And as for those who make accusations against their own wives without having any witnesses other than themselves, the testimony of one of them must be a fourfold testimony by Allah that he is among the truthful.
and the fifth [testimony] is "may the curse of Allah fall upon him if he is of the liars."
And the punishment [of stoning] will not be inflicted on her if she testifies four times by Allah that he [her husband] is certainly among the liars.
and the fifth [testimony] is that the wrath of Allah be upon her, if he were of the truthful.
And were it not for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy...! Allah is Great, Welcoming to repentance and Wise!
Those who came with the slander are a group of you. Don't think it's bad for you, but rather, it's good for you. To each of them what he has acquired as a sin. Whoever among them has taken on the greater part will have an enormous punishment.
Why, when you heard it, did not the believers in themselves conjecture favorably, and say, "This is an obvious calumny?"
Why didn't they call four witnesses? If they do not produce witnesses, then they are liars in the sight of Allah.
Had it not been for Allah's grace upon you and His mercy here and hereafter, a great punishment would have come upon you for this (slander) in which you have embarked,
when you spread the news with your tongues and said with your mouths what you had no knowledge of; and you counted it as insignificant, whereas in the eyes of Allah it is enormous.
And why, when you heard it, didn't you say, "We must not talk about it. Glory be to You (O Allah)! It's a huge slander"?
Allah exhorts you never to return to such a thing again if you are believers.
Allah clearly states the verses to you, and Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
Those who love the spread of turpitude among believers will have a painful punishment, both here and hereafter. Allah knows, and you do not know.
And if it had not been for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy, and (had it not been) that Allah is Merciful and Merciful...
O you who have believed! Don't follow in the footsteps of the Devil. Whoever follows in the footsteps of the Devil, [know that] he commands turpitude and blameworthiness. And had it not been for Allah's grace to you and His mercy, none of you would ever have been pure. But Allah purifies whomever He wills. And Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
