And let the holders of wealth and wealth among you not swear not to give any more to relatives, to the poor, and to those who emigrate in the cause of Allah. Let them forgive and absolve. Do you not like Allah to forgive you? and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful!
Those who make accusations against virtuous, chaste women [who do not even think of committing turpitude] and believers are cursed in this world as well as in the Hereafter; and they will have a great chastisement,
The day when their tongues, hands and feet will testify against them for what they were doing.
On that Day, Allah will give them their full and true reward; and they will know that Allah is the Truth.
The bad [women] to the bad [men], and the bad [men] to the bad [women]. In the same way, the good [women] to the good [men], and the good [men] to the good [women]. These are innocent of what others say. They have forgiveness and a generous reward.
O you who believe! Do not enter houses other than your own until you ask permission and greet their inhabitants. This is better for you. Maybe you remember.
If you do not find anyone there, then do not enter until permission is given to you. And if you say, "Go back," why, go back. This is purer for you. And Allah, of what you do, is All-Knowing.
There is no grievance against you for entering uninhabited houses where there is property for you. Allah knows what you divulge and what you hide.
Tell the believers to lower their eyes and keep their chastity. It's purer for them. Verily, Allah is Knower of what they do.
And tell the believing women to lower their eyes, to keep their chastity, and to show of their finery only what appears to be so, and to fold their veil over their breasts; and that they show their finery only to their husbands, or to their fathers, or to their husbands' fathers, or to their sons, or to their husbands' sons, or to their brothers, or to their brothers' sons, or to their sisters' sons, or to Muslim women, or to the slaves they own, or to the helpless male servants,  or to prepubescent boys who know nothing about the hidden parts of women. And let them not strike with their feet, so that it may be known what they hide from their adornments. And repent all of you to Allah, O believers, so that you may reap success.
Marry the bachelors among you and the good people among your slaves, men and women. If they are needy, Allah will make them rich by His grace. For Allah is immense and He is All-Knowing.
And let those who have no means of marrying seek to remain chaste until Allah makes them rich by His grace. Those of your slaves who seek a contract of emancipation, conclude this contract with them if you recognize any good in them; and give them the goods of Allah that He has bestowed upon you. And in your pursuit of the transient profits of this life, do not compel your slave wives into prostitution, if they wish to remain chaste. If they are forced to do so, Allah grants them His forgiveness and mercy after they have been compelled.
We have indeed sent down to you clear verses, giving a parable of those who lived before you, and an exhortation for the righteous!
Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. Its light is similar to a niche where there is a lamp. The lamp is in a crystal (container) and it resembles a star of great brilliance; Its fuel comes from a blessed tree: an olive tree that is neither Eastern nor Western whose oil seems to light up without the fire even touching it. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whomever He wills. Allah offers men parables and Allah is All-Knowing.
In houses [mosques] that Allah has allowed to be raised, and where His Name is invoked; Glorify Him in them morning and afternoon,
men who are not distracted by trade or barter from the invocation of Allah, the performance of Salat and the payment of Zakat, and who fear a Day when hearts will be turned upside down as well as eyes.
So that Allah may reward them in the best way for what they have done. And He'll add His grace to them. Allah assigns to whom He wills without counting.
As for those who have disbelieved, their actions are like a mirage in a desert plain that the thirsty take for water. Then when he arrives, he realizes that it was nothing; but there Allah finds Him who settles his account in full, for Allah is quick to count.
[The deeds of the disbelievers] are also like darkness on a deep sea: waves cover it, [waves] above which rise [other] waves, on which there are [thick] clouds. Darkness [heaped up] one on top of the other. When someone stretches out his hand, he hardly distinguishes it. Whoever Allah deprives of light has no light.
Have you not seen that Allah is glorified by all who are in the heavens and the earth; as well as by the birds spreading their wings? Everyone, of course, has learned his way of worshipping and glorifying Him. Allah knows perfectly well what they are doing.
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And to Allah will be the final return.
Have you not seen that Allah pushes the clouds? Then He gathers them together and makes a heap of them, and you see the rain coming out of His womb. And He sends down from heaven hail [from] clouds [likened] to mountains. He strikes whomever He wills and removes it from whomever He wills. The brilliance of its lightning is very far from delighting the sight.
Allah alternates night and day. This is a matter for reflection for those who have eyes.
And Allah created every animal out of water. Some walk on their stomachs, others walk on two legs, and still others walk on four. Allah creates what He wills and Allah is Omnipotent.
We have certainly sent down explicit verses. And Allah guides whomever He wills to a straight path.
And they say, "We believe in Allah and the Messenger and we obey." Then after that, some of them do an about-face. These are not the believers.
And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge among them, behold, some of them depart.
But if they have the right in their favor, they come to him, submissive.
Is there a disease in their hearts? Or do they doubt? Or do they fear that Allah will oppress them and His Messenger? No!... but they are the unjust.
The only word of the believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge among them, is: "We have heard and we have obeyed." And these are the ones who succeed.
And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah and fears Him... So, here are the ones who reap success.
And they swear by Allah in solemn oaths that if you commanded them, they would certainly go out (to battle). Say: "Do not swear. [Your] [verbal] obedience is well known. Allah is Knower of what you do."
Say: "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. If they turn away, ... he [the messenger] is then responsible only for what he is responsible for; and you assume what you are responsible for. And if you obey him, you will be well guided." And it is only incumbent on the messenger to convey explicitly (his message).
Allah has promised those of you who have believed and done good deeds that He will give them succession on earth as He gave it to those who came before them. He would give strength and supremacy to their religion, which He has approved for them. It would turn their old fear into security. They worship Me and do not associate anything with Me, and the one who disbelieves afterwards is the pervert.
Perform Salah, pay Zakat, and obey the Messenger, so that you may have mercy.
Do not think that those who do not believe can oppose the authority of Allah on earth. Fire will be their refuge. What a bad destination.
O you who have believed! Let the slaves you own ask your permission before entering, as well as those of your own who have not yet reached puberty, at three times: before the dawn salat, at noon when you take off your clothes, and after the night salat; three opportunities to undress. Apart from these moments, there is no reproach to you or them for coming and going, to each other's homes. This is how Allah clearly states His verses to you, and Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission before they come in, as do their elders. This is how Allah clearly states His verses to you, and Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And as for the women who have gone through menopause and no longer hope for marriage, there is no reproach to them for taking off their clothes when they go out, but without showing their finery, and if they seek chastity, it is better for them. Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
There is no hindrance to the blind, the lame, the sick, or yourselves from eating in your own houses, or in the houses of your fathers, or in the houses of your mothers, or of your brothers, or of your sisters, or of your paternal uncles, or of your paternal aunts, or of your maternal uncles, or of your maternal aunts,  or in those of which you possess the keys, or in the houses of your friends. Nor is there any impediment to you from eating together, or separately. Therefore, when you enter houses, greet each other with greetings from Allah, blessed and pleasant. This is how Allah exposes His verses to you, so that you may understand.
The true believers are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and who, when they are in His company on matters of general interest, do not leave until they ask His permission. Those who ask you for this permission are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger. If, therefore, they ask your permission for a personal matter, give it to whomever you want of them; and beg Allah's forgiveness for them, for Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Don't think of the messenger's call as a call to one another. Verily, Allah knows those of your people who go away secretly in secret. Let them, therefore, who oppose his command, take heed that a trial does not come upon them, or that a painful punishment befalls them.
To Allah, indeed, belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. He knows perfectly well the state you are in, and on the Day when men are brought back to Him, He will then inform them of what they were doing. Allah is All-Knowing.
Let the Blessing of Him who sent down the Book of Discernment upon His servant be exalted, that he may be a warner to the universe.
He to whom belongs the kingdom of heaven and earth, who has not given Himself a child, who has no partner in His kingship, and who has created all things by giving them their rightful proportions.
But they have adopted besides Him gods who, being themselves created, create nothing, and who possess neither the faculty of doing evil nor good for themselves, and who are masters neither of death, nor of life, nor of the resurrection.
The disbelievers say: "All this is a lie that he (Muhammad) invented, and where other people helped him." However, they are committing an injustice and a lie.
And they say, "These are the tales of the elders that he has written! We dictate them to him morning and evening!"
Say: "He who knows secrets in heaven and earth has sent down him. And He is Forgiving and Merciful.
And they say, "What is this Messenger who eats food and goes about in the markets? Why was it not that an angel who would have been a warner in his company had been sent down to him?
Or why has a treasure been thrown at him? Or why does he not have a garden of his own, from which he could eat (the fruit)?" The unrighteous say, "You follow only a bewitched man."
See how they compare you to! They have lost their way. They will not be able to find any way.
Blessed be He who, if He wills, will grant you much better than this: Gardens under which the streams flow; and He will assign you castles.
But they have instead called the Hour a lie. We have, however, prepared a burning Flame for anyone who calls the Hour a lie.
When she sees them from afar, they will hear her fury and her fizzes.
And when they have been thrown into it, in a narrow recess, with their hands tied behind their necks, they will then wish for their complete destruction.
"Today, don't want destruction once, but want it several.
Say, "Is this better? or the eternal Paradise which has been promised to the righteous, as a reward and final destination?
They will have there all they desire, and an eternal home. This is a promise incumbent on your Lord.
And on the Day He gathers them and those whom they worshipped besides Allah, He will say, "Are you the ones who have led this My servants astray, or have they themselves lost the path?"
They will say, "Glory to You! It was not fitting for us to take protective patrons besides You, but You have filled them and their ancestors with enjoyment to the point that they have forgotten the Book of Remembrance [the Qur'an]. And they were lost people."
"They have denied you what you say. There will be no escape or (possible) help for you. And whoever of yours is unjust, We will make him taste a great punishment."
And We sent before you only messengers who ate food and went about the markets. And We have made some of you a trial for others – will you endure with constancy? - And your Lord remains a Clairvoyant.
And those who do not hope to meet Us say, "If only angels had been sent down upon us, or if we could see our Lord." Indeed, they have puffed themselves up with pride, and have exceeded the limits of arrogance.
The day they see the Angels, it will not be good news, on that day, for the unrighteous, they (the Angels) will say: "Dam totally forbidden"!
We have considered the work they have done, and We have reduced it to scattered dust.
The people of Paradise will be in a better abode and in the most beautiful place of rest on that day.
And on the day when the sky is split by clouds and angels are sent down,
on that day, true kingship belongs to the Most Merciful, and it will be a difficult day for the infidels.
The day when the unrighteous will bite both his hands and say: "[Alas for me!] If only I had walked the path with the Messenger...
Woe to me! Alas! If only I hadn't taken "so-and-so" as a friend...
For it led me astray from the remembrance [of the Qur'an] after it came to me." And the Devil deserts man (after having tempted him).
And the Messenger said, "Lord, my people have truly taken this Qur'an for a forsaken thing."
Thus We made every prophet an enemy among the criminals. But your Lord is sufficient for a guide and a support.
And those who do not believe say: "Why was the Qur'an not sent down on him at one time?" We have revealed it in this way to strengthen your heart. And We have recited it carefully.
They will not bring you any parables, unless We bring you the truth with the best interpretation.
Those who are dragged [together] on their faces to Hell, these will be in the worst situation and the most led astray from the straight path.
For We brought the Book to Moses and assigned his brother Aaron to be his assistant.
Then We said, "Go both to the people who have called Our proofs a lie." We then destroyed them completely.
And the people of Noah, when they had denied the messengers, We drowned them and made a sign of warning to the people. And We have prepared for the unrighteous a painful punishment.
And the 'Aad, the Thamud, the people of Ar-Rass and many generations in between!
To all, however, We had made parables and destroyed them all in a brutal way.
They passed through the city on which a rain of misfortune fell. Do they not see it? But they do not hope for a resurrection!
And when they see you, they only mock you: "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a Messenger?
He came very close to leading us astray from our divinities, if it were not for our patient attachment to them!" However, they will know when they see the chastisement, which is the most misguided in its way.
Do you not see him who has made his passion his divinity? Is it up to you to be a guarantor for him?
Or do you think most of them hear or understand? They are in truth comparable only to cattle. Or rather, they are still more lost from the path.
Have you not seen how your Lord spreads the shadow? If He had willed, He would have made it immobile. Then We gave him the sun his clue,
then We take it [to bring it back] to Us with ease.
And it is He who made you a garment of night, rest of sleep, and of day a return to active life.
And it was He who sent forth the winds as a proclamation preceding His mercy. We sent down from heaven pure and purifying water,
to revive a dead land through it, and to give drink to the many cattle and men whom We have created.
We had divided it among them so that they might remember (Us). But most people refuse to do anything but be ungrateful.
Now, if We had wished, We would certainly have sent a warner to every city.
Do not obey the infidels; and with this (the Qur'an), fight against them vigorously.
And it is He who gives free rein to the two seas: one sweet, refreshing, the other salty, bitter. And He assigns between the two an intermediate zone and an impassable barrier.
And it is He who created a human species out of water, which He unites by the bonds of kinship and covenant. And your Lord remains Omnipotent.
But they worship apart from Allah, which does not benefit them or harm them. And the unfaithful will always be the ally of the enemies of his Lord!
Now We have sent you only as a herald and a warner.
Say: "I do not ask you for any reward (for myself). However, whoever wants to follow a path leading to his Lord [is free to spend in the way of Allah]."
And place your trust in the Living One who never dies. And by His praise, glorify Him. He is sufficient as a Perfect Knower of the sins of His servants.
It is He who, in six days, created the heavens, the earth and all that exists between them, and the Most Merciful established Himself "Istawa" afterwards on the Throne. Ask therefore who is well informed about Him.
And when they are told, "Prostrate yourselves before the Most Merciful," they say, "What is the Most Merciful? Are we going to bow down to what you command us?" - And this increases their repulsion.
Blessed be He who has placed constellations in heaven and has placed a luminary (the sun) and also an illuminating moon in them.
And it is He who has assigned an alternation of night and day for anyone who wants to reflect on it or show gratitude.
The servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk humbly on earth, who, when the ignorant speak to them, say: "Peace",
who spend the nights prostrate and standing before their Lord;
who say, "Lord, take away from us the punishment of Hell." - for his punishment is permanent.
What a bad lodging and place to stay!
Who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor miserly, but stand in the middle ground.
Who do not invoke any other god with Allah and do not kill the life that Allah has made sacred, except with good reason; who do not commit fornication - for whoever does this will incur punishment
and the punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and there he will remain eternally covered with shame;
except the one who repents, believes, and does a good deed; Allah will change their evil deeds into good, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful;
and whoever repents and does a good deed, it is to Allah that his return will end.
Those who do not give false witness; and who, when they pass by a frivolity, depart from it nobly;
who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not become deaf or blind;
and who say, "Lord, give us joy in our wives and descendants of the eyes, and make us a guide to the pious."
Such will be rewarded with a high place [of Paradise] because of their endurance, and there they will be welcomed with salvation and peace.
to remain there forever. What a beautiful cottage and place to stay!
Say: "My Lord will not care for you without your prayer; but you have denied (the Prophet). Your [chastisement] will be inevitable and permanent.
T'â, Sîn, Mim.
Here are the verses of the Explicit Book.
You may be consumed with grief because they are not believers!
If We wished, We would send down upon them from heaven a prodigy before which their necks will bow.
No new reminder comes to them from the Most Merciful without them dodging it.
And they called a lie [everything that comes to them from the Lord]. They will soon hear of what they are mocking.
Have they not observed the earth, how many generous couples of all kinds We have caused to grow there?
This is a proof! And most of them don't believe.
And your Lord is truly He, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
And when your Lord called Moses, "Go to the unrighteous people,
[unto the] people of Pharaoh," will they not fear (Allah)?
He said, "Lord, I am afraid that they will call me a liar;
lest my breast be constricted, and my tongue may not be embarrassed: summon Aaron, then.
They have a crime to reproach me with; so I fear that they will kill me."
But [Allah] said to him: "Never! Go both with Our wonders, We will remain with you and We will listen.
So both of you go to Pharaoh and say, "We are the messengers of the Lord of the universe,
that you may send the Children of Israel back with us."
"Have we not brought you up among us as a child," said Pharaoh? And have you not dwelt among us for years of your life?
Then you committed the misdeed you did, despite all gratitude."
"I did it," said Moses, "while I was still among the lost.
So I fled from you when I was afraid of you, and then my Lord gave me wisdom and appointed me to be one of His messengers.
Is this a blessing on your part [that you remind me] with reproach, when you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
"And what is the Lord of the universe?" said Pharaoh.
"The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them," says [Moses], "if only you could be convinced of it!"
[Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?
[Moses] continues, "... Your Lord, and the Lord of your oldest ancestors."
"Truly," says [Pharaoh], "your messenger who has been sent to you is a madman."
[Moses] added, "... The Lord of the East and the Sunset, and of that which is between the two; if only you understood!"
"If you adopt," says [Pharaoh], "a deity other than me, I will put you among the prisoners."
"And even if I were to bring you," said [Moses], "a clear thing?
"Bring it," says [Pharaoh], "if you are of the truthful."
So [Moses] threw down his staff and he became a manifest serpent.
And he drew out his hand and behold, it was white (sparkling) to those who were looking.
[Pharaoh] said to the notables around him, "Here is indeed a learned magician.
He wants to expel you from your land by his magic. What do you order?"
They said, "Put them off and his brother, and send men into the cities to gather together,
and bring you every great learned magician."
The magicians were therefore assembled in appointment on the appointed day.
And it was said to the people, "Are you going to get together,
so that we may follow the magicians, if they are the overcomers?"
Then when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Will there really be a reward for us if we are the overcomers?"
He said, "Yes, of course, then you will be among my relatives."
Moses said to them, "Throw away what you have to throw away."
So they threw down their ropes and sticks and said, "By the power of Pharaoh... We will be the winners."
Then Moses threw down his staff, and behold, he grabbed what they had made.
Then the magicians fell prostrate,
saying, "We believe in the Lord of the universe,
The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
[Pharaoh] said, "Did you believe in him before I allowed you? In truth, he is your leader, who taught you magic! Well, you'll know soon! I will surely cut off your hands and legs opposite, and crucify you all."
They say, "There is no harm! For it is to our Lord that we will return.
We want our Lord to forgive us our sins for being the first to believe."
And We revealed to Moses, "Go by night with My servants, for you will be pursued."
Then Pharaoh sent gatherers [to say] in the cities:
"They are, in fact, a small gang,
but they irritate us,
while we are all vigilant."
So We brought them out of the gardens, out of the springs,
treasures and a pleasant place to stay.
It was so! And We gave them as an inheritance to the children of Israel.
At sunrise they pursued them.
Then, when the two parties saw each other, Moses' companions said, "We are going to be overtaken."
He says, "Never, for I have my Lord with me who will guide me."
Then We revealed to Moses, "Strike the sea with your staff." Then it split, and each side was like a huge mountain.
We brought the others [Pharaoh and his people] near.
And We saved Moses and all those who were with him;
then We drowned the others.
This is a prodigy, but most of them do not believe.
And your Lord is truly He, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
And recite to them the news of Abraham:
When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
They said, "We worship idols and we cling to them."
He said, "Do they hear you when you call [them]?
Or do they benefit you? or do they harm you?"
They said, "No! but we found our ancestors doing so."
He said, "What do you say about what you worshiped...?
You and your old ancestors?
They are all enemies to me except the Lord of the universe,
who created me, and it is He who guides me;
and it is He who feeds me and gives me drink;
and when I am sick, it is He who heals me,
and who will kill me, and then give me life again,
and it is from Him that I covet the forgiveness of my sins on the Day of Retribution.
Lord, grant me wisdom (and knowledge) and make me join the good;
grant that I may have an honorable mention on the tongues of posterity;
and make me one of the heirs of the Garden of Earthly Delights.
and forgive my father: for he was of the erring;
and do not cover me with shame on the day when they are resurrected,
the day when neither property nor children will be of any use,
except the one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."
Paradise for the pious will then be brought nearer,
and the Furnace will be exposed to wanderers,
and they will say to them, "Where are those whom you worshiped?
apart from Allah? do they help you? Or do they help themselves?"
So they will be thrown pell-mell, and so will the wanderers,
as well as all the legions of Iblis.
They will say, while quarrelling:
"By Allah! We were certainly in an obvious error,
when we made you the equals of the Lord of the universe.
It is only the criminals who have led us astray.
And we have no intercessors,
nor a warm friend.
If we could go back, then we would be among the believers!"
This is a sign; however, most of them do not believe.
And your Lord is truly the Mighty, the Most Merciful.

when Noah, their brother, (contributes) says to them: "Will you not fear [Allah]?
I am a trustworthy messenger to you.
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me.
And I don't ask you for a salary for that; my salary belongs only to the Lord of the universe.
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me."
They said, "Shall we believe in you, while the vilest follow you?
He said, "I don't know what those were doing.
Their account belongs only to my Lord. If only you are aware.
I am not the one who rejects believers.
I am only an explicit warning."
They said, "If you do not cease, Noah, you will certainly be among the stoned."
He said, "O my Lord, my people call me a liar.
So make a clear distinction between them and me; and save me and those of the believers who are with me."
So we saved him, as well as those who were with him in the ark, which was fully loaded.
And then we drowned the rest (the infidels).
This is a sign. However, most of them don't believe.
And Your Lord is truly the Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The 'Aad called the Messengers liars.
And when Hud, their brother, said to them, "Will you not fear [Allah]?"
I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me.
And I don't ask you for a salary for that; my salary belongs only to the Lord of the universe.
Do you build a monument on every hill out of frivolity?
And do you build castles as if you were to remain forever?
And when you crack down on someone, you do it mercilessly.
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me.
Fear Him who has provided you with [all the good things] that you know,
who provided you with cattle and children,
gardens and springs.
I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
They said, "Whether you exhort us or not, we don't care!
These are only the words of the ancients:
We will not be punished in any way."
So they called him a liar. And we put them to death. This is a sign! However, most of them don't believe.
And Your Lord is truly the Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The Thamud called the Messengers liars.
When Salih, their brother (contributes) said to them: "Will you not fear [Allah]?"
I am a trustworthy messenger to you.
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me.
I do not ask you for a salary for this, my salary belongs only to the Lord of the universe.
Will you be left safe in your present condition?
In the middle of gardens, springs,
of crops and palm trees with digestible fruits?
Do you skillfully dig houses in the mountains?
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me.
Do not obey the order of the outrageous,
which sow disorder on the earth and improve nothing".
They said, "You are only a bewitched man.
You are just a man like us. Bring a wonder, then, if you are of the truthful."
He said, "Here is a she-camel: it is for it to drink on an appointed day, and for you to drink on a day.
And do not inflict any harm on him, or the punishment of a terrible day will come upon you."
But they killed her. Well, they had reason to regret!
Punishment, in fact, seizes them. This is a prodigy. However, most of them don't believe.
And your Lord is truly He, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of Lot called the Messengers liars,
when their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear [Allah]?
I am a trustworthy messenger to you.
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me.
I do not ask you for a salary for this; my salary belongs only to the Lord of the universe.
Do you perform the carnal act with the males of this world?
And do you forsake the wives that your Lord has created for you? But you are just transgressors."
They said, "If you do not stop, Lot, you will certainly be among the expelled."
He says, "I really hate what you do.
Lord, save me and my family from what they are doing."
We then saved him and all his family,
except for an old woman who was among the exterminated.
Then We destroyed the others;
and We rained down on them (of stones). And what a fatal rain for those who are warned!
This is a prodigy. However, most of them don't believe.

The people of Al-Ayka called the Messengers liars.
When Chuayb said to them: "Will you not fear [Allah]?"
I am a trustworthy messenger to you.
Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me,
and I do not ask you for a salary for it; my salary belongs only to the Lord of the universe.
Give it your full measure and don't let [people] lose any of it.
and weigh with an exact scale.
Don't give people less than they are due; and do not commit disorder and corruption on earth.
And fear Him who created you and the older generations."
They said, "You are indeed of the bewitched;
You are only a man like us; and truly we think that you are among the liars.
Drop pieces of heaven on us, if you are of the truthful."
He said, "My Lord knows best what you are doing."
But they called him a liar. Then the punishment of the Day of Darkness seized them. It was the punishment of a terrible day.
This is a prodigy. However, most of them don't believe.
And your Lord is truly He, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
This (Qur'an) is the Lord of the universe who sent it down,
and the faithful Spirit came down with it
on your heart, that you may be of the warners,
in a very clear Arabic language.
And this was already mentioned in the writings of the elders.
Is it not a sign for them that the scholars of the Children of Israel know this?
If We had sent him down on any of the non-Arabs,
and if he had recited it to them, they would not have believed it.
Thus We have made [doubt] penetrate into the hearts of criminals;
but they will not believe it until they see the painful punishment,
who will come upon them suddenly, without them realizing it;
then they will say, "Are we going to be given a break?"
Do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?
Do you see if We allowed them to enjoy for years,
and then what happened to them was threatened,
the pleasures they have been allowed would be of no use to them.
And We do not destroy a city until it has had warners,
[as a reminder], and We are not unjust.
And it was not the devils who came down with this (the Qur'an):
it does not suit them; and they could not have done it.
For they are kept away from all listening (to the divine message).
Do not call upon another god with Allah, or you will be among the punished.
And warn the people who are closest to you.
And lower your wing [be kind] to the believers who follow you.
But if they disobey you, say to them, "I disavow what you are doing."
And place your trust in the Almighty, the Most Merciful,
who sees you when you get up,
and (see) thy gestures among those who bow down.
It is He truly, the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
Shall I teach you on whom the devils descend?
They descend on every slanderer, sinner.
They listen... However, most of them are liars.
And as for the poets, it is the lost who follow them.
Do you not see that they wander in every valley,
and that they say what they do not do?
except those who believe and do good deeds, who often invoke the name of Allah and defend themselves against the wrongs done to them. The unrighteous will soon see the turnaround they will experience!
T'â, Sîn. These are the verses of the Qur'an and an explicit Book,
a guide and good news to the believers,
who perform Salah, pay Zakat, and believe with certainty in the Hereafter.
As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We beautify their deeds, and then they become confused and hesitant.
They are the ones who will suffer the worst punishment, while they will be the biggest losers in the hereafter.
Verily, it is you who receive the Qur'an from a Sage, a Scholar.
(Recall) when Moses said to his family, "I saw a fire; I will bring you news of it, or I will bring you a lighted brand so that you may warm yourselves."
When he arrived there, he was called, "Blessed be He who is in the fire and He who is all around, and glory to Allah, the Lord of the universe."
"O Moses, it is I, Allah the Almighty, the Wise."
And: "Throw away your stick." When he saw him move like a snake, he turned his back [to flee] without retracing his steps. "Do not be afraid, Moses. The Messengers are not afraid of Me.
Except the one who committed an injustice and then replaced evil with good... then I am Forgiving and Merciful."
And thrust thy hand into the opening of thy tunic. She will come out white and without any harm - one of the nine wonders to Pharaoh and his people, for they are truly perverse people."
And when Our wonders came to them, clear and explicit, they said, "This is obvious magic!"
They denied them unjustly and proudly, while in themselves they believed them with certainty. Look at what has become of the corrupters.
We have indeed given David and Solomon a knowledge; and they said, "Praise be to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
And Solomon inherited from David and said, "O men! We have been taught the language of birds; and we have been given a share of all things. This is truly the evident grace.
And his armies of jinn, men, and birds were gathered together for Solomon, and were placed in ranks.
When they arrived at the Valley of the Ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter into your dwellings, lest Solomon and his armies crush you [under their feet] without realizing it."
He smiled, amused by his words and said: "Allow me, Lord, to give thanks for the benefit with which You have bestowed upon me and my father and mother, and that I may do a good work which You may accept and bring me, by Your mercy, into Your virtuous servants."
Then he went over the birds and said, "Why don't I see the hoopoe? Is she among the absentees?
I will punish her severely! or I will slaughter him! or it will bring me an explicit argument."
But she had only been absent for a short time, and said, "I have learned what you have not learned; and I bring you reliable news from Saba:
I found that a woman is their queen, that she has been fulfilled with everything and that she has a magnificent throne.
I found her and her people bowing down to the sun instead of Allah. The Devil has made their deeds more beautiful, and has led them astray, and they are not well guided.
Why do they not bow down to Allah, who brings out what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and who knows what you hide and what you divulge?
Allah! There is no god but Him, the Lord of the Immense Throne.
Then Solomon said, "We will see if you told the truth or if you lied.
Go with my letter, which is this; then throw it at them; Then stand away from them to see what their response will be.
The queen said, "O notables! A noble letter has been thrown to me.
It comes from Solomon; and it is: "In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful,
Do not be haughty with me and come to me in all submission."
She said, "O notables! Advise me on this matter: I will not decide anything unless you are present (to advise me)."
They said, "We are possessors of tremendous strength and power. The command, however, belongs to you. Look at what you want to order."
She said: "Truly, when kings enter a city they corrupt it, and make its honorable citizens humiliated. And that's how they act.
I will send them a present, and then I will see what the envoys bring back."
Then when [the delegation] came to Solomon, he said, "Are you willing to help me with goods? whereas what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. But it's you who is more interested in your gift.
Go back to them. We will come with armies against which they will have no resistance, and we will expel them from them all humiliated and despised.
He said: "O notables! Which of you will bring me his throne before they come to me in subjection?"
A fearsome jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, for that I am strong and trustworthy."
Someone who had knowledge of the Book said, "I'll bring it to you before you blink." When Solomon then saw the throne set up beside him, he said, "This is the grace of my Lord, to try me whether I am thankful or ungrateful. Whoever is grateful it is in his own interest that he does it, and whoever is ungrateful... then my Lord is sufficient to Himself and He is generous."
And he said, "Make her throne unrecognizable, and then we will see whether she will be guided or whether she is of the unguided."
When she had come, they said to her, "Is your throne like this?" She says, "It's like he is." - [Solomon said]: "Knowledge was given to us before her; and we were already submissive."
However, what she worshipped apart from Allah prevented her from being a believer, because she was a member of a disbelieving people.
He was told, "Enter the palace." Then, when she saw it, she mistook it for deep water and uncovered her legs. Then [Solomon] said to him, "This is a palace paved with crystal." She said: "Lord, I have wronged myself: I submit with Solomon to Allah, Lord of the universe."
We did indeed send their brother Salih to the Thamûd. [who says to them]: "Worship Allah." And now they divided into two groups that quarrelled.
He said, "O my people, why do you seek to hasten evil rather than good? If only you would ask Allah for forgiveness? Perhaps you would have mercy.
They said, "We see in you and in those who are with you bearers of misfortune." He said: "Your fate depends on Allah. But you are rather people who are subjected to temptation.
And there was a group of nine people in the city who were making a mess of the earth and doing nothing good.
They said, "Let us swear by Allah that we will attack him and his family by night. Then we will say to the one who is in charge of avenging him: "We did not witness the murder of his family, and we are sincere."
They hatched a ruse, and We hatched a ruse without their realizing it.
Look, then, at what was the consequence of their stratagem: We put them and all their people to death.
So their houses are deserted because of their misdeeds. This is a warning to people who know.
And We saved those who had believed and were righteous.
[And remind them] Lot, when he said to his people: "Do you give yourself over to turpitude [homosexuality] when you see clearly?"
Do you go to men instead of women to satisfy your desires? You are rather an ignorant people.
Then his people had only this answer: "Expel the family of Lot from your city! For these are people who affect purity.
We saved him and his family, except his wife, for whom We had determined that she should be among the exterminated.
And We rained down on them (of stones). And what a bad rain it is for the people who have been warned!
Say: "Praise be to Allah and peace be upon His servants whom He has chosen." Which is better: Allah or what they associate with Him?
Is it not He who created the heavens and the earth and sent down water from heaven with which We have made beautiful gardens grow? You were not able to make their trees grow at all. Is there a god with Allah? No, but they are people who give Him equals.
Is it not He who has established the earth as a place to dwell, placed rivers through it, assigned firm mountains to it, and established a separation between the two seas, - Is there then a god with Allah? No, but most of them don't know.
Is it not He who answers the anguished when he calls upon Him, and who takes away evil, and makes you succeed on earth, generation after generation, - Is there then a god with Allah? It's rare that you remember!
Is it not He who guides you in the darkness of the land and the sea, and sends forth the winds, as a good announcement preceding His grace? - Is there a god with Allah? Allah is exalted above what they associate with Him.
Is it not He who begins creation, then remakes it, and who nourishes you with heaven and earth? Is there a god with Allah? Say: "Bring your proof, if you are truthful."
Say: "None of those who are in the heavens and on the earth knows the Unknowable except Allah." And they do not know when they will be resurrected!
But their sciences have converged on the subject of the other world. They are rather doubtful about it. Or rather, they are blind to it.
And those who do not believe say, "When we and our fathers are dust, will we really be brought up (from our graves)?
Certainly, we and our fathers were promised this before. These are only old tales!"
Say: "Go through the earth and see what has become of the criminals."
And do not grieve over them or be distressed because of their plot.
And they say, "When will this promise be made, if you're truthful?"
Say: "It may be that some of what you are trying to hasten is already on your heels."
True, your Lord is a provider of grace to men, but most of them are not grateful.
Verily, your Lord knows what is hidden in their breasts and what they are disclosing.
And there is nothing hidden in heaven and earth that is not in an explicit Book.
This Qur'an tells the Children of Israel about most of the subjects on which they differ,
while he is a guide and a mercy for believers.
Your Lord will certainly decide between them by His judgment; and He is the Almighty, the Wise.
So put your trust in Allah, for you are obviously in the truth and righteousness.
You cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they flee with their backs turned.
Nor can you guide the blind out of their error. You shall only make those who believe in Our verses and submit to hear.
And when the Word falls upon them, We will bring out of the ground a beast that will speak to them; the people were by no means convinced of the truth of Our signs [or verses].
And on the Day when We gather from every community a crowd of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be placed in ranks.
and when they have arrived, [Allah] will say: "Have you treated My signs as lies without having embraced them with your knowledge? Or what were you doing?"
And the Word will fall upon them because of their misdeeds. And they won't be able to say anything.
Have they not seen that in truth We have appointed the night for them to rest, and the day to see? This is much evidence for people who believe.
And on the Day when the trumpet is blown, all those who are in the heavens and those who are in the earth will be afraid, except those whom Allah has willed [to preserve]! - And all will come to Him humbling themselves.
And you will see the mountains - you think they are frozen - as they pass like clouds. This is the work of Allah who has fashioned everything to perfection. He is a Perfectly Knowledgeable of what you do!
Whoever comes with good will have much better, and on that day they will be safe from all fear.
And whoever will come with evil... then they will be knocked down with their faces in the Fire. Aren't you only paid according to what you worked?"
"I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city (Mecca) whom He has sanctified, and to Him all things, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims,
and to recite the Qur'an." Whoever guides himself, it is for himself that he guides himself. And whoever goes astray, then say, "I'm just one of the warners."
Say: "Praise be to Allah! He will show you His proofs, and you will know them." Your Lord is not inattentive to what you do.
T'â, Sîn, Mîm.
Here are the verses of the Explicit Book.
We tell you in all truth, the story of Moses and Pharaoh, for the benefit of people who believe.
Pharaoh was haughty on earth; He divided his inhabitants into clans, in order to take advantage of the weakness of one of them: he slaughtered their sons and left their wives alive. He was really among the troublemakers.
But We wanted to favor those who had been weak on earth and make them rulers and heirs,
and to establish them mightily on earth, and to show Pharaoh, Haman, and their soldiers, what they feared.
And We revealed to Moses' mother, "Suckle him. And when you fear for him, throw him into the flood. And do not be afraid or grieved: We will give him back to you and make him a Messenger."
Pharaoh's men took him in, so that he would be an enemy to them and a source of affliction. Pharaoh, Haman and their soldiers were at fault.
And Pharaoh's wife said, "(This child) will gladden my eye and yours! Don't kill him. He could be useful to us or will we take him as a child." And they had no sense of it.
And the heart of Moses' mother became empty. She came very near divulging everything, if We had not strengthened her heart so that she would remain among the believers.
She said to her sister, "Follow him," and she saw him from afar without them noticing.
We had previously forbidden her (the breast) of wet nurses. So she (Moses' sister) said, "Would you like me to show you the people in a house who will do it for you and be kind to her?" ...
So We gave him back to his mother, so that her eye would rejoice, and she would not grieve, and she might know that Allah's promise is true. But most of them don't know.
And when he had reached maturity and full formation, We gave him the faculty of judgment and a science. This is how We reward the beneficent.
He entered the city at a time of inattention on the part of its inhabitants; there he found two men fighting, one of his partisans and the other of his adversaries. The man of his party called him for help against his enemy. Moses punched him and finished him off. - [Moses] said, "This is the work of the Devil. He is really an enemy, an obvious misguide."
He said, "Lord, I have wronged myself; forgive me." And He forgave him. He is truly the Forgiving, the Merciful!
He said, "Lord, because of the blessings you have bestowed upon me, I will never support criminals."
The next morning he was in town, fearful and looking about him, when the man who had asked him for help the day before called to him with loud cries. Moses said to him, "You are indeed an open provocateur."
When he wanted to strike a blow at their common enemy, he (the Israelite) said, "O Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant on earth; and you do not want to be among the benefactors."
And then a man came running from the end of the city and said, "O Moses, the notables are convening about you to kill you. Leave (the city). That's the advice I give you."
He came out of there, fearful, looking about him. He said, "Lord, save me from [this] unrighteous people!"
And when he went to Madyan, he said, "I wish my Lord to guide me to the right path."
And when he came to the watering hole of Madyan, he found there a crowd of people watering [their animals] and he also found two women standing apart and holding [their animals]. He said, "What do you want?" They said, "We will not water until the shepherds are gone; and our father is very old."
He watered [the animals] for them and then went back to the shade and said, "Lord, I have great need of the good that you will bring down to me."
Then one of the two women came to him with a timid gait and said, "My father is calling you to reward you for watering for us." And when he came to him and told him his story, he (the old man) said, "Do not be afraid, for you have escaped from the unrighteous."
One of them said, "O my father, hire him [to your service] for a fee, for the best to hire is the one who is strong and trustworthy."
He said, "I would like to marry you to one of my two daughters, on condition that you work for me for eight years. If you finish ten [years], it will be of your own free will; I do not wish, however, to impose anything excessive on you. You will find me, Allah willing, among the good."
"It is (concluded) between you and me," said [Moses]. Whichever of the two terms I assign to myself, there will be no pressure on me. And Allah is the Guarantor of what we say."
Then, when Moses had completed the appointed period and set out with his family, he saw a fire on the side of the Mount. He said to his family, "Stay here. I saw fire. Perhaps I will bring you a new one or a firebrand so that you can warm yourselves."
Then when he arrived there, he was called from the right side of the valley, in the blessed place, from the tree: "O Moses! It is I, Allah, the Lord of the universe."
And: "Throw away your staff" Then when he saw it move as if it were a snake, he turned his back without even turning around. "O Moses! Approach and do not be afraid: you are among those who are safe.
Put your hand in the opening of your tunic, and it will come out white without any harm. And hold your arm close to you so that you are not afraid. These, then, are two proofs of your Lord for Pharaoh and his notables. They are really perverse people."
"Lord," said [Moses], "I have killed one of them, and I am afraid they will kill me.
But Aaron, my brother, is more eloquent than I. Send him therefore with me as an helper, to declare my truthfulness: I am truly afraid that they will call me a liar."
[Allah] said: "We will, through your brother, strengthen your arm, and give you irrefutable arguments; they will not be able to reach you, thanks to Our signs [Our miracles]. The two of you and those who follow you will be the winners.
Then when Moses came to them with Our evident wonders, they said, "This is just invented magic. We have never heard of this from our first ancestors."
And Moses said, "My Lord knows best who came from Him with the guidance, and to whom the final Abode shall belong. Truly, the unrighteous will not succeed."
And Pharaoh said, "O notables, I know no god for you but me. Haman, light fire for me on clay and then build me a tower, and then perhaps I will ascend to the God of Moses. I rather think that he is one of the liars."
And he was puffed up with pride on earth as well as his soldiers, without any right. And they thought that they would not be brought back to Us.
So we seized him and his soldiers, and threw them into the flood. Look what has become of the unjust!
We made them leaders who called the people to the Fire. And on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.
We followed them, in this life here below, with a curse. And on the Day of Resurrection they will be among the despised.
We have indeed given the Book to Moses, after having destroyed the older generations, as an enlightening evidence for the people, as well as guidance and mercy so that they may remember.
You were not on the western slope (of Sinai) when We decreed the commandments to Moses; you were not among the witnesses.
But We have given birth to generations whose age has been prolonged. And you were not [either] a resident among the people of Madyan reciting Our verses to them; but We send the Messengers.
And you were not on the side of Mount Tor when We called. But (thou hast come as) a mercy of thy Lord, to warn a people to whom no warner before thee hath come, that they may remember.
If a calamity were to befall them in retribution for what their own hands had prepared, they would say, "Lord, why did You not send us a Messenger? Then we would have followed Your verses and we would have been believers."
But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "If only he had received the same thing as Moses." Did they not deny what had previously been brought to Moses? They said, "Two magics have mutually supported each other!" And they said, "We have no faith in any."
Say to them: "Bring a Book from Allah that is a better guide than these two, and I will follow it if you are truthful."
But if they don't answer you, then know that it's only their passions that they're following. And who is more misguided than the one who follows his passion without guidance from Allah? Allah, truly, does not guide unjust people.
We have already expounded the Word (the Qur'an) to them so that they may remember.
Those to whom We brought the Book before it [the Qur'an] believe in it.
And when it is recited to them, they say, "We believe in it. This is indeed the truth emanating from our Lord. Even before his arrival, we were Submissive."
These are the ones who will receive twice their reward for their endurance, for responding to evil with good, and for spending of what We have allotted to them;
and when they hear trivialities, they turn away from them and say, "Ours are our deeds, and yours are yours. Peace be upon you. We are not looking for the ignorant."
You [Muhammad] do not rule over the one you love, but Allah guides whom He wills. However, he knows the rightly guided better.
And they said, "If we follow the right path with you, we will be torn from our land." - Have We not established them in a sacred, safe precinct, to which products of all kinds are brought as an allottance from Us? But most of them don't know.
And how many cities have We destroyed that were ungrateful (while their inhabitants lived in abundance), and behold, after them their dwellings are but very little inhabited, and it was We who were the heirs of them.
Your Lord does not destroy cities until you have sent a Messenger to their metropolis to recite Our verses to them. And We do not destroy cities except when their inhabitants are unjust.
All that has been given to you is the ephemeral enjoyment of life in this world and its adornment, while what is with Allah is better and more enduring... Don't you understand?
Is He to whom We have made a beautiful promise, which he will see fulfilled, comparable to the one to whom We have granted the enjoyment of this present life, and which will be the Day of Resurrection, of those who will appear (before Us).
And the day He calls them, He'll say, "Where are those that you claimed to be My associates?"
Those against whom the Word is fulfilled will say, "Behold, Lord, those whom we have deceived. We have seduced them as we have led ourselves astray. We disown them before You: it is not us that they worshipped."
And they will be told, "Call your associates." They will call them, but they will not answer them. When they see the chastisement, then they will wish to have followed the right path (in this life).
And the day that He calls them and says, "What did you say to the Messengers?"
On that day, their arguments will become obscure and they will not ask themselves any questions.
But the one who has repented, who has believed and done good, may be among those who succeed.
Your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; it has never been up to them to choose. Glory be to Allah! He transcends what they associate with Him!
Your Lord knows what is hidden in their breasts and what they are disclosing.
He is Allah. No god but Him. To Him be praise here on earth as well as in the Hereafter. To Him belongs the judgment. And to Him you will be brought back.
Say: "What would you say? If Allah were to assign you the night permanently until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than Allah could bring you light? Do you not hear?"
Say: "What would you say? If Allah were to assign you the day permanently until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than Allah could bring you a night on which you would rest? Do you not observe?"
It is by His mercy that He has assigned you night and day: that you may rest and seek His grace, and that you may be thankful.
And the day He calls them, He'll say, "Where are those that you claimed to be My associates?"
However, We will bring out a witness from each community, and then We will say, "Bring your decisive evidence." Then they will know that the Truth is Allah's; and that what they had invented abandoned them.
Truly, Korah was of the people of Moses, but he was full of violence towards them. We had given him treasures, the keys of which weighed heavily on a whole band of strong people. His people said to him, "Do not rejoice. For Allah does not like the arrogant.
And seek through what Allah has given you, the Last Abode. And don't forget your part in this life. And be kind as Allah has been kind to you. And don't look for corruption on earth. For Allah does not love corrupters."
He says, "It is by a knowledge that I possess that this came to me." Did he not know that before him Allah had destroyed generations greater than him in strength and richer in possessions? And criminals will not be questioned about their sins!"
He went out to his people in all his pomp. Those who loved the present life said, "If only we had like what was given to Korah. He was certainly endowed with an immense fortune."
And those to whom knowledge was given said, "Woe to you! Allah's reward is better for him who believes and does good." But it will only be received by those who endure.
So we caused the earth to swallow him and his house. No clan besides Allah was there to help him, and he could not help himself.
And those who, the day before, wished to be in his place, began to say: "Ah! It is true that Allah increases the share of whomever He wills among His servants or restricts it. If Allah had not favored us, He would certainly have caused us to be swallowed up. Ah! It is true that those who do not believe do not succeed."
This Last Abode We reserve for those who seek neither to ascend on earth nor to sow corruption on it. However, the happy end belongs to the pious.
Whoever comes with good will have better than this; and whoever comes with evil, (let him know that) those who commit misdeeds will not be rewarded except according to what they have committed.
The One who prescribed the Qur'an for you will certainly bring you back to where you (wish) to return. Say: "My Lord knows best the one who has given guidance and the one who is in obvious error.
You did not expect that the Book would be revealed to you. This was only by the mercy of your Lord. Therefore never be a support to the infidels;
and let them not turn you away from the verses of Allah once they have been sent down to you. Call the people to your Lord and do not be among the Associates.
And do not invoke any other deity with Allah. There is no divinity but Him. Everything must perish except His Face. To Him belongs the judgment; and to Him you will be brought back.
Alif, Lâm, Mîm.
Do people think that they will be allowed to say, "We believe!" without testing them?
Verily, We have tried those who lived before them; [Thus] Allah knows those who speak the truth and those who lie.
Or do those who commit misdeeds expect to be able to escape from Us? How bad their judgment is!
Whoever hopes to meet Allah, the time set by Allah will certainly come. And He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
And whoever fights, fights only for himself, for Allah can do without the whole universe.
And as for those who believe and do good deeds, We will blot out their misdeeds, and We will reward them with the best reward for what they have done.
And We have enjoined man to treat his father and mother well, and "if they force you to associate with Me, of which you have no knowledge, then do not obey them." To Me is your return, and then I will inform you of what you were doing.
And as for those who believe and do good deeds, We will certainly bring them among the righteous.
Among the people there are those who say, "We believe in Allah," and then, if they are made to suffer for the sake of Allah, they regard the trial of men as a punishment from Allah. But if it comes from the help of your Lord, they will certainly say, "We were with you." Is not Allah the best to know what is in everyone's chests?
Allah knows the believers perfectly and knows the hypocrites perfectly.
And those who do not believe say to those who believe; "Follow our path, and let us bear with your trespasses." But they will not bear any of their faults. In truth, they are liars.
And most certainly, they will carry their burdens and other burdens in addition to their own burdens. and they will be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they were inventing.
And indeed, We sent Noah to his people. He dwelt among them a thousand years minus fifty years. Then the flood swept them away when they were unjust.
Then We saved him and the people of the ark; and We made it a warning to the universe.
And Abraham, when he said to his people; "Worship Allah and fear Him: it is much better for you if you knew."
You worship only idols, besides Allah, and you forge a lie. Those whom you worship besides Allah have no means of providing you with food; seek your sustenance with Allah. Worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be brought back.
And if you cry lies, other nations before you have also called (their prophets) liars. The Messenger, however, is responsible only for the clear transmission.
Do they not see how Allah begins creation and then remakes it? This is easy for Allah.
Say, "Go through the earth and see how He began creation. Then how Allah creates the ultimate generation. For Allah is Omnipotent."
He chastises whom He wills and shows mercy to whom He wills; and to Him you will be brought back.
And you will not be able to oppose His power either on earth or in heaven; and there is no ally or helper for you besides Allah.
And those who do not believe in the verses of Allah and in meeting Him, despair of My mercy. And these will have a painful punishment.
His people made no other answer than: "kill him or burn him". But Allah saved him from the fire. These are signs for people who believe.
And [Abraham] said: "Indeed, it is to cement bonds between yourselves in this present life, that you have adopted idols, besides Allah. Then, on the Day of Resurrection, some will reject others, and some will curse others, while you will have Fire for your refuge, will have no protectors.
Lot believed in him. He said, "I am emigrating to my Lord, for He is the Almighty, the Wise."
We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and placed in his descendants the prophecy and the Book. We gave him his reward here on earth, while in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.
And Lot, when he said to his people, "Truly, you are committing turpitude where no one in the universe has gone before you.
Will you have carnal intercourse with males? Will you practice brigandage? Will you commit the blameworthy in your assembly?" But his people made no other answer than "Let the punishment of Allah come to us, if you are among the truthful."
He said, "Lord, give me victory over this corrupting people."
And when Our Angels brought Abraham the good news, they said, "We are going to destroy the inhabitants of this city, for its inhabitants are unjust."
He said, "But Lot is there." They said, "We know perfectly well who lives there, and we will certainly save him and his family, except his wife, who will be among those who will perish."
And when Our Angels came to Lot, he was grieved for them, and felt unable to protect them. They said to him, "Do not be afraid and do not grieve... We will save you and your family, except your wife, who will be among those who will perish.
We will bring punishment from heaven to the inhabitants of this city, for their perversity."
And certainly, We have left (from the ruins of this city) a clear sign (of warning) for people who understand.
Similarly, to the Madyan (We sent) their brother Chuayb who said to them: "O my people, worship Allah and wait on the Last Day, and do not sow corruption on the earth."
But they called him a liar. The cataclysm seized them, and in the morning they lay lifeless in their homes.
In the same way, (We annihilated) the 'Aad and the Thamud. - You see it clearly through their dwellings - The Devil, however, had beautified their deeds, so much so that he drove them away from the Path; they were nevertheless invited to be clear-sighted.
In the same way, (We destroyed) Korah, Pharaoh, and Haman. While Moses brought them proofs, they became proud on earth. And they couldn't escape [Us].
So We seized each one for his sin: there were some on whom We sent a hurricane; there were some that the Cri seized; there were some whom We caused to be swallowed up by the earth; and there were some whom We drowned. However, Allah is not such as to harm them; but they have done harm to themselves.
Those who have taken protectors besides Allah are like the spider that has given itself home. However, the most fragile house is that of the spider. If only they knew!
Allah knows everything that they invoke besides Him. And He is the Almighty, the Wise.
These are the parables that We quote to the people; however, only scholars understand them.
It is for a good reason that Allah created the heavens and the earth. This is proof for believers.
Recite what is revealed to you from the Book and perform Salah. In truth, Salat preserves against turpitude and blameworthiness. The remembrance of Allah is certainly the greatest thing. And Allah knows what you are doing.
And argue only in the best way with the People of the Book, except those of them who are unjust. And say, "We believe in what has been sent down to us and down to you, while our God and your God is the same, and to Him we submit."
This is how We sent down the Book (the Qur'an) to you. Those to whom We have given the Book believe in it. And among these, there are some who believe in it. Only the disbelievers deny Our verses.
And before that, you didn't recite any books and you didn't write any with your right hand. Otherwise, those who deny the truth would have had doubts.
Rather, it consists of obvious verses, (preserved) in the breasts of those to whom knowledge has been given. And only the unrighteous deny Our verses.
And they said, "Why have not wonders been sent down upon him from his Lord?" Say: "The wonders are with Allah. I'm just a clear warning."
Is it not enough for them, then, that We have sent down the Book upon you and that it is recited to them? There is certainly a mercy and a reminder to people who believe.
Say: "Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you." He knows what is in the heavens and the earth. And as for those who believe in falsehood and do not believe in Allah, they will be the losers.
And they ask you to hasten [the coming] of punishment. If there had not been a fixed term, the punishment would certainly have come to them. And certainly, it will come to them suddenly, without them being aware of it.
They ask you to hasten [the coming] of punishment, while Hell surrounds the disbelievers on all sides.
The day when the chastisement will envelop them from above and under their feet. He will say to them, "Taste what you were doing."
O My servants who had believed! My land is very vast. Worship Me, then!
Every soul will taste death. Then you will be brought back to Us.
And as for those who believe and do good deeds, We will certainly set them upstairs in Paradise under which the streams flow, to dwell there forever. What a fine reward is that of those who do good,
who endure, and put their trust in their Lord!
How many beasts do not take care of their own food! It is Allah who feeds them and you. And He is the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
If you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth, and subdued the sun and the moon?" they will most certainly say, "Allah." How is it that they then turn away (from the straight path)?
Allah dispenses His gifts to whomever He wills among His servants. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing.
If you ask them, "Who sent down water from heaven with which He revived the earth after His death?" they will most certainly say, "Allah." Say: "Praise be to Allah." But most of them do not reason.
This life here below is nothing but fun and play. The Abode of the Beyond is certainly true life. If only they knew!
When they get on a boat, they invoke Allah and worship Him exclusively. Once He has saved them [from the dangers of the sea by bringing them back] to dry land, behold, they give [Him] associates.
Let them deny what we have given them and enjoy the goods of this world! They will know soon!
Do they not see that We have really made a safe sanctuary [Makkah], while all around them people are being taken away? Will they then believe falsehood and deny the blessings of Allah?
And what worse unrighteous person than the one who invents a lie against Allah, or who denies the Truth when it reaches him? Is it not in Hell a dwelling place for the disbelievers?
And as for those who strive for Our cause, We will certainly guide them in Our paths. Verily, Allah is with the doers.
Alif, Lâm, Mîm.
The Romans have been defeated,
in the neighboring country, and after their defeat they will be the victors,
in a few years. To Allah belongs the commandment, at the beginning and at the end, and on that day the Believers will rejoice
of Allah's help. He helps whomever He wills and He is the Almighty, the All-Merciful.
This is the promise of Allah. Allah never breaks His promise, but most people don't know.
They know an aspect of the present life, while they are inattentive to the hereafter.
Have they not meditated within themselves? Allah created the heavens and the earth and what is between them, only rightly and for a fixed time. Many people, however, do not believe in the encounter with their Lord.
Have they not traveled the earth to see what has become of those who lived before them? They surpassed them in power, and had ploughed and peopled the earth much more than they did themselves. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. It is not Allah who wronged them; but they wronged themselves.
Then evil was the end of those who did evil, having called the verses of Allah lies and mocked them.
It is Allah who begins creation; then He makes it again; then you will be brought back to Him.
And on the day when the Hour comes, the criminals will be struck with despair.
And they will not have intercessors among those whom they associated [with Allah], and they will even deny their gods.
On the day when the Hour comes, on that day they will separate [from one another].
Those who believe and do good works will rejoice in a garden;
and as for those who do not believe and treat Our signs as lies, as well as the meeting in the Hereafter, they will be led to punishment.
Glorify Allah, therefore, night and morning!
To Him all praise in the heavens and on earth, in the afternoon and in the middle of the day.
From the dead He brings out the living, and from the living He brings forth the dead. And He gives life to the earth after his death. And this is how you will be brought out.
Among His signs: He created you from the earth, and then you are men who are scattered [in the world].
And among His signs He has created wives from you, for you, so that you may live in peace with them, and He has placed affection and kindness between you. There is evidence in this for people who think.
And among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the variety of your idioms and colors. There is evidence for the learned in this.
And among His signs is your sleep night and day, and also your quest for His grace. There is evidence in this for people who hear.
And among His signs He shows you lightning with fear (of lightning) and hope (of rain), and sends down from heaven water with which He restores life to the earth after its death. There is evidence in this for reasoning people.
And among His signs the heavens and the earth are maintained by His order; then when He calls you with a call, behold, you will arise from the earth.
To Him all who are in heaven and earth: all are entirely subject to Him.
And it is He who begins creation and then remakes it; and it is easier for Him. He has absolute transcendence in heaven and on earth. He is the Almighty, the Wise.
He has told you a parable of yourselves: Have you associated your slaves with what We have given you, so that you may all be equal [in the right of property] and fear them [as much as you fear one another]? This is how We set forth Our verses for reasoning people.
Those who have been unjust have rather followed their own passions, without knowing. Who can guide the one whom Allah leads astray? And they have no protector for them.
Direct your whole being to religion exclusively [for Allah], this is the nature that Allah originally gave to men - no change in Allah's creation. This is the religion of righteousness; But most people don't know.
Return repentant to Him; fear Him, perform Salah and do not be among the associates,
among those who divided their religion and became sects, each party exulting in what it held.
And when evil befalls people, they call upon their Lord by returning to Him repentant. And if He gives them a taste of mercy from Him, behold, some of them give their Lord associates,
so that they become ungrateful to what We have given them. "And enjoy. You'll know soon."
Have We sent down upon them such authority (a Book) that it speaks of what they associated with Him?
And when We give people a taste of mercy, they rejoice. But if a misfortune befalls them because of what their own hands have prepared, then they despair.
Have they not seen that Allah dispenses His gifts or restricts them to whomever He wills? There is evidence in this for people who believe.
Give therefore the next of kin his due, as well as the poor, and the traveler in distress. This is better for those who seek the face of Allah (His satisfaction); and they are the ones who succeed.
Whatever you give for usury to increase your wealth at the expense of the goods of others does not increase them in the sight of Allah, but what you give as Zakat, while seeking the Face of Allah (His satisfaction)... They will see [their rewards] multiplied.
It is Allah who created you and fed you. Then He will kill you, and then He will give you life again. Are there any of your partners who do any of that? Glory be to Him! He transcends what is associated with Him.
Corruption has appeared on land and in the sea because of what people have done with their own hands; so that [Allah] may make them taste some of what they have done; perhaps they will return (to Allah).
Say: "Go through the earth and see what has become of those who lived before. Most of them were associates."
Direct your whole being to the religion of righteousness, before the day comes from Allah that cannot be postponed. On that day [people] will be divided:
Whoever disbelieves will suffer the consequences of his unfaithfulness. And whoever has done good... It is for themselves that they are preparing (their future),
so that [Allah] may reward with His grace those who believe and do good deeds. Verily, He does not love infidels.
Among His signs, He sends the winds as heralds, to make you taste His mercy and for the ship to sail, by His command, and for you to seek His grace. Maybe you'd be grateful!
We have indeed sent messengers before you to their people, and they brought them proofs. We took revenge on those who committed the crimes [of denial]; and it was Our duty to help believers.
Allah is the One who sends the winds that raise clouds; then He spreads them out in heaven as He wills; and He tears them to pieces. Then you see the rain coming out of their depths. And when He reaches with her whom He wills among His servants, they rejoice,
even if they were before, before he was brought down on them, desperate.
So look at the effects of Allah's mercy how He restores life to the earth after its death. He is the One who revives the dead, and He is Omnipotent.
And if We send a wind and they see [their vegetation] turn yellow, they remain ungrateful after that.
Verily, you do not make the dead hear; and you do not make the deaf hear the call, if they go away with their backs turned.
You are not the one who guides the blind out of their error. You only give voice to those who believe in Our verses and who are then entirely submissive.
Allah is the One who created you weak; then after weakness, He gives you strength; then after strength, He reduces you to weakness and old age: He creates what He wills and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Powerful.
And on the day when the Hour comes, the criminals will swear that they have stayed only an hour. Thus they have been turned away (from the truth);
while those to whom knowledge and faith were given will say: "You have dwelt according to the decree of Allah, until the Day of Resurrection, this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not know."
Therefore, on that day, excuses will not be of use to the wrongdoers, and they will not be asked to seek to please [Allah].
And in this Qur'an, We have certainly cited examples of all kinds for people. And if you bring them a wonder, those who do not believe will say, "Surely you are only impostors."
This is how Allah seals the hearts of those who do not know.
So be patient, for Allah's promise is truth. And let not those who do not firmly believe shake you!
Alif, Lâm, Mîm.
These are the verses of the Book full of wisdom,
it is a guide and a mercy to the beneficents,
who perform Salah, pay Zakat, and believe with certainty in the Hereafter.
These are on the right path of their Lord and they are the blessed.
And among men there is [someone] who, without knowledge, buys pleasant speeches to lead astray from the path of Allah and to mock Him. Such will suffer a degrading punishment.
And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns his back with pride, as if he had not heard them, as if there were a weight in his ears. Tell him, then, of a painful punishment.
Those who believe and do good deeds will have the Gardens of Earthly Delights,
