to dwell there forever, - it is indeed a promise of Allah. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
He created the heavens without pillars for you to see; and He has driven firm mountains into the earth to keep it from toppling over with you; and He has propagated animals of all kinds there. And from heaven We sent down water, with which We caused productive plants to grow in pairs of all kinds.
"This is the creation of Allah. Show Me then what those who are outside of Him have created?" But the unjust are obviously misguided.
We did give Luqman wisdom: "Be thankful to Allah, for whoever is grateful, is grateful only for himself; as for the one who is ungrateful... Verily, Allah dispenses with all things, and He is worthy of praise."
And when Luqman said to his son while exhorting him, "O my son, do not give a partner to Allah, for association with [Allah] is truly a great injustice."
We commanded man [to do goodness to] his father and mother; his mother carried him [suffering for him] sentence after sentence: he was weaned at two years of age. "Be grateful to Me as well as to your parents. To Me is the destination.
And if both of them force you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of, then do not obey them; but stay with them here on earth in a proper way. And follow the path of the one who turns to Me. To Me, then, is your return, and then I will inform you of what you were doing."
"O my child, even if it be the weight of a mustard seed, at the bottom of a rock, or in the heavens or in the earth, Allah will bring him. Allah is infinitely Gentle and Perfectly Knowing.
O my son, perform Salah, command what is proper, forbid what is blameworthy, and endure what happens to you with patience. This is the resolution to be made in every company!
And do not turn your face away from men, nor tread the earth with arrogance: for Allah does not love the presumptuous full of glory.
Be modest in your approach, and lower your voice, for the most hated of voices is the voice of donkeys."
Do you not see that Allah has subdued to you what is in the heavens and on the earth? And He has showered you with His apparent and hidden benefits. And among the people there are those who argue about Allah, without knowledge, guidance, or the Enlightening Book.
And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has sent down," they say, "Rather, we follow what we found our ancestors on." Is it then even if the Devil called them to the punishment of the furnace?
And whoever submits his being to Allah, while being beneficent, is really clinging to the firmest handle. The end of all things belongs to Allah.
Whoever disbelieves, let not his disbelief afflict you: to Us will be their return, and We will tell them what they were doing. Allah knows well the contents of the breasts.
We give them enjoyment for a short time; then We will force them to a severe punishment.
If you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will certainly say, "Allah." Say: "Praise be to Allah." But most of them don't know.
To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth. Allah is the Self-Sufficient One, He is the One Worthy of Praise!
Even if all the trees of the earth were to turn into calames [pens for writing], even if the ocean were an ocean of ink where seven other oceans converged, the words of Allah would not be exhausted. For Allah is Mighty and Wise.
Your creation and resurrection [to all] are [as easy to Allah] as if it were one soul. Verily, Allah is Hearer and Clear-sighted.
Have you not seen that Allah brings night into day, and that He brings day into night, and that He has subdued the sun and the moon, each one of whom continues his course to a fixed time? And Allah is Fully Aware of what you do.
This is because Allah is the Truth, and whatever they invoke besides Him is the False, and Allah is the High, the Great.
Have you not seen that it is by the grace of Allah that the ship sails in the sea, so that He may show you His wonders? There are proofs in this for every patient and grateful man.
When a wave covers them like shadows, they invoke Allah, devoting their worship exclusively to Him; and when He saves them, by bringing them back to dry land, some of them become reluctant; but only the great traitor and the great ungrateful deny Our signs.
O men! Fear your Lord and dread a day when the father will answer for nothing for his child, nor the child for his father. Allah's promise is truth. So don't let this life deceive you, and may the Deceiver (Satan) not mislead you about Allah!
The knowledge of the Hour is with Allah; and it is He who causes the saving rain to fall; and He knows what's in the wombs. And no one knows what he will acquire tomorrow, and no one knows in what land he will die. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Knowing.
Alif, Lâm, Mîm.
The Revelation of the Book, no doubt about it, emanates from the Lord of the universe.
Will they say that he (Muhammad) invented it? This, on the contrary, is the truth coming from your Lord, that you should warn a people to whom no warner before you has come, that they may be guided.
Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days. Then He established himself "Istawâ" on the Throne. Apart from Him, you have neither an ally nor an intercessor. Don't you remember?
From heaven to earth, He administers the matter, which then ascends to Him in a day equivalent to a thousand years of your calculation.
He is the Knower of the unknown and visible worlds, the Mighty, the Merciful,
who has done well all that He has created. And He began the creation of man out of clay,
then He drew His offspring from a drop of vile water [the semen];
then He gave it its perfect form and breathed into it with His Spirit. And He has assigned you hearing, eyes, and heart. How little you are grateful!
And they say, "When we are lost in the earth [in the form of dust], will we become a new creation again?" Moreover, they do not believe in the encounter with their Lord.
Say: "The Angel of Death who is in charge of you will put you to death. Then you will be brought back to your Lord."
If only you then saw the criminals [appear] with their heads bowed before their Lord! "Our Lord, We have seen and heard, send us away, therefore, that we may do good; We believe [now] with certainty."
"If We wished, We would bring to each soul his guidance. But the word from Me must be fulfilled: "I will fill Hell with jinn and men together."
"Taste it! For forgetting the meeting of your day that is here. We too have forgotten you. Taste eternal punishment for what you did."
Only those who are reminded of Our verses fall prostrate and, with praise to their Lord, praise His glory and are not puffed up with pride.
They tear themselves from their beds to call on their Lord, out of fear and hope; and they make a largesse of what We attribute to them.
No being knows what has been reserved for them as a rejoicing for the eyes, as a reward for what they worked!
Is the believer comparable to the perverse? (No), they are not equal.
Those who believe and do good deeds will have their residence in the Gardens of Refuge as a reward for what they have done.
And as for those who have been perverse, their refuge will be Fire: whenever they want to come out of it, they will be brought back to it, and it will be said to them, "Taste the punishment of the Fire which you refused to believe."
We will certainly give them a taste of the punishment here on earth, before the great chastisement, so that they may return (to the straight path)!
Who is more unjust than the one who is reminded of the verses of Allah and then turns away from them? We will certainly take revenge on the criminals.
We did indeed give Moses the Book - so do not be in doubt about your encounter with it - and assigned him as a guide to the Children of Israel.
And We appointed leaders from among them who guided (the people) by Our command as long as they endured and firmly believed in Our verses.
Your Lord will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection what they disagree on.
Is it not an indication to them that before them We have destroyed so many generations in whose houses they walk? There is evidence for this! Will they not listen?
Have they not seen that We push water to a dry soil, and then We bring out a crop that they and their cattle eat? Do they not see, then?
And they say, "When will this victory come, if you are truthful?"
Say: "On the Day of Victory it will be useless for the infidels to believe! And no deadline will be given to them."
Get away from them and wait. They too remain in waiting.
O Prophet! Fear Allah and do not obey the infidels and the hypocrites, for Allah remains All-Knowing and Wise.
And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. For Allah is the Knower of what you do.
And put your trust in Allah. Allah is sufficient for you as a protector.
Allah has not placed two hearts in a man's chest. He did not equate your wives with your mothers, "You are as unlawful to me as my mother's back." He has not made your adopted children your own children. These are words [that come out] of your mouth. But Allah speaks the truth and it is He who points [man] in the right direction.
Call them by the name of their fathers, for it is more equitable in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their fathers, then consider them your brothers in religion or your allies. There is no blame on you for what you do by mistake, but (you will be blamed for) what your hearts do deliberately. Allah, however, is Forgiving and Merciful.
The Prophet has more right over the believers than they have over themselves; and his wives are their mothers. Ties of consanguinity have precedence [in inheritance] between the believers [of Medina] and the emigrants [of Makkah] according to the Book of Allah, unless you make a suitable will in favor of your brothers in religion. And it's written in the Book.
When We pledged the prophets, as well as you, Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary, and We made a solemn pledge of them,
so that [Allah] may question the truthful about their sincerity. And He has prepared a painful punishment for the infidels.
O you who believe! Remember the blessing of Allah upon you, when troops came to you and We sent against them a wind and troops that you did not see. Allah remains Clear-sighted about what you do.
When they came to you from above and below, and the eyes were troubled, and the hearts went up to the throats, and you made all kinds of assumptions about Allah...
The believers were then tried and shaken with a harsh shock.
And when the hypocrites and those who have sickness [doubt] in their hearts said: "Allah and His Messenger have promised us nothing but deception."
Similarly, a group of them said, "People of Yathrib! Don't stay here. Go back [home]." A group of them asked the Prophet for permission to leave, saying, "Our homes are unprotected," when they were not: they only wanted to flee.
And if a breakthrough had been made on them from the flanks of the city and then they had been asked to renounce their faith, they would certainly have accepted, and would not have been long in coming,
whereas before they had made a commitment to Allah that they would not turn their backs. And he will be asked to account for any commitment to Allah.
Say: "Flight will never be of any use to you if it is death (without fighting) or murder (in battle) that you are fleeing; in that case, you will enjoy (life) only a short time."
Say: "Who is there who can protect you from Allah, if He wishes to harm you or if He wants to show you mercy?" And they will not find for themselves besides Allah, neither ally nor helper.
Verily, Allah knows those of you who raise obstacles, and those who say to their brothers, "Come to us," while they show little zeal in battle.
stingy with you. Then, when fear strikes, you see them look at you with rolled back eyes, like those of someone who has fainted for fear of death. Once the fear has passed, they lacerate you with sharp tongues, while they are stingy at doing good. They never believed. Allah, therefore, makes their deeds vain. And this is easy for Allah.
They think that the coalition has not left. But if the coalition returned, [these people] would like to be nomads among the Bedouins and [would] be content to ask for your news. If they were among you, they would have fought very little.
Indeed, you have in the Messenger of Allah an excellent model for anyone who hopes in Allah and the Last Day and invokes Allah frequently.
And when the believers saw the coalition, they said, "This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us; and Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth." And this only increased their faith and submission.
There are men among the believers who have been sincere in their commitment to Allah. Some of them have reached their end, and others are still waiting; and they have not varied in the least;
so that Allah may reward the truthful for their sincerity, and punish, if He wills, the hypocrites, or accept their repentance. For Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And Allah has sent away the infidels with their rage without them having obtained any good, and Allah has spared the believers the fight. Allah is Mighty and Mighty.
And He brought down from their fortresses those of the People of the Book who had supported them [the coalition], and He threw terror into their hearts; a group of them you killed, and a group took you prisoner.
And He has made you inherit their land, their dwellings, their goods, and also a land which you had not trodden. And Allah is Omnipotent.
O Prophet! Say to your wives, "If it is this life that you desire and its adornment, then come! I will give you [the means] to enjoy it and set you free [by divorce] without prejudice.
But if it is Allah whom you want and His Messenger and the Last Abode, Allah has prepared a great reward for the beneficent among you.
O wives of the Prophet! Whoever among you commits proven turpitude, the punishment will be doubled twice! And this is easy for Allah.
And the one among you who is completely submissive to Allah and His Messenger and does good, We will give her twice her reward, and We have prepared for her a generous allotment.
O wives of the Prophet! You are not comparable to any other woman. If you are pious, do not be too complacent in your language, so that he whose heart is sick [the hypocrite] will not covet you. And use decent language.
Stay in your homes; and do not exhibit yourself in the manner of the women before Islam (Jâhiliyah). Perform Salah, pay Zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only wants to rid you of all defilement, O people of the household, and wants to cleanse you completely.
And keep in your memories what is recited in your homes from the verses of Allah and wisdom. Allah is Gentle and All-Knowing.
Muslims, men and women who believe, who are obedient, loyal and loyal, who endure, who fear and fear, who give alms, who fast, who are guardians of their chastity and guardians, who often invoke Allah and who supplication: Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward for them.
It is not up to a believer, once Allah and His Messenger have decided one thing, to still have a choice in how they act. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has gone astray, indeed by a clear error.
When you said to the one whom Allah had bestowed with blessings, just as you had bestowed upon him, "Keep your wife to yourself and fear Allah," and you were hiding in your soul what Allah was going to make public. You feared people, and Allah is more worthy of your fear. And when Zayd had ceased all intercourse with her, We made you marry her, so that there would be no hindrance for the believers to marry the wives of their adopted sons, when they cease all intercourse with them. Allah's command must be carried out.
There is no reproach to be made against the Prophet in that Allah has imposed on him, in accordance with the laws established for those who lived before. Allah's commandment is an inescapable decree.
Those who communicated the messages of Allah, feared Him and feared none other than Allah. And Allah is sufficient to keep track of everything.
Muhammad was never the father of one of your men, but the Messenger of Allah and the last of the Prophets. Allah is All-Knowing.
O you who believe! Evoke Allah abundantly,
and glorify Him at the dawn and at the end of the day.
It is He who prays over you, together with His Angels, that He may bring you out of darkness into light; and He is Merciful to believers.
Their greeting on the day they meet Him will be: "Salam" [peace], and He has prepared a generous reward for them.
O Prophet! We have sent you to witness, to herald, to warn,
calling (people) to Allah, by His permission; and like an illuminating lamp.
And give good news to the believers that they will receive great grace from Allah.
And do not obey the infidels and hypocrites, do not pay attention to their wickedness, and put your trust in Allah and Allah is sufficient as your protector.
O you who believe! When you marry women of faith and then divorce them before you have touched them, you cannot impose a waiting period on them. Give them the enjoyment [of property] and set them free [by divorce] without prejudice.
O Prophet! We have made lawful for you your wives to whom you have given their mahr (dowry), what you have lawfully possessed among the captives [or slaves] whom Allah has destined for you, the daughters of your paternal uncle, the daughters of your paternal aunts, the daughters of your maternal uncle, and the daughters of your maternal aunts, those who had emigrated with you,  and any believing woman if she gives her person to the Prophet, provided that the Prophet consents to marry her: this is a privilege for you, to the exclusion of other believers. We know what We have imposed on them concerning their wives and the slaves they own, so that there will be no blame against you. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
You make whoever you want wait for them, and you host whomever you want in your home. Then you are not reproached if you invite to your home one of those whom you had rejected. This is what is most likely to rejoice them, to save them all sorrow, and to make them accept with a good heart what you have given them all. Allah knows, however, what is in your hearts. And Allah is All-Knowing and Forgiving.
It is no longer lawful for you to take [other] wives, nor to change wives, even if their beauty pleases you; - except for the slaves you own. And Allah observes all things.
O you who believe! Do not enter the dwellings of the Prophet unless you are invited to a meal, without being there waiting for it to be cooked. But when you are called, then come in. Then, when you have eaten, disperse yourselves, without trying to make yourselves familiar to talk. It hurt the Prophet, but he was embarrassed to dismiss you, whereas Allah does not mind the truth. And if you ask them (his wives) for any object, ask them behind a curtain: it is purer for your hearts and their hearts; you must not cause pain to the Messenger of Allah, nor should you ever marry his wives after him; it would be, in the eyes of Allah, a great sin.
Whether you divulge something or hide it,... Allah remains All-Knowing.
No grievance against them concerning their fathers, their sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their wives and the slaves they own. And fear Allah. For Allah is the witness of all things.
Verily, Allah and His angels pray upon the Prophet; O you who believe, pray upon him and address your greetings to him.
Those who offend Allah and His Messenger, Allah curses them in this world, as in the Hereafter, and prepares for them a degrading punishment.
And those who offend believers without their having deserved it, are burdening themselves with slander and obvious sin.
O Prophet! Tell your wives, your daughters, and the wives of believers to bring their large veils over them, and they will be more quickly recognized and will avoid being offended. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Verily, if the hypocrites, those with heart disease, and the alarmists in Madinah do not cease, We will incite you against them, and then they will stay there only a short time in your neighborhood.
They are cursed. Wherever they are found, they will be taken and killed mercilessly:
This was the law established by Allah for those who lived before and you will not find any change in the law of Allah.
People ask you about the Hour. Say: "His knowledge is exclusive to Allah." What do you know? It may be that the Hour is near.
Allah cursed the infidels and prepared a furnace for them,
so that they may remain there forever, without finding allies or helpers.
On the day when their faces are turned and turned back in the Fire, they will say, "Alas for us! If only we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!"
And they said, "Lord, we have obeyed our leaders and our nobles. So they are the ones who have led us astray from the Path.
O our Lord, inflict twice the punishment on them and curse them with a great curse."
O you who believe! Do not be like those who offended Moses. Allah declared him innocent of their accusations, because he was honorable in the sight of Allah.
O you who believe! Fear Allah and speak righteously,
so that He may improve your actions and forgive you your sins. Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger is indeed very successful.
We had proposed to the heavens, the earth, and the mountains the responsibility (to bear the burdens of doing good and avoiding evil). They refused to carry it and were afraid of it, while the man took care of it; for he is very unjust and very ignorant.
So that Allah may punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the associates, and Allah may accept the repentance of the believers. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Praise be to Allah, to whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth. And praise be to Him in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Perfected Knower.
He knows what enters the earth and what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven and what rises again. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.
Those who do not believe say, "The Hour will not come to us." Say: "By my Lord! Most certainly, it will come to you. [My Lord] the Knower of the Unknowable. Nothing escapes Him, even from the weight of an atom in the heavens, as on earth. And there is nothing smaller or greater, that is not written in an explicit Book,
so that He may reward those who believe and do good works. For these, there will be forgiveness and a generous donation.
And those who strive to make Our verses vain, they will have the punishment of a painful torment.
And those to whom knowledge has been given see that what has been sent down to you from your Lord is the truth that guides to the path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy.
And those who do not believe said, "Do you want to be shown a man who will tell you that when you are completely disintegrated, you will undoubtedly reappear as a new creation?
Is he inventing a lie against Allah? Or is he crazy?" [No], but those who do not believe in the hereafter are doomed to punishment and distant error.
Do they not then see what is heaven and earth before and behind them? If We wished, We would cause the earth to swallow them up, or pieces of heaven to fall upon them. There is a proof in this for every repentant servant.
We have indeed granted a favor to David from Us: O mountains and birds, repeat with him (the praises of Allah). And for him, We have softened the iron,
(telling him): "Make complete chainmail and measure the stitches well." And do good. I am a Clairvoyant about what you are doing.
And to Solomon (We have subdued) the wind, the morning course of which is equivalent to a month's journey, and the evening journey is also a month. And for him We have made the spring of copper flow. And among the jinn there are some who worked under him, by permission of his Lord. Whoever of them, however, deviated from Our command, We gave him a taste of the punishment of the furnace.
They made for him what he wanted: shrines, statues, trays like basins, and well-anchored pots. - "O family of David, work out of gratitude," while there have been few of My servants who are grateful.
Then, when We decided on his death, there was only the "beast of the earth" to warn them of his death, which gnawed at his cane. Then when he collapsed, it became evident to the jinn that if they really knew the unknown, they would not have remained in the humiliating torment [of servitude].
There was certainly a Sign in their dwellings for the tribe of Sheba': two gardens, one on the right and the other on the left. "Eat of what your Lord has given you, and be grateful to Him: a good land and a Forgiving Lord."
But they turned away. We unleashed the flooding of the Dam against them, and changed their two gardens into two gardens of bitter fruits, tamarisk and a few jujube trees.
Thus rewarded Us for their disbelief. Are We able to punish anyone other than the disbeliever?
And We had placed other prominent cities between them and the cities that We had blessed, and We had evaluated the stages of travel between them. "Travel between them for nights and days, in safety."
Then they said, "Lord, lengthen the distances between our stages," and they wronged themselves. We therefore made them the subjects of legend and disintegrated them completely. There are warnings in this for all, great endurance and great grateful.
And Satan has most certainly made his conjecture about them true. So they followed him, except for a group of believers.
And yet he had no power over them except that We wanted to distinguish between the one who believed in the Hereafter and the one who doubted. Your Lord, however, ensures the safeguarding of all things.
Say: "Invoke those whom you claim besides Allah [to be gods]. They do not even possess the weight of an atom, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. They have never been associated with their creation and He has no one among them to support Him."
Intercession with Him benefits only the one for whom He permits it. When fear has then passed from their hearts, they will say, "What has your Lord said?" They will answer, "The Truth; He is the Sublime, the Great."
Say: "Who feeds you from heaven and earth?" Say: "Allah. It is we or you who are on the right path, or in a manifest error."
Say: "You will not be questioned about the crimes we have committed, and we will not be questioned about what you are doing."
Say: "Our Lord will bring us together, and then He will decide between us, with the truth, for He is the Great Judge, the All-Knowing."
Say: "Show me those whom you have given Him as associates. Well, no! Rather, it is He, Allah, the Mighty, the Wise."
And We have sent you only as a herald and warner for all mankind. But most people don't know.
And they say, "When will this promise come, if you are truthful?"
Say: "The appointment is for a day that you will not be able to delay for an hour, nor bring forward."
And those who disbelieved said: "We will never believe in this Qur'an or in what came before it." And if you could only see when the unrighteous will stand before their Lord, sending the word back to one another! Those who were considered weak will say to those who were proud: "Without you, we would certainly have been believers."
Those who were proud will say to those whom they considered weak, "Were we the ones who pushed you away from the right direction after it came to you? But you were more like criminals."
And those who were considered weak will say to those who were proud: "It was your ploy, rather, night and day, to command us not to believe in Allah and to give Him equals." And they will hide their regret when they see the punishment. We will put shackles around the necks of those who have disbelieved: would we reward them other than according to what they worked?"
And We have not sent any warner into a city without its well-to-do people saying, "We do not believe the message with which you are sent."
And they said, "We have more wealth and more children, and we will not be punished."
Say: "My Lord generously dispenses His gifts to whomever He wills. But most people don't know."
Neither your possessions nor your children will bring you close to Us. Except the one who believes and works in good. They will have a double reward for what they have been doing, while they will be safe on the upper floors (of Paradise).
And as for those who strive to make Our verses ineffective, they will be forced to present themselves for punishment.
Say: "My Lord dispenses His gifts generously or restrained to whom He wills among His servants. And whatever you spend [in good], He replaces it, and He is the Best of Givers."
And someday He will gather them all. Then He will say to the Angels, "Was it you that these people worshipped?"
They will say, "Glory to You! You are our Ally apart from them. Rather, they worshipped the jinn, in whom most of them believed.
On that day, therefore, you will have no means of benefiting or harming one another, while We will say to the unjust: "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you called a lie."
And when Our edifying verses are recited to them, they say, 'This is only a man who wants to turn you away from what your forefathers worshipped.'" And they say, "This (the Qur'an) is just a made-up lie." And those who do not believe say of the Truth when it comes to them: "This is only obvious magic!"
[Yet] We didn't give them books to study. And We have not sent them any warner before you.
Those before them had [also] denied (their messengers). [The Meccans] have not attained a tenth of what We have given them [in strength and wealth]. They called My Messengers liars. And what a reprobation was mine!
Say: "I exhort you only to one thing: that for the sake of Allah you get up, in pairs or singly, and then think. Your companion (Muhammad) is not possessed at all, but he is only a warning to you of severe punishment."
Say: "What I ask of you as a salary is for yourselves. For my salary belongs only to Allah. He is a Witness of all things."
Say: "Verily, my Lord speaks the Truth, [to His messengers], He is the Perfect Knower of the unknowable."
Say: "The truth [Islam] has come. And the False [disbelief] cannot begin or renew anything."
Say: "If I go astray, I go astray only at my own expense; whereas if I guide myself, then it is thanks to what My Lord reveals to me, for He is Hearing and Near."
If you see them when they are seized with fear, - there is no escape for them - and they will be seized at close quarters!
Then they will say, "We believe in him." - But how will they attain faith from so far away?
whereas before they had actually disbelieved in it and they offend the stranger from a distant place!
They will be prevented from attaining what they desire, as was done before with their fellow-men, for they were in deep doubt.
Praise be to Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, who has made the angels messengers with two, three or four wings. He adds to creation what He wills, for Allah is Omnipotent.
What Allah grants in mercy to people, there is no one who can hold back. And what He retains, there is no one to release after Him. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.
O men! Remember the blessing of Allah upon you: is there a Creator besides Allah who from heaven and earth bestows your sustenance on you? There is no god but Him! How can you turn away [from this truth]?
And if they call you a liar, surely the Messengers have been called liars before you. To Allah, however, everything is brought back.
O men! Allah's promise is truth. Do not let this life deceive you, and let the great deceiver, (Satan) not deceive you about Allah!
The Devil is an enemy to you. Take him for your enemy, then. He only calls his supporters to be people of the Furnace.
Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, while those who believe and do good deeds will have forgiveness and a great reward.
What! The one whose evil deed has been embellished to the point that he sees it beautiful...? - But Allah leads astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills - Let not your soul be filled with regret for them: Allah is Perfectly Knowledgeable of what they make.
And it is Allah who sends the winds that raise a cloud which We then push to a dead land; then We give life to the earth after its death. This is how the Resurrection will take place!
Whoever wants power (let him seek it from Allah) for all power is Allah's: to Him ascends the good word, and He exalts good deeds. And as for those who plot evil deeds, they will have a severe punishment. However, their scheme is doomed to failure.
And Allah created you from the earth, then from a drop of semen, and then He established you into couples. No female bears or gives birth without His knowledge. And no existence is prolonged or shortened without it being recorded in a book. This is really easy for Allah.
The two seas are not identical: [the water of] the one is drinkable, sweet, and pleasant to drink, and the other is salty, bitter. However, from each you eat fresh flesh, and you extract an ornament which you wear. And you see the vessel cleaving the water noisily, so that you may seek some of His grace's products. Maybe you'll be grateful!
He makes night penetrate the day and day penetrate the night. And He subdued the sun and the moon. Each of them is moving towards a fixed term. This is Allah your Lord: to Him belongs the kingdom, while those whom you invoke besides Him are not even masters of the skin of a date stone.
If you call upon them, they do not hear your supplication; and even if they heard, they would not be able to answer you. And on the Day of Judgment they will deny your association. No one can give you news like the One who is perfectly informed.
O men, you are the needy who need Allah, and it is Allah who dispenses with all things and He is the One worthy of praise.
If He willed, He would make you disappear, and bring forth a new creation.
And this is not difficult for Allah.
But no one will bear the burden of another. And if a soul overloaded [with sins] cries out for help, none of his burden will be borne by another even if he is a close relative. In fact, you warn only those who fear their Lord even though they do not see Him, and who perform Salah. And whoever purifies himself purifies himself only for himself, and to Allah is the destination.
The blind man and the seeer are not alike,
nor darkness and light,
nor the shade and the fiery heat.
In the same way, the living and the dead are not alike. Allah makes whomever He wills hear, while you [Muhammad] cannot make those who are in the tombs hear.
You are only a warner.
We have sent you with the Truth as a herald and warner. There is not a nation that has not already had a warner.
And if they call you a liar, well, those before them called (their Messengers) liars, while their Messengers brought them the proofs, the Writings and the Illuminating Book.
Then I seized those who disbelieved. And what a reprobation was mine!
Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from heaven? Then We bring forth fruits of different colors. And in the mountains, there are white and red furrows, of different colors, and excessively black rocks.
There are likewise different colors among men, animals, and cattle. Among His servants, only the scholars fear Allah. Verily, Allah is Mighty and Forgiving.
Those who recite the Book of Allah, perform Salah, and spend in secret and in public what We have allotted to them, hope in this way to carry on a trade that will never perish.
so that [Allah] may fully reward them and add His grace to them. He is Forgiving and Grateful.
And what We have revealed to you of the Book is the Truth confirming what came before it. Verily, Allah is Allainthetical and Knowingly Knowingly and Knowingly His servants.
Then We made those of Our servants whom We chose heirs of the Book. There are some among them who harm themselves, others who stand in the middle way, and others with Allah's permission anticipate [all others] in their good deeds; such is infinite grace
The Gardens of Eden where they will enter, adorned with gold bracelets and pearls; and there their garments are of silk.
And they will say: "Praise be to Allah, who has removed affliction from us. Our Lord is indeed Forgiving and Grateful.
It is He who has installed us, by His grace, in the Abode of stability, where no fatigue, no weariness touches us."
And those who have disbelieved will have the fire of Hell: they are not finished off to die; nothing is relieved of their torments. This is how We reward every obstinate denier.
And there they will cry out, "Lord, bring us out; We will do good, contrary to what we were doing." "Have We not given you a life long enough for the one who thinks to reflect? The alarm, however, had come to you. Well, taste (your punishment). For for the unjust, there is no helper."
Allah knows the Unknowable in the heavens and the earth. He knows the contents of the breasts.
It is He who has made you successors on earth. Whoever disbelieves, his disbelief will fall on him. Their disbelief only adds reproach to the disbelievers to their Lord. Their disbelief only adds loss to the disbelievers.
Say: "Do you see your associates whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they created from the earth. Were they associated with the creation of the heavens? Or have We brought them a Book that contains proofs [for what they do]." No! But it is only in deception that the unrighteous make promises to one another.
Allah holds back the heavens and the earth so that they do not collapse. And if they should sink, no one else after Him will be able to hold them back. He is Indulgent and Forgiving.
And they solemnly swore by Allah, that if a warner came to them, they would certainly be better guided than any other community. Then, when a warner (Muhammad) came to them, it only increased their repulsion,
by pride on earth and by treacherous maneuvers. However, the treacherous maneuver only envelops its own perpetrators. Are they then waiting for a different fate from that of the Ancients? But you will never find a change in Allah's rule, and you will never find a deviation in Allah's rule.
Have they never traveled the earth to see what has become of those who lived before them and who were more powerful than they? And nothing in heaven or on earth can reduce the authority of Allah. For He is indeed Omniscient, Omnipotent.
And if Allah were to attack people for what they acquire, He would not leave on the face [of the earth] any living being. But He gives them a period of time until a fixed term. Then when their end comes... (He will take hold of them) because Allah is Very Discerning over His servants.
Yâ Sîn.
By the Qur'an full of wisdom.
You (Muhammad) are indeed among the Messengers,
on a straight path.
It is a revelation from the Almighty, the Most Merciful,
so that you warn a people whose ancestors were not warned: therefore they are careless.
For the Word against most of them has been fulfilled, so they will not believe.
We will put shackles around their necks, and there will be some up to their chins: and now they will go with their heads raised.
and We will set a barrier before them and a barrier behind them; We will cover them with a veil, and behold, they will be able to see nothing.
They don't care whether you warn them or not: they will never believe.
You only warn the one who follows the Remembrance (the Qur'an), and fears the All-Merciful, even though he does not see Him. Announce to him forgiveness and a generous reward.
It is We who raise the dead and write down what they have done [for the Hereafter] and their traces. And We have enumerated everything in an explicit register.
Give them as an example the inhabitants of the city, when the envoys came to him.
When We sent them two [messengers] and they called them liars. Then we reinforced [them] with a third, and they said, "Truly, we are sent to you."
But they said, "You are just men like us. The Most Merciful has sent down nothing and you are only lying."
They [the messengers] said, "Our Lord knows that in truth we are sent to you,
and it is only incumbent on us to convey (our message) clearly."
They said, "We see in you an evil omen. If you do not stop, we will stone you and a painful punishment from us will come upon you."
They said, "Your bad omen is with yourselves. Do you (this is how you act) when you are reminded of it? But you are outrageous people!"
And from the end of the city a man came in all haste and said, "O my people, follow the messengers:
Follow those who don't ask you for any salary and are on the right track.
and why should I not worship Him who created me? And to Him you will be drawn.
Would I take gods besides Him? If the Most Merciful wishes me harm, their intercession will be of no use to me and they will not save me.
I will then be in an obvious way.
[But] I believe in your Lord. Listen to me, then."
Then it was said to him, "Enter Paradise." He said, "Oh, if only my people knew!
... for which reason my Lord has forgiven me and made me one of the honored."
And after him We sent down no army from heaven. We did not want to send anything down on his people.
It was only one Cry and now they are extinguished.
Alas for slaves [humans]! Never does it come to them that they don't scoff at.
Do they not see how many generations before them We have destroyed them? They will never return to their midst.
And all of them without exception will appear before Us.
A proof for them is the dead earth, to which We give life, and from which We bring forth grain from which they eat.
We have planted gardens of palm trees and vines and have caused springs to gush out,
so that they may eat of His fruit and of what their hands have produced. Won't they be grateful?
Praise be to Him who created all couples from what the earth grows, from themselves, and from what they do not know!
And a proof for them is the night. We skin them during the day and they are then in darkness.
and the sun runs to a lodging assigned to it; such is the determination of the Almighty, of the All-Knowing.
And the moon We have determined phases for it until it becomes like the old palm.
The sun cannot catch up with the moon, nor night precede the day; and each one sails in an orbit.
And (another) sign for them is that We have carried their descendants on the loaded boat;
and We created for them like men on which they ascend.
And if We will, We drown them; for them then, there is no helper and they will not be saved,
except by mercy on Our part, and as a pleasure for a time.
And when they are told, "Fear what is before you and what is behind you, so that you may have mercy"...
Now not a single proof comes to them, among the proofs of their Lord, that they do not turn away from it.
And when it is said to them, "Spend what Allah has given you," those who have disbelieved say to those who have believed, "Shall we feed someone whom Allah would have fed if He had willed? You are only in an obvious error."
And they say, "When will this promise be made, if you are truthful?"
They are only waiting for a single Cry to seize them while they are arguing.
They will therefore not be able to make a will or return to their families.
And they will blow into the Trunk, and behold, from the tombs they will rush to their Lord,
saying, "Woe to us! Who raised us from where we slept?" This is what the Most Merciful had promised; and the Messengers had spoken the truth.
It will be but one Cry, and behold, they will all be brought before Us.
On that day, no soul will be harmed in anything. And you will only be rewarded according to what you did.
The people of Paradise will be, on that day, in an occupation that fills them with happiness;
they and their wives are under shade, leaning on the couches.
There they will have fruit and they will have what they ask for,
"Salam" [peace and blessings of all]! Word from a Most Merciful Lord.
"O unjust! Stay away on this day!
Have I not urged you, children of Adam, not to worship the Devil? For he is truly an open enemy to you,
and [have I not urged you] to worship Me? This is a straight path.
And it has most certainly led many of you astray. Were you not reasoning?
This is the Hell that was promised to you.
Burn it today, for having disbelieved."
On that day We will seal their mouths, while their hands will speak to Us and their legs will bear witness to what they have done.
And if We wished, We would blot out their eyes and they will run to the path. But how will they be able to see?
And if We wished, We would transform them on the spot; then they will not know how to move forward or return.
To whomsoever We grant a long life, We bring down his form. Will they not understand?
We did not teach him (Muhammad) poetry; it doesn't suit him either. This is just a reminder and a clear reading [Qur'an].
so that he may warn the one who is alive and that the Word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.
Do they not see that, among what Our hands have made, We have created for them cattle of which they are the owners;
and We have subjected them to them, some of them for horses and others for food;
and they derive other uses and drinks from it. Won't they be grateful?
And they adopted deities besides Allah, in the hope of being rescued...
The latter will not be able to help them, but will instead form an army against them.
Let not their words grieve you! We know what they are hiding and what they are disclosing.
Does not man see that We have created him from a drop of semen? And here he is [become] an open adversary!
He cites an example for Us, while he forgets his own creation; he says, "Who is going to give life to bones when they are reduced to dust?"
Say: "He who created them the first time will give them life again. He knows Himself perfectly in all creation.
it is He who made fire for you out of the green tree, and now you are lighting from it.
Will not He who created the heavens and the earth be able to create their like? Oh yes! and He is the great Creator, the All-Knowing.
When He wants a thing, His commandment is to say, "Be," and it is.
Praise therefore be to Him who holds the kingdom over all things in His hand. And to Him you will be drawn.
By those who are ranged in ranks.
By those who push (the clouds) with force.
By those who recite, as a reminder:
"Your God is indeed one,
the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of what exists between them and Lord of the Levants"
We decorated the sky closest to a setting: the stars,
in order to protect him against any rebellious devil.
They will not be able to listen to the supreme dignitaries [the Angels]; for they will be harassed on all sides,
and repressed. And they will have perpetual punishment.
Except the one who seizes some [information]; He is then chased by a piercing meteor.
Ask them if they are more difficult to create than those We have created? For We have created them of sticky mud!
But you are surprised, and they laugh!
And when they are reminded of it (the Qur'an), they do not remember;
and when they see a prodigy, they try to laugh at him,
and say, "This is just obvious magic.
When we are dead and become dust and bones, will we be resurrected?
as well as our first ancestors?"
Say: "Yes! and you will humble yourself."
There will be only one Cry, and behold, they will look,
and they will say, "Woe to us! it is the day of Retribution."
"It is the day of judgment that you called a lie."
"Gather the unrighteous and their wives and all that they worshipped,
apart from Allah. Then drive them to the Chemin de la Fournaise.
And stop them: for they must be interrogated."
"Why don't you help each other?"
But on that day, they will be completely submissive,
and some will turn to others questioning each other;
They will say: "It is you who forced us (to disbelieve)."
"It was rather you (the chiefs will say) who did not want to believe.
And we had no power over you. Rather, it was you who were transgressors.
The word of our Lord has therefore been fulfilled against us; Verily, we will taste [the punishment].
We have misled you, for in truth we ourselves were misled."
On that day, therefore, they will all be associated in the punishment.
This is how We treat criminals.
When it was said to them, "There is no god but Allah," they were puffed up with pride.
and said, "Are we going to abandon our gods for a mad poet?"
Rather, He came with the Truth and confirmed the (previous) Messengers.
You will certainly taste the painful punishment.
And you will be rewarded only according to what you worked,
except the chosen servants of Allah,
These will have a well-known reward:
fruits, and they will be honored,
in the Gardens of Delight,
on beds, face to face.
A cup of water filled with water should be circulated between them at a spring
white, tasty to drink,
It will not offend their reason or intoxicate them.
And they will have with them beauties with large eyes, with chaste eyes,
similar to the well-preserved white of the egg.
Then some will turn to each other, questioning each other.
One of them said: "I had a companion
who said, "Are you really one of those who believe?
Will we have to account when we die and are dust and bones?"
He'll say, "Would you look down from above?"
Then he will look down and see him right in the Furnace,
and will say: "By Allah! You almost caused my downfall!
and but for the blessing of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those who are dragged [to execution].
Is it not true that we shall not die
than for our first death and that we will not be punished?"
This, of course, is the great success.
It is for such a thing that those who open must open.
Is this better as a dwelling, or the tree of Zaqum?
We have assigned him to the trial of the unjust.
It is a tree that comes out of the bottom of the Furnace.
Its fruits are like devils' heads.
They must certainly eat it and they must fill their bellies with it.
Then they will have a mixture of boiling water on top.
Then their return will be to the Furnace.
It is because they found their ancestors in error,
and there they are running in their tracks.
Indeed, before them, most of the elders had lost their way.
And We had certainly sent warners among them.
Look at what has become of those who have been warned!
Except for the elect, among the servants of Allah:
Noah, in fact, called upon Us who are the Best Answering Machine.
And We saved him and his family from great anguish,
and We made his descendants the only survivors.
and We have perpetuated his memory in posterity,
Peace be upon Noah throughout the universe!
Thus do We reward the beneficents.
He was, indeed, one of Our believing servants.
Then We drowned the others.
Of his co-religionists, certainly, was Abraham.
When he came to his Lord with a sound heart.
When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
Are you looking for gods besides Allah in your error?
What do you think of the Lord of the universe?"
Then he cast a careful glance at the stars,
and says, "I'm sick."
They turned their backs on him and went away.
Then he crept up to their deities and said, "Don't you eat?
What do you have not to talk about?"
Then he began to strike them furtively with his right hand.
Then [the people] came running to him.
He said to them: "Do you worship what you yourselves carve,
when it is Allah who created you and what you make?"
They said, "Let them build him an oven and throw him into the furnace."
They wanted to play a trick on him; but it was they whom We put down.
And he said, "I'm going to my Lord and He'll guide me.
Lord, give me one of the righteous."
So we gave him the good news of a long-suffering boy (Ishmael).
Then when the latter was old enough to accompany him, [Abraham] said: "O my son, I see myself in a dream immolating you. So see what you think." (Ishmael) said: "O my dear father, do as you are commanded, and you will find me, Allah willing, among the enduring."
Then when both of them had submitted (to Allah's command) and he had thrown him on his forehead,
behold, We called him "Abraham!
You confirmed the vision. This is how We reward the beneficents."
This was certainly the manifest trial.
And We ransomed him with a generous immolation.
And We perpetuated his fame in posterity:
"Peace be upon Abraham."
Thus We reward the beneficent;
for he was one of Our believing servants.
We gave him the good news of Isaac as a prophet among the righteous.
And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants there is the good man and the one who is manifestly unjust to himself.
And We did Moses and Aaron favor him,
And saved them and their people from great anguish,
and helped them, and they were the victors.
And We brought them the explicit book
and guided them to the right path.
And We perpetuated their fame in posterity:
"Peace be upon Moses and Aaron"
Thus We reward the beneficent;
for they were of the number of Our believing servants.
Elijah was indeed one of the Messengers.
When he said to his people, "Do you not fear [Allah]?"
Will you summon Ball (an idol) and leave the Best of Creators,
Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your oldest ancestors?"
They called him a liar. Well, they will be taken away (to punishment).
Except for the chosen servants of Allah.
And We perpetuated his fame in posterity:
"Peace be upon Elijah and his followers."
Thus do We reward the beneficent,
for he was one of Our believing servants.
And Lot, indeed, was one of the Messengers.
When We saved him and his whole family,
except for an old woman who was to disappear with the others,
And We destroyed the others
And you certainly pass by them in the morning
and at night. Are you not reasoning, then?
Jonah was certainly one of the Messengers.
When he flees to the packed boat,
He took part in the drawing of lots that designated him to be thrown [into the sea].
The fish swallowed him when he was blameworthy.
If he had not been among those who glorify Allah,
it would have remained in his womb until the day when one is resurrected.
We threw him on the bare ground, indisposed as he was.
And We caused a pumpkin plant to grow above him,
and then sent him (as a prophet) to a hundred thousand men or more.
They believed, and we gave them the enjoyment of life for a time.
So ask them, "Does your Lord have daughters and they sons?
Or have We created female angels, and are they witnesses of it?"
Certainly, they say in their lie:
"Allah has begotten" but they are certainly liars!
Would He have chosen daughters in preference to sons?
What have you to judge in this way?
Don't you think?
Or do you have an obvious argument?
Bring your Book if you are truthful!"
And they have established a kinship between Him and the jinn, while the jinn know that they [the disbelievers] are going to be taken away (for punishment).
Glory be to Allah. He is above what they describe!
Except for the chosen servants of Allah.
Verily, you and all that you worship,
will not be able to tempt [anyone],
except the one that will be burned in the Furnace.
There is not one of us who does not have a known place;
we are certainly the ranged in ranks;
and it is indeed we who celebrate the glory [of Allah].
Even if they said:
"If we had had a Recall of [our] ancestors,
we would have been the chosen servants of Allah!
They disbelieved in it and they will soon know.
For Our Word has already been given to Our servants, the Messengers,
that they are the ones who will be helped,
and that Our soldiers will have the upper hand.
Stay away from them until a while;
and watch them: they will soon see!
What! Is it Our chastisement that they seek to hasten?
When he falls into their place, it will be a bad morning for those who have been warned!
And depart from them until a while;
and observes; they will see soon!
Glory to your Lord, the Lord of power. He is above what they describe!
And peace be upon the Messengers,
and praise be to Allah, the Lord of the universe.
Sâd. By the Qur'an, with glorious fame (dikr)!
Those who have disbelieved are rather in pride and schism!
How many generations before them have We caused to perish, who cried out, alas, when there was no longer time to escape?
And they (the Meccans) were astonished that a warner among them had come to them, and the infidels say, "He is a magician and a great liar,
Will he reduce the gods to one God? This is a truly astonishing thing."
And their notables departed, saying, "Go away, and remain constant to your gods: this is really a desirable thing.
We did not hear this in the last religion (Christianity); it is in truth only pure invention!
What! Is it on him, among us, that the Reminder [the Qur'an] would have been sent down?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Or rather, they have not yet tasted My chastisement!
Or do they hold the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, the Mighty, the Giver par excellence.
Or do they have the kingdom of heaven and earth and of what exists between them? Well, let them get there by any means!
An army of coalition members who, right here, will be routed!
Before them, the people of Noah, the Aad and Pharaoh the man of the pals (or the Pyramids),
and the Tamūd, the people of Lot, and the people of Al-Aykah, (have all denied their Messengers). Here are the coalitions.
There is not one of them who has not called the Messengers liars. Well, My punishment has proven against them!
They are waiting for only one Cry, without repetition.
And they say, "Lord, hasten our portion before the Day of Reckoning."
Endure what they say; and remember David, Our servant, endowed with strength [in worship] and full of repentance [to Allah].
We subdued the mountains to glorify Allah, night and morning, in his company,
and the birds gathered in a mass, all of them only obeying him [Allah].
And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and the faculty of judging rightly.
And did the news of the disputants come to you when they climbed the wall of the sanctuary?
When they came to David, he was frightened. They said, "Do not be afraid! We are both in dispute; one of us has wronged the other. Judge therefore justly between us, do not be unjust, and guide us to the right path.
This is my brother: he has ninety-nine sheep, while I have only one sheep. He told me: 'Entrust her to me' and in the conversation, he put a lot of pressure on me."
He [David] said, "He was certainly unjust to you in asking to join your sheep to his sheep." Many people transgress the rights of their associates, except those who believe and do good deeds, although they are very rare. And David thought then that We had put him to the test. So he asked his Lord for forgiveness and fell down prostrate and repented.
We forgave him. He will have a place close to Us and a beautiful refuge.
"O David, We have made you a caliph on earth. Judge therefore justly among the people and do not follow the passion, otherwise it will lead you astray from the path of Allah." For those who stray from the path of Allah will have a severe punishment for forgetting the Day of Reckoning.
We did not create heaven and earth and what exists between them in vain. This is what those who have disbelieved think. Woe to those who have disbelieved for the fire [that awaits them]!
Will We treat those who believe and do good deeds like those who make a mess on earth? Or will We treat the pious as the wicked?
A blessed Book which We have sent down to you, that they may meditate on its verses and that the endowed with understanding may reflect.
And to David We gave Solomon, what a good servant! - He was full of repentance.
When one afternoon he was presented with magnificent racehorses,
he said: "Yes, I have been so pleased to love the goods (of this world) that I have forgotten the remembrance of my Lord until [the sun] has hidden itself behind its veil.
Bring them back to me." Then he began to cut off their legs and necks.
And We had certainly tried Solomon by placing a body on his seat. Then he repented.
He said, "Lord, forgive me and give me a kingdom such as no one after me will have. You are the great Giver."
We then subjected him to the wind, which, by his order, blew moderately wherever he pleased.
As well as devils, builders and divers of all kinds.
And still others, coupled in chains.
"This is our gift; distribute it or withhold it without having to account for it."
And he has a place close to Us and a beautiful refuge.
And remember Job, Our servant, when he called upon his Lord, "The Devil has inflicted distress and suffering upon me."
Strike [the earth] with your foot: here is fresh water to wash you and here is something to drink.
And We restored to him his family and made them twice as numerous, as a mercy from Us and as a reminder to the understanding.
"And take a bundle of twigs in your hand, and strike with it. And do not violate your oath." Yes, We found him really enduring. What a good servant! He was constantly repenting.
And remember Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, Our mighty and far-sighted servants.
We have made them the object of a special distinction: the reminder of the afterlife.
They are certainly among the best elected officials with Us.
And remember Ishmael and Elisha, and Dal Kifl, each of them among the best.
This is a reminder. It is to the pious that belongs, in truth, the best retreat,
The Gardens of Eden, open doors for them,
where, leaning on their elbows, they will ask for abundant fruit and drink.
And beside them will be the beautiful ones with chaste looks, all of the same age.
This is what is promised to you for the Day of Reckoning.
This will be Our inexhaustible allocation.
There you go! While the rebels will certainly have the worst retreat,
Hell where they will burn. And what a dreadful bed!
There you go! Let them taste it: boiling water and purulent water,
and other punishments of the same kind.
Here is a group that enters in a hurry at the same time as you, no welcome to them. They're going to burn in the Fire.
They said, "No welcome for you, rather. It is you who have prepared this for us." What a bad place to stay!
They said, "Lord, the one who prepared this for us, add to him a double punishment in the Fire."
And they said, "Why don't we see people whom we counted among the evildoers?
Have we mocked them (wrongly) or are they out of sight?"
Such are the quarrels of the people of the Fire.
Say: "I am only a warner. There is no god but Allah, the One, the Supreme Ruler,
Lord of heaven and earth and of what exists between them, the Mighty, the Great Forgiver."
Say: "This (the Qur'an) is great news,
but you turn away from it.
I had no knowledge of the sublime cohort at the time they were contesting.
It is only revealed to me that I am a clear warner."
When your Lord said to the Angels, "I am going to create a human being out of clay.
When I have formed him well and breathed into him with My Spirit, fall down before him in prostration."
Then all the angels fell down,
with the exception of Iblîs, who was puffed up with pride and was among the infidels.
(Allah) said to him: "O Iblis, who has prevented you from prostrating yourself before what I have created with My hands? Are you puffed up with pride or do you consider yourself among the highest?"
"I am better than he," says [Iblis,] "You created me of fire and you created him of clay."
(Allah) said: "Get out of here, you will be banished;
and upon you will be my curse until the day of retribution."
"Lord," says [Iblis], "give me a delay, until the day when they are resurrected."
(Allah) said: "You are one of those who are given a delay,
until the day of the Well-Known Moment."
"By Your power!" says [Satan]. I will certainly seduce them all,
except Your chosen servants from among them."
(Allah) said: "Verily, and this is the truth that I speak,
I will certainly fill Hell with you and all those of them who follow you."
Say: "For this I do not ask you for any wages; and I am not an impostor.
This [the Qur'an] is only a reminder to the universe.
And you'll certainly hear from them soon!"
The revelation of the Book comes from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
We have sent down the Book to you in all truth. Worship Allah by worshipping Him exclusively.
Pure religion belongs to Allah. While those who take protectors apart from Him say: "We worship them only so that they may bring us closer to Allah." Verily, Allah will judge among them by what they differ from. Allah does not guide one who is a liar and a great ungrateful.
If Allah had wanted to give Himself a child, He would have chosen what He wanted from what He creates. Glory be to Him! He is Allah, the One, the Supreme Ruler.
He created the heavens and the earth in all truth. He winds night over day and winds day over night, and He has made the sun and the moon each to pursue its course for a fixed term. He is indeed the Mighty, the Great Forgiver!
He created you from a single person and drew from her his wife. And He sent down eight pairs of cattle for you. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in three darknesses. This is Allah your Lord! To Him belongs all the Kingship. There is no divinity but Him. How can you turn away [from his worship]?
If you do not believe, Allah largely dispenses with you. Of His servants, however, He does not accept disbelief. And if you're grateful, He accepts it for you. No sinner will bear the sins of another. Then to your Lord will be your return: He will then inform you of what you were doing, for He knows perfectly well the contents of the breasts.
And when a misfortune befalls man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him. And when He bestows a favor on Him on His behalf, he forgets the reason for which he appealed, and he assigns equals to Allah, in order to lead (people) astray from His path. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a short time. You are one of the people of the Fire."
Does he who, in the hours of the night, remains in devotion, prostrate and standing, taking care of the hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord... Say: "Are they equal, those who know and those who do not know?" Only those endowed with intelligence remember.
Say: "O My servants who have believed! Fear your Lord." Those who do good here will have a good [reward]. The land of Allah is vast and the enduring will have their full reward without counting.
Say: "I have been commanded to worship Allah by worshipping Him exclusively,
and I was commanded to be the first of the Muslims.
Say: "If I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a terrible day."
Say: "It is Allah whom I worship, and worship Him exclusively.
Worship therefore besides Him whomever you will!" - Say: "The losers are those who, on the Day of Resurrection, have caused the loss of their own souls and those of their families." This is the obvious loss.
Above them they will have layers of fire and layers below them. This is what Allah threatens His slaves with. "O My slaves, fear Me!"
And to those who depart from the Taghût so as not to worship them, while they return to Allah, to them the good news! Announce the good news to My servants
who give ear to the Word, and then follow the best that is in it. These are the ones whom Allah has guided, and they are the ones who are endowed with understanding.
Well, what! The one against whom the decree of punishment is revealed,... Do you save the one who is in the Fire?
But those who fear their Lord will have [for their dwelling] floors [in Paradise] above which other floors are built and under which rivers flow. Allah's promise! Allah does not fail in His promise.
Do you not see that Allah brings water down from heaven and then brings it to springs in the earth; then with this, He brings forth a crop of various colors, which then withers, so that you see it yellowed; then He smashes it to smithereens. This is certainly a reminder to the intelligent [people].
Is the one whose chest Allah opens to Islam and who thus holds a light from His Lord... Woe therefore to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah. These are obviously misguided.
Allah has sent down the most beautiful of narrations, a Book of which [some verses] are similar and repeated. The skins of those who fear their Lord shudder (to hear him); then their skins and hearts are appeased at the remembrance of Allah. This is Allah's guide by which He guides whomever He wills. But whoever Allah leads astray has no guide.
Is he who on the Day of Resurrection will have protected his face from the worst punishment... And the unrighteous will be told: "Taste what you have acquired."
Those who lived before them denied (the Messengers), the punishment came to them from where they did not foresee it.
Allah has given them a taste of ignominy in this life. The punishment of the afterlife, however, is greater, if only they knew!
In this Qur'an, we have cited examples of all kinds for people to remember.
A Qur'an [in Arabic], devoid of twists, so that they may be pious!
Allah has quoted as a parable a man belonging to associates quarrelling about him and a man belonging to one man: Are they equal in example? Praise be to Allah! But most of them don't know.
Verily thou shalt die, and they shall also die;
then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will argue with your Lord.
Who is more unrighteous than the one who lies against Allah and calls the truth a lie when it comes to him? Is it not in Hell that there is a refuge for the disbelievers?
Whereas the one who comes with the truth and the one who confirms it, these are the pious.
They will have everything they desire from their Lord; this is the reward of the beneficent,
so that Allah may erase the worst of their deeds and reward them according to the best they have done.
Is Allah not sufficient for His slave [as a support]? And they frighten you with what is outside of Him. And whoever Allah leads astray has no guide.
Whoever Allah guides, no one can lead astray. Is not Allah the Mighty and the Possessor of the power to punish?
If you were to ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" They would certainly say, "Allah." Say: "Do you see those whom you invoke besides Allah; If Allah wanted to harm me, could [these gods] dispel His evil? Or if He wanted mercy on me, could they withhold His mercy?" - Say: "Allah is sufficient for me: in Him those who seek support place their trust."
Say: "O my people, act according to your method, I will act [according to mine]. Soon you will know
on whom a punishment will fall that will degrade him; and on whom a lasting punishment will be justified."
We have sent down the Book to you for men in all truth. Whoever guides himself [does so] for his own good; and whoever goes astray, goes astray to his detriment. You are not responsible [for their own affairs].
Allah receives souls at the time of their death as well as those who do not die during their sleep. He retains those to whom He has decreed death, while He sends the others away until a fixed time. There is certainly evidence there for people who think.
Have they adopted intercessors besides Allah? Say: "What! Even if they have nothing and are devoid of reason?
Say: "The whole intercession belongs to Allah. To Him is the kingdom of heaven and earth. Then it is to Him that you will be brought back."
And when Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter tense and when those who are outside of Him are mentioned, they rejoice.
Say: "O Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of all that the world does not know and what it perceives, it is You who will judge among Your servants what they differed about."
If the unrighteous possessed all that is on earth, and as much more, they would offer it as a ransom to escape the worst punishment on the Day of Resurrection; and there will appear to them from Allah what they never imagined;
and the misdeeds they have committed will appear to them, and what they mocked will envelop them.
When a misfortune befalls man, he invokes Us. When, afterwards, We grant him a favor from Us, he says: "I owe it only to [my] knowledge." It's a test, rather; But most of them don't know.
Thus spoke those who lived before them. But what they have acquired has been of no use to them;
They were therefore affected by the bad consequences of their gains. Those of these people [the Meccans] who have committed injustice will be affected by the evil consequences of their achievements, and they will not be able to oppose the power [of Allah].
Do they not know that Allah bestows His gifts generously or restricts them to whomever He wills? There is evidence in this for people who believe.
Say: "O My servants who have committed excesses to your own detriment, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. For Allah forgives all sins. Yes, He is the Forgiving, the Most Merciful.
And return repentant to your Lord, and submit to Him, before the punishment comes to you, and then you receive no help.
And follow the best revelation that has come down to you from your Lord, before the chastisement comes to you suddenly, without your sensing it;
before a soul says, "Woe to me for my sins against Allah. For I have certainly been among the scoffers."
or that she would say: "If Allah had guided me, I would certainly have been among the pious."
or else that she will say when she sees the punishment: "Ah! If there was a return for me! Then I would be among the beneficents."
"Oh yes! My verses came to you and you called them a lie, you were puffed up with pride and you were among the disbelievers."
And on the Day of Resurrection, you will see the faces of those who lied about Allah, darkened. Is it not in Hell that there will be a dwelling place for the proud?
And Allah will save those who have been pious by making them gain [their place in Paradise]. No evil will touch them, nor will they be afflicted.
Allah is the Creator of all things, and of all things He is the Guarantor.
He holds the keys of heaven and earth; and those who do not believe in the verses of Allah are the losers.
Say: "Will you command me to worship other than Allah, O ignorant ones?"
Indeed, it has been revealed to you and to those who have gone before you: "If you give partners to Allah, your work will certainly be in vain; and you will most certainly be among the losers.
On the contrary, worship Allah alone and be among the grateful."
They did not esteem Allah as He should be, whereas on the Day of Resurrection He will make the whole earth a handful, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Glory be to Him! He is above what they associate with Him.
And they will blow into the trumpet, and behold, those who are in the heavens and those who are on the earth will be struck by lightning, except those whom Allah will [spare]. Then they will blow again, and there they are, standing and watching.
And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord; the Book will be laid down and the prophets and witnesses will be called; they will be decided among them in all equity and they will not be wronged;
and each soul will be fully rewarded for what he has done. He [Allah] knows best what they are doing.
And those who had disbelieved will be led in groups to Hell. And when they get there, its gates will be opened, and its guardians will say to them, "Have not messengers come to you from among you, reciting to you the verses of your Lord, and warning you of the meeting of this day?" They will say: Yes, but the decree of punishment has proved to be right against the disbelievers.
"Enter," they will say, "through the gates of Hell, to dwell there forever." How bad is the place for the proud to dwell!
And those who had feared their Lord will be led in groups to Paradise. Then, when they get there and its doors open, its guardians will say to them: "Hail to you! you have been good: come in, therefore, to dwell there forever."
And they will say: "Praise be to Allah, who has kept His promise to us and made us inherit the earth! We will settle in Paradise wherever we want." How great is the reward of those who do good!
And you will see the angels circling around the throne, praising their Lord and glorifying Him. And he will be judged between them in all fairness, and it will be said: "Praise be to Allah, Lord of the universe."
H'â, Mîm.
The revelation of the Book comes from Allah, the Mighty, the All-Knowing.
The Forgiver of sins, the Acceptor of repentance, the Harsh One in punishment, the Bearer of favors. There is no divinity but Him and to Him is the destination.
Only those who have disbelieved discuss the verses of Allah. Let their activities in the country not deceive you.
Before them, Noah's people called (His Messenger) liars, and the coalition after them (did the same), and each community conceived the plan to seize His Messenger. And they discussed false arguments for rejecting the truth. So I grabbed them. And what a punishment was mine!
Thus the Word of your Lord proved to be right against those who disbelieved: "They shall be the people of the Fire."
Those (the Angels) who carry the Throne and those who surround it praise their Lord, believe in Him, and beg forgiveness for those who believe: "Lord! You extend Your mercy and knowledge to all things. So forgive those who repent and follow Your path and protect them from the punishment of Hell.
Lord! Bring them into the gardens of Eden which You have promised them, and the righteous among their forefathers, wives, and descendants, for You are the Mighty, the Wise.
And preserve them [from the punishment] of evil deeds. Whoever You save from evil deeds on that day, You will have mercy on him." And this is the enormous success.
To those who do not believe, it will be proclaimed: "Allah's aversion [to you] is greater than your aversion to yourselves when you were called to faith and persisted in disbelief."
They will say, "Our Lord, You have put us to death twice and given us life twice, so we acknowledge our sins. Is there a way out of it?"
«... This is because when Allah was invoked alone, you did not believe; and if you gave Him associates, then you believed. Judgment belongs to Allah, the Most High, the Most Great."
It is He who makes you see His proofs, and brings down from heaven a sustenance for you. Only the one who returns [to Allah] remembers.
Invoke Allah, therefore, by worshipping Him exclusively, no matter how much the disbelievers may be repulsed by it.
He is the One who is exalted to the highest degrees, the Possessor of the Throne, He sends the Spirit by His command upon whomever He wills among His servants, so that he may warn of the Day of Meeting,
the day when they will appear without anything in them being hidden from Allah. To whom does royalty belong today? To Allah, the One, the Dominator.
On that day, each soul will be rewarded according to what it has acquired. On that day, there is no injustice, for Allah is swift in [His] accounts.
And warn them of the day that is approaching, when hearts will rise to the throats, terrified (or anguished). The unjust will have neither a zealous friend nor an intercessor who is listened to.
He (Allah) knows the betrayal of the eyes, just like what the breasts hide.
And Allah judges justly, while those whom they invoke besides Him judge nothing. Verily, it is Allah who is the Hearer, the Clairvoyant.
Do they not go about the earth to see what has become of those who have lived before them? They were stronger than they were and left many more remnants on earth. Allah took them for their sins, and they had no protector against Allah.
