This was so, because their Messengers had brought them the proofs, but they showed themselves to be disbelievers. So Allah seizes them, for He is strong and dreadful in His punishment.
We did send Moses with Our signs and clear proof,
to Pharaoh, Haman and Korah. But they said, "Magician! Great liar!"
Then when he had brought them the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him, and let their wives live." And the tricks of the disbelievers are nothing but waste.
And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses. And let him call his Lord! I fear that he will change your religion or that he will bring corruption to the earth."
Moses said to him, "I seek protection from my Lord and yours from every proud one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."
And a believing man of Pharaoh's family, who was concealing his faith, said, "Do you kill a man because he says, 'My Lord is Allah?' Whereas he came to you with the clear proofs from your Lord. If he is a liar, his lie will be to his detriment; whereas if it is truthful, then part of what it threatens you with will fall on you." Verily, Allah does not guide the one who is outrageous and impostor.
"O my people, triumphant on earth, you have the kingdom today. But who will help us from the severity of Allah if it comes to us?" Pharaoh said, "I tell you only what I consider good. I guide you only to the path of righteousness."
And he who was a believer said, "O my people, I fear for you a day like that of the coalition.
A fate similar to that of the people of Noah, the 'Aad and the Thamûd and those [who lived] after them." Allah does not want to do injustice to the servants.
"O my people, I fear for you the day of the Mutual Call,
The Day when you turn your back in rout, without there being a protector for you against Allah." And whoever Allah leads astray, has no guide.
True, Joseph came to you before with the clear evidence, but you never ceased to have doubts about what he had brought you. But when he died, then you say: "Allah will never send a Messenger after him again." Thus Allah leads astray the one who is outrageous and the one who doubts.
Those who dispute the wonders of Allah without any proof having come to them, [their deed] is greatly hateful to Allah and to those who believe. Thus Allah seals the heart of every proud tyrant.
And Pharaoh said, "O Haman, build me a tower, and perhaps I may reach the ways,
the ways of heaven, and I shall perceive the God of Moses; but I think this one is a liar." Thus Pharaoh's evil deed seemed to him to be embellished; and he was led astray; and Pharaoh's stratagem is doomed only to destruction.
And the one who had believed said, "O my people, follow me. I will guide you to the path of righteousness.
O my people, this life is only temporary enjoyment, while the hereafter is truly the abode of stability.
Whoever does a bad deed will be rewarded only by his peer; and whoever, male or female, does a good deed while being a believer, then they will enter Paradise to receive their sustenance without reckoning.
O my people, but what have I to call you to salvation, when you call me to the Fire?
You invite me to deny Allah and to give Him partners of whom I have no knowledge, while I call you to the Almighty, to the Great Forgiver.
There is no doubt that what you are calling me to cannot answer an invocation either here on earth or in the Hereafter. It is to Allah that we have returned, and the outrageous are the people of the Fire.
Soon you will remember what I am telling you; and I entrust my fate to Allah. Verily, Allah is Clairvoyant over the servants.
So Allah protected him from the misdeeds of their tricks, while the worst punishment surrounded Pharaoh's people:
Fire, to which they are exposed morning and evening. And on the Day when the Hour shall come (it shall be said), "Bring Pharaoh's people into the severest punishment."
And when they quarrel in the Fire, the weak will say to those who were puffed up with pride, "We followed you: could you save us from any part of the fire?"
And those who were puffed up with pride will say: "Verily, here we are." Allah has already given judgment among the servants.
And those who are in the Fire will say to the guardians of Hell, "Pray to your Lord to lighten us one day from [our] torment."
They will say, "Did not your Messengers bring you clear proofs?" They will say, "Yes"! They [the guards] will say, "Well, pray!" And the supplication of the disbelievers is an aberration.
Verily, We will help Our Messengers and those who believe, in this life as well as in the Day when the witnesses [the Guardian Angels] stand (the Day of Judgment),
on the day when their excuse will not be of use to the unjust, while there will be a curse and a worse abode for them.
For We have brought guidance to Moses, and caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Book,
a guide and a reminder to people endowed with intelligence.
Endure then, for Allah's promise is truth, beg forgiveness for your sin, and praise the glory and praise of your Lord, night and morning.
Those who argue about the verses of Allah without any proof having come to them, have nothing but pride in their breasts. They will not achieve their goal. Therefore implore the protection of Allah, for He is the Hearer, the Clairvoyant.
The creation of the heavens and the earth is something greater than the creation of people. But most people don't know.
The blind and the sighted are not equal, and those who believe and do good works cannot be compared to the one who does evil. It's rare that you remember!
Truly; The Hour is about to arrive: there is no doubt about it; But most people don't believe it.
And your Lord said, "Call Me, and I'll answer you. Those who, out of pride, refuse to worship Me will soon enter Hell, humiliated."
Allah is the One who has assigned you the night to rest, and the day to see clearly. Allah is the Bravier of grace to men, but most people are not grateful.
This is your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no divinity but Him. How is it that you turn away (from the straight path)?
So those who deny the wonders of Allah turn away [from the straight path.]
It is Allah who has assigned you the earth as a stable dwelling place and the sky as your roof and has given you your form, - and what a beautiful form He has given you! - and He has nourished you with good things. This is Allah your Lord; Glory be to Allah, Lord of the universe!
He is the Living One. There is no divinity but Him. Call Him, then, by devoting an exclusive worship to Him. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the universe!
Say: "It was forbidden for me, once the proofs came to me from my Lord, to worship those whom you invoke besides Allah, and I was commanded to submit to the Lord of the universe."
It is He who created you from the earth, then from a drop of semen, then from an adhesion; Then He brings you out as a little child so that you may reach maturity and then become old, some of you die sooner, and so that you may reach a fixed time, so that you may reason.
It is He who gives life and gives death. Then when He decides a matter, He has only to say, "Be," and it is.
Have you not seen how those who argue about the verses of Allah allow themselves to be turned astray?
Those who call the Book (the Qur'an) and that with which We sent Our Messengers lies; they will soon know,
when, from the shackles around their necks and with chains, they will be dragged
in boiling water; and then they will burn in the Fire.
Then they will be told: "Where are those whom you associate
To Allah?" "They have moved away from us," they will say. Or rather, we didn't invoke anything before." Thus Allah leads the disbelievers astray.
This is the price of your exultation on earth, for no reason, as well as of your immoderate joy.
Walk through the gates of Hell to dwell there forever. How bad is the place for the proud to dwell!
Endure then. Allah's promise is true. Whether We show you some of what We threaten them with or whether We put you to death (before that)... to Us they will be brought back.
Verily, We have sent Messengers before you. There are some of whom We have told you the story; and there are some of whom We have not told you the story. And it is not proper for a Messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except with the permission of Allah. When Allah's command comes, everything will be decided in all justice; and those who tell lies are then the losers.
It is Allah who has made you cattle to ride and eat from them,
and you have profits there, and that you may attain to them a necessary thing that was dear to your heart. It is on them and on the ships that you are transported.
And He shows you His wonders. What wonders of Allah do you deny?
Do they not then travel the earth to see what has become of those who were before them? They were more numerous than they were and much more powerful, and they had left many more remnants on earth. But what they have acquired has been of no use to them.
When their Messengers brought them the clear proofs, they exulted in the knowledge they had. And what they mocked enveloped them.
Then, when they saw Our strictness, they said: "We believe in Allah alone, and we deny what we give Him as partners."
But their belief, at the moment when they had ascertained Our rigor, did not profit them; This is Allah's rule towards His servants in the past. And it was there that the disbelievers found themselves the losers.
H'â, Mîm.
[It is] a Revelation from the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful.
A Book whose verses are detailed (and clearly stated), an Arabic Qur'an for people who know,
herald and warner. But most of them turn away; it is because they do not hear.
And they said, "Our hearts are veiled against what you call us to, our ears are deaf. And between us and you, there is a partition. Act therefore on your side; we act with our own."
Say: "I am just a man like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is one God. Seek the right path to Him and beg His forgiveness." And woe to the Associators
who do not pay Zakat and do not believe in the Hereafter!
Those who believe and do good works will have a huge reward that will never be interrupted.
Say: "Will you deny [the existence] of Him who created the earth in two days and give Him equals? Such is the Lord of the universe,
it is He who has fixed mountains above her, blessed her and assigned her his food resources in four days of equal duration. [This is the answer] to those who ask you.
He then spoke to heaven, which was then smoked, and said to it and to the earth, "Come, both of you, willingly or unwillingly." Both said, "We come obediently."
He decreed to make seven heavens in two days and revealed to each heaven its function. And We have decorated the nearest heaven with lamps [stars] and have protected it. This is the Order established by the Mighty, the All-Knowing.
If they turn away from it, then tell them; "I warned you of a thunderbolt like that which struck the 'Aad and the Tamûd."
When the Messengers came to them from before them and from behind, "Worship only Allah," they said, "If our Lord had willed, He would certainly have sent down angels. So we don't believe [the message] with which you were sent."
As for the 'Aad, they were unjustly puffed up with pride on earth and said, "Who is stronger than us?" What! Have they not seen that in truth Allah who created them is stronger than they? And they denied Our signs.
We unleashed against them a violent and icy wind in evil days, in order to make them taste the punishment of ignominy in this life. The punishment of the Hereafter, however, is still more ignominious, and they will not be helped.
And as for the Tamûd, We guided them; but they preferred blindness to guidance. It was then that they were seized by the lightning of the most humiliating torture for what they had acquired.
And We saved those who believed and feared Allah.
And on the Day when the enemies of Allah will be gathered en masse to the Fire... Then they will be pushed [in his direction].
Then, when they are there, their hearing, their eyes, and their skins will testify against them for what they were doing.
They will say to their skins, "Why did you testify against us?" They will say: "It is Allah who has made us speak, He who makes all things speak. It is He who created you for the first time and it is to Him that you will have returned."
You could not hide yourself so much that neither your hearing, nor your eyes, nor your skins could testify against you. But you thought that Allah didn't know much about what you were doing.
And it was this thought that you had of your Lord that ruined you, so that you became among the losers.
If they endure, the Fire will be their dwelling place; and if they seek to apologize, they will not be excused.
And We have appointed for them companions who are inseparable [from the demons] who have embellished for them what was before and behind them. And the decree proved to be just against them, as it was against the other communities of jinn and men who lived before them. They are certainly losers!
And those who disbelieved said: "Do not listen to this Qur'an, and make a ruckus (during its recitation), so that you have the upper hand."
We will certainly make those who do not believe a severe punishment taste, and will certainly reward them [with a punishment] worse than their misdeeds.
Thus, the reward of the enemies of Allah will be the Fire where they will have an eternal abode, as a punishment for denying Our verses [the Qur'an].
And the disbelievers will say: "Lord, let us see those of the jinn and of the men who have led us astray, so that we may place them all under our feet, so that they may be among the lowest."
Those who say, "Our Lord is Allah," and stand in the right way, the angels descend upon them. "Do not be afraid or grieved; but have the good news of the Paradise that was promised to you.
We are your protectors in this life and in the hereafter; and you will have what your souls desire and what you ask for,
a place of welcome from a Most Great Forgiver, a Most Merciful".
And who speaks more beautiful words than the one who calls to Allah, does good deeds, and says: "I am one of the Muslims?"
Good deeds and bad deeds are not the same. Repel (evil) by what is better; and now the one with whom you had animosity becomes like a warm friend.
But (this privilege) is given only to those who endure, and it is given only to the possessor of infinite grace.
And if the Devil ever urges you (to do otherwise), then seek refuge with Allah; it is He, truly the Hearer, the All-Knowing.
Among His wonders are night and day, the sun and the moon: do not bow down to the sun or the moon, but bow down to Allah who created them, if it is Him whom you worship.
But if they puff themselves up with pride... those who are with your Lord [the angels] glorify Him, night and day, never weary!
And among His wonders is that you see the humbled earth. Then as soon as We bring the water down on it, it rises and increases. The One who gives it life is certainly the One who will revive the dead, for He is Omnipotent.
Those who distort the meaning of Our verses (the Qur'an) do not escape Us. Will he who is thrown into the Fire be better than the one who comes safely on the Day of Resurrection? Do what you want because He is Clairvoyant about everything you do;
Those who do not believe in the Remembrance [the Qur'an] when it comes to them... whereas it is a powerful [unassailable] Book;
The false does not reach him [on any side], either from before or from behind: it is a revelation emanating from a Sage, worthy of praise.
You are told only what was said to the Messengers before you. Your Lord is certainly the Holder of forgiveness and also the Holder of a painful punishment.
If We had made it a Qur'an in a language other than Arabic, they would have said: "Why have its verses not been made clear? what? A non-Arab [Qur'an] and an Arab [Messenger]?" Say: "For those who believe, he is a guide and a healing." And as for those who do not believe, there is deafness in their ears, and they are struck with blindness as far as it is concerned; these are called from a distant place.
We did give Moses the Book. Then there was controversy about it. And if it were not for a previous word of your Lord, they would certainly have been decided. They are really in a troubling state of doubt about him.
Whoever does a good deed, it is for his own good. And whoever does evil, he does it at his own expense. Your Lord, however, is not unjust to servants.
To Him belongs the knowledge of the Hour. No fruit comes out of its husk, no female conceives or gives birth without His knowledge. And the day He calls them, "Where are My associates?" they'll say, "We declare to You that there is no witness among us."
And what they invoked before will forsake them; and they will realize that they have no escape.
Man never tires of imploring good. If the disease touches him, he is desperate, helpless.
And if we make him taste mercy from Us, after distress has befallen him, he will certainly say, "It is due to me! And I don't think the Hour will rise [one day]. And if I am brought back to my Lord, I will find the most beautiful part near Him." We will inform those who have disbelieved of what they have done, and We will surely give them a taste of severe punishment.
When We shower man with blessings, he slips away and goes away. And when a misfortune befalls him, he then gives himself up to a long prayer.
Say: "See? If this (the Qur'an) emanates from Allah and then you deny it; who will find himself more misguided than he who distances himself in dissent?"
We will show them Our signs in the universe and in themselves, until it becomes clear to them that this (the Qur'an) is the truth. Is it not enough that your Lord is a witness of all things?
They are in doubt, are they not, about meeting their Lord? It is indeed He who embraces all things (through His knowledge and power).
H'â, Mîm.
Aîn, Sîn, Qâf.
This is how Allah, the Mighty, the Wise, makes revelations to you, as to those who lived before you.
To Him belongs what is in heaven and what is on earth. And He is the Sublime, the Most Great,
The heavens are very close to splitting from their summits when the angels glorify their Lord, praise Him and beg forgiveness for those on earth. Verily, Allah is the Forgiving, the Most Merciful.
And as for those who take protectors apart from Him, Allah sees to it what they do. And you are not a guarantor for them.
And so We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur'an, so that you may warn the Mother of Cities (Makkah) and its surroundings and warn of the Day of Gathering, about which there is no doubt, a group in Paradise and a group in the fiery furnace.
And if Allah had willed, He would have made it one community. But He brings whomever He wants into His mercy. And the unrighteous will have neither master nor helper.
Have they taken masters besides Him? It is Allah who is the only Master and it is He who gives life to the dead; and it is He who is Omnipotent.
On all your differences, the judgment belongs to Allah. This is Allah my Lord; in Him I place my trust and it is to Him that I return [repentant]
... Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has given you wives of yourselves, and cattle in pairs; by this means He multiplies you. There's nothing like Him; and He is the Hearer, the Clairvoyant.
He possesses the keys of the heavens and the earth. He allocates His gifts generously, or restricts them to whomever He wills. Verily, He is Omniscient.
He has legislated for you in matters of religion, what He enjoined Noah, what We revealed to you, as well as what We enjoined Abraham, Moses, and Jesus: "Establish religion; and don't make it a divisive issue." What you call the associators to do seems enormous to them: Allah elects and brings to Him whomever He wills and guides to Him the one who repents.
They were divided only after they had received knowledge, and this was done through rivalry among themselves. And if it were not for a previous word of your Lord for a fixed term, they would certainly have been decided. Those to whom the Book was given as an inheritance after them are really about it, in troubling doubt.
So call (people) to this; Stand upright as you have been commanded; do not follow their passions; and said, "I believe in all that Allah has sent down as the Book, and I have been commanded to be fair among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. Ours are our works and your works are yours. No argument [can decide] between us and you. Allah will bring us all together. And to Him is the destination."
And those who argue about Allah, after [His call] has been answered, their argument is worthless before Allah. Wrath will fall upon them, and they will have a severe punishment.
It is Allah who has sent down the Book in all truth, as well as the scales. And what do you know about it? Maybe the Hour is near?
Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it; while those who believe in it are fearful and know that it is the pure truth. And those who argue about the Hour are in a distant error.
Allah is gentle with His servants. He assigns [His possessions] to whomever He wills. And He is the Strong, the Mighty.
Whoever desires to plough [the field] of the Hereafter, We will increase his ploughing for him. Whoever desires to plough [the field] of this life, We will grant him [his enjoyments]; but he will have no part in the Hereafter.
Or would they have associates [with Allah] who would have established religious laws for them that Allah has never permitted? However, if the decisive judgment had not been pronounced, it would have been decided between them. The unrighteous will certainly have a painful punishment.
You will see the unrighteous terrified by what they have done, and the punishment will come upon them (inevitably). And those who believe and do good deeds will be in the flowery sites of the gardens, having what they will with their Lord. Such is the great grace!
This is the [good news] that Allah proclaims to those of His servants who believe and do good deeds. Say: "I do not ask you for any reward except affection for kinship." And whoever does a good deed, We respond with a still greater [reward]. Allah is indeed Forgiving and Grateful.
Or they say, he has invented a lie against Allah. Now, if Allah wills, He will seal your heart. By His words, however, Allah erases the false and confirms the true. He knows the contents of the breasts perfectly.
And it is He who accepts repentance from His servants, forgives wrongdoings, and knows what you do,
and grant [the wishes] of those who believe and do good deeds and increase His favor to them, while the disbelievers have a severe punishment.
If Allah were to bestow His gifts generously on [all] His servants, they would commit abuses on earth; but He sends down with measure what He wills. He knows His servants perfectly and is a Clairvoyant.
And it is He who brings down the rain after we have despaired of it, and pours out His mercy. And He is the Master, the One Worthy of praise.
Among His proofs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the living things He has scattered there. He also has the power to bring them together whenever He wills.
Any misfortune that befalls you is due to what your hands have acquired. And He forgives much.
You cannot escape the power of Allah on earth; and you have no master or defender besides Allah.
And among His proofs are the ships across the sea, like mountains.
If He wills, He calms the wind, and there they are, standing still on its surface. These are certainly proofs for every enduring and grateful [man].
Or He destroys them as a punishment for what they have acquired. However, He forgives many.
Those who argue about Our evidence know well that they have no escape.
All that has been given to you is only the enjoyment of this present life; but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who have believed and put their trust in their Lord,
who avoid the most grievous sins and sinfulness, and who forgive after becoming angry,
who respond to the call of their Lord, perform Salah, consult with one another about their affairs, spend what We assign to them,
and who, struck by injustice, retaliate.
The punishment for an evil deed is an identical evil action. But whoever forgives and reforms, his reward belongs to Allah. He does not love the unjust!
As for those who retaliate after being wronged, ... the latter have no way (legal recourse) against them;
There is no remedy except against those who harm people and commit abuses, contrary to the law, on earth: these will have a painful punishment.
And he who endures and forgives, this in truth, is part of the good disposition and resolution in affairs.
And whoever Allah leads astray has no protector after Him. However, when you see the punishment, you will see the unrighteous say, "Is there a way to return [to earth]?"
And you will see them exposed before Hell, confounded in degradation, and looking with a furtive eye, while those who have believed will say: "The losers are certainly those who on the Day of Resurrection are their own destruction and that of their families." The unrighteous will certainly suffer permanent punishment.
They will have no protector but Allah to help them, and whoever Allah leads astray has no way.
Respond to the call of your Lord before the day comes, the end of which Allah will never postpone. On that day there is no refuge for you, and you will not be able to deny (your sins).
If they turn away, ... We have not sent you to safeguard them, but you are only responsible for transmitting [the message]. And when We make man taste a mercy from Us, he rejoices; but if a misfortune befalls them for what their hands have perpetrated..., then the man is very ungrateful!
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wants. He gives girls to whom He wills, and gives boys to whom He wills,
or else He gives both boys and girls; and He makes whomever He wills barren. He is certainly Omniscient and Omnipotent.
It has not been given to a mortal that Allah speaks to him otherwise than by revelation or from behind a veil, or that He sends a messenger (Angel) who reveals, by His permission, what He [Allah] wants. He is Sublime and Wise.
And so We have revealed to you a spirit [the Qur'an] from Our order. You had no knowledge of the Book or of faith; but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will among Our servants. And verily thou guides to a straight path,
the way of Allah to Whoever belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. Yes, it is to Allah that all things are directed.
H'â, Mîm.
By the Explicit Book!
We have made it an Arabic Qur'an so that you can reason.
He is with Us, in the Mother Scripture (the original in heaven), sublime and full of wisdom.

He who gave you the earth for a cradle and made paths for you to be guided by;

It is to our Lord that we will return."

He says, "Even if I come to you with a better direction than you found your ancestors on?" They said, "We do not believe the message with which you were sent."
We took revenge on them. Look at what happened to those who cried lies.

And he made it a word that was to be perpetuated among his descendants. Maybe they will come back?

And when the Truth came to them, they said, "This is magic and we don't believe in it."
And they said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down to a high person of one of the two cities?" (Mecca and Ta'if).
Are they the ones who distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have divided their sustenance among them in this life, and have raised them in rank one over the other, so that some may take others into their service. The mercy of your Lord is better, however, than what they gather.
If men were not to constitute a single (disbeliever) community, We would certainly have provided the houses of those who do not believe in the Most Merciful with silver roofs with stairs to ascend to them;
(We would have provided) their houses with doors and couches where they would lean their elbows,
as well as ornaments. And all this would be only a temporary enjoyment of the life of this world, while the hereafter, with your Lord, is for the pious.
And whoever blinds himself (and departs from) the remembrance of the Most Merciful, We point out to him a devil who becomes his inseparable companion.
They [the devils] are indeed turning [men] astray, while they think they are rightly guided.
When this [man] comes to Us, he will say [to his demon]: "Alas! Would that there is not between you and me the distance between the two easts [East and West]" - What a bad companion [that you are]!
It will not profit you on that day, since you have been unjust, that you are partners in the punishment.
Is it then you who make the deaf hear, or who guide the blind and those who are obviously misguided?
Either We take you away and then We will take revenge on them;
or that We will show you what We have promised them; for We have power over them.
Hold fast to what has been revealed to you because you are on the right path.
It is certainly a reminder [the Qur'an] for you and your people. And you will be questioned about it.
And ask those of Our messengers whom We have sent before you, whether We have instituted any gods besides the Most Merciful to worship?
We did indeed send Moses with Our miracles to Pharaoh and his notables. He says, "I am the Messenger of the Lord of the universe."
Then, when he came to them with Our miracles, behold, they laughed at it.
Every miracle that We showed them was more convincing than his previous one. And We seized them with chastisement, perhaps they will return [to Us].
And they said, "O magician! Implore your Lord for us in the name of the commitment He has made to you. We will follow the right path."
And when We had removed the punishment from them, behold, they violated their engagements.
And Pharaoh made a proclamation to his people and said, "O my people! Is not the kingdom of Misr [Egypt] mine and the canals that flow at my feet? Do you not observe?
Am I not better than this wretch who can hardly express himself?
Why weren't gold bracelets thrown at him? Why didn't the angels go with him?"
Thus he sought to stun his people and so they obeyed him, for they were perverse people.
Then when they had angered Us, We took revenge on them and drowned them all.
We made them an antecedent and an example [a lesson] for posterity.
When the example of the son of Mary is cited, your people turn away from it,
saying, "Are our gods better, or he?" It is only in polemic terms that they cite him as an example. They are more quarrelsome.
He (Jesus) was only a Servant whom We had showered with blessings and whom We had pointed out as an example to the Children of Israel.
If We wished, We would make you Angels who would succeed you on earth.
It will be a sign about the Hour. Do not doubt it. And follow me: this is a straight path.
May the Devil not turn you away! For he is an open enemy to you.
And when Jesus brought the proofs, he said, "I have come to you with wisdom and to explain to you some of your points of disagreement. Fear Allah, therefore, and obey me.
Verily, Allah is my Lord and your Lord. Worship Him, then. This is a straight path."
But the factions differed among themselves. Woe then to the unjust for the punishment of a painful day!
Are they just waiting for the Hour to come to them unexpectedly, without them realizing it?
Friends on that day will be enemies to one another; except the stakes.

H'â, Mîm.
The revelation of the Book emanates from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
Verily, there are proofs in the heavens and on earth for believers.
And in your own creation, and in what He scatters as animals, there are signs for people who believe with certainty.
Similarly, in the alternation of night and day, and in what Allah sends down from heaven as a sustenance [rain] by which He restores life to the earth when it is dead, and in the distribution of the winds, there are signs for people who reason.
These are the verses of Allah that We recite to you in all truth. Then in what word will they believe after [the word] of Allah and after His signs?
Woe to every great sinful impostor!
He hears the verses of Allah that are recited to him and then persists in his pride, as if he had never heard them. Tell him, therefore, a painful punishment.
If he knows some of Our verses, he makes a mockery of them. These will have a degrading punishment:
Hell is hot on their heels. What they have acquired will be of no use to them, nor what they have taken as protectors except Allah. They will have a huge punishment.
This [the Qur'an] is a guide. And those who reject the verses of their Lord will be tormented with painful punishment.
Allah is the One who has subdued the sea for you, so that ships may sail in it, by His command, and that you may seek His grace so that you may be grateful.
And He has subdued to you all that is in heaven and on earth, all of which comes from Him. There are signs there for people who are thinking.
Tell those who have believed to forgive those who do not hope for the days of Allah so that He may reward [every] people for the gains they did.
Whoever does good, does it for himself; and whoever acts evil, acts against himself. Then you will be brought back to your Lord,
We did bring to the Children of Israel the Book, wisdom, prophecy, and attributed good things to them, and preferred them to other human beings [their contemporaries];
And We have brought them clear proofs of the Order. They did not diverge until science had come to them through aggressiveness among themselves. Your Lord will decide among them on the Day of Resurrection what they differed in.
Then We set you on the path of Order. Follow it, then, and do not follow the passions of those who do not know.
They will be of no use to you in the sight of Allah. The unjust are truly allies of one another; while Allah is the Protector of the righteous.
This [the Qur'an] is a source of clarity, a guide and a mercy for people who believe with certainty.
Do those who do evil deeds expect that We will treat them like those who believe and do good deeds, in their lives and in their deaths? How badly they judge!
And Allah created the heavens and the earth in all truth and so that every soul would be rewarded according to what he has acquired. However, they will not be harmed.
Do you see the one who takes his passion for his own divinity? And Allah knowingly misleads him and seals his hearing and his heart and spreads a veil over his sight. Who can guide him after Allah? Don't you remember?
And they said, "There is nothing for us but the life of this world: we die and we live, and only time causes us to perish." They have no knowledge of it: they only speculate.
And when we recite Our clear verses to them, their only argument is to say, "Bring back our ancestors if you are truthful."
Say: "Allah gives you life and then He gives you death. Then He will gather you together on the Day of Resurrection, there is no doubt about it, but most people don't know.
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And on the day when the Hour comes, on that day, the impostors will be lost.

H'â, Mîm.
The revelation of the Book emanates from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
We have created the heavens and the earth and what is between them only in all truth and [for] a fixed term. Those who have disbelieved turn away from what they have been warned about.
Say: "What do you think of those whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth! Or do they have a participation in heaven with God? Bring me a Book prior to this (the Qur'an) or even a remnant of a science, if you are truthful."
And who is more misguided than the one who supplies besides Allah, and life will not be able to answer him until the Day of Resurrection? And they [their deities] are indifferent to their invocation.
And when the people are gathered [for the Judgment], they will be their enemies and will deny their worship [for them].
And when Our clear verses are recited to them, those who have disbelieved say of the truth, when it comes to them: "This is manifest magic."
Or they say, "He invented it!" Say: "If I invented it, then you will not be able to do anything for me against Allah's [punishment]. He knows perfectly well what you are propagating (in slander against the Qur'an): Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you. And He is the Forgiving, the Most Merciful."
Say: "I am not an innovation among the messengers; and I do not know what will be done with me, or with you. I am only following what is revealed to me; and I am only a clear warner."
Say: "What will you say if [this revelation turns out] to be from Allah and you do not believe in it, let a witness among the children of Israel testify to its conformity [to the Pentateuch] and believe in it, while you reject it with pride... Verily, Allah does not guide the unrighteous."
And those who disbelieved said to those who believed, "If this were good, they (the poor) would not have gone ahead of us." And since they will not have let themselves be guided by him, they will say: "This is only an old lie!"

Those who say, "Our Lord is Allah" and then stand on the right path. They need have no fear and will not be afflicted.
These are the people of Paradise where they will dwell eternally, as a reward for what they did.
And We enjoined a man to be kind to his father and mother: his mother bore him with difficulty and gave birth to him with difficulty; and its gestation and weaning last thirty months; then when he reaches his full strength and reaches forty years of age, he says, "O Lord! Inspire me to give thanks for the blessing with which You have bestowed upon me and my father and mother, and to do a good work that You are pleased with. And grant that my posterity may be of sound morality. I repent of You and I am one of the Submissive."
These are the ones from whom We accept the best of what they do and pass over their misdeeds, (they will be) among the people of Paradise, according to the truthful promise made to them.
As for the one who says to his father and mother, "Enough of you both! Do you promise me that I will be brought out of the ground when generations before me have passed?" And the two of them, imploring Allah's help, said, "Woe to you! Believe. For Allah's promise is true." But he (answers): "These are only tales of the ancients."
These are the ones who have deserved the sentence at the same time as the communities that have already gone before them among the jinn and men. They were really losers.
And there are ranks [of merit] for each one, according to what they have done so that Allah may give them the full reward of their deeds; and they will not be wronged.
And on the Day when those who have disbelieved shall be presented to the Fire (it shall be said to them): "You have squandered your excellent [goods] and enjoyed them to the full during your life on earth: therefore you are rewarded today with the degrading punishment, for the pride with which you were unjustly puffed up on earth, and for your perversity.
And remember the brother of the 'Aad (Hud) when he warned his people in Al-Ahqaf, when before and after him there were warners: "Worship only Allah. I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from our gods? Well, bring us what you promise us if you are of the truthful."
He said: "Knowledge is only with Allah. However, I am passing on to you the message with which I was sent. But I see that you are ignorant people."
Then, seeing a cloud moving towards their valleys, they said: "Here is a cloud that brings us rain." On the contrary! it is this very thing that you sought to hasten: it is a wind that contains a painful chastisement,
destroying everything, by the command of his Lord. Then the next day nothing was to be seen but their homes. In this way We reward criminal people.
In fact, We had consolidated them in positions that We did not give you. And We had assigned them hearing, eyes, and hearts, but neither their hearing, nor their eyes, nor their hearts benefited them in any way, because they denied the signs of Allah. And what they mocked surrounded them.
We have certainly destroyed the cities around you; and We have diversified the signs so that they may return.
Why, then, do they not help those whom they had taken as gods besides Allah, in order to bring them closer to Him? The latter, on the contrary, abandoned them; such is their deception and this is what they invented as lies.

Endure (Muhammad), therefore, as the messengers endowed with firmness endured; and do not be in too much of a hurry to see them suffer [their punishment]. On the day when they see what is promised to them, it will seem to them that they had stayed only an hour of a day. This is a communication. Who will be annihilated if not the evil people?

This is so because those who disbelieved followed the False and those who believed followed the Truth emanating from their Lord. This is how Allah offers their examples to the people.
When you meet those who have disbelieved, strike their necks. Then, when you have dominated them, chain them solidly. Then it's either free release or ransom, until the war lays down its burdens. This is so, because if Allah wills, He will take vengeance on them, but it is to test you one by another. And those who are killed in the way of Allah, He will never make their deeds in vain.

O you who believe! if you make Allah triumph, He will make you triumph and strengthen your steps.

This is because they have revulsion for what Allah has sent down. He has therefore rendered their works in vain.
Have they not traveled the earth to see what has become of their predecessors? Allah has destroyed them. Such ends are reserved for the disbelievers.
It is because Allah is truly the Protector of those who believe; while the disbelievers have no protector.
Those who believe and do good deeds, Allah will bring them into gardens under which streams flow. And those who disbelieve enjoy and eat as cattle eat; and the Fire will be their place of abode.
And how many cities, much stronger than your city that expelled you, have We put to death, and they had no helper.
Is he who bases himself on a clear proof from his Lord comparable to those whose evil deeds have been embellished and who have followed their own passions?
This is the description of Paradise that has been promised to the righteous: there will be streams of water that is never smelly, and streams of milk that tastes unalterable, and streams of wine that is delicious to drink, and streams of purified honey. And there are fruits of all kinds for them, as well as forgiveness from their Lord. Will they be like those who linger in the Fire and are watered with boiling water that tears their entrails?
And there are some among them who listen to you. When they come out of your house, they say to those who have received knowledge, "What did he say earlier?" These are the ones whose hearts Allah has sealed and who follow their own passions.
As for those who set out on the right path, He guided them still more and inspired them with their piety.
What are they waiting for if not for the Hour to come to them unexpectedly? But its warning signs have certainly already come. And how will they be able to remember when it comes to them (out of the blue)?
Know, then, that there is no god but Allah, and beg forgiveness for your sin, as well as for the believers. Allah knows your activities (on earth) and your resting place (in the Hereafter).

Those who disbelieved and obstructed the path of Allah and then died while being disbelievers, Allah will never forgive them.
So do not weaken and do not call for peace when you are the highest, Allah is with you, and He will never deprive you of your deeds.
The present life is nothing but play and amusement; whereas if you believe and fear, [Allah] will give you your rewards and will not ask you for your goods.
If He asked you for them importunately, you would become miserly and He would show your hatreds.
You are called to spend money in the way of Allah. Some of you are being stingy. Whoever is miserly, however, is miserly to his detriment. Allah is Self-Sufficient while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with a people other than you, and they will not be like you.
Verily We have granted you a resounding victory,
that Allah may forgive you your sins, past and future, that He may complete His blessing on you and guide you to a straight path;

To Allah belong the armies of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Mighty and Wise.
We have sent you as a witness, a proclaimer of the good news and a warner,
so that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger, honor Him, recognize His dignity, and glorify Him morning and night.
Those who swear allegiance to you are only swearing an oath to Allah: the hand of Allah is above their hands. Whoever violates the oath violates it only to his own detriment; and whoever fulfills his commitment to Allah, He will soon bring him a huge reward.
Those of the Bedouins who have been left behind will say to you: "Our property and our families have held us back: therefore beg forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: "Who can do anything for you with Allah if He wants to harm you or if He wants to do you good? To Allah belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whomever He wills and chastises whomever He wills. However, Allah remains, Forgiving and Merciful.
Those who remained behind will say, when you go to the booty to seize it; "Let us follow you." They would like to change the word of Allah. Say: "You will never follow us, for so Allah has already announced." But they will say, "You are rather envious of us." But in reality they understood very little.
Say to those of the Bedouins who remained behind, "You will soon be called upon against people of formidable strength. You will fight them unless they embrace Islam, if you obey, Allah will give you a great reward, and if you turn away as you have turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."
No grievance is to be made against the blind, nor the lame nor the sick. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, He will bring him into the Gardens under which the streams flow. Whoever turns away, however, He will punish him with a painful punishment.

as well as abundant booty that they will collect. Allah is Mighty and Wise.

He promises you another booty that you will never be able to take and that Allah has embraced in His power, for Allah is Omnipotent.

Allah was truthful in the vision in which He announced to His Messenger in all truth: You will enter the Holy Mosque if Allah wills, in safety, having shaved your heads or cut your hair, without any fear. So he knew what you didn't. He placed a close victory below that (the truce of Hudaybiya).
It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth [Islam] to make it triumph over all other religions. Allah is sufficient as a witness.
Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. And those who are with him are harsh to the disbelievers, merciful to one another. You see them bowing, prostrate, seeking from Allah grace and pleasure. Their faces are marked by the trace left by prostration. This is their image in the Torah. And the image that is given of them in the Gospel is that of a seed that comes out of its shoot, then becomes firm, thickened, and then stands on its stalk, to the wonder of the sowers. [Allah] through them [the believers] fills the disbelievers with vexation. Allah promises those among them who believe and do good deeds, forgiveness and a huge reward.
O you who have believed! Do not precede Allah and His Messenger. And fear Allah. Allah is Hearing and All-Knowing.
O you who have believed! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, nor raise your voice when speaking to him, as you raise it with one another, or your deeds will become in vain without your realizing it.
Those who bow their voices to the Messenger of Allah are those whose hearts Allah has tested for piety. They will have forgiveness and a huge reward.
Those who call you out loud from behind the apartments, most of them don't reason.
And if they waited until you came out to them, it would certainly be better for them. Allah, however, is Forgiving and Merciful.
O you who have believed! If a wicked person brings you news, see clearly that you are inadvertently harming people and then regretting what you have done.
And know that the Messenger of Allah is among you. If he obeyed you in many matters, you would be in trouble. But Allah has made you love the faith and has made it more beautiful in your hearts and has made you hate disbelief, evil and disobedience. These are the rightly led,
this is indeed a grace of Allah and a blessing. Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And if two groups of believers are fighting each other, make conciliation between them. If one of them rebels against the other, fight the group that is rebelling, until they comply with Allah's command. Then, if he does so, reconcile them with justice and be fair, for Allah loves the fair.
Believers are only brothers. Establish harmony among your brothers, and fear Allah, so that you may have mercy.
O you who have believed! Let one group not make fun of another group: the latter may be better than them. And let no women make fun of other women: they may be better than them. Do not denigrate each other or hurl (insulting) monikes at each other. What a nasty word "perversion" when you already have faith. And whoever does not repent... These are the unjust.
O you who have believed! Avoid conjecturing too much, for some conjecture is sinful. And don't spy; and do not slander one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? (No!) you will abhor it. And fear Allah. For Allah is Great, Welcoming to repentance, Most Merciful.
O men! We have created you from a male and a female, and We have made you nations and tribes, so that you may know one another. The noblest of you, in the sight of Allah, is the most pious. Allah is indeed All-Knowing, and the Great Knower.
The Bedouins said, "We have faith." Say: "You don't have faith yet. Say instead, We have simply submitted, for faith has not yet penetrated into your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not cause you to lose any of your deeds." Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
The true believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, who do not doubt and who strive with their possessions and their persons in the way of Allah. These are the truthful ones.
Say: "Are you the ones who will teach Allah your religion, when Allah knows all that is in the heavens and on the earth?" And Allah is All-Knowing.
They remind you of their conversion to Islam as if it were a favor on their part. Say: "Do not remind me of your conversion to Islam as a favor. On the contrary, it is a favor that Allah has bestowed upon you by directing you to faith, if you are truthful."
Allah knows the Unknowable of the heavens and the earth and Allah is Clairvoyant about what you do.

When they came to his house and said, "Peace," he said, "Peace, unknown visitors."

Those who believe and their descendants follow in the faith, We will cause their descendants to join them. And We will not diminish the merit of their deeds in any way, each one being held responsible for what he has acquired.

There they will pass a cup to each other that will provoke neither vanity nor incrimination.
And among them will circulate boys in their service, like well-preserved pearls.
And they will turn to one another, wondering;
They will say: "We lived among our own people in fear [of Allah];
Then Allah favored us and protected us from the punishment of Samûm.
Previously, we invoked Him. He is certainly the Charitable, the Most Merciful."
Remember, then, and by the grace of your Lord you are neither a soothsayer nor a possessed person.
Or they say, "He's a poet! Let's wait for him to die."
Say: "Wait! I am with you among those who wait."
Is it their reason that commands them to do this? Or are they outrageous people?
Or do they say, "He invented it himself?" No... but they do not believe.
Well, let them produce a narration like it (the Qur'an), if they are truthful.
Were they created from scratch or are they the creators?
Or did they create the heavens and the earth? But they have no convictions.
Do they possess the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the sovereign masters?
Do they have a scale from which they listen? Let the one of their own who remains attentive provide clear proof!
Would [Allah] have the daughters, while you have the sons?
Or do you ask them for a salary, so that they are burdened with a heavy debt?
Or do they hold the Unknowable to mention it in writing?
Or are they looking for a scheme? But it is those who have disbelieved who are the victims of their own stratagem.
Or do they have any other god besides Allah? May Allah be glorified and purified from all that they associate.
And if they see fragments of the sky falling, they say, "These are superimposed clouds."
Leave them, then, until they meet their day when they will be struck by lightning,
the day when their cunning will be of no use to them, when they will not be helped.
The unrighteous will have a prior punishment. But most of them don't know.
And patiently bear the decision of your Lord. For verily you are before Our eyes. And praise the glory of your Lord when you arise;
Glorify Him a part of the night and the setting of the stars.
By the star in its waning!
Your companion has not lost his way or been misled
and he pronounces nothing under the effect of passion;
it is nothing but an inspired revelation.
Which [Angel Gabriel] taught him with prodigious strength,
gifted with sagacity; it was then that he showed himself in his real [angelic] form,
while he was on the upper horizon.
Then he came closer and went down even lower,
and was within two bow ranges, or nearer.
He revealed to His servant what He revealed.
The heart has not lied in what it has seen.
Do you dispute with him what he sees?
Yet he saw him, during another descent,
near the Sidrat-ul-Muntahâ,
near it is the garden of Ma'w?:
at the moment when the lotus was covered with what covered it.
the sight has in no way deviated or exceeded the measure.
He saw well some of the great wonders of his Lord.
What do you think of [the deities], Lât and Uuzzâ
as well as Manat, this third other?
Will it be yours the boy and Him the girl?
What an unjust division!
These are just names that you and your ancestors have invented. Allah has not sent down any evidence about them. They follow only the conjecture and passions of [their] souls, whereas the guidance has come to them from their Lord.
Or will man have everything he desires?
To Allah belong the future life and the life of this world.
And how many angels in the heavens whose intercession is of no use, except after Allah has permitted it, for whom He wills and whom He pleases.
Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the Angels the names of women,
whereas they have no knowledge of it: they follow only conjecture, whereas conjecture is of no use against truth.
Depart from him who turns his back on Our call and desires only the present life.
This is the whole scope of their knowledge. Verily your Lord knows perfectly well the one who strays from His path and He knows perfectly well those who are rightly guided.
To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and on the earth, so that He may reward those who do evil according to what they do, and reward those who do good with the best [reward].
those who avoid the greatest sins and turpitude, and only slight sins. Certainly, your Lord's forgiveness is immense. He knows you best when He produced you from the earth, and also when you were embryos in your mothers' wombs. Do not boast of your purity yourselves; it is He who knows best those who fear [Him].
Do you see the one who has turned away,
gave little and [finally] stopped giving?
Does he possess the knowledge of the Unknowable so that he sees?
Was he not told what was in the leaves of Moses?
and those of Abraham who perfectly fulfilled [his promise to transmit]
that no [soul] shall bear the burden (sin) of another,
and that in truth man obtains only [the fruit] of his efforts;
and that his effort, in truth, will be presented to him (on the Day of Judgment).
Then he will be fully rewarded,
and that all things end in truth to your Lord,
and that it is He who has made people laugh and who has made them cry,
and that it is He who has caused death and brought back to life,
and that it is He who created the two elements of the couple, the male and the female,
a drop of semen when it is ejaculated
and that the second creation devolves upon Him,
and it is He who has enriched and made acquired.
And He is the Lord of Sirius,
and it is He who destroyed the elder 'Aad,
and the Thamûd, and He caused nothing to remain of it,
and the people of Noah before, for they were even more unjust and violent,
just as He annihilates the overthrown cities.
And covered them with what He covered them with.
Which of your Lord's blessings do you doubt?
Here is a horn similar to the old horns:
the Imminent (Hour of Judgment) is approaching.
Nothing else but Allah can reveal it.
What! Are you surprised at this discourse (the Qur'an)?
And you laugh at it and cry not about it?
absorbed [that you are] by your distraction.
Therefore bow down to Allah and worship Him.
The Hour is approaching and the Moon has split.
And if they see a prodigy, they turn away from it and say, "Persistent magic."
And they call [him] a lie and follow their own impulses, but everything will come to an end.
Yet they have received as news what to prevent them (from evil);
[This is] perfect wisdom. But warnings are of no use to [them].
Turn away from them. On the day when the caller calls to something awful,
with downcast eyes, they will come out of the graves like scattered locusts,
running, with his neck outstretched, towards the caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult day."
Before them, Noah's people had cried lies. They called Our servant a liar and said, "He is possessed!" and he was repulsed.
So he called on his Lord: "I am defeated. Make (Your Cause) triumph."
We then opened the gates of heaven to torrential water,
and caused the earth to gush forth in springs. The waters met according to an order that had already been decreed in a thing [done].

sailing before Our eyes: reward for him whom they had denied [Noah].
And We left it, as a sign. Is there anyone to think?
How were My chastisements and My warnings?
Indeed, We have made the Qur'an easy for meditation. Is there anyone to think?
The 'Aad called (their Messenger) a liar. How were My chastisements and My warnings?
We have sent against them a violent and icy wind, in a bad and interminable day;
he was tearing people up like stumps of uprooted palm trees.
How were My chastisements and My warnings?
Indeed, We have made the Qur'an easy for meditation. Is there anyone to think?
The Thamûd have called the warnings lies.
They said, "Are we going to follow one man (Sālih) from among ourselves? We would then be in a state of bewilderment and madness.
Was the message sent to Him except for all of us? He is rather a great liar, full of pretension and pride."
Tomorrow they will know who the great liar is full of pretentiousness and pride.
We will send them the camel as a trial. So keep an eye on them and be patient.
And inform them that the water will be shared between them [and the she-camel]; everyone will drink in turn.
Then they called their comrade, who took [his sword] and killed [it].
How, then, were My chastisements and My warnings?
We let out a single cry on them, and behold, they were reduced to the state of stable straw.
And truly, We have made the Qur'an easy for meditation. Is there anyone to think?
Lot's people called the warnings lies.
We let loose a hurricane on them, except the family of Lot, whom We saved before dawn,
as a blessing on Our part: thus do We reward the one who is grateful.
He had, however, warned them of Our reprisals. But they questioned the warnings.
Indeed, they wanted to seduce his guests. We blinded their eyes, "Taste therefore My chastisement and My warnings."
Indeed, in the early morning, a persistent chastisement surprised them.
Taste therefore My chastisement and My warnings.
And truly, We have made the Qur'an easy for meditation. Is there anyone to think?
Warnings came to Pharaoh's people.
They called all Our wonders lies. We therefore seized them, with the grasp of a Mighty Omnipotent.
Are your disbelievers better than these? Or is there an immunity to you in the Scriptures?
Or they say, "We are a [strong] group and we will win."
Their gathering will soon be routed, and they will flee.
Rather, the Hour will be their rendezvous, and the Hour will be more terrible and bitter.
Criminals are certainly bewildered and mad.
On the Day when they are dragged into the Fire over their faces, (they will be told): "Taste the touch of Saqar [the burning heat of Hell]".
We have created everything with measure,
and Our order is one [word]; [he's quick] like the twinkling of an eye.
For we have destroyed peoples like you. Is there anyone to remember it?
And everything they did is recorded in the records,
and everything, small and large, is recorded.
The stakes will be in gardens and among streams,
in a sojourn of truth, with an Omnipotent Sovereign.
The Most Merciful.
He taught the Koran.
He created man.
He taught him to express himself clearly.
The sun and the moon [evolve] according to [minute] calculation.
And the grass and the trees prostrate themselves.
And as for heaven, He has raised it very high. And He set the scales,
so that you do not transgress in the weighing:
Give [always] the exact weight and do not distort the weighing.
As for the earth, He has extended it for living beings:
there are fruits there, and also palm trees with fruits covered with husks,
as well as grains in their husks, and aromatic plants.
