Blessed be the Name of your Lord, Full of Majesty and Munificence!
When the event (the Judgment) happens,
no one will call his coming a lie.
He will lower (some), he will exalt (others).
When the earth is violently shaken,
and the mountains will be reduced to smithereens,
and that they will become scattered dust
Then you will be three categories:
People on the Right - What are people on the right?
And the people on the left - what are the people on the left?
They are the first to be the first (to follow Allah's orders on earth) and they will be the first (in the Hereafter)
These are the ones closest to Allah
in the Gardens of Earthly Delights,
a multitude of the chosen among the first [generations],
and a few among the last [generations],
on beds adorned [with gold and jewels],
leaning on it and facing each other.
Among them will circulate boys eternally young,
with cups, ewers, and a glass [filled] with a spring liquor
that will not cause them headaches or dizziness;
and fruits of their choice,
and any bird's flesh they desire.
And they will have houris in their eyes, large and beautiful,
like shell beads
as a reward for what they did.
They will hear neither futility nor blasphemy;
but only the words: "Salam! Salâm!" ... [Peace! Peace!]
And the people on the right; What are the people of the right?
[They will be among] thornless jujube trees,
and among banana trees with well-stocked bunches,
in Extended Shadow
[near] water flowing continuously,
and abundant fruits
neither interrupted nor forbidden,
on raised beds,
It is We who have created them to perfection,
and We made them virgins,
graceful, all of the same age,
for people on the right,
a multitude of the chosen among the first [generations],
and a multitude of the chosen ones among the last [generations].
And the people on the left; What are people on the left?
they will be in the midst of a burning breath and boiling water,
in the shade of black smoke
neither fresh nor sweet.
They used to live in luxury.
They persisted in the great sin [polytheism]
and said, "When we die and are dust and bones, will we be resurrected?
as well as our ancient ancestors?.."
Say: "Verily the first and the last
will be gathered for the appointment of a known day".
And then you, the misguided, who called (the Resurrection) a lie,
you will certainly eat from a Zaqqum tree.
you will fill your belly with it,
then you shall drink boiling water over it,
you will drink it as thirsty camels drink.
This is the welcome meal that will be served to them on the day of Retribution.
It is We who have created you. Why should you not believe [in the resurrection]?
So do you see what you're ejaculating:
Are you the one who creates it or are We the Creator?
We have predetermined death among you. We will not be hindered
to replace you with your fellow-creatures, and to make you reborn in [a state] which you do not know.
You knew the first creation. Don't you remember?
Do you see what you are ploughing?
Are you the one who grows it? Where are We the cultivator?
If We wished, We would reduce it to rubble. And you would not cease to be amazed and [to cry out]:
"Here we are in debt!
or rather, exposed to deprivation".
Do you see the water you drink?
Was it you who brought him down from the cloud? Where are We the descender?
If We wanted, We would make it salty. Why are you not grateful?
Do you see the fire you get by rubbing?
Are you the one who created his tree or are We the Creator?
We have made it a reminder (of Hell), and a useful element for those who need it.
Glorify therefore the name of your Lord, the Most Great!
No!.. I swear by the positions of the stars (in the firmament).
And that's just a solemn oath, if you knew.
And it is certainly a noble Qur'an,
in a well-kept book
which only the purified touch;
It is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.
Is it this speech that you call a lie?
And is it for you to call (the Qur'an) a lie?
When the breath of life rises to the throat (of a dying man),
and at that moment you are looking,
and that We are nearer to him than you [who surround him] but you do not see [him].
Why, then, if you believe that you are not accountable,
Do you not bring it back [this soul], if you are truthful?
If he is one of those who are close to Allah,
then (he will have) rest, grace and a Garden of delights.
And if he is one of the people of the right,
it will be [greeted with these words]: "Peace to you" from the people of the right.
And if he is one of those who had called (the resurrection) a lie and had gone astray,
then it will be placed in boiling water,
and it will burn in the Furnace.
This is full certainty.
Glorify therefore the name of your Lord, the Most Great!
Everything in the heavens and the earth glorifies Allah. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.
To Him belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and he causes death, and He is Omnipotent.
He is the First and the Last, the Apparent and the Hidden, and He is All-Knowing.
He created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then set Himself on the throne; He knows what goes into the earth and what goes out of it, and what comes down from heaven and what goes up there, and He is with you wherever you are. And Allah is watching perfectly what you do.
To Him belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. And to Allah all is brought back.
He makes the night penetrate into the day and the day into the night, and He knows perfectly well the contents of the breasts.
Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend of what He has given you the lieutenancy of. Those of you who believe and spend [for the sake of Allah] will have a great reward.
And what is the matter with you not believing in Allah, when the Messenger calls you to believe in your Lord? And [Allah] has already made your commitment if you are [sincere] in your faith.
It is He who sends down clear verses upon His servant, that He may bring you out of darkness into light; and surely Allah is Merciful to you, and Most Merciful.
And what do you have not to spend in the way of Allah, when Allah is the inheritance of the heavens and the earth? However, one cannot compare the one among you who gave away your property and fought before the conquest... The latter are higher in the hierarchy than those who spent and fought afterward. To each of you, Allah has promised the greatest reward, and Allah is the Great Knower of what you do.
Whoever makes a sincere loan to Allah, Allah multiplies it for him, and he will have a generous reward.
On the day when you see the believers, their light running before them and at their right hand; (they will be told): "This is good news for you today: Gardens under which the streams flow, to dwell in them forever." Such is the enormous success.
The day when the hypocrites, men and women, will say to those who believe, "Wait until we borrow [a little] from your light." It will be said, "Go back and seek light." It was then that a wall was erected between them, with a door whose interior contains mercy, and whose face has before it punishment [Hell].
"Weren't we with you?" they will shout at them. "Yes," [the others] will reply, "but you have been tempted, you have plotted (against the believers) and you have doubted and vain hopes have deceived you, until the command of Allah came. And the deceiver, [the devil] has deceived you about Allah.
Today, therefore, no ransom will be accepted from you or from those who have disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire: it is the Fire that is your inseparable companion. And what a bad destination!
Has not the time come for those who have believed, let their hearts humble themselves at the remembrance of Allah and before what has come down from the truth [the Qur'an]? And not to be like those who received the Book before them. They found the time long enough, and their hearts hardened, and many of them are perverse.
Know that Allah restores life to the earth when it is dead. Verily, We have made the evidence clear to you so that you may reason.
Those who give charity and have made a sincere loan to Allah, it will be multiplied for them and they will have a generous reward.
Those who believed in Allah and His Messengers are the great truthful and witnesses to Allah. They will have their reward and their light, while those who have disbelieved and called Our signs lies, these will be the people of the Furnace.
Know that this life is nothing but play, amusement, vain adornment, a race for pride among you and a rivalry in the acquisition of wealth and children. In this it is like rain: the vegetation that comes from it amazes the farmers, then it withers and you see it yellowed; then it becomes debris. And in the Hereafter, there is harsh punishment, and also forgiveness and Allah's approval. And the present life is nothing but deceptive enjoyment.
Hasten to a forgiveness from your Lord and a Paradise as wide as heaven and earth, prepared for those who have believed in Allah and His Messengers. This is the grace of Allah that He gives to whomever He wills. And Allah is the Possessor of great grace.
No misfortune befalls the earth or your persons that is not recorded in a Book before We created it; and this is indeed easy for Allah,
so that you do not worry about what has escaped you, nor rejoice for what He has given you. And Allah does not love all presumptuous and glorious things.
Those who are miserly and command people to be greedy. And whoever turns away... Then Allah is sufficient in Himself and He is worthy of praise.
We have indeed sent Our Messengers with clear proofs, and sent down with them the Book and the scales, so that the people may establish righteousness. And We have sent down iron, in which there is a formidable force, as well as benefits for the people, and so that Allah may recognize who in the Unseen will defend His cause and that of His Messengers. Verily, Allah is Mighty and Mighty.
We did send Noah and Abraham and bestowed prophecy and the Book on their descendants. Some of them were rightly guided, while many of them were perverse.
Then, following in their footsteps, We sent for Our [other] messengers, and We made them follow Jesus son of Mary and brought him the gospel, and put in the hearts of those who followed him meekness and meekness. The monasticism which they invented We have in no way prescribed to them. [They should] only seek the pleasure of Allah. But they did not observe it (this monasticism) as it should. We have given their reward to those of them who believed. But many of them were perverts.
O you who have believed! Fear Allah and believe in His Messenger that He may grant you two parts of His mercy, and that He may assign you a light with which you may walk, and that He may forgive you, for Allah is Forgiving and Most Merciful.
This is so that the People of the Book may know that they cannot have the grace of Allah and that the grace is in the hand of Allah. He gives it to whomever He wills, and Allah is the Possessor of immense grace.
Allah heard the words of the one who was arguing with you about her husband and complaining to Allah. And Allah heard your conversation, for Allah is Hearer and Clairvoyant.
Those of you who divorce your wives, declaring that they are to you like the backs of their mothers. whereas they are not their mothers at all, for their mothers are only those who gave birth to them. They are certainly speaking a blameworthy and lying word. Allah, however, is Forgiving and Forgiving.
Those who compare their wives to their mothers' backs and then go back on what they have said, must free a slave before they have any [conjugal] contact with their wives. This is what we urge you to do. And Allah is Perfectly Aware of what you are doing
But one who cannot afford to do so must fast for two consecutive months before having any contact with his wife. But if he cannot do it either, then let him feed sixty poor people. This is so that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger. These are the limits imposed by Allah. And the disbelievers will have a painful punishment.
Those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be overthrown as their predecessors were overthrown. We have already sent down explicit proofs, and the disbelievers will have a degrading punishment,
On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and then inform them of what they have done, Allah has counted it and they will have forgotten it. Allah is witness to all things.
Do you not see that Allah knows what is in the heavens and on the earth? No secret conversation between three without Him being their fourth, nor between five without Him being their sixth, or less or more than that without Him being with them where they are. Then He will inform them on the Day of Resurrection of what they were doing, for Allah is All-Knowing.
Do you not see those to whom secret conversations have been forbidden? Then they return to what has been forbidden to them, and concert together to sin, transgress, and disobey the Messenger. And when they come to you, they greet you in a way that Allah has not greeted you, and say to themselves, "Why doesn't Allah punish us for what we say?" Hell will suffice for them, where they will burn. And what a bad destination!
O you who have believed! When you hold secret conversations, do not consult with each other to sin, transgress and disobey the Messenger, but consult in kindness and piety. And fear Allah to whom you will be gathered.
The secret conversation is only the Devil's [work] to grieve those who have believed. But he cannot harm them in any way without Allah's permission. And it is in Allah that the believers must place their trust.
O you who have believed! When you are told, "Make room [for others] in the assemblies," then make room. Allah will give you a place (in Paradise). And when you are told to stand up, stand up. Allah will exalt in degrees those of you who believe and those who have received knowledge. Allah is Knower of what you do.
O you who have believed! When you have a confidential interview with the Messenger, precede your conversation with alms, for this is better for you and purer. But if you cannot find the means then Allah is Forgiving and Most Merciful!
Are you afraid of preceding your interview with alms? But if you have not done so and Allah has accepted your repentance, then perform Salah, pay Zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah is Knower of what you do.
Have you not seen those who have taken as allies people against whom Allah has been angry? They are neither of you nor of theirs; and they swear falsely, even though they know.
Allah has prepared a harsh punishment for them. What they were doing then was very bad.
Taking their oaths as shields, they obstruct the path of Allah. They will therefore have a degrading punishment.
Neither their property nor their children will be of any use to them against Allah's [punishment]. These are the people of the Fire where they will dwell forever.
On the day when Allah resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, thinking that they are relying on something solid. But they are the liars.
The Devil dominated them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. These are the Devil's party and it is the Devil's party that are certainly the losers.
Those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be among the most humiliated.
Allah has commanded: "Assuredly, I and My Messengers will triumph." Verily, Allah is Mighty and Mighty.
You will not find any among the people who believe in Allah and the Last Day, who take as friends those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, be they their fathers, sons, brothers, or the people of their tribe. He has prescribed faith in their hearts and He has helped them with His help. He will bring them into Gardens under which streams flow, where they will dwell forever. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. These are the party of Allah. The party of Allah is the party of those who succeed.
What is in the heavens and what is on earth glorifies Allah, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
It was He who expelled from their homes those among the People of the Book who did not believe, during the first exodus. You did not think that they would leave, and they thought that in truth their fortresses would defend them against Allah. But Allah came to them through where they did not expect, and brought terror into their hearts. They demolished their homes with their own hands, as well as with the hands of believers. Learn a lesson from this, O you who are endowed with clairvoyance.
And if Allah had not prescribed expatriation against them, He would certainly have punished them here on earth; and in the Hereafter they will have the punishment of fire.
This is because they have risen up against Allah and His Messenger. And whoever stands against Allah... so, truly Allah is harsh in punishment.
Every palm tree that you cut down or left standing on its roots, it is with Allah's permission and so that He may cover the wicked with shame.
The booty from their possessions, which Allah gave to His Messenger without a fight, you did not hire horses or camels; but Allah gives His Messengers dominion over whomever He wills, and Allah is Omnipotent.
The spoils of the people of the cities, which Allah bestowed on His Messenger without a fight, belong to Allah, the Messenger, the next of kin, the orphans, the poor, and the traveler in distress, so that it may not circulate among the rich among you alone. Take what the Messenger gives you; and what he forbids you, abstain from it; and fear Allah because Allah is harsh in punishment.
[It also belongs] to the needy emigrants who were expelled from their homes and possessions, while they were seeking a grace and pleasure from Allah, and helping Allah and His Messenger. These are the truthful ones.
It [also belongs] to those who before them settled in the land and in the faith, who love those who migrate to them, and feel in their hearts no envy for what [these immigrants] have received, and who prefer [them] to themselves, even if there is a shortage among them. Whoever guards himself against his own avarice, these are the ones who succeed.
And [it also belongs] to those who came after them, saying, "Lord, forgive us, and our brethren who went before us in the faith; and do not put in our hearts any resentment for those who have believed. Lord, You are Compassion and Most Merciful."
Have you not seen the hypocrites say to their brethren who have disbelieved among the People of the Book: "If you are cast out, we will certainly go with you, and we will never obey anyone against you; and if you are attacked, we will certainly help you." And Allah testifies that they are liars.
If they are driven out, they will not go with them; and if they are attacked, they will not help them; and even if they went to their aid, they would surely turn their backs; then they will not be helped.
You strike more terror into their hearts than Allah. It's because they're people who don't understand.
All of them will fight you only entrenched in fortified cities or from behind walls. Their internal dissensions are extreme. You would think they were united, but their hearts were divided. It is because they are people who do not reason.
They are like those who, a short time before them, tasted the consequence of their behavior and they will have a painful punishment;
they are like the Devil when he says to man, "Be unbelieving." Then when he disbelieved, he said: "I disown you because I fear Allah, the Lord of the Universe."
It was their destiny to both be in the Fire to dwell there forever. Such is the retribution of the unjust.
O you who have believed! Fear Allah. Let each soul see what it has put forward for tomorrow. And fear Allah, for Allah is Knower of what you do.
And do not be like those who have forgotten Allah; [Allah] then made them forget their own persons; these are the perverts.
The people of Fire and the people of Paradise will not be equal. The people of Paradise are the winners.
If We had sent this Qur'an down a mountain, you would have seen it humble itself and split for fear of Allah. And these parables We quote to the people so that they may think.
He is Allah. There is no god but Him, the Knower of the Invisible as well as the visible. He is the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful.
It is Allah. No god but Him; The Sovereign, the Pure, the Soothing, the Reassuring, the Predominant, the Almighty, the Constraining, the Proud. Glory be to Allah! He transcends what they associate with Him.
He is Allah, the Creator, the One who gives a beginning to all things, the Formator. To Him are the most beautiful names. All that is in heaven and earth glorifies Him. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.
O you who have believed! Do not take My enemy and yours as your allies, offering them friendship, when they have denied what has come to you of the truth. They expel the Messenger and you because you believe in Allah your Lord. If you have gone out to wrestle in My way and to seek My pleasure, will you secretly show them friendship, when I know perfectly well what you hide and what you divulge? And whoever of you does this strays from the righteousness of the path.
If they dominate you, they will be enemies to you and will stretch out their hands and tongues to you in evil; and they would like you to become disbelievers.
Neither your relatives nor your children will be of any use to you on the Day of Resurrection, He [Allah] will decide between you, and Allah is Clear-sighted about what you do.
Verily, you had a fine example in Abraham and those who were with him, when they said to their people, "We disavow you and what you worship besides Allah. We deny you. Between you and us, enmity and hatred are forever declared until you believe in Allah alone." Except for Abraham's words to his father: "I will indeed beg forgiveness [from Allah] on your behalf, although I can do nothing for you with Allah." "Lord, it is in You that we put our trust and to You we return [repentant]. And to You is Becoming.
Lord, do not make us a temptation to those who have disbelieved; and forgive us, Lord, for You are the Mighty, the Wise."
You have indeed had in them a fine example [to follow], for one who hopes in Allah and in the Last Day; but whoever turns away... then Allah is sufficient in Himself and is worthy of praise.
It may be that Allah establishes friendship between you and those of them whose enemies you have been. And Allah is Omnipotent and Allah is Forgiving and Most Merciful.
Allah does not forbid you to be kind and fair to those who did not fight you for the sake of religion and did not drive you out of your homes. For Allah loves the just.
Allah only forbids you to take as allies those who fought you for the sake of religion, who were driven out of your homes, and who helped in your expulsion. And those who take them as allies are the unjust.
O you who have believed! When the believing women come to you as emigrants, try them; Allah knows their faith best; If you see that they are believers, do not send them back to the disbelievers. They are not lawful [as wives] for them, nor are they lawful [as husbands] for them. And give them back what they have spent (as mahr). You will not be hurt by marrying them when you have given them their mahr. And do not keep marital ties with the disbelievers. Claim what you have spent, and let (the disbelievers) also claim what they have spent. This is the judgment of Allah by which He judges between you, and Allah is All-Knowing and Wise.
And if any of your wives escape to the disbelievers, and you retaliate, give back to those whose wives have left as much as they spent. Fear Allah in whom you believe.
O Prophet! When the believing women come to swear allegiance to you, and swear that they will not associate anything with Allah, that they will not steal, that they will not commit adultery, that they will not kill their own children, that they will not commit any infamy with their hands or feet, and that they will not disobey what is proper,  then take their oath of allegiance, and beg Allah for forgiveness for them. Verily, Allah is Forgiving and Most Merciful.
O you who have believed! Do not take as allies people against whom Allah is angry and who despair of the Hereafter, just as the disbelievers despair of the people of the tombs.
What is in the heavens and what is on earth glorifies Allah, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
O you who have believed! Why do you say what you don't do?
It is a great abomination in the sight of Allah to say what you do not do.
Allah loves those who fight in His way in close ranks, like a strong building.
And when Moses said to his people, "O my people! Why do you mistreat me when you know that I am truly the Messenger of Allah [sent] to you?" Then when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate, for Allah does not guide the wicked.
And when Jesus son of Mary said: "O Children of Israel, I am truly the Messenger of Allah [sent] to you, confirming what in the Torah is prior to me, and heralding a Messenger to come after me, whose name will be "Ahmad". Then when he came to them with clear proofs, they said, "This is manifest magic."
And who is more unjust than the one who invents a lie against Allah, when he is called to Islam? And Allah does not guide unrighteous people.
They want to extinguish the light of Allah from their mouths, while Allah will complete His light in spite of the dislike of the disbelievers.
It is He who sent His messenger with the guidance and the Religion of Truth, to place it above all other religions, in spite of the aversion of the associates.
O you who have believed! shall I point out to you a trade that will save you from a painful punishment?
You believe in Allah and His Messenger and you fight with your property and your people in the cause of Allah, and it is much better for you, if you knew!
He will forgive you your sins, and bring you into the Gardens under which the streams flow, and into pleasant dwellings in the Gardens of Eden. This is the huge success
and He will grant you other things that you like: help from Allah and a coming victory. And proclaims the good news to believers.
O you who have believed! Be the allies of Allah, as Jesus son of Mary said to the apostles: "Who are my allies (for the cause) of Allah?" - The apostles said: "We are the allies of Allah". A group of the Children of Israel believed, while a group denied. So we helped those who believed against their enemy, and they triumphed.
What is in the heavens and what is on earth glorifies Allah, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Mighty, the Wise.
It is He who sent to the people without a Book (the Arabs) a Messenger of their own who recites His verses to them, purifies them and teaches them the Book and the Wisdom, although they were previously in an obvious error,
as well as others among those who have not yet joined them. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
This is the grace of Allah that He gives to whomever He wills. And Allah is the Possessor of great grace.
Those who have been entrusted with the Torah but have not applied it are like a donkey carrying books. What a bad example is that of those who call the verses of Allah lies, and Allah does not guide unrighteous people.
Say: "O you who practice Judaism! If you claim to be Allah's beloved to the exclusion of others, then wish for death, if you are truthful."
But they will never wish for it, because of what their hands have prepared. Allah, however, knows well the wrongdoers.
Say: "The death you are fleeing from will certainly meet you. Then you will be brought back to the One who knows perfectly the Invisible world and the visible world and who will then inform you of what you were doing."
O you who have believed! When one calls for the Friday prayer, hasten to the invocation of Allah and leave all business. This is much better for you, if you knew!
Then when the Salat is finished, scatter yourselves on the earth and seek [some effect] of Allah's grace, and invoke Allah much so that you may succeed.
When they see some commerce or amusement, they scatter there and leave you standing. Say: "What is with Allah is far better than entertainment and commerce, and Allah is the best of providers."
When the hypocrites come to you, they say: "We testify that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah" Allah knows that you are truly His Messenger; and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are certainly liars.
They take their oaths as a shield and obstruct the path of Allah. What bad things they did!
It is because in truth they believed, and then rejected the faith. Their hearts, therefore, have been sealed, so that they understand nothing.
And when you see them, their bodies amaze you; and if they speak, you listen to their word. They are like logs leaning against walls and they think that every cry is directed at them. The enemy is them. Take heed of this. May Allah destroy them! As they are diverted (from the right path).
And when it is said to them, "Come, may the Messenger of Allah beg forgiveness for you," they turn their heads, and you see them turn away while they puff themselves up with pride.
It is all the same whether you beg forgiveness for them or not: Allah will never forgive them, for Allah does not guide evil people.
They are the ones who say: "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah, so that they may be scattered." And to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
They say: "If we return to Madinah, the most powerful will certainly bring out the humblest." And it is to Allah that the power is and to His Messenger and to the believers. But the hypocrites don't know this.
O you who have believed! Let neither your property nor your children distract you from the remembrance of Allah. And anybody who does that... then those will be the losers.
And spend of what We have bestowed upon you before death comes to one of you and he then says, "Lord! if only You would grant me a short delay: I would give alms and be among the good."
Allah, however, never gives a delay to a soul whose term has come. And Allah is Fully Aware of what you do.
What is in the heavens and what is on the earth glorifies Allah. To Him is the kingdom and to Him are the praises. And He is Omnipotent.
He is the One who created you. Among you there are disbelievers and believers. Allah is watching perfectly what you do.
He created the heavens and the earth in all truth and gave you your form and what a beautiful form He gave you! And to Him is becoming.
He knows what is in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what you hide as well as what you disclose. And Allah knows well the contents of the breasts.
Has it not reached you, the news of those who previously disbelieved and who tasted the evil consequence of their act; they will also have a painful punishment.
This is because their messengers came to them with clear proofs, and they said, "Will men guide us?" Then they disbelieved and turned away, and Allah did without them, and Allah is sufficient for Himself and is worthy of praise.
Those who have disbelieved say that they will not be resurrected. Say: "Yes! By my Lord! You will most certainly be resurrected; then you will certainly be informed of what you were doing. And this is easy for Allah."
Believe in Allah and His Messenger and in the Light [the Qur'an] that We have sent down. And Allah is Fully Aware of what you do.
The day He gathers you together for the Day of Gathering, it will be the day of great loss. And whoever believes in Allah and does good deeds, He will blot out his evil deeds and bring him into gardens under which flow streams where they will dwell forever. This is a huge success!
And those who have disbelieved and called Our verses lies, these are the people of the Fire where they will dwell forever. And what a bad destination!
No evil befalls [man] except by the permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah, [Allah] guides his heart. Allah is All-Knowing.
Obey Allah and obey the Messenger and if you turn away... it is incumbent upon Our Messenger only to convey (His message) in plain English.
Allah no god but Him! And it is to Allah that the believers [must] entrust.
O you who have believed, you have an enemy of your wives and children [a temptation]. Take heed, then. But if you excuse [them], pass over [their] faults and forgive [them], know that Allah is Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Your possessions and your children are only a temptation, while with Allah is a huge reward.
Fear Allah, so as much as you can, listen, obey and give largesse. It will be good for you. And whoever has been protected from his own greed... these are the ones who succeed.
If you make a sincere loan to Allah, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. Allah, however, is Most Grateful and Forgiving.
He is the Knower of the Invisible and Visible world, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
O Prophet! When you repudiate women, divorce them according to their prescribed waiting period; and count the period; and fear Allah your Lord. Do not take them out of their houses, nor let them leave them, unless they have committed proven turpitude. These are the laws of Allah. Whoever transgresses the laws of Allah, however, is wronging himself. You don't know if by then Allah will not raise up something new!
Then, when they reach the prescribed term, restrain them in a proper manner, or separate yourself from them in a proper manner; and take two upright men from among you as witnesses. And fulfill your testimony to Allah. This is what one who believes in Allah and the Last Day is exhorted to do. And whoever fears Allah, He will give him a favorable outcome,
and will bestow upon him His gifts in ways that he did not rely on. And whoever puts his trust in Allah, He [Allah] is sufficient for him. Allah attains what He sets Himself for, and Allah has assigned a measure to everything.
If you have doubts about your wives who are no longer expecting to have a period, their waiting period is three months. The same goes for those who do not yet have a period. And as for those who are pregnant, their waiting period will end when they give birth. Whoever fears Allah, however, He makes things easier for him.
This is the command of Allah that He has sent down to you. Whoever fears Allah, however, He will erase his sins and give him a great reward.
And let these women live where you live, and according to your means. And don't try to harm them by forcing them to live in cramped conditions. And if they are pregnant, provide for them until they have given birth. Then, if they nurse [the child born] of you, give them their wages. And consult [on this matter] in a proper way. And if you encounter mutual difficulties, then another will breastfeed for him.
Let him who is well-to-do spend his fortune; and let him whose possessions are restricted spend according to what Allah has granted him. Allah imposes on no one except according to what He has given him, and Allah will make ease succeed to embarrassment.
How many cities have insolently refused the command of their Lord and His messengers! We demanded of them an account of it with severity, and punished them with an unheard-of punishment.
So they tasted the consequence of their behavior. And the end result of their actions was [their] perdition.
Allah has prepared a harsh punishment for them. Fear Allah, therefore, O you who are endowed with understanding, you who have faith. Verily, Allah has sent down a reminder to you,
a Messenger who recites to you the verses of Allah as clear proofs, in order to bring out those who believe and do good deeds from darkness to light. And whoever believes in Allah and does good, He brings him into the Gardens under which the streams flow, to dwell there forever. Allah has given him a beautiful attribution.
Allah who created seven heavens and as many earths. Between them [His] commandment descends, so that you may know that Allah is indeed Omnipotent and that Allah has embraced all things of [His] knowledge.
O Prophet! Why, in seeking the pleasure of your wives, do you forbid yourself what Allah has made lawful for you? And Allah is Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Allah has commanded you to free yourself from your oaths. Allah is your Master; and He is the All-Knowing, the Wise.
When the Prophet confided a secret to one of his wives and she had divulged it and Allah had informed him of it, he made known part of it and passed over part of it. Then, when he had informed her of this, she said, "Who gave you news?" He said, "It is the All-Knowing, the All-Knowing, who has warned me."
If you repent to Allah, it is because your hearts have failed. But if you support each other against the Prophet, then his allies will be Allah, Gabriel, and the righteous among the believers, and the angels will also support [him].
If He divorces you, His Lord may give Him better wives than you, Muslims, believers, obedient, repentant, worshippers, fasting, already married or virgins.
O you who have believed! Preserve your persons and your families from a Fire whose fuel will be people and stones, watched over by rude, harsh angels, never disobeying Allah in what He commands them, and doing strictly as they are commanded.
O you who have disbelieved! Don't apologize today. You will only be rewarded according to what you worked.
O you who have believed! Repent to Allah with sincere repentance. It may be that your Lord will blot out your sins and bring you into the Gardens under which the streams flow, on the Day when Allah will spare the Prophet and those who believe with him from ignominy. Their light will run before them and at their right hand; they will say, "Lord, forgive us our light and forgive us. for you are omnipotent."
O Prophet! Lead the fight against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh towards them. Their refuge will be Hell, and what a bad destination!
Allah has quoted as a parable for those who disbelieved the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under the authority of two righteous of Our servants. Both betrayed them and they were of no help to [these two women] in the eyes of Allah. And it was said to them, "Enter into the Fire, both of you, with those who enter it."
and Allah has quoted Pharaoh's wife as a parable for those who believe, when she says: "Lord, build me a house with You in Paradise, and save me from Pharaoh and his work; and save me from unjust people."
Similarly, Mary, the daughter of Imran who had preserved her virginity; We then breathed into it Our Spirit. She had declared the words of her Lord as well as His Books to be true: she was among the devoted.
Blessed be He in whose hand is the kingdom, and He is Omnipotent.
The One who created death and life in order to test you (and to know) which of you is the best at work, and He is the Mighty, the Forgiver.
He who created seven heavens superimposed without you seeing any disproportion in the creation of the Most Merciful. Bring [her back] to her. Do you see any breach in it?
Then turn your gaze twice: the look will come back to you humiliated and frustrated.
We have indeed beautified the nearest heaven with lamps [of the stars] which We have made into projectiles to stone the devils, and We have prepared for them the punishment of the Furnace.
Those who have disbelieved in their Lord will have the punishment of Hell. And what a bad destination!
When they are thrown into it, they will hear a groan in it, while it bubbles.
He is very far from bursting out of rage. Whenever a group is thrown into it, its guards ask them: "What! Has not a warner come to you?"
They said, "Yes! a warner came to us, but we cried out and said, 'Allah has not sent anything down: you are only in a great error.'
And they said, "If we had listened or reasoned, we would not have been among the people of the Furnace."
They have acknowledged their sin. May the people of the Furnace be annihilated forever.
Those who fear their Lord even though they have never seen Him will have forgiveness and a great reward.
Whether you hide your word or divulge it, He knows the contents of the breasts well.
Does He not know what He has created when He is the Compassionate, the Perfected Knower?
It is He who has subdued the earth to you: therefore go through its great expanses. Eat of what He provides for you. To Him is the Resurrection.
Are you safe from Him who is in heaven burying you in the earth? And now she trembles!
Or are you safe from Him in heaven sending a hurricane of stones against you? In this way you will know what My warning was.
Indeed, those before them had cried lies. What was My reprobation then!
Have they not seen the birds above them, spreading and folding their wings in turn? Only the Most Merciful sustains them. For He is over all things, Clairvoyant.
Who is there who would constitute for you an army [capable] of helping you, apart from the Most Merciful? In truth, the disbelievers are in complete illusion.
Or who is the one who will give you your sustenance if He stops providing His allocation? But they persist in their insolence and repulsion.
So who is better guided? The one who walks face down or the one who walks upright on a straight path.
Say: "He created you and gave you hearing, eyes and hearts." But you're rarely grateful!
Say: "It is He who has poured you out on the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
And they say, "When will this promise be made, if you are truthful?"
Say: "Allah alone has knowledge. And I'm just a clear warner."
Then, when they see (the punishment) at close quarters, the faces of those who have disbelieved will be afflicted. And they will be told, "This is what you have been asking for."
Say: "What do you think? May Allah destroy me and those who are with me, or have mercy on us, who will protect the disbelievers from painful punishment?"
Say: "He is the Most Merciful. We believe in Him and it is in Him that we place our trust. You will soon know who is in an obvious error."
Say: "What do you think? If your water were absorbed deep in the earth, who would bring you spring water?"
Nûn. By the pen and what they write!
You (Muhammad) are not, by the grace of your Lord, a possessed person.
And there will certainly be for you a reward that will never be interrupted.
And you are certainly of eminent morality.
You'll see and they'll see
Who among you has lost your mind.
It is your Lord who knows best those who stray from His path, and He knows better those who walk the right way.
Do not obey those who cry lies,
They would like you to compromise with them so that they will compromise with you.
And obey no great swearer, contemptible,
great slanderer, great peddler of backbiting,
great hindrance of good, transgressor, great sinner,
hard-hearted, and on top of that a bastard.
Even if he is endowed with wealth and (many) children.
When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Tales of the ancients."
We will mark it on the muzzle [nose].
We have tried them as We have tried the owners of the orchard who had sworn to harvest them in the morning,
without saying: "Allah willing".
A calamity from your Lord fell upon them while they were sleeping,
and in the morning it was as if everything had been razed to the ground.
The next morning they called to one another:
"Go to your field early if you want to harvest it."
So they went, while talking to each other in a low voice:
"Don't let any poor people enter today."
They set out early determined to use avarice [towards the poor], convinced that it was in their power.
Then, when they saw it [the garden], they said, "Truly, we have lost our way.
Or rather we are frustrated."
The most righteous of them said: "Did I not say to you, 'If only you have given glory to Allah?'"
They said, "Glory to our Lord! Yes, we have been unjust."
Then they addressed each other, reproaching each other.
They said, "Woe to us! We have been rebels.
We wish that our Lord would replace it for us with something better. We want to get closer to our Lord."
Such was the punishment; and the punishment of the Hereafter is even greater, if only they knew!
The pious will have the Gardens of Delight with their Lord.
Will We treat those who are subject to Allah in the manner of criminals?
What have you got? How do you judge?
Or do you have a Book in which you learn
that in truth you will obtain all that you desire?
Or have you obtained from Us oaths valid until the Day of Resurrection, binding Us to give you what you decide?
Ask them who among them is responsible for this?
Or do they have partners? Well, let them bring their associates if they are truthful!
The day when they will face the horrors [of the Judgment] and will be called to prostration, but they will not be able to.
Their eyes will be lowered, and degradation will cover them. Now they were called to prostration at the time when they were safe and sound...
Leave Me therefore with anyone who calls this speech a lie; We will gradually lead them through where they don't know!
And I give them a delay, for My stratagem is safe!
Or do you ask them for a salary, thus burdening them with a heavy debt?
Or do they know the Unknowable and it is from there that they write [their lies]?
Endure with patience the sentence of your Lord, and do not be like the man with the fish [Jonah] who called (Allah) in his great anguish.
If a blessing of his Lord had not come to him, he would have been cast back in despised land on a desert land,
Then his Lord elected him and named him among the good.
Those who disbelieve are very close to piercing you with their eyes, when they hear the Qur'an, they say: "He is indeed mad!"
And this is only a Reminder, addressed to the worlds!
The inevitable [the Hour that shows the truth]
What is the inevitable?
And who will tell you what the inevitable is?
The Thamûd and the 'Aad had treated the cataclysm as a lie.
As for the Thamud, they were destroyed by the excessively loud [noise].
And as for the 'Aad, they were destroyed by a roaring and furious wind
that [Allah] unleashed against them for seven consecutive nights and eight consecutive days; then you saw the people knocked to the ground like hollowed-out palm stumps.
Do you see the slightest vestige of it?
Pharaoh and those who lived before him, as well as the overthrown cities, committed sins.
They disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord. The latter, therefore, seized them in an irresistible manner.
It was We who, when the water overflowed, charged you on the Ark
in order to make it a reminder for you that every faithful ear preserves.
Then, when with a single breath one blows into the Trunk,
and that the earth and the mountains will be lifted and then compacted at one blow;
on that day then, the Event will take place,
and the sky will split and be fragile on that day.
And on his sides [shall stand] the angels, while eight on that day shall carry over them the throne of thy Lord.
On that day you will be exposed; and nothing of you will be hidden.
As for the one who has been given the Book in his right hand, he will say: "Here! Read my book.
I was sure to find what I was looking for."
He will enjoy a pleasant life:
in a high-ranking garden
whose fruits are within reach.
"Eat and drink pleasantly for what you have advanced in the past days."
As for the one who has been given the Book in his left hand, he will say: "Alas for me! I wish they hadn't given me my book,
and not having known my account...
Alas, how I wish [my first death] had been the final one.
My fortune has been of no use to me.
My authority has been annihilated and has left me!"
"Seize it! Then, put a shackle on him;
then burn it in the Furnace;
then bind him with a chain of seventy cubits,
for he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great.
and did not encourage them to feed the poor.
He has no warm friend for him here today, [to protect him].
nor any other food than pus,
that only the guilty will eat."
Of course not... I swear by what you see,
as well as by what you do not see,
that this [the Qur'an] is the word of a noble Messenger,
and that it is not the word of a poet; but you believe very little,
nor the word of a soothsayer, but you remember very little.
It is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.
And if he had forged some words which they had attributed to Us,
We would have grasped it with our right hand,
Then We would have cut off his aorta.
And none of you could have served as a bulwark for it.
It is indeed a reminder to the pious.
And We know that there are among you who call him a liar;
But verily, it will be a matter of regret to the disbelievers,
this is the real certainty.
Glorify therefore the name of your Lord, the Most Great!
One claimant called for an unavoidable punishment,
for the disbelievers, whom no one could reject,
and which comes from Allah, the Lord of the ways of ascent.
The Angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in a day of fifty thousand years.
Bear with a good patience.
They see it (the punishment) far away,
when We see him very near,
the day when the sky will be like molten metal
and the mountains like wool,
where no devoted friend will inquire about a friend,
although they see each other. The criminal would like to be able to redeem himself from the punishment of this day, by betraying his children,
his partner, his brother,
even his clan that gave him asylum,
and everything that is on earth, everything that could save him.
But nothing [will save him]. [Hell] is an inferno
brutally tearing the skin off the skull.

We sent Noah to his people: "Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them."

Book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham.
Abraham became Isaac's father. Isaac became Jacob's father. Jacob is the father of Judah and his brothers.
Judah begat Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Pérez is Hezron's father. Hezron fathered Ram.
Ram fathered Amminadab. Amminadab begat Nahshon. Nachschon begets Salmon.
Salmon fathered Boaz by Rahab. Boaz begat Obed of Ruth. Obed is the father of Jesse.
Jesse begat King David. King David begat Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
Solomon begat Rehoboam. Rehoboam begat Abijah. Abija begat Asa .
Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat is the father of Jehoram. Joram begat Uzziah.
Uzziah is the father of Jotham. Jotham is the father of Ahaz. Ahaz begat Hezekiah.
Hezekiah is the father of Manasseh. Manasseh was the father of Amun. Amun begat Josiah.
Josiah was the father of Jeconiah and his brothers at the time of the exile in Babylon.
After the exile to Babylon, Jeconiah became Shealtiel's father. Shealtiel fathered Zerubbabel.
Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud is Eliakim's father. Eliakim is the father of Azor.
Azor fathered Zadok. Zadok begat Achim. Achim begat Eliud.
Eliud is the father of Eleazar. Eleazar begat Matthan. Matthan begat Jacob.
Jacob begat Joseph, husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, called Christ.
Thus, all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile in Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the deportation to Babylon until Christ, fourteen generations.
This is how the birth of Jesus Christ took place: After the betrothal of Mary, his mother, to Joseph, before they met, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
Joseph, her husband, being a just man, and not wishing to make her a public example, intended to repudiate her secretly.
But while he was thinking of these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, and said, "Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for that which was conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
She gave birth to a son. You shall call his name Jesus, for it is he who will save his people from their sins. »
Now all this happened in order that what was spoken by the Lord by the prophet might be fulfilled, saying,
"Behold, the virgin shall conceive, and give birth to a son. He will be called Immanuel," which is, according to the interpretation, "God with us."
Joseph rose from his sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him, and took his wife for himself;
and he did not know her sexually until she had given birth to his firstborn son. He gave him the name of Jesus.
Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the time of King Herod, behold, the wise men from the east went to Jerusalem, saying:
"Where is he who was born king of the Jews? For we have seen his star in the east, and we have come to bow down to him. »
When King Herod heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
Gathering together all the chief priests and the scribes of the people, he asked them where Christ was to be born.
They answered him, "To Bethlehem of Judea," for this is written by the prophet,
"You, Bethlehem, land of Judea. are by no means the least among the princes of Judah; for out of you will come a governor who will be the shepherd of my people, Israel. »
Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and he learned from them at what exact hour the star had appeared.
He sent them to Bethlehem and said to them, "Go and fetch the little child. When you have found it, let me know, so that I too may come and worship it. »
When they had heard the king, they went away. And behold, the star which they had seen in the east went before them, until it came to place itself above the place where the little child was.
When they saw the star, they rejoiced with great joy.
They went into the house and saw the little child with Mary, his mother; they prostrated themselves and adored him. Opening their treasures, they offered him gifts: gold, frankincense and myrrh.
Having been warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they returned to their country by another way.
Now when they were gone, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, "Arise, take the little child and his mother, flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the little child to destroy him."
He got up, took the little child and his mother by night, and went to Egypt,
where he remained until the death of Herod, that what the Lord had foretold through the prophet might be fulfilled, "I have called my son out of Egypt."
Then Herod, seeing that he was being mocked by the wise, was exceedingly angry, and he sent to kill all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding country, from the age of two years and under, according to the exact time he had learned from the wise.
Then was fulfilled what had been foretold by Jeremiah the prophet, in these words:
"A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentations, weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she would not be comforted, for they are no more. »
But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in Egypt in a dream, and said,
"Arise, take the little child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who sought the life of the little child are dead."
He arose, took the little child and his mother, and went to the land of Israel.
But when he heard that Archelaus reigned in Judea in the place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. Warned in a dream, he withdrew to the region of Galilee,
and came to settle in a city called Nazareth, that what had been spoken by the prophets might be fulfilled: he shall be called a Nazarene.
At that time John the Baptist came to preach in the wilderness of Judea, saying:
"Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand."
For it was he who was foretold by the prophet Isaiah, saying, "The voice of him crying in the wilderness, prepare the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight! »
John himself wore camel hair clothes and a leather belt around his waist. It fed on locusts and wild honey.
Then the people of Jerusalem, and of all Judea, and of the whole region of the Jordan, came to him.
They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
But when he saw a great number of Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, "O races of vipers, who taught you to flee from the wrath to come?
Produce fruits worthy of repentance!
Do not say to yourself, "We have Abraham for our father," for I tell you that God can raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
Even now, the axe is at the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
"I baptize you with water for repentance, but he who comes after me is mightier than I, and I am not worthy to wear his sandals. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.
He has the van in his hand, and he will clean its area thoroughly. He will gather his wheat in the barn, but he will burn the tares in an unquenchable fire. »
Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.
But John prevented him, saying, "I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?"
But Jesus answered and said to him, "Let it be done now, for it is the proper way for us to fulfill all righteousness." So he allowed it.
Jesus, after being baptized, came directly out of the water; and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descend like a dove and come upon him.
And behold, a voice from heaven said, "This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."
Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
As he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was then hungry.
The tempter came and said to him, "If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread."
But he answered, "It is written, 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God.'"
Then the devil led him into the holy city. He placed it on the pinnacle of the temple,
and said to him, "If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, 'He will command his angels concerning you,' and 'They will carry you on their hands, so that your foot does not strike against a stone.'"
Jesus said to him, "It is also written, 'You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.'"
The devil took him again to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
He said to him, "I will give you all these things, if you will bow down and worship me."
Then Jesus said to him, "Go behind me, Satan! For it is written, "You shall worship the Lord your God, and serve no one but him."
Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and ministered to him.
Now, when Jesus heard that John had been betrayed, he withdrew to Galilee.
Leaving Nazareth, he came to settle at Capernaum, which is near the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,
that what was foretold by Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, in these words:
"The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, towards the sea, beyond the Jordan, the Galilee of the Gentiles,
the people who sat in darkness saw a great light; To those who sat in the region and the shadow of death, for them the light has risen. »
From then on, Jesus began to preach and to say, "Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand. »
As he walked along the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, who were casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
He said to them, "Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men."
Immediately they left their nets and followed him.
When he left there, he saw two other brothers, James, son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, in the boat with Zebedee, their father, who were mending their nets. He called them .
Immediately they left the boat and their father, and followed him.
Jesus went through all Galilee, teaching in the synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every sickness and infirmity among the people.
The news of his coming spread throughout Syria. All the sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed by demons, epileptics and paralytics, were brought to him; and he healed them.
Numerous crowds, from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan, followed him.
Seeing the crowd, he went up to the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him.
He opened his mouth and taught them, saying,
"Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Blessed are those who weep, for they will be comforted.
Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled.
Blessed are the merciful, for they will obtain mercy.
Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.
Happy are the peacemakers! for they will be called children of God.
Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness' sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Happy will you be when, for my sake, you are insulted, persecuted, and all kinds of evil are falsely spoken against you.
Rejoice, and be glad, for your reward will be great in heaven. For thus the prophets who were before you were persecuted.
"You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? He is then good for nothing, except to be thrown out and trampled under the feet of men.
You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill cannot be hidden.
Nor do you light a lamp to put it under a measuring basket, but on a stand, and it shines for all who are in the house.
In the same way, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
"Do not think that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets. I have not come to destroy, but to fulfill.
For, verily, I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, not one little letter or one little stroke of the pen will disappear from the law until all is accomplished.
Therefore, whoever transgresses one of these lesser commandments and teaches others to do so, will be called the least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whoever does them and teaches them will be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.
For I say to you, unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven.
You have heard that it was said to the ancients, "Thou shalt not commit murder, and "He that commits murder shall be exposed to judgment."
But I tell you that anyone who gets angry with his brother for no reason will be in danger of judgment. The one who says to his brother: "Raca! risks the council. Whoever says, "You are mad," will risk the fire of hell.
"If, therefore, thou shalt present thy offering at the altar, and there thou remembers that thy brother has something against thee,
leave your offering there before the altar, and go away. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your offering.
Quickly come to an agreement with your adversary while you are with him on the way, lest the procurator deliver you up to the judge, the judge deliver you up to the officer, and you be thrown into prison.
In any case, I tell you, you will not get out of there until you have paid the last penny.
You have heard that it was said, 'You shall not commit adultery';
but I tell you that whoever looks at a woman to lust after her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
If your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you. For it is more advantageous for you that one of your members should perish than your whole body should be cast into hell.
If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw it away from you. For it is more advantageous for you that one of your members should perish, that your whole body should be cast into hell.
It was also said: "If anyone divorces his wife, let him give her a letter of divorce."
But I tell you that if anyone divorces his wife, except on account of sexual immorality, he makes her an adulteress, and if anyone marries her while she is divorced, he commits adultery.
"You have also heard that it was said to the elders, 'You shall not swear falsely, but you shall fulfill your oaths to the Lord.'
But I say to you do not swear at all, nor by heaven, for it is the throne of God;
nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
Neither shall you swear by your head, for one cannot make a hair white or black.
But let your "yes" be "yes" and your "no" be "no". Everything that is more than that belongs to the evil one.
You have heard that it was said: 'An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth'.
But I say to you, do not resist him who does evil; but if anyone strikes you on the right cheek, hold out the other to him also.
If someone chases you to take your cloak, leave your cloak for him too.
If someone forces you to walk a kilometer, do two with him.
Give to him who asks you, and do not reject him who wants to borrow you.
You have learned that it was said, "You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy."
But I say to you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat and persecute you,
that ye may be the children of your Father who is in heaven. For he causes his sun to rise on the wicked and on the good, and he causes rain to fall on the just and on the unjust.
For if you love those who love you, what reward will you have? Don't the tax collectors themselves do the same?
If you just greet your friends, what do you do more than others? Don't tax collectors do the same?
Therefore you must be perfect, as your Father who is in heaven is perfect.
"Take heed that you do not do your charity before men, that you may be seen by them, or you will have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.
Thus, when you do acts of mercy, do not blow the trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, in order to bring glory to men. I tell you for sure, they have received their reward.
But when you do works of mercy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
that your works of mercy may be in secret; then your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you openly.
"When you pray, you will not be like the hypocrites, who love to stand and pray in synagogues and on street corners, that they may be seen by men. Verily, I say to you, they have received their reward.
But you, when you pray, go into your inner chamber, and, having closed your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you openly.
In praying, do not use vain repetitions, as the pagans do; for they imagine that they will be heard because they have spoken much.
So do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
Pray thus: 'Our Father who is in heaven, hallowed be your name.
Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread.
Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.
Do not subject us to temptation, but deliver us from the evil one. For thee is thee the kingdom, the power, and the glory for ever and ever. Amen.
For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive you your trespasses.
"Moreover, when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites, with their sad faces. For they disfigure their faces so that men may see them fasting. I tell you for sure, they have received their reward.
But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
so that men may not see that you are fasting, but your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
"Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal;
but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and rust do not destroy, and where thieves do not break through and steal;
for where your treasure is, there will your heart also be.
"The lamp of the body is the eye. So if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be filled with light.
But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be in darkness. If, then, the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
"No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and mammon.
Therefore I say to you not to worry about your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor for your body: what you will wear. Is not life more than food, and the body more than clothing?
Look at the birds of the air: they do not sow, they do not reap, they do not gather in barns. Your Heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much more valuable than they?
Which of you, by worrying, can add a moment to its lifespan?
Why are you worried about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don't work, they don't spin,
and I tell you that Solomon himself, in all his glory, was not clothed like them.
But if God thus dresses the grass of the field, which exists today and tomorrow will be thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you, who are of little faith?
So don't worry, saying, "What shall we eat?", "What shall we drink?" or "What shall we be clothed in?"
For the heathen seek all these things; your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
But first seek the Kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be given to you also.
So don't worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will worry about itself. The misfortune of each day is enough.
"Do not judge, so that you will not be judged.
For by whatever judgment you judge, you will be judged, and by whatever measure you measure, you will be measured.
Why do you see the spot in your brother's eye, and do you not consider the beam in your own eye?
Or how will you say to your brother, "Let me remove the speck from your eye," and behold, the beam is in your own eye?
Hypocrite! First remove the beam from your eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.
"Do not give to dogs what is sacred, nor throw your pearls before pigs, lest they trample them underfoot, turn around, and tear you to pieces.
"Ask, and it will be given to you. Seek , and you will find . Knock, and it will be opened to you.
For whoever asks receives . He who seeks finds . To the one who knocks, we will open .
Or who among you is who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?
Or, if he asks for a fish, who will give him a snake?
If, then, wicked as you are, you know how to give good things to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him.
Therefore, whatever you want men to do to you, you will do to them also; for this is the law and the prophets.
"Enter by the narrow gate; for the gate is wide, and the way is wide, which leads to perdition, and there are many who enter by it.
How narrow is the gate and how narrow is the path that leads to life! There are few who find it.
"Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but who are in reality ravaging wolves.
It is by their fruits that you will recognize them. Do you pick grapes from thorns or figs from thistles?
In the same way, every good tree produces good fruit, but the corrupt tree produces bad fruit.
A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and neither can a corrupt tree produce good fruit.
Any tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
It is therefore by their fruits that you will recognize them.
"Not all those who say to me, 'Lord, Lord,' will enter into the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.
In that day, many will say to me, "Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in your name, cast out demons in your name, and done many miracles in your name?
Then I will say to them: "I never knew you. Depart from me, you who work iniquity."
"Whoever hears these words which I speak, and does them, I will compare him to a wise man who built his house on a rock.
The rain fell, the floods came, the winds blew and beat this house, but it did not fall, for it was founded on the rock.
Whoever hears these words that I say and does not do them is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
The rain fell, the floods came, the winds blew and hit that house, and it fell, and its fall was great. »
When Jesus had finished saying these things, the crowd was struck by his teaching,
for he taught them with authority, and not like the scribes.
When he came down from the mountain, great crowds followed him.
Behold, a leper came to him and adored him, saying, "Lord, if you will, you can make me clean."
Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, "I will. Be purified. Immediately, his leprosy was cleansed.
Jesus said to him, "Take care not to tell anyone; but go and show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift which Moses commanded, as a witness for them. »
When he arrived at Capernaum, a centurion came to him for help.
saying, "Lord, my servant is lying in the house, paralyzed and severely tormented."
Jesus said to him, "I will come and heal him."
The centurion replied, "Lord, I am not worthy that you should come under my roof. Just say one word, and my servant will be healed.
For I too am a man of authority, having soldiers under my command. I said to this one, "Go," and he goes; I said to him, "Come," and he comes; I said to my servant, "Do this," and he does it. »
When Jesus heard this, he was astonished and said to those who followed him, "Truly, I say to you, I have not found so great a faith, not even in Israel.
I say to you, many will come from the east and the west and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,
but the children of the kingdom will be cast into outer darkness. There will be crying and gnashing of teeth. »
Jesus said to the centurion, "Go, let it happen. Let it be done for you what you have believed. His servant was healed that very hour.
When Jesus entered Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother lying down and suffering from a fever.
He touched her hand, and the fever left her. So she got up and served him.
When evening came, several demon-possessed persons were brought to him. He drove out the spirits with a word and healed all the sick,
that what had been foretold by the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled: "He has taken our infirmities and borne our sicknesses."
Now, seeing a great crowd around him, Jesus gave the order to cross over to the other bank.
A scribe came up to him and said, "Master, I will follow you wherever you go."
Jesus said to him, "The foxes have holes and the birds of the air nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head."
Another of his disciples said to him, "Lord, let me go and bury my father first."
But Jesus said to him, "Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead."
He got into a boat, and his disciples followed him.
Behold, a violent storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was covered by the waves; but he was asleep.
The disciples came to him and woke him up, saying, "Save us, Lord! We are dying! »
He said to them, "Why are you fearful, O people of little faith?" Then he arose, threatened the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.
Men were astonished and said, "What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?"
When he arrived on the other side, in the land of the Gergesenians, two demon-possessed persons met him there, coming out of the tombs, extremely ferocious, so that no one could pass through it.
And behold, they cried out, "What have we to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before time? »
Now far from them there was a herd of numerous pigs grazing.
The demons begged him, saying, "If you drive us out, let us go to the herd of pigs."
He said to them, "Go!" They went out and entered the herd of pigs; and behold, the whole herd of pigs threw themselves from the top of the cliff into the sea and died in the water.
Those who had fed them fled and went into the city, telling everything, including what had happened to those who were possessed by demons.
And behold, the whole city went out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him to move away from their borders.
He got into a boat, crossed the boat, and arrived in his city.
And behold, a paralyzed man was brought to him, lying on a bed. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, "My son, rejoice! Your sins are forgiven you. »
Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, "This man is blaspheming."
Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said to them, "Why do you think evil in your hearts?
For which is easier, to say, "Your sins are forgiven," or to say, "Arise and walk"?
But that you may know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins, he said to the paralytic, "Arise, take up your bed, and go to your house."
He got up and went to his house.
But the crowd, seeing this, marveled and glorified God, who had given such power to men.
As Jesus passed by, he saw a man named Matthew, sitting at the tax collection desk. He said to him, "Follow me." He got up and followed him.
As he was sitting in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.
The Pharisees, seeing this, said to his disciples, "Why does your master eat with publicans and sinners?"
When Jesus heard this, he said to them, "Those who are healthy do not need a doctor, but those who are sick do.
But you will learn what it means: "I want mercy and not sacrifices, for I have come not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."
Then John's disciples came to him, saying, "Why do we and the Pharisees often fast, but your disciples do not fast?"
Jesus said to them, "Can the friends of the bridegroom lament while the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.
No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the piece would detach from the garment, and a more serious hole would be made.
Nor is new wine put into old wineskins, otherwise the wineskins would burst, the wine would spill out, and the wineskins would be ruined. No, the new wine is put in fresh wineskins, and both are preserved. »
While he was telling them these things, behold, a chief came and prostrated himself before him, saying, "My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live."
Jesus arose and followed him, as well as his disciples.
Behold, a woman who had had a flow of blood for twelve years came behind him and touched the fringe of his garment;
for she said to herself, "If I only touch her garment, I will be healed."
But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said to her, "My daughter, rejoice! Your faith has healed you. And the woman was healed from that hour.
When Jesus entered the chief's house and saw the flute-players and the crowd in great disorder,
he said to them, "Make way, for the maiden is not dead, but she is asleep." They laughed at him.
But as the crowd had withdrawn, he entered, took her by the hand, and the young girl stood up.
The report of this spread throughout the country.
As Jesus passed by, two blind men followed him, crying, "Have mercy on us, son of David!"
When he had entered the house, the blind approached him. Jesus said to them, "Do you think I can do this?" They said to him, "Yes, Lord."
Then he touched their eyes, saying, "Let it be done to you according to your faith."
Then their eyes were opened. Jesus gave them a strict command, saying, "See that no one knows anything of this."
But they went out and spread his fame throughout the country.
As they were going out, behold, a dumb man possessed by a demon was brought to him.
