but especially those who walk according to the flesh in lust for defilement and despise authority. Bold, selfish, they are not afraid to speak ill of dignitaries,
whereas the angels, though more powerful, do not pass a slanderous judgment against them before the Lord.
But these, as irrational beings, born natural animals to be taken and destroyed, speaking ill of what they do not know, will be destroyed by their destruction,
receiving the wages of iniquity; people who delight in reveling in the day, the blemishes and defects, reveling in their deceit while they feast with you;
having eyes full of adultery, and who cannot cease to sin, seducing troubled souls, having a heart drawn to covetousness, accursed children!
Leaving the right path, they went astray, having followed the way of Balaam, son of Beor, who loved the wages of iniquity;
but he was rebuked for his own disobedience. A voiceless donkey spoke with a man's voice and stopped the prophet's madness.
They are wells without water, clouds driven by the storm, to whom the darkness of darkness has been reserved forever.
For by empty and puffed up speeches they attract by the lusts of the flesh, by licentiousness, those who escape from those who live in error;
they promise them freedom, while they themselves are slaves to corruption; for man is enslaved by him who dominates him.
For if, after having escaped from the defilement of the world by the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they allow themselves to be drawn and overcome in it again, this last condition has become worse to them than the first.
For it is better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than after having known it, to turn away from the holy commandment which has been delivered to them.
But what happened to them is what the true proverb says: "The dog returns to its vomiting," and "the sow that has washed wallows in the mire."
Here now, beloved, is the second letter I wrote to you; and in both of them I stimulate your sincerity by reminding you of the
that you must remember the words that were spoken before by the holy prophets, and the command that we, the apostles of the Lord and Saviour, have given,
knowing first that in the last days scoffers will come, walking according to their own lusts
and saying, "Where is the promise of his coming? For from the day when the fathers fell asleep, everything continues as at the beginning of creation. »
For they willfully forget that there were heavens from the beginning, and an earth formed of water and in the midst of water by the word of God,
which means that the world that existed at the time, overflowed by water, perished.
But the heavens that now exist and the earth, by the same word, have been stored up for fire, being reserved for the day of judgment and destruction of ungodly men.
But do not forget, beloved, that a day is to the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as a day.
The Lord is not slow with regard to his promise, as some are with regard to slowness; but he is patient with us, not wanting anyone to perish, but that all should come to repentance.
But the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night, when the heavens will pass away with a loud noise, when the elements will dissolve in fiery heat, and when the earth and the works that are in it will be burned.
Therefore, since all these things will be destroyed in this way, what kind of people are you to be in a holy life and in godliness,
longing for the advent of the day of God, which will make the blazing heavens disappear and melt the elements with fiery heat?
But, according to his promise, we look forward to new heavens and a new earth, where righteousness dwells.
Therefore, beloved, since you are waiting for these things, apply yourselves to be found in peace, without blemish and blameless before Him.
Consider the patience of our Lord as salvation, as our beloved brother Paul, according to the wisdom given him, wrote to you,
as also in all his letters, speaking of these things. In these letters, there are things that are difficult to understand, which the ignorant and the disoriented distort, as they also do for the other Scriptures, for their own destruction.
Therefore you, beloved, knowing these things beforehand, take heed that, carried away by the error of the wicked, you do not fall from your firmness.
But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be the glory, now and forever. Amen.
What was from the beginning, what we have heard, what we have seen with our eyes, what we have contemplated and our hands have touched, concerning the word of life
(and life was revealed, and we saw, and we testify, and we declare to you life, eternal life, which was with the Father and was revealed to us);
What we have seen and heard we proclaim to you, so that you also may have fellowship with us. Yes, and our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus Christ.
And we write these things to you, that our joy may be complete.
This is the message which we have heard from him and which we proclaim to you: God is light, and there is no darkness in him.
If we say that we are in fellowship with Him and that we walk in darkness, we are lying and we are not telling the truth.
But if we walk in the light as he is in the light, we are in fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanses us from all sin.
If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.
If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
If we say that we have not sinned, we are making him lie, and his word is not in us.
My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you may not sin. If anyone sins, we have a counselor with the Father, Jesus Christ, the righteous.
And he is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, not only for our sins, but also for those of the whole world.
This is how we know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.
He who says, "I know him," and does not keep his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.
But the love of God is certainly perfect in him who keeps his word. This is how we know that we are in him:
Whoever says that he abides in him must also walk as he walked.
Brethren, I am not writing to you a new commandment, but an old commandment which you had from the beginning. The ancient commandment is the word you heard from the beginning.
Again I write to you a new commandment, which is true in him and in you, for the darkness is departing and the true light is already shining.
He who says he is in the light and hates his brother is in darkness until now.
He who loves his brother abides in the light, and there is no occasion for him to fall.
But he who hates his brother is in darkness, he walks in darkness and does not know where he is going, because darkness has blinded his eyes.
I am writing to you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.
I am writing to you, fathers, because you know Him who is from the beginning. I am writing to you, young men, because you have conquered the evil one. I am writing to you, little children, because you know the Father.
I have written to you, fathers, because you know Him who is from the beginning. I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, let the word of God abide in you, and because you have overcome the evil one.
Do not love the world or the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the Father's love is not in him.
For all that is in the world—the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, the pride of life—is not of the Father, but of the world.
The world passes away with its lusts, but he who does the will of God abides forever.
Little children, we are at the end times, and as you have learned that the Antichrist is coming, even now several Antichrists have arisen. We know from this that this is the last hour.
They came out of our house, but they did not belong to us; for if they had belonged to us, they would have continued with us. But they have gone, so that it may be revealed that none of them belong to us.
You have the anointing of the Holy One, and you all have the knowledge.
I have not written to you because you do not know the truth, but because you know it, and because no lie is truth.
Who is the liar, if not the one who denies that Jesus is the Christ? He is the Antichrist, the one who denies the Father and the Son.
He who denies the Son has not the Father. He who confesses the Son also has the Father.
Wherefore, as for you, let what you heard from the beginning abide in you. If what you heard from the beginning abides in you, you will also abide in the Son and in the Father.
This is the promise he made to us, eternal life.
I have written these things to you about those who want to lead you astray.
As for you, the anointing which you have received from him remains in you, and you need no one to instruct you. But as his anointing teaches you all things, and it is true, and is not a lie, and as it has taught you, you will abide in him.
Now, little children, abide in him, so that when he appears, we may be confident and not be ashamed before him at his coming.
If you know that he is righteous, you know that whoever practices righteousness is born of him.
See what great love the Father has given us, that we may be called children of God! That is why the world does not know us, because it has not known it.
Beloved, now we are children of God. What we will be has not yet been revealed; but we know that when he is revealed, we shall be like him, for we shall see him as he is.
Whoever puts this hope in himself purifies himself, as he himself is pure.
Whoever sins also commits anarchy. Sin is anarchy.
You know that he was revealed to take away our sins, and that there is no sin in him.
He who abides in him does not sin. He who sins has not seen him and does not know him.
Little children, let no one lead you astray. He who practices justice is just, as he himself is just.
He who sins is of the devil, for the devil has sinned from the beginning. For this reason the Son of God was revealed, that he might destroy the works of the devil.
He who is born of God does not commit sin, for his seed abides in him, and he cannot sin, since he is born of God.
It is in this that the children of God and the children of the devil are revealed. He who does not practice justice is not of God, nor he who does not love his brother.
For this is the message you have heard from the beginning, that we must love one another -
unlike Cain, who was of the evil one and killed his brother. Why did he kill him? Because his deeds were evil, and those of his brother were righteous.
Do not be surprised, my brethren, if the world hates you.
We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love our brothers and sisters. He who does not love his brother remains in death.
He who hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life that dwells in him.
To this we know love, for he gave his life for us. And we must lay down our lives for our brethren.
But whoever possesses the goods of the world and sees his brother in need, and then closes his heart with compassion against him, how does the love of God abide in him?
My little children, let us not love in words only, nor with tongue alone, but in deeds and in truth.
And by this we know that we are of the truth and that we persuade our hearts before him,
for if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and he knows all things.
Beloved, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have confidence before God;
and whatever we ask we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do what is pleasing in his sight.
This is his commandment: that we believe in the name of his Son, Jesus Christ, and that we love one another, as he commanded.
He who keeps his commandments abides in him, and he in him. We know by this that he dwells in us, through the Spirit he has given us.
Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits, to know if they are of God, for many false prophets have gone out into the world.
By this you know the Spirit of God: every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ came in the flesh is of God,
and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ came in the flesh is not of God; this is the spirit of Antichrist, whose coming you have heard. However, he is already in the world.
You are of God, little children, and you have overcome them, because he who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.
They are of the world. That is why they talk about the world, and the world listens to them.
We are of God. He who knows God listens to us. He who is not of God does not listen to us. This is how we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.
Beloved, let us love one another, for love comes from God; and whoever loves is born of God and knows God.
He who does not love does not know God, for God is love.
It is through this that the love of God has been revealed in us, that God has sent his only Son into the world, that we may live through him.
In this consists love, not that we have loved God, but that he has loved us and sent his Son as a sin offering for our sins.
Beloved, if God has loved us in this way, we must also love one another.
No one has ever seen God. If we love one another, God dwells in us, and his love is perfect in us.
We know by this that we abide in him and he in us, because he has given us of his Spirit.
We have seen and we testify that the Father sent the Son as the Savior of the world.
Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God.
We know and we have believed in the love that God has for us. God is love, and he who abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.
In this, love has been perfected among us, so that we may have confidence on the day of judgment, for what it is, we are also in this world.
There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear, for fear has a punishment. He who fears is not perfect in love.
We love him, because he loved us first.
If anyone says, "I love God," and hates his brother, he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?
We have this commandment from him: that he who loves God should also love his brother.
Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God. He who loves the Father also loves the child who is born of him.
By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep his commandments.
For it is loving God to keep his commandments. His commandments are not painful.
For everything that is born of God overcomes the world. This is the victory that has overcome the world: your faith.
Who is he who will overcome the world, if not the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
It is he who came by water and blood, Jesus Christ; not by water alone, but by water and blood. It is the Spirit who bears witness, because the Spirit is the truth.
For there are three people who bear witness:
the Spirit, the water, and the blood, and all three agree to be one.
If we receive the testimony of men, the testimony of God is greater; for it is the testimony of God that he has given to his Son.
He who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. He who does not believe in God has become a liar, because he has not believed the testimony that God has given concerning his Son.
This testimony is this: God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
He who has the Son has life. He who does not have the Son of God has no life.
I have written these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life, and that you may continue to believe in the name of the Son of God.
This is the assurance we have to him, that if we ask for anything according to his will, he listens to us.
And if we know that he listens to us, whatever we ask, we know that we have the requests that we have addressed to him.
If anyone sees his brother committing a sin that does not lead to death, he will ask, and God will give him life for those who commit a sin that does not lead to death. There is a sin that leads to death. I am not saying that he must make a request on this subject.
All iniquity is a sin, and there is a sin that does not lead to death.
We know that he who is born of God does not sin, but he who is born of God keeps himself, and the evil one does not touch him.
We know that we are of God, and that the whole world is under the sway of the evil one.
We know that the Son of God came and gave us understanding, that we might know Him who is true; and we are in Him who is true, in His Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God and eternal life.
Little children, beware of idols.
The eldest, to the chosen one and her children, whom I love in truth, and not only I, but also all those who know the truth,
because of the truth, which dwells in us, and will be with us forever:
May grace, mercy and peace be with us, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.
I rejoice very much to have found some of your children walking in the truth, as the Father has commanded us.
Now, I beg you, dear madam, not as if I were writing you a new commandment, but the one we had from the beginning, to love one another.
This is love, to walk according to his commandments. This is the command which you heard from the beginning, that you should walk in it.
For many deceivers have gone out into the world, those who do not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh. This is the deceiver, and the Antichrist.
Watch over yourselves, that we may not lose what we have accomplished, but that we may receive a full reward.
He who transgresses and does not abide in the teaching of Christ does not have God. He who abides in teaching has the Father and the Son.
If someone comes to your house and does not bring this teaching, do not receive him into your house and do not welcome him,
for he who receives him participates in his evil deeds.
Having many things to write to you, I do not want to do it with paper and ink, but I hope to come to your house and talk to you face to face, so that our joy will be complete.
The children of your chosen sister greet you. Amen.
The eldest to Gaius, the beloved, whom I love in truth.
Beloved, I pray that you may prosper in all things and be healthy, as your soul prospers.
For I rejoiced greatly when brethren came and testified to your truth, as you walk in the truth.
I have no greater joy than this: to hear of my children who walk in the truth.
Beloved, you do faithful work in all that you do for those who are brothers and strangers.
They testified to your love before the assembly. You will do well to send them on a journey in a manner worthy of God,
for it was for the sake of the Name that they went out, without taking anything from the Gentiles.
We must therefore welcome them, in order to be fellow workers for the truth.
I have written to the assembly, but Diotrephes, who loves to be the first among them, does not accept what we say.
Therefore, if I come, I will call attention to the deeds he commits, accusing us unjustly with wicked words. Not content with this, he himself does not receive the brethren, and those who wish to do so, he forbids and drives them out of the assembly.
Beloved, do not imitate what is bad, but what is good. He who does good is of God. He who does evil has not seen God.
Demetrius has the testimony of all, and of the truth itself; Yes, we also bear witness, and you know that our testimony is true.
I had many things to write to you, but I do not want to write to you with ink and a pen;
but I hope to see you soon. We will then talk to each other face to face. Peace be with you. Friends greet you. Greet friends by name.
Jude, servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James, to those who are called, sanctified by God the Father and kept for Jesus Christ:
May mercy, peace and charity be multiplied to you!
Beloved, while I was very anxious to write to you about our common salvation, I was compelled to write to you to exhort you to strive earnestly for the faith which has once and for all been delivered up to the saints.
For there are men who have crept secretly into the Church, the same men who have long been announced for this condemnation, impious men, who transform the grace of our God into indecency, and who deny our only Master, God and Lord, Jesus Christ.
I now want to remind you, although you already know it, that the Lord, after saving a people from the land of Egypt, then destroyed those who did not believe.
The angels who did not keep their first domain, but who deserted their own home, he kept in eternal bonds, under darkness, for the judgment of the great day.
As Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighboring cities, which, like them, gave themselves up to fornication and sought foreign flesh, are held up as an example, suffering the punishment of eternal fire.
But in the same way, these also, in their dreams, defile the flesh, despise authority, and slander the heavenly beings.
But Michael, the archangel, when he was struggling with the devil and discussing the body of Moses, did not dare to bring an insulting condemnation against him, but said, "May the Lord rebuke you!"
But these people speak ill of things they do not know. They are destroyed in those things which they naturally understand, as creatures without reason.
Woe to them! For they followed the way of Cain, they went astray in the error of Balaam, and they perished in the rebellion of Korah.
They are hidden rocks in your feasts of love, when they feast with you, shepherds who without fear feed themselves; clouds without water, carried by the winds; autumn trees without fruit, twice dead, uprooted by the roots;
wild waves of the sea, foaming their own shame; of the wandering stars, for whom the darkness of darkness has been reserved forever.
It was about them that Enoch, the seventh since Adam, prophesied, saying, "Behold, the Lord has come with ten thousand of his saints,
to judge all, and to condemn all the ungodly for all the works of impiety which they have committed in an ungodly manner, and for all the harsh words which ungodly sinners have uttered against him. 16 These are murmuring and complaints, and they are people complaining.
They are murmurers and complainers, who walk according to their lusts, and their mouths speak proud words, showing respect for people, in order to obtain advantages.
But you, beloved, remember the words that were spoken before by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ.
They have told you, "In the last time there will be scoffers, walking according to their own ungodly desires."
They are the divisive ones, who are sensual and who do not have the Spirit.
But you, beloved, be edified on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Spirit.
Remain in the love of God, waiting for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ for eternal life.
Some have compassion, making a distinction,
and others save, by snatching them from the fire with fear, by hating even clothes that are defiled by the flesh.
Now, to him who can preserve them from the fall and present you without blemish before the presence of his glory in great joy,
to God our Saviour, who alone is wise, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, now and forever. Amen.
This is the Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show his servants the things that are soon to happen, which he sent and made known by his angel to his servant John,
who bore witness to the word of God and to the testimony of Jesus Christ, concerning all that he saw.
Blessed is he who reads, and those who hear the words of the prophecy, and keep the things written therein, for the time is at hand.
John, to the seven assemblies that are in Asia: Grace and peace to you from God, who is, who was, and who is to come, and from the seven spirits who are before his throne,
and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the chief of the kings of the earth. To him who loves us, who has washed us from our sins with his blood -
and who has made us a Kingdom, priests to his God and Father - to him the glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
Behold, he is coming in the clouds, and every eye shall see him, even those who have pierced him. All the tribes of the earth will mourn over him. So be it, Amen.
"I am the Alpha and the Omega," says the Lord God who is, who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.
I, John, your brother and partner in oppression, Kingdom, and perseverance in Christ Jesus, was on the island called Patmos, because of the Word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ.
I was in the Spirit on the day of the Lord, and I heard a loud voice behind me, like a trumpet
who said, "What you see, write it down in a book and send it to the seven assemblies: at Ephesus, at Smyrna, at Pergamum, at Thyatira, at Sardis, at Philadelphia, and at Laodicea."
I turned around to see the voice speaking to me. And I turned around, and I saw seven golden candlesticks.
And among the candlesticks there was one that looked like a son of man, dressed in a robe that came down to his feet, and a golden girdle around his breast.
His head and hair were white as white wool, like snow. His eyes were like a flame of fire.
His feet were like polished brass, as if he had been refined in a furnace. His voice was like the sound of great waters.
He had seven stars in his right hand. From his mouth came a sharp two-edged sword. His face was like the sun shining to its highest degree.
When I saw him, I fell at his feet like a dead man. He laid his right hand on me, saying, "Don't be afraid. I am the first and the last,
and the Living . I was dead, and behold, I am alive for ever and ever. Amen. I have the keys to death and hell.
Write down therefore the things that you have seen, the things that are, and the things that will happen in the future.
This is the mystery of the seven stars which you saw in my right hand, and of the seven golden candlesticks: The seven stars are the angels of the seven assemblies. The seven candlesticks are the seven assemblies.
"Write to the angel of the assembly at Ephesus, 'He who holds the seven stars in his right hand, he who walks among the seven golden candlesticks, says these things:
"I know your works, your work, and your perseverance, and I know that you do not endure the wicked, that you have tested those who call themselves apostles and are not, and that you have found them false.
You have perseverance, you have endured for my name's sake, and you have not grown weary.
But I have this against you: it is that you have abandoned your first love.
Remember, therefore, whence thou didst fall, and repent, and do the first works; if not, I come to you quickly, and I will move your lampstand from its place, unless you repent.
But what you have is that you hate the works of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. To him who overcomes, I will give food of the tree of life, which is in the paradise of my God.
"Write to the angel of the assembly of Smyrna: 'The first and the last, who was dead and has come back to life, says these things:
"I know your works, the oppression, your poverty (but you are rich), and the blasphemy of those who call themselves Jews, and who are not, but who are a synagogue of Satan.
Don't be afraid of the things you are going to suffer. Behold, the devil is going to throw some of you into prison, to put you to the test, and you will be oppressed for ten days. Be faithful unto death, and I will give you the crown of life.
Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. He who overcomes will not be affected by the second death.
"Write to the angel of the congregation of Pergamum, 'He who has a sharp two-edged sword says these things:
"I know your works and the place where you dwell, where the throne of Satan is. You hold fast to my name, and you did not deny my faith in the days of Antipas, my witness, my believer, who was slain among you, where Satan dwells.
But I have something to reproach you with, and that is that you have here people who follow the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balak to throw a stumbling block before the children of Israel, to eat meat sacrificed to idols, and to indulge in fornication.
Similarly, you also have people who cling to the doctrine of the Nicolaitans.
Repent then, or I will come to you quickly and make war on them with the sword of my mouth.
Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. To him who overcomes, I will give hidden manna, I will give him a white stone, and on this stone will be written a new name that no one knows, except the one who receives it.
"Write to the angel of the assembly of Thyatira, 'The Son of God, whose eyes are like a flame of fire, and whose feet are like polished brass, says these things:
"I know your works, your love, your faith, your service, your perseverance, and I know that your last works are more numerous than the first.
But I have this against you: you tolerate your wife Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess. She teaches and deceives my servants to indulge in fornication and to eat meat sacrificed to idols.
I have given her time to repent, but she refuses to repent of her sexual immorality.
Behold, I will cast her and those who commit adultery with her into a bed of great oppression, if they do not repent of her works.
I will put his children to death, and all the congregations will know that I am the one who searches minds and hearts. I will render to each one of you according to his works.
But to you, I say, to those who remain in Thyatira - all those who do not have this teaching, who do not know what some call "the deep things of Satan" - to you, I say, I do not impose any further burden on you.
Nevertheless, hold fast to what you have, until I come.
He who overcomes, he who keeps my works to the end, to him I will give authority over the nations.
Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies.
"And write to the angel of the assembly of Sardis, 'He who has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars says these things: 'I know your works, that you are reputed to be alive, but that you are dead.
Awaken and strengthen what remains, what you were going to throw away, for I have not found any of your works perfect before my God.
Remember, then, how you received and heard. Keep it and repent. So if you do not watch, I will come as a thief, and you will not know at what hour I will come upon you.
You have, however, in Sardis some names which have not soiled their clothes. They will walk with me in white, for they are worthy of it.
He who overcomes will be clothed in white garments, and I will not blot out his name from the book of life, nor will I confess his name before my Father and his angels.
Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies.
"Write to the angel of the Philadelphia assembly, 'He who is holy, he who is true, he who has the key of David, he who opens and no one can close, and who shuts and no one opens, says these things:
"I know your works (behold, I have set before you an open door, which no one can shut), that you have a little strength, and that you have kept my word, and that you have not denied my name.
Behold, I bring some of the synagogue of Satan, of those who call themselves Jews, and are not, but who lie, and I bring them to bow down at your feet, and know that I have loved you.
Because you have kept my command to persevere, I will also keep you from the hour of trial that is to come upon the whole world, to try the inhabitants of the earth.
I'm coming quickly! Hold fast to what you have, so that no one takes your crown.
Whoever overcomes, I will make him a pillar in the temple of my God, and he will not come out of it again. I will write on him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which comes down from heaven from my God, and my new name.
Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies.
"Write to the angel of the assembly of Laodicea, 'The Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God, says these things:
"I know your works: you are neither cold nor hot. I would like you to be cold or hot.
Therefore, because you are lukewarm, and neither hot nor cold, I will spew you out of my mouth.
Because you say, "I am rich, I have acquired riches, and I have need of nothing," and you do not know that you are unfortunate, wretched, poor, blind, and naked.
I advise you to buy from me gold purified by fire, that you may be rich, and white garments, that you may be clothed and that the shame of your nakedness may not appear, and eye-salve to anoint your eyes, that you may see.
All those I love, I rebuke and chastise them. Be zealous, therefore, and repent.
Behold, I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will enter his house, I will sup with him, and he with me.
Whoever overcomes, I will give him to sit with me on my throne, as I also overcame, and sat with my Father on his throne.
Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. »
After this, I looked and saw an open door in heaven; and the first voice I heard, like a trumpet speaking to me, was a voice saying, "Come up here, and I will show you what is to happen after this."
Immediately I was filled with the Spirit. And behold, there was a throne set in heaven, and one seated on the throne
which resembled a jasper stone and a sardony. There was a rainbow around the throne, like an emerald to look at.
Around the throne there were twenty-four thrones. On the thrones sat twenty-four elders, dressed in white garments, with golden crowns on their heads.
From the throne come lightning, sounds and thunders. Before his throne burned seven lamps of fire, which are the seven Spirits of God.
In front of the throne was something like a sea of glass, similar to crystal. In the middle of the throne, and around the throne, there were four living beings filled with eyes in front and behind.
The first living being was similar to a lion, the second living being was similar to a calf, the third living being had the face of a man, and the fourth living being was similar to a flying eagle.
The four living beings, which each have six wings, are full of eyes around and within. They do not cease, day and night, to repeat: "Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God, the Almighty, who was, who is, and who is to come!"
When living beings give glory, honor and praise to him who sits on the throne, to him who lives forever and ever,
The twenty-four elders prostrate themselves before him who sits on the throne and adore him who lives forever and ever, and they throw their crowns before the throne, saying:
"Thou art worthy, O Lord and God, the Holy One, to receive glory, honor, and power, for it is Thou who created all things, and by Thy will they exist and were created."
I saw in the right hand of him who was seated on the throne a book written inside and out, closed by seven seals.
I saw a mighty angel proclaiming with a loud voice, "Who is worthy to open the book and break the seals thereof?"
No one, neither in the heavens above, nor on the earth, nor under the earth, has been able to open the book or look at it.
Then I wept much, because no one was found worthy to open the book or look at it.
One of the elders said to me: "Don't cry. Behold, the Lion who is of the tribe of Judah, the root of David, has conquered: he who opens the book and its seven seals. »
I saw in the midst of the throne and the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, a lamb standing, as if slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of God, sent forth from all the earth.
Then he came, and took the book from the right hand of him who was seated on the throne.
When he had taken the book, the four living beings and the twenty-four elders prostrated themselves before the lamb, each having a harp and golden cups filled with incense, which are the prayers of the saints.
They sang a new song, saying, "You are worthy to take the book and open its seals, for you were slain, and bought us for God with your blood from every tribe, tongue, people, and nation,
and made us kings and priests to our God; and we will reign over the earth. »
I looked, and heard as it were the voice of many angels around the throne, living beings and old men. Their number was ten thousand, ten thousand, and thousands of thousands,
saying with a loud voice, "The lamb that was slain is worthy to receive power, riches, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and blessings!"
I have heard all that was created in the heavens, on the earth, under the earth, on the sea, and all that is therein, say, "To him that sits on the throne, and to the Lamb, blessing, honor, glory, and dominion, forever and ever! Amen! »
The four living beings said, "Amen!" Then the elders prostrated themselves and prostrated themselves.
I saw that the lamb was opening one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living beings say, as in a voice of thunder, "Come and see!"
Then a white horse appeared, and the one who rode it held a bow. A crown was given him, and he went out as a conqueror, and to conquer.
When he opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, "Come!"
Another came out, a red horse. To him who rode it was given the power to take away the peace of the earth, and to cause men to kill one another. A great sword was given to him.
When he opened the third seal, I heard the third living being say, "Come and see!" And behold, there was a black horse, and the one who rode it held a set of scales in his hand.
I heard a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying, "One choenix of wheat for a denarius, and three choenix of barley for a denarius! Don't spoil the oil and wine! »
When he opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth living creature say, "Come and see!"
And behold, there was a pale horse, and the name of the one who rode it was death. Hades followed him. He was given authority over a quarter of the earth, to kill by the sword, by famine, by death, and by the wild beasts of the earth.
When he opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain because of the Word of God and the testimony of the Lamb that they had.
They cried out with a loud voice, saying, "How long, Master, the holy and the true, will you judge and avenge our blood on the inhabitants of the earth?"
Each of them was given a long white robe. They were told that they were to rest for some time longer, until their companions in service and their brothers, who would also be killed like themselves, had finished their course.
I saw, when he opened the sixth seal, that there was a great earthquake. The sun became black as a sackcloth of horsehair, and the whole moon became as blood.
The stars of heaven fell to the earth, like a fig tree that drops its unripe figs when it is shaken by a great wind.
The sky was lifted up like a scroll that is rolled up. Every mountain and every island was moved from their place.
The kings of the earth, the princes, the military chiefs, the rich, the strong, all the slaves and free men, hid themselves in the caves and rocks of the mountains.
And they said to the mountains and the rocks, "Fall upon us, and hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne, and from the wrath of the lamb,
for the great day of his wrath has come, and who can stand? » .
After this, I saw four angels standing in the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, so that no wind blew on the land, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.
I saw another angel ascend from the rising sun, having the seal of the living God. He cried out with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it had been given to harm the land and the sea,
saying, "Do not harm the earth, nor the sea, nor the trees, until we have sealed the slaves of our God on their foreheads."
I heard the number of those who had been sealed, a hundred and forty-four thousand, from all the tribes of the children of Israel:
of the tribe of Judah, twelve thousand were sealed, of the tribe of Reuben, twelve thousand, of the tribe of Gad, twelve thousand,
of the tribe of Asher, twelve thousand, of the tribe of Naphtali, twelve thousand, of the tribe of Manasseh, twelve thousand,
of the tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand, of the tribe of Levi, twelve thousand, of the tribe of Issachar, twelve thousand,
of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve thousand, of the tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand, and of the tribe of Benjamin, twelve thousand were sealed.
After this, I looked, and behold, a great crowd, which no one could number, from every nation, tribe, people, and language, stood before the throne and before the lamb, clothed in white robes, palms in hand.
They cried with a loud voice, saying, "Salvation is to our God, who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb!"
All the angels stood around the throne, the elders and the four living beings; they fell on their faces before his throne and worshipped God,
saying, "Amen! Blessing, glory, wisdom, thanksgiving, honor, power, and strength, be to our God forever and ever! Amen. »
One of the elders spoke up and said to me, "Who are those who are clothed in white robes, and where do they come from?"
I said to him: "Monseigneur, you know it." He told me, "These are the ones who came out of the great suffering. They washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
Therefore they are before the throne of God, and they serve him day and night in his temple. He who sits on the throne spreads his tent over them.
They will never hunger or thirst again. The sun will not strike them, nor any heat;
for the Lamb who is in the midst of the throne feeds them and leads them to springs of life-giving waters. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes. »
When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in the sky for about half an hour.
I saw the seven angels standing before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.
Another angel came and stood above the altar, having a golden censer. They gave him many incense, that he might add them to the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar which was before the throne.
The smoke of the incense, with the prayers of the saints, rose before God from the hand of the angel.
The angel took the censer, filled it with the fire of the altar, and then threw it on the earth. Thunders, sounds, lightning and an earthquake followed.
The seven angels who held the seven trumpets prepared to blow them.
The first shot sounded, and hail and fire ensued, mingled with blood, which were thrown on the earth. A third of the earth was burned, a third of the trees were burned, and all green grass was burned.
The second angel blew his trumpet, and something like a great burning mountain was cast into the sea. A third of the sea became blood,
and a third of the living beings that were in the sea died. A third of the ships were destroyed.
The third angel blew his trumpet, and a great star fell from heaven, burning like a torch, which fell on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water.
The name of the star is "Absinthe". A third of the waters became absinthe. Many people died because of these waters, because they had become bitter.
The fourth angel blew his trumpet. A third of the sun was struck, as well as a third of the moon and a third of the stars, so that a third of them were darkened; the day would not shine for a third, and the night likewise.
I saw and heard an eagle flying in the middle of the sky and saying in a loud voice, "Woe! Misfortune! Woe to the inhabitants of the earth, because of the other blasts of the trumpets of the three angels, which are yet to sound! » .
The fifth angel blew his trumpet, and I saw from heaven a star that had fallen to the earth. The key to the pit of the abyss was given to him.
He opened the well of the abyss, and smoke rose from the well, like the smoke of a fiery furnace. The sun and the air were darkened by the smoke coming out of the shaft.
Then smoke came out of the locusts on the earth, and power was given to them, as power to the scorpions of the earth.
They were told that they were not to harm the grass of the earth, nor any greenery, nor any tree, but only those who did not have the seal of God on their foreheads.
They were given power, not to kill them, but to torment them for five months. Their torment was similar to the torment of a scorpion when it strikes a person.
In those days, people will seek death, and they will not find it. They will desire to die, and death will flee from them.
The locusts were shaped like horses prepared for war. On their heads there were something like crowns of gold, and their faces were like the faces of men.
They had hair like the hair of a woman, and their teeth were like those of lions.
They had cuirasses as iron cuirasses. The sound of their wings was like the sound of many chariots and horses rushing to war.
They had scorpion-like tails, with stingers. In their tails, they have the power to harm men for five months.
They have the angel of the abyss as their king. His name in Hebrew is "Abaddon", but in Greek, he is called "Apollyon".
The first misfortune is over. Behold, there are two more misfortunes that come after this one.
The sixth angel blew his trumpet. And I heard a voice from the horns of the golden altar that is before God,
and saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, "Set free the four angels who are bound to the great river Euphrates!"
The four angels were set free who had been prepared for that hour, day, month, and year, to kill a third of mankind.
The number of the armies of the horsemen was two hundred millions. I heard the number of them.
Thus I saw in the vision the horses and those who rode them, having cuirasses of a fiery red, a blue of hyacinth, and a yellow of sulphur; and the horses' heads looked like lions' heads. From their mouths come fire, smoke and sulphur.
By these three plagues, a third of the human race was killed: by fire, smoke, and sulphur, which issued from their mouths.
For the power of horses is in their mouths and in their tails. For their tails are like serpents, and they have heads; and it is with them that they do harm.
The rest of mankind, who have not been killed by these plagues, have not repented of the works of his hands so as not to worship the demons and idols of gold, silver, brass, stone, and wood, which can neither see, nor hear, nor walk.
They have not repented of their murders, their enchantments, their sexual immorality, nor their thefts.
I saw a mighty angel descend from heaven, clothed in a cloud. A rainbow was on his head. His face was like the sun, and his feet like pillars of fire.
He held in his hand a small open book. He put his right foot on the sea, and his left foot on the ground.
He cried out in a loud voice, as a lion roars. And when he cried out, the seven thunders made their voices heard.
When the seven thunders had sounded, I was about to write; but I heard a voice from heaven saying, "Seal up the things which the seven thunders have spoken, and write them not."
The angel whom I saw standing on the sea and on the land raised his right hand to heaven
and swore by him who lives forever and ever, who created the heaven and what it contains, the earth and what it contains, and the sea and what it contains, that there shall be no more delay,
but that in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he blows the trumpet, then the mystery of God will be fulfilled, as he announced to his servants the prophets.
The voice which I heard from heaven, speaking to me again, said, "Go, take the open book in the hand of the angel who stands on the sea and on the land."
I went to see the angel, asking him to give me the little book. He told me, "Take it and eat it. It will make your stomach bitter, but in your mouth it will be sweet as honey. »
I took the little book from the angel's hand, and ate it. It was sweet as honey in my mouth. When I had eaten it, my stomach became bitter.
I am told, "You must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, tongues, and kings."
I was given a reed like a rod. Someone said, "Stand up and measure the temple of God, the altar and those who bow down therein.
Leave aside the outer court of the temple, and do not measure it, for it has been given to the nations. They will trample under foot the holy city for forty-two months.
I will give power to my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for one thousand two hundred and sixty days, clothed with sackcloth. »
These are the two olive trees and the two candlesticks, which stand before the Lord of the earth.
If anyone wants to harm them, fire comes out of their mouths and devours their enemies. If anyone wants to harm them, he must be killed in this way.
They have the power to close the heavens, so that it does not rain during the days of their prophecy. They have power to turn the waters into blood, and to strike the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.
When they have finished their testimony, the beast that rises from the abyss will make war on them, conquer them, and kill them.
Their corpses will be in the streets of the great city, spiritually called Sodom and Egypt, where their Lord was crucified.
People among peoples, tribes, tongues, and nations will look at their corpses for three and a half days, and will not allow their corpses to be put in a tomb.
The inhabitants of the earth will rejoice over them, and they will rejoice. They will give gifts to one another, because these two prophets tormented the inhabitants of the earth.
After the three and a half days, a breath of life from God entered them, and they stood on their feet. Great fear took possession of those who saw them.
I heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, "Come up here." They ascended to heaven in a cloud, and their enemies saw them.
On that day there was a great earthquake, and a tenth of the city collapsed. Seven thousand people were killed in the earthquake, the rest were terrified and gave glory to the God of heaven.
The second misfortune is over. Here comes the third misfortune quickly.
The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and great voices in heaven followed, saying, "The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ. He will reign forever and ever! »
The twenty-four elders, who sit on their thrones before the throne of God, fell on their faces and bowed down to God,
saying, "We thank you, O Lord God, the Almighty, he who is and was, for you have taken your great power and have reigned.
The nations have become angry, and your wrath has come, and the time has come to judge the dead, to give to your servants, the prophets, their reward, and to the saints and to those who fear your name, to the small and the great, and to destroy those who destroy the earth. »
The temple of God which is in heaven was opened, and the ark of the covenant of the Lord appeared in his temple. Flashes of lightning, noises, thunder, an earthquake and a great hail followed.
A great sign appeared in the sky: a woman enveloped in the sun, the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars.
She was pregnant. She cried out in pain as she worked to give birth.
Another sign appeared in the sky. Behold, it was a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on its heads seven crowns.
Its tail attracted a third of the stars of the sky, and threw them on the earth. The dragon stood before the woman who was about to give birth, so that, when she gave birth, he would devour her child.
She gave birth to a son, a male child, who is to rule all nations with a rod of iron. His child was taken up to God and to his throne.
The woman has fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared by God, to be fed there for one thousand two hundred and sixty days.
There was a war in heaven. Michael and his angels made war on the dragon. The dragon and his angels made war.
They were not victorious. They no longer found a place in the sky.
The great dragon was cast down, the ancient serpent, the one called the devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world. He was cast down to the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.
I heard a loud voice in heaven saying, "Now the salvation, the power, the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ have come; for the accuser of our brethren was cast down, who accused them before our God day and night.
They overcame him because of the blood of the Lamb, and because of the word of their testimony. They did not love their lives, even to death.
Therefore rejoice, O heavens, and you who dwell in them. Woe to the land and the sea, because the devil has come down to you, animated by great anger, knowing that he has only a very short time. »
The dragon, seeing that he was cast down to the earth, persecuted the woman who had given birth to the male child.
The two wings of the great eagle were given to the woman to fly into the wilderness to her place of residence, so that she might be fed for a time, times, and half a time, away from the face of the serpent.
The serpent caused water to gush out of his mouth after the woman, like a river, so that she might be carried away by the current.
The earth helped the woman, and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed up the river that the dragon had caused to gush out of its mouth.
The dragon became angry with the woman and went to make war on the rest of her descendants, who keep the commandments of God and hold the testimony of Jesus.
Then I stood on the sand of the sea. I saw a beast come up from the sea with ten horns and seven heads. On his horns were ten diadems, and on his heads, names of blasphemy.
The beast I saw was like a leopard, its feet were like those of a bear, and its mouth like the mouth of a lion. The dragon gave him his power, his throne, and great authority.
One of his heads appeared to have been mortally wounded. His mortal wound was healed, and the whole earth marveled at the beast.
They worshipped the dragon, because he had given his authority to the beast; and they worshipped the beast, saying, "Who is like the beast? Who is capable of waging war against him? »
He was given a mouth that uttered great things and blasphemies. The power to make war for forty-two months was given to him.
He opened his mouth to blaspheme against God, to blaspheme his name, his dwelling, and those who dwell in heaven.
It was given to him to make war on the saints and to conquer them. Authority over every tribe, every people, every language, and every nation has been given to him.
All the inhabitants of the earth will worship him, all those whose names were not written from the foundation of the world in the book of life of the lamb that was slain.
If anyone has ears, let him hear.
If someone has to go into captivity, he will go into captivity. If anyone is to be killed by the sword, he must be killed. This is the endurance and faith of the saints.
I saw another beast rise from the earth. She had two horns like a lamb and she spoke like a dragon.
She exercises in his presence all the authority of the first beast. It compels the earth and its inhabitants to worship the first beast, whose mortal wound has been healed.
She performs great wonders, even sending fire down from heaven to the earth, in the eyes of the people.
It deceives my people who dwell on the earth, because of the signs which it has been given to them to perform before the beast, by telling the inhabitants of the earth to make an image to the beast that has had the wound of the sword and has lived.
It was given to him to make the image of the beast breathe, so that the image of the beast might speak and put to death all those who would not worship the image of the beast.
It causes all, small and great, rich and poor, free and slaves, to receive marks on the right hand or on the forehead;
and that no one can buy or sell without having this mark, which is the name of the beast or the number of its name.
Here is wisdom. Let him who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man. Its number is six hundred and sixty-six.
I looked, and behold, the Lamb stood on Mount Zion, and with him a number of a hundred and forty-four thousand, who had his name and the name of his Father written on their foreheads.
I heard a sound from heaven, like the sound of many waters and the sound of great thunder. The sound I heard was like that of harpists playing their harps.
They sing a new hymn before the throne, before the four living beings and before the elders. No one could learn this song except the hundred and forty-four thousand, those who had been redeemed from the earth.
These are those who have not defiled themselves with women, for they are virgins. They are the ones who follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were redeemed from among men by Jesus, the firstfruits of God and the Lamb.
There has been no lie in their mouths, for they are blameless.
I saw an angel flying in the midst of heaven, having everlasting Good News to proclaim to the inhabitants of the earth, to every nation, tribe, tongue, and people.
He said in a loud voice, "Fear the Lord, and give him glory, for the hour of his judgment has come. Worship Him who made heaven, earth, sea, and springs of water! »
Another, a second angel, followed, saying, "Babylon the great has fallen, who has made all nations drink the wine of the wrath of her fornication."
Another angel, a third, followed them, saying in a loud voice, "If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives a mark on his forehead or on his hand,
he too will drink the wine of the wrath of God, prepared without mixture in the cup of his wrath. He will be tormented in fire and brimstone, in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the lamb.
The smoke of their torment rises forever and ever. They have no rest day or night, those who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name.
This is the perseverance of the saints, of those who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus. »
I heard a voice from heaven saying, "Write, Blessed henceforth are the dead who die in the Lord!" "Yes," says the Spirit, "that they may rest from their labors, for their works follow them."
I looked, and I saw a white cloud, and on the cloud a man sitting like a son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.
Another angel came out of the temple and cried out with a loud voice to him who was sitting on the cloud, "Send your sickle and reap, for the hour of reaping has come, for the harvest of the earth is ripe."
He who sat on the cloud threw his sickle on the earth, and the earth was reaped.
Another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven. He also had a sharp sickle.
Another angel came out of the altar, he who has power over the fire, and he called with a loud voice to him who had the sharp sickle, saying, "Send forth your sharp sickle and harvest the grapes of the vine of the earth, for the grapes of the earth are ripe."
The angel thrust his sickle into the earth, collected the harvest from the earth, and threw it into the great vat of the wrath of God.
The vat was trampled out of the city, and blood flowed out of the vat to the bridles of the horses to the height of one thousand six hundred stadia.
I saw in heaven another great and wonderful sign: seven angels who held the seven last plagues, for in them the wrath of God ends.
I saw something like a sea of glass mixed with fire, and those who had conquered the beast, his image and the number of his names, standing on the sea of glass, having the harps of God.
They sang the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, "Great and wonderful are your works, O Lord God, the Almighty! Righteous and true are your ways, King of the nations.
Who would not fear you, Lord, and glorify your name? For you alone are holy. For all the nations will come and bow down to you. For your righteous deeds have been revealed. »
After this, I looked, and the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony was opened in heaven.
And the seven angels who held the seven plagues came out, clothed in pure and bright linen, and wearing golden belts around their breasts.
One of the four living beings gave to the seven angels seven golden cups full of the wrath of God, who lives forever and ever.
The temple was filled with smoke because of the glory of God and His power. No one could enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were finished.
I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, "Go, pour out on the earth the seven bowls of the wrath of God."
The first went to scatter its cup on the earth, and it became a painful ulcer for the people who had the mark of the beast and who worshipped its image.
The second angel poured his cup into the sea, which became blood like that of a dead man. All the living beings of the sea died.
The third poured his cup into the rivers and springs of water, and they became blood.
I heard the angel of the waters say, "You are righteous, you who are and who were, O Holy One, for you have judged these things.
For they shed the blood of the saints and prophets, and you gave them blood to drink. They deserve this. »
I heard the altar say, "Yes, Lord God, the Almighty, your judgments are true and just."
The fourth poured out his cup on the sun, and it was given to him to burn men with fire.
The people were burned by great heat, and the people blasphemed the name of God who has power over these plagues. They did not repent and give him glory.
The fifth poured out his cup on the throne of the beast, and his kingdom was darkened. They were biting their tongues because of the pain,
and they blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their ulcers. They still haven't repented of their deeds.
The sixth poured his cup on the great river, the Euphrates. Its waters dried up, so that the way might be prepared for the kings who will come from the rising sun.
I saw coming out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet, three unclean spirits, like frogs;
for they are the spirits of demons, who work wonders, and who go to the kings of all the inhabited earth, in order to gather them together for the battle of the great day of God the Almighty.
"Behold, I come as a thief. Blessed is he who watches and keeps his clothes, that he may not walk naked, and that his shame may not be seen. »
He gathered them together in the place which is called in Hebrew "Harmagedon."
The seventh poured his cup into the air. And a loud voice came out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, "It is done!"
There was lightning, sounds, thunders, and a great earthquake, such as has never been since there have been men on earth, an earthquake so great and so powerful.
The great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell. Babylon the great in the sight of God was remembered, to give her the cup of wine of the ardor of her wrath.
All the islands fled, and the mountains were not found.
Large hailstones, the weight of a talent, fell from the sky on the people. God was blasphemed because of the plague of hail, for this plague was extremely violent.
One of the seven angels who held the seven bowls came to me and said, "Come hither. I will show you the judgment of the great harlot who sits on the great waters,
and with which the kings of the earth have given themselves up to fornication. The inhabitants of the earth have become drunk with the wine of his fornication. »
He carried me by the Spirit into a wilderness. I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast, full of blasphemous names, having seven heads and ten horns.
This woman was clothed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold, precious stones, and pearls. She held in her hand a golden cup filled with abominations and impurities of the earth's fornication.
And on her forehead was written a name: "MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF THE HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH."
I saw this woman drunk with the blood of the saints and the blood of the martyrs of Jesus. When I saw her, I was seized with great astonishment.
The angel said to me, "Why are you surprised? I will tell you the mystery of the woman and the beast that bears her, the one with the seven heads and the ten horns.
The beast you saw was, and it is no more; it will come out of the abyss and go to perdition. The inhabitants of the earth, whose names have not been written in the book of life since the foundation of the world, will be amazed when they see that the beast was, and is not, and that it will be present.
Here is the spirit that has wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman sits.
They are seven kings. Five have fallen, one is, and the other has not yet come. When he comes, he will have to persist a little.
The beast that was, and is no more, is itself also an eighth, and is of the number of the seven; and it is going to destruction.
The ten horns you have seen are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom, but who receive authority as kings with the beast for an hour.
They have one thought, and they give their power and authority to the beast.
They will make war on the lamb, and the lamb will overcome them, for he is Lord of lords and King of kings, and those who are with him are called, chosen, and faithful. »
He said to me, "The waters that you have seen, where the harlot is sitting, are peoples, crowds, nations, and tongues.
The ten horns that you have seen, they and the beast, will hate the harlot, will devour her, strip her, eat her flesh, and consume her with fire.
For God has put in their hearts to do what he has in mind, to agree, and to give their kingdom to the beast, until the words of God are fulfilled.
The woman you have seen is the great city that rules over the kings of the earth. »
After this, I saw another angel descend from heaven, who had great authority. The earth was illuminated by his glory.
He cried out with a loud voice, saying, "Babylon the great has fallen, she has fallen, she has become a dwelling place of demons, a prison for every unclean spirit, and a den for every unclean and hateful bird!
For all nations have drunk the wine of the fury of her fornication, the kings of the earth have given themselves up with her to fornication, and the merchants of the earth have been enriched by the abundance of her luxury. »
I heard another voice from heaven, saying, Come out from among her, my people, that you may not share in her sins and receive no of her plagues;
for his sins have reached heaven, and God has remembered his iniquities.
Render to her as she has rendered, and render to her double what she has done, and according to her works. In the cup she has mixed, mix double it.
As much as she has glorified herself and has been wanton, so much torment and mourning give her. For she says in her heart, "I sit as a queen, I am not a widow, and I do not want to see mourning."
Wherefore, in a single day, his plagues shall come: death, mourning, and famine; and it will be consumed by fire, for the Lord God who judged it is mighty.
The kings of the earth, who have given themselves up to fornication and who have lived in lust with her, will weep and groan for her, looking at the smoke of her conflagration.
They will stand at a distance, in fear of his torment, and they will say, "Woe, woe to the great city, to Babylon, the fortified city! For your judgment came in an hour.
The merchants of the earth weep and lament over it, for no one buys their goods any more:
goods of gold, silver, precious stones, pearls, fine linen, purple, silk, scarlet, every precious wood, every vessel of ivory, every vessel of very precious wood, brass, iron, and marble;
and cinnamon, incense, perfume, incense, wine, olive oil, fine flour, wheat, sheep, horses, chariots, bodies and souls of people.
The fruits that your soul coveted have been lost to you. All the things that were delicate and sumptuous have disappeared from you, and you will no longer find them at all.
The merchants of these things, who have enriched themselves by her, will stand afar away, in fear of her torment, weeping and lamenting,
saying, "Woe, woe to the great city, which was clothed in fine linen, purple, and scarlet, and adorned with gold, precious stones, and pearls!
For, in one hour, such great riches are reduced to nothing. All the captains of ships, all those who sail in any place, the sailors, and all those who earn their living on the sea, stood at a distance,
and exclaimed, looking at the smoke of its blaze, "What is like the great city?
They threw dust on their heads, and they cried out weeping and lamenting, "Woe, woe to the great city, in which all those who had their ships on the sea grew rich because of its great riches! Because in one hour, it is reduced to desolation.
"Rejoice over her, O heaven, you saints, apostles and prophets, for God has judged her."
A mighty angel took a stone like a great millstone and threw it into the sea, saying, "Thus Babylon, the great city, will be thrown down with violence, and it will be found no more.
The voices of harpists, minstrels, flute-players, and trumpeters will no longer be heard in your house. You will no longer find any craftsman, whatever his trade. The sound of a mill will no longer be heard at all in your home.
The light of a lamp will no longer shine at all in your home. The voice of husband and wife will no longer be heard in you, because your merchants were the princes of the earth, because all nations have been seduced by your magic.
In it was found the blood of the prophets and saints, and of all those who were slain on earth. »
After this, I heard something in the sky like the loud voice of a great crowd saying, Hallelujah! Salvation, power, and glory belong to our God;
for his judgments are true and just. For he judged the great harlot who corrupted the earth by her sexual immorality, and he avenged with his hand the blood of his servants. »
A second said, "Hallelujah! Its smoke rises for ever and ever. »
The twenty-four elders and the four living beings prostrated themselves and worshipped the God who sits on the throne, saying, "Amen! Hallelujah! »
A voice arose from the throne, saying, "Praise our God, all you his servants, you who fear him, small and great!"
I heard something like the voice of a great crowd, like the voice of many waters, and like the voice of mighty thunders, saying, "Hallelujah! For the Lord our God, the Almighty, reigns!
Let us rejoice and be glad, and let us give him glory. For the marriage of the Lamb has come, and his wife has prepared herself. »
It was given to him to clothe himself with fine, shining, and pure linen, for fine linen is the righteous deeds of the saints.
He said to me, "Write, 'Blessed are those who are invited to the wedding feast of the Lamb!' He said to me, "These are the true words of God."
I threw myself at his feet to adore him. He said, "Look! Don't do that! I am a companion in servitude with you and with your brothers who hold the testimony of Jesus. Worship God, for the testimony of Jesus is the Spirit of prophecy. »
I saw the sky open, and here is a white horse. The one who rode it is called Faithful and True. He judges and fights with justice.
His eyes are a flame of fire, and there are many crowns on his head. He has written names and a written name that no one knows, except himself.
He is dressed in a garment sprinkled with blood. His name is called "the Word of God".
The armies that are in heaven, dressed in white linen, pure and fine, follow him on white horses.
From his mouth comes a sharp sword, a double-edged edge, that with it he may strike the nations. He will rule them with a rod of iron. He treads the vat of wine with the ardor of the wrath of God, the Almighty.
He has on his garment and on his thigh a name written: "KING OF KINGS AND LORD OF LORDS".
I saw an angel standing in the sun. He cried out in a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in the sky, "Come! Gather for the great supper of God,
in order to eat the flesh of kings, the flesh of military leaders, the flesh of heroes, the flesh of horses and those who ride them, and the flesh of all men, free and slaves, small and great. »
I saw the beast, the kings of the earth and their armies, gathered together to make war against him who sat on the horse and his army.
The beast was taken, and with it the false prophet who performed the wonders by which he deceived those who had received the mark of the beast and those who worshipped his image. These two were thrown alive into the lake of fire that burns with sulfur.
The rest were killed by the sword of the one who sat on the horse, the sword that came out of his mouth. And all the birds were satisfied with their flesh.
I saw an angel descend from heaven with the key of the abyss and a great chain in his hand.
He seizes the dragon, the ancient serpent, who is the devil and Satan, and who deceives all the inhabited earth; he bound him for a thousand years,
cast him into the abyss, shut him up and sealed him over him, so that he would not deceive the nations again until the thousand years were fulfilled. After that, he must be released for a short time.
I saw thrones, and they sat down on them, and judgment was given to them. I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for the testimony of Jesus and for the word of God, and of those who had not worshiped the beast or his image, and who had not received the mark on their foreheads and on their hands. They lived and reigned with Christ for a thousand years.
The rest of the dead did not live until the thousand years had passed. This is the first resurrection.
Blessed and holy is he who has a share in the first resurrection. The second death has no power over them, but they will be priests of God and of Christ, and they will reign with him for a thousand years.
And after the thousand years, Satan will be freed from his prison
and he will go out to deceive the nations that are in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them together for war, whose number is like the sand of the sea.
They ascended the breadth of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city. Fire came down from heaven from God and devoured them.
The devil who deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are also found. They will be tormented day and night, forever and ever.
I saw a great white throne and the one who sat on it, before whose face the earth and the sky fled. There was no room for them.
I saw the dead, the great and the small, standing before the throne, and they opened books. Another book was opened, which is the book of life. And the dead were judged according to what was written in the books, according to their works.
The sea gave up the dead that were in it. Death and hell have given back the dead that were in them. They were judged, each according to his works.
Death and hell were thrown into the lake of fire. This is the second death, the lake of fire.
If anyone was not found written in the book of life, he was cast into the lake of fire.
I have seen a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth are gone, and the sea is no more.

One of the seven angels who held the seven bowls laden with the seven last plagues came, and he spoke to me, saying, "Come hither. I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb. »
He carried me in spirit to a great and high mountain, and showed me the holy city, Jerusalem, which came down from heaven from God,
and who had the glory of God. Its light was like a very precious stone, like a jasper stone, clear as crystal.
It had a great and high wall, with twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, with names written upon them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel.
There were three gates to the east, three gates to the north, three gates to the south, and three gates to the west.
The wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
The one who spoke to me had a golden reed for a measure to measure the city, its gates and its walls.
The city is square. Its length is as great as its width. He measured the city with the reed: twelve thousand twelve stadia. Its length, breadth and height are equal.
Its wall is one hundred and forty-four cubits, the measure of a man, that is to say, of an angel.
The construction of its wall was made of jasper. The city was of pure gold, like pure glass.
The foundations of the city wall were adorned with all kinds of precious stones. The first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,
the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardony, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh hyacinth and the twelfth amethyst.
The twelve gates were twelve pearls. Each of the doors was made of a pearl. The streets of the city were made of pure gold, like transparent glass.
I saw no temple there, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are his temple.
The city needs neither the sun nor the moon to shine, for the very glory of God enlightens it and his lamp is the Lamb.
The nations will walk in his light. The kings of the earth bring the glory and honor of the nations.
Its gates will not be closed in the day, for there will be no night,
and the glory and honor of the nations will be introduced into it so that they may enter it.
There shall enter into it nothing profane, nor shall anyone who commits an abomination or a lie, but only those which are written in the Lamb's book of life.
He showed me a river of water of life, clear as crystal, which issued from the throne of God and of the Lamb,
in the middle of its street. On this side of the river and on the other, there was the tree of life, which bore twelve kinds of fruit and bore its fruit every month. The leaves of the tree were used for the healing of nations.
There will be no more curse. The throne of God and of the Lamb will be there, and his servants will serve him.
They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads.
There will be no night, and they will need neither lamp nor sun, for the Lord God will enlighten them. They will reign forever and ever.
